You better go get a synchronic meter so we can double-check. All right, Captain. Locked onto you. Are you all right, Captain? Let me give you a hand. Wilson will be right back, sir. It might profit you to let Doctor McCoy give you the once-over. Transporter breakdown. Continue circuit testing. We beamed up this animal and, well, look for yourself. It's in this specimen case. A few seconds after they sent this one up through the transporter, that duplicate appeared. Except it's not a duplicate, it's an opposite. Two of the same animal, but different. One gentle, this. One mean and fierce, that. Some kind of savage, ferocious opposite. Captain, we don't dare send Mister Sulu and the landing party up. If this should happen to a man. I don't know sir, but when Fisher came up, his suit was covered with a soft yellow ore that had highly unusual properties. It may have caused an overload. Can't tell, not yet. Yes sir, but we don't dare bring up the landing party. It might be duplicated like this animal. Can't say, sir. We're doing everything we can, sir. Captain Kirk. Mister Scott, sir, on the lower level of the Engineering deck. I've found a new trouble with the transporter. The casing has a wide gap ripped in it. The main circuits have been burned through. The abort control circuit is gone altogether. Scott here, Captain. The transporter unit ioniser. Nothing much left of it, sir. We can't repair it in less than a week. We've found a way to get the transporter working, sir. I'll grab him by the scruff of the neck and hold him as long as I can. If this doesn't work, I don't know what will.

Title: The Enemy Within
Dialogue: ['Bridge to all decks. Section duty officers, check communication lines.', 'Captain Kirk, I have a tie-in with Sulu now.']
Flattened Dialogue: Bridge to all decks. Section duty officers, check communication lines. Captain Kirk, I have a tie-in with Sulu now.

Title: The Enemy Within
Dialogue: ["You picked a good day, Fisher. Business has been lousy. What'd you do, take a fall on purpose so you could get a little vacation?", 'What can I do for you, Jim?', "Back to that bed, bucko. Come on, let's go.", "He'll be regaining consciousness soon, and not knowing what his physical state is, I don't think I dare give him a tranquilizer of any kind. I think we'd better bind him.", 'You have a point, Spock?', "It's the Captain's guts you're analysing. Are you of that, Spock?", 'You have your intellect, Jim. You can fight with that!', 'Apparently the body functioning weakened during the duplication process. A fact I failed to consider.', "I don't know, Jim.", "Jim, he is back! Jim, you can use that brandy now. In fact, I'll join you.", "Jim, you're no different than anyone else. We all have our darker side. We need it! It's half of what we are. It's not really ugly, it's human.", "Yes, human. A lot of what he is makes you the man you are. God forbid I should have to agree with Spock, but he was right. Without the negative side, you wouldn't be the Captain. You couldn't be, and you know it. Your strength of command lies mostly in him.", 'You have the goodness.', "The intelligence, the logic. It appears your half has most of that, and perhaps that's where man's essential courage comes from. For you see, he was afraid and you weren't.", "He's dead, Jim.", "Autopsy in-depth. Hurry. I don't know. Animal could have died of some kind of shock.", "I said could have, Mister Spock. We won't know until we get a full post-mortem.", "Could be, if, maybe. All guesswork so far. Just theory. Jim, why don't you give me a chance to do an autopsy and let Spock check the transporter circuits again.", "Suppose it wasn't shock, Jim. Suppose death was caused by transporter malfunction. Then you'd die. They'd die, anyway. Jim, you can't risk your life on a theory!", "Well then, we can't help you, Jim. The decision is yours.", 'No!', 'He attacked him.', 'Well, Mister Spock? Jim?', "Severe exposure and frostbite, but I think they'll make it. How do you feel, Jim?"]
Flattened Dialogue: You picked a good day, Fisher. Business has been lousy. What'd you do, take a fall on purpose so you could get a little vacation? What can I do for you, Jim? Back to that bed, bucko. Come on, let's go. He'll be regaining consciousness soon, and not knowing what his physical state is, I don't think I dare give him a tranquilizer of any kind. I think we'd better bind him. You have a point, Spock? It's the Captain's guts you're analysing. Are you of that, Spock? You have your intellect, Jim. You can fight with that! Apparently the body functioning weakened during the duplication process. A fact I failed to consider. I don't know, Jim. Jim, he is back! Jim, you can use that brandy now. In fact, I'll join you. Jim, you're no different than anyone else. We all have our darker side. We need it! It's half of what we are. It's not really ugly, it's human. Yes, human. A lot of what he is makes you the man you are. God forbid I should have to agree with Spock, but he was right. Without the negative side, you wouldn't be the Captain. You couldn't be, and you know it. Your strength of command lies mostly in him. You have the goodness. The intelligence, the logic. It appears your half has most of that, and perhaps that's where man's essential courage comes from. For you see, he was afraid and you weren't. He's dead, Jim. Autopsy in-depth. Hurry. I don't know. Animal could have died of some kind of shock. I said could have, Mister Spock. We won't know until we get a full post-mortem. Could be, if, maybe. All guesswork so far. Just theory. Jim, why don't you give me a chance to do an autopsy and let Spock check the transporter circuits again. Suppose it wasn't shock, Jim. Suppose death was caused by transporter malfunction. Then you'd die. They'd die, anyway. Jim, you can't risk your life on a theory! Well then, we can't help you, Jim. The decision is yours. No! He attacked him. Well, Mister Spock? Jim? Severe exposure and frostbite, but I think they'll make it. How do you feel, Jim?

Title: The Enemy Within
Dialogue: ['Mister Spock.', 'Is there something I can do for you, Captain?', 'Well, Doctor McCoy seemed to think I should check on you.', 'Well, our good doctor said that you were acting like a wild man, demanded brandy.', "Hmm. Well, in that case, if you'll excuse the intrusion Captain, I'll get back to my work.", 'Captain.', "Doctor McCoy reports that you demanded this brandy in Sickbay and left with it. I found this bottle in Yeoman Rand's quarters.", "You can go now, Yeoman. There's only one logical answer. We have an impostor aboard.", 'About your double, Captain.', "We can't take a chance on killing it. We have no previous experience, no way of knowing what would happen to you.", 'How shall we explain it to them, Captain? The search parties are to capture you?', 'The search parties, Captain.', "Captain, no disrespect intended, but you must surely realise you can't announce the full truth to the crew. You're the Captain of this ship. You haven't the right to be vulnerable in the eyes of the crew. You can't afford the luxury of being anything less than perfect. If you do, they lose faith, and you lose command.", 'Understood, Captain.', 'About the phaser weapons to be set for stunning force and locked.', "Thermal heaters were transported down. They duplicated. They won't operate.", 'Spock here.', 'Acknowledged. Continue the search.', 'Apparently, this double, however different in temperament, has your knowledge of the ship, its crew, its devices. This being the case, perhaps we can outguess him by determining his next move. Knowing how the ship is laid out, where would you go to elude a mass search?', "Set and locked on base cycle to stun, not to kill. What about your phaser, Captain? Don't you think we ought to get some help, Captain?", 'Captain, you ordered me to tell you.', "Judging from my observations, Captain, you're rapidly losing the power of decision.", 'Yes, always, Doctor. We have here an unusual opportunity to appraise the human mind, or to examine, in Earth terms, the roles of good and evil in a man. His negative side, which you call hostility, lust, violence, and his positive side, which Earth people express as compassion, love, tenderness.', "Yes, and what is it that makes one man an exceptional leader? We see indications that it's his negative side which makes him strong, that his evil side, if you will, properly controlled and disciplined, is vital to his strength. Your negative side removed from you, the power of command begins to elude you.", "If your power of command continues to weaken, you'll soon be unable to function as Captain. You must be prepared for that.", "If I seem insensitive to what you're going through, Captain, understand it's the way I am.", "This is Spock, Mister Sulu. You'll have to hold on a little longer. There's no other way. Survival procedures, Mister Sulu.", 'Captain Kirk.', 'Spock here. Would you come to the transporter room. We think we may have found an answer.', "We've attached some bypass and leader circuits to compensate for the difference. Tied directly into the impulse engines, there shouldn't be more than a five point variation in the velocity balance. I suggest we send the animal through. Captain.", "It's painless and quick. The animal will be unconscious for only a few minutes.", 'Energise. Reverse.', 'The shock of putting him back together seems to have been too much for him.', 'For once, I agree with you.', 'No autopsy is necessary to know that the animal was terrified, confused. It was split into two halves and suddenly thrust back together again. Thus shock induced by blind terror.', "It couldn't understand. You can. You have your intelligence controlling your fear.", "Aren't you forgetting something, Captain?", 'Your men on the planet surface. How much time do they have left?', 'Being split in two halves is no theory with me, Doctor. I have a human half, you see, as well as an alien half, submerged, constantly at war with each other. Personal experience, Doctor. I survive it because my intelligence wins over both, makes them live together. Your intelligence would enable you to survive as well.', 'Are you relinquishing your command, Captain?', 'Captain, I thought the plan', "We'll let the captain handle this.", "You'll have to hold on to him, Captain.", 'Captain?', 'Understood, Captain.', 'Ready.', 'Right away, Captain.', 'All sections report ready, sir.', 'Shall I pass that on to the crew, sir?', "The, er, impostor had some interesting qualities, wouldn't you say, Yeoman?"]

Title: Mudd's Women
Dialogue: ['There he is, sir. Centre screen. Still trying to run away from us, sir.', 'No, sir.', "Changing course again. He knows we're after him all right.", "He's seen the asteroids too, sir.", 'If one hits him.', "He's drifting into the asteroid belt, Captain.", "We're overloading, Captain. Engine temperatures climbing.", 'That was one of our lithium crystal circuits, sir.', 'Another circuit, sir.', 'Another lithium circuit. Now supplementing with battery power, sir.', 'Asteroid hit him dead centre.', "You're on duty, Johnny-o. Back to reality.", 'I noticed. How I noticed. Come on, Johnny.', 'Captain Kirk, engineering section reports our entire life-support system is now on batteries.', 'Power curve still dropping, Captain.', 'Checking, but not getting much.', "That's Ben Childress' quarters.", 'Engines engaged. Helm answering.', 'Ahead full, sir.']

Captain Kirk, engineering section reports our entire life-support system is now on batteries. Power curve still dropping, Captain. Checking, but not getting much. That's Ben Childress' quarters. Engines engaged. Helm answering. Ahead full, sir.

Communications, have a representative of the Rigel 12 miners meet us here to discuss our needs. Beam him up first pass over their camp.', "Not at all, Mister Spock. The choice was burning this lithium crystal or the destruction of another man's ship. Come.", "Good. Show them in. I'm James Kirk, captain of the Enterprise. This is my science officer Mister Spock.", "Fine. I'm authorised to pay an equitable price.", 'What did you have in mind?', 'Is there anything else?', "No deal. You're a long way out in space, gentlemen. You'll need medical help, cargo runs, starship protection. You want to consider those facts too?", "It's still no deal.", "All right, Childress, you've won. Now I'll take the lithium crystals.", 'Childress.', 'You got a better idea?', 'Just have those crystals here when I get back.', 'Eve! Eve!', "But we don't! I didn't get any. I should have found a way. Satisfied, Mister Scott?", 'Has Childress reported in yet?', 'Sorry, Scotty. How much power do we have left?', 'Have Mudd meet me in the transporter room.', 'The name of this game.', 'Sit down. Tell him. Tell him, Harry.', 'The Venus drugs, Harry.', 'Oh, it exists, illegally.', 'He gave it to the women before you met them.', "They've left for their quarters during the storm, Childress. They're married. Subspace radio marriage. It was a fraud. They can get out of it.", 'Quite a woman, eh, Childress?', 'By herself. She took no drug.', 'Coloured gelatin.', "There's only one kind of woman.", "You either believe in yourself, or you don't. All right Childress, I've gone as far with you as I intend to. I want those lithium crystals and I want them now. Enterprise, this is Kirk.", 'Stand by. Do I beam down a search party?', "Stand by, Mister Spock. We're coming aboard with the lithium crystals.", 'Eve?', 'Two of us, Mister Spock. Come on, Mister Mudd.', "I can't do that, Harry, but I will appear as a character witness at your trial. If you think that'll help.", 'Why should I work your side of the street?', 'Ahead full.']

Title: Mudd's Women
Dialogue: ["Difficult to say, Captain. We're getting no registration beam from it.", "Sir, he's pushing his engines too hard.", 'Approaching an asteroid belt, Captain. Schiller rating three five.', 'Sensor reading on the vessel. I make it out as a small class J cargo ship, and his engines are super-heating.', 'How many more in your crew?', "What's wrong?", "It'll take longer on battery power.", "Curious. You're certain this was everyone aboard, Mister Walsh? No other crewmen?", 'You can explain that to the Captain.', 'Deck twelve.', 'The Commander of the transport to see you, Captain.', "I'm well aware of that, Mister Scott.", 'Better rig a by-pass circuit.', 'Needed on the bridge, Captain.', "The entire ship's power is feeding through one lithium crystal.", "And that crystal won't hold up, not pulling all our power through it.", "There's a lithium mining operation on Rigel 12. High-grade ore, I've heard.", "Mister Farrell has the course. Less than two day's travel.", 'Rigel 12, Mister Farrell. You have the course.', 'State your name for the record.', 'Your correct name.', 'State your correct name for the record.', 'Any past offenses, Mister Mudd?', 'We can sustain this orbit for three days, seven hours.', "Even burned and cracked, they're beautiful. Destroying them was a shame.", 'Conserving batteries, sir. Half power.', "We don't have the time to spare, Captain.", 'The storm is ionising the atmosphere, Captain. Getting difficult to probe through it.', 'Infrared reading. Check traverse three, grid zero four zero.', "There's a heat unit operating in there. It could be a cookstove.", 'Mudd?', 'Spock here, Captain.', 'How many coming, Captain?', "I'm happy the affair is over. A most annoying emotional episode.", 'The fact that my internal arrangement differs from yours, Doctor, pleases me no end.']
Flattened Dialogue: Difficult to say, Captain. We're getting no registration beam from it. Sir, he's pushing his engines too hard. Approaching an asteroid belt, Captain. Schiller rating three five. Sensor reading on the vessel. I make it out as a small class J cargo ship, and his engines are super-heating. How many more in your crew? What's wrong? It'll take longer on battery power. Curious. You're certain this was everyone aboard, Mister Walsh? No other crewmen? You can explain that to the Captain. Deck twelve. The Commander of the transport to see you, Captain. I'm well aware of that, Mister Scott. Better rig a by-pass circuit. Needed on the bridge, Captain. The entire ship's power is feeding through one lithium crystal. And that crystal won't hold up, not pulling all our power through it. There's a lithium mining operation on Rigel 12. High-grade ore, I've heard. Mister Farrell has the course. Less than two day's travel. Rigel 12, Mister Farrell. You have the course. State your name for the record. Your correct name. State your correct name for the record. Any past offenses, Mister Mudd? We can sustain this orbit for three days, seven hours. Even burned and cracked, they're beautiful. Destroying them was a shame. Conserving batteries, sir. Half power. We don't have the time to spare, Captain. The storm is ionising the atmosphere, Captain. Getting difficult to probe through it. Infrared reading. Check traverse three, grid zero four zero. There's a heat unit operating in there. It could be a cookstove. Mudd? Spock here, Captain. How many coming, Captain? I'm happy the affair is over. A most annoying emotional episode. The fact that my internal arrangement differs from yours, Doctor, pleases me no end.

Title: Mudd's Women
Dialogue: ["If it is, he'll soon overload his engines.", "Captain, if we try, we'll overload our own engines. He's too far away.", 'Aye, sir.', "They're not answering our signal. There's nothing to lock onto.", "We're locked onto something, Captain.", "Your vessel's breaking up, man. If we don't get them over here right now", "Only one, sir, but we've locked onto three more.", "I don't know, sir. With those three lithium crystals gone", "Not yet, sir, but we've hooked onto something.", 'Oh, er, four in all, sir.', "We've got trouble, Mister Spock.", 'One lithium crystal left, and that with a hairline split at the base.', "Can't. We blew the whole converter assembly.", 'We burned them all out when we super-heated. That jackass Walsh not only wrecked his vessel, but in saving his skin', "But it's frustrating. Almost a million gross tons of vessel depending on a hunk of crystal the size of my fist.", "Our last crystal, sir. It's gone.", "It'll get us to Rigel 12, sir, but it'll be a shaky orbit.", "I'll get you there.", 'Captain, this is draining our batteries further. If we only had those crystals.', 'About five hours, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: If it is, he'll soon overload his engines. Captain, if we try, we'll overload our own engines. He's too far away. Aye, sir. They're not answering our signal. There's nothing to lock onto. We're locked onto something, Captain. Your vessel's breaking up, man. If we don't get them over here right now Only one, sir, but we've locked onto three more. I don't know, sir. With those three lithium crystals gone Not yet, sir, but we've hooked onto something. Oh, er, four in all, sir. We've got trouble, Mister Spock. One lithium crystal left, and that with a hairline split at the base. Can't. We blew the whole converter assembly. We burned them all out when we super-heated. That jackass Walsh not only wrecked his vessel, but in saving his skin But it's frustrating. Almost a million gross tons of vessel depending on a hunk of crystal the size of my fist. Our last crystal, sir. It's gone. It'll get us to Rigel 12, sir, but it'll be a shaky orbit. I'll get you there. Captain, this is draining our batteries further. If we only had those crystals. About five hours, sir.

Title: Mudd's Women
Dialogue: ["I've tried all frequencies, sir. He refuses to answer. Unless he's not receiving us.", "I'm getting a distress signal call from them, sir.", 'Yes, sir.', 'Losing communications with the miners, sir. Magnetic storm seems worse.', 'No, sir. He and the girl are still missing.']
Flattened Dialogue: I've tried all frequencies, sir. He refuses to answer. Unless he's not receiving us. I'm getting a distress signal call from them, sir. Yes, sir. Losing communications with the miners, sir. Magnetic storm seems worse. No, sir. He and the girl are still missing.

Title: Mudd's Women
Dialogue: ["You're aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise.", 'Never trusted this.', 'Yes. Yes, they are.', 'Amen to that, Scotty.', 'Why, yes, please do. By all means. Connors, are you finished?', 'Would, Would you walk past my panel again, please?', 'My medical scanner.', "Oh no. I wouldn't trust my, my judgment, believe me. Just walk by, please. It's not supposed to do that.", 'Yes, if they need it.', "What? Oh, yes, they're in excellent health, all three of them.", 'Are you wearing some unusual kind of perfume or something radioactive, my dear?', 'I wonder what makes it do that.', 'She refused.', "Are they, Jim? Are they actually more lovely, pound for pound, measurement for measurement, than any other women you've known? Or is it that they just, well, act beautiful. No. Strike that, strike that.", 'You mean are they alien illusions? That sort of thing?', 'No, an alien smart enough to pull this could also keep my medical scanner from going beep!', "I don't either.", 'That must have been quite a talk you made down there. Ever try considering the patent medicine business?', "Smack right in the old heart. Oh, I'm sorry. In your case, it would be about here."]

What? Oh, yes, they're in excellent health, all three of them. Are you wearing some unusual kind of perfume or something radioactive, my dear? I wonder what makes it do that. She refused. Title: Mudd's Women

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Dialogue: ["We're entering standard orbit, Nurse. It won't be much longer.", 'I understand you gave up a career in bio-research to sign aboard a starship.', "It's been five years since his last message.", 'Put it on all frequencies, Lieutenant.', 'But the surface temperature of that planet is one hundred degrees below zero.', "Required reading at the academy, Mister Spock. I've always wanted to meet him. Do you think there's any chance of him still being alive?", 'Keep trying.', 'And since then two expeditions have failed to find him.', "Enterprise to Korby. We have your co-ordinates pin-pointed. We're preparing to beam down a party. It may interest you that we have aboard this vessel", 'The man making it is Doctor Roger Korby.', 'Agreed, Doctor. However, there will be two of us.', "We're on our way, Doctor. We'll be with you in a moment. Enterprise out.", 'Energise.', "Doctor Korby? Doctor Korby. It's possible we may have hit the wrong entry point. Kirk to Enterprise.", 'Beam down two security men.', "Some delay in meeting us. Probably nothing at all. Kirk out. Corridors could be quite deep. Getting here may have taken more time than he estimated. Don't worry.", 'Rayburn, maintain post here.', "Matthews, we'll look for Doctor Korby. Accompany us.", 'Is that you, Doctor Korby?', 'Is there a path down there?', 'Any chance of a projection or a ledge?', 'Not soon enough.', 'You do know him well? An old friend?', 'Captain Kirk to Rayburn. Report.', 'We lost Matthews. Apparently an accident. Tell the Enterprise to have a full security party standing by.', "And we'll both report in at hourly intervals. If you and I lose contact, or if he fails to hear from either of us, he's to beam the security party down immediately. Kirk out.", 'Where is Doctor Korby?', "There's no need to apologise, sir, and certainly no need to introduce yourself.", "It wasn't your fault. Kirk to Rayburn, report. I'm required to make a security confirmation. When I call my ship, if you list your personnel, cargo requirements, any special needs", 'Rayburn, are you receiving?', "I've lost contact with my guard. I'm required to call my ship.", "Sir, one man is dead. I've lost contact with the other.", 'What are you doing?', 'Drop it!', 'Enterprise from Captain Kirk. Come in. Do you read?', 'Contact established with Doctor Korby.', 'No problem, Mister Spock. Bear with me.', "Yes, I know your reputation. The whole galaxy knows who you are and what you stand for. That's why all this makes no sense.", 'Or disobey an order from her.', 'Doctor, do I need to be a prisoner to be convinced?', "A simple layman's question, Doctor. Where is my other crewman? Alive? Dead?", 'Where is my other crewman?', "He's an android like Brown?", "You've convinced me, Doctor. You've convinced me that you're dangerous.", "If these mechanical things have no feelings and perform only as you programme them, then why did Brown try to shoot me? Why did he kill two of my men? There are many things I don't understand, Doctor.", "Mind your own business, Mister Spock. I'm sick of your half-breed interference, do you hear? Mind your own business, Mister Spock. I'm sick of your half-breed", 'As far as I know.', "Well, there's one difference between us. I'm hungry.", 'Eating is a pleasure, sir. Unfortunately, one you will never know.', "He's an exact duplicate?", 'What about memory? Tell me about Sam.', 'He saw me off on this mission.', 'He said he was being transferred to Earth colony two research station.', "Obviously, I can't, but we do have some interesting differences.", 'Programming. Different word, but the same old promises made by Genghis Khan, Julius Caesar, Hitler, Ferris, Maltuvis.', 'It can also be improved by eliminating love, tenderness, sentiment. The other side of the coin, Doctor.', 'All you wanted before was my understanding.', 'Yes, yes. No one need know, only to frighten uninformed minds.', "You've created your own Kirk. Why do you need me?", "I'm impressed, Doctor, but not the way you think! Stand back, Ruk! I'll kill him! Stay back.", 'Christine, is that you?', 'Andrea, kiss me.', "What's the matter, Andrea? Confused?", "Emotion, Ruk? You disapprove of Miss Chapel's orders to save my life?", "Why? Can't your memory banks solve a simple equation like that? What happened to the old ones, Ruk?", 'Is it possible they built their machines too well, gave them pride and a desire to survive? Machines that wanted logic and order and found that frustrated by the illogical emotional creatures that built them?', "And isn't it Korby who's creating the same danger to you all over again? Unlike you, we humans are full of unpredictable emotions that logic cannot solve.", 'And Korby?', 'The danger to you is Korby.', 'The old ones programmed you, too, but it became possible to destroy them.', "That's it, Ruk! Logic! You can't protect someone who's trying to destroy you!", 'You were a man with respect for all things alive. How can I explain the change in you? If I was to tell Earth I was in your hands, to tell them what has become', "Spock. He must've got my message.", "She killed the android, Korby, the same way you killed Ruk. Is this your perfect world, your flawless beings killing off one another? Aren't you doing exactly what you hate most in humans, killing with no more concern than when you turn off a light?", "Then prove it. Give me that phaser gun. If there's any human left in you, give it to me.", 'Andrea, give me the weapon.', 'In here, Spock.', 'Doctor Korby was never here.', "She's staying with the ship. Something bothering you, Mister Spock?", "I'll remember that Mister Spock, the next time I find myself in a similar situation. Steady as we go, helm."]

Different word, but the same old promises made by Genghis Khan, Julius Caesar, Hitler, Ferris, Maltuvis. It can also be improved by eliminating love, tenderness, sentiment. The other side of the coin, Doctor. All you wanted before was my understanding. Yes, yes. No one need know, only to frighten uninformed minds. You've created your own Kirk. Why do you need me? I'm impressed, Doctor, but not the way you think! Stand back, Ruk! I'll kill him! Stay back. Christine, is that you? Andrea, kiss me. What's the matter, Andrea? Confused? Emotion, Ruk? You disapprove of Miss Chapel's orders to save my life? Why? Can't your memory banks solve a simple equation like that? What happened to the old ones, Ruk? Is it possible they built their machines too well, gave them pride and a desire to survive? Machines that wanted logic and order and found that frustrated by the illogical emotional creatures that built them? And isn't it Korby who's creating the same danger to you all over again? Unlike you, we humans are full of unpredictable emotions that logic cannot solve. And Korby? The danger to you is Korby. The old ones programmed you, too, but it became possible to destroy them. That's it, Ruk! Logic! You can't protect someone who's trying to destroy you! You were a man with respect for all things alive. How can I explain the change in you? If I was to tell Earth I was in your hands, to tell them what has become Spock. He must've got my message. She killed the android, Korby, the same way you killed Ruk. Is this your perfect world, your flawless beings killing off one another? Aren't you doing exactly what you hate most in humans, killing with no more concern than when you turn off a light? Then prove it. Give me that phaser gun. If there's any human left in you, give it to me. Andrea, give me the weapon. In here, Spock. Doctor Korby was never here. She's staying with the ship. Something bothering you, Mister Spock? I'll remember that Mister Spock, the next time I find myself in a similar situation. Steady as we go, helm.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Dialogue: ["I know he's alive down there, Captain.", "Roger's a very determined man. He'd find a way to live.", 'His last signal told about finding underground caverns.', "Have you ever been engaged, Mister Spock? Yes, it's Roger.", 'Hello, Roger.', 'Yes, Roger.', "Yes, Roger. Everything's all right now.", "He said he'd be waiting.", 'Thank you.', "Doctor Brown! It's Roger's assistant. Brownie, where's Roger?", 'Brownie, what is it?', "Don't you recognise me?", 'I suppose living here for five years.', "I don't remember Doctor Korby mentioning an Andrea.", "Oh, I knew I'd find you.", 'Roger.', 'Roger, that', 'Where is Captain Kirk?', 'Yes, I am concerned.', "Yes, let's start with Andrea.", 'How convenient.', 'Given a mechanical Doctor Brown, a mechanical geisha would be no more difficult.', 'Did you?', "Roger, what's happened to you? When I sat in your class, you wouldn't even dream of harming an insect or an animal. Their life was sacred to you then.", "I don't know. They're exact. I honestly don't know.", 'Are you all right?', 'Yes, thank you.', 'Captain.', "No, I'm not torn. I'm puzzled. I'm worried.", "Nothing he hasn't told you. I know it doesn't make sense. What he's done may seem wrong, but he is Roger Korby, whatever he seems to be doing.", "No. You're forgetting how well I know him. He's as sane as you or I.", "Please, don't ask me to make that choice. I'd much rather you push me off the same precipice where Matthews died. Oh, I can't. Please, go ahead and eat.", 'Roger, I. Ruk, no!', 'Ruk, stop! Doctor Korby said you are to obey me! Ruk! Ruk! Ruk, I order you not to harm him!', 'Are you, Roger?', "But he'll never find us in this maze.", "Don't you see, Roger? Everything you've done has proved it isn't you.", "Thank you for letting me make the decision, Captain. I'm quite certain I'm doing the right thing."]
Flattened Dialogue: I know he's alive down there, Captain. Roger's a very determined man. He'd find a way to live. His last signal told about finding underground caverns. Have you ever been engaged, Mister Spock? Yes, it's Roger. Hello, Roger. Yes, Roger. Yes, Roger. Everything's all right now. He said he'd be waiting. Thank you. Doctor Brown! It's Roger's assistant. Brownie, where's Roger? Brownie, what is it? Don't you recognise me? I suppose living here for five years. I don't remember Doctor Korby mentioning an Andrea. Oh, I knew I'd find you. Roger. Roger, that Where is Captain Kirk? Yes, I am concerned. Yes, let's start with Andrea. How convenient. Given a mechanical Doctor Brown, a mechanical geisha would be no more difficult. Did you? Roger, what's happened to you? When I sat in your class, you wouldn't even dream of harming an insect or an animal. Their life was sacred to you then. I don't know. They're exact. I honestly don't know. Are you all right? Yes, thank you. Captain. No, I'm not torn. I'm puzzled. I'm worried. Nothing he hasn't told you. I know it doesn't make sense. What he's done may seem wrong, but he is Roger Korby, whatever he seems to be doing. No. You're forgetting how well I know him. He's as sane as you or I. Please, don't ask me to make that choice. I'd much rather you push me off the same precipice where Matthews died. Oh, I can't. Please, go ahead and eat. Roger, I. Ruk, no! Ruk, stop! Doctor Korby said you are to obey me! Ruk! Ruk! Ruk, I order you not to harm him! Are you, Roger? But he'll never find us in this maze. Don't you see, Roger? Everything you've done has proved it isn't you. Thank you for letting me make the decision, Captain. I'm quite certain I'm doing the right thing.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Dialogue: ['Beginning signals to surface, sir.', "I've tried all frequencies, sir. No return signal.", "I've run all frequencies a second time. There's no", 'Frequency open, Mister Spock.']
Flattened Dialogue: Beginning signals to surface, sir. I've tried all frequencies, sir. No return signal. I've run all frequencies a second time. There's no Frequency open, Mister Spock.

Title: What Are Little Girls Made Of?
Dialogue: ["Ship's record banks show little we don't already know about this planet, Captain. Gravity is one point one of Earth, atmosphere within safety limits.", 'It may have been inhabited once, but the sun in this system has been fading steadily for a half million years. Now, Doctor Korby, often called the Pasteur of archaeological medicine. His translation of medical records from the Orion ruins revolutionised our immunisation techniques.', "That's an unusual request.", "You're certain you recognise his voice?", 'Spock here, Captain.', 'Any problems, Captain?', 'Spock here, Captain.', "We were becoming concerned, Captain. Your check-in was overdue and since we'd not heard from your security team", 'Captain, are you all right? You sound tired.', 'Acknowledge, Captain. Is everything all right?', 'Captain!', 'Captain, We finished ahead of schedule.', "You're going back down with the command pack?", 'Yes. very well, Captain.', 'No problems here, sir.', 'Security, Spock here. Status of your landing party?', 'Have them meet me in the transporter room after the Captain has beamed down.', 'Captain Kirk!', "Captain, are you all right? Nurse? Where's Doctor Korby?", 'Frankly, I was rather dismayed by your use of the term half-breed, Captain. You must admit it is an unsophisticated expression.']
Flattened Dialogue: Ship's record banks show little we don't already know about this planet, Captain. Gravity is one point one of Earth, atmosphere within safety limits. It may have been inhabited once, but the sun in this system has been fading steadily for a half million years. Now, Doctor Korby, often called the Pasteur of archaeological medicine. His translation of medical records from the Orion ruins revolutionised our immunisation techniques. That's an unusual request. You're certain you recognise his voice? Spock here, Captain. Any problems, Captain? Spock here, Captain. We were becoming concerned, Captain. Your check-in was overdue and since we'd not heard from your security team Captain, are you all right? You sound tired. Acknowledge, Captain. Is everything all right? Captain! Captain, We finished ahead of schedule. You're going back down with the command pack? Yes. very well, Captain. No problems here, sir. Security, Spock here. Status of your landing party? Have them meet me in the transporter room after the Captain has beamed down. Captain Kirk! Captain, are you all right? Nurse? Where's Doctor Korby? Frankly, I was rather dismayed by your use of the term half-breed, Captain. You must admit it is an unsophisticated expression.

Title: Miri
Dialogue: ['Earth-style distress signal. SOS.', "We're hundreds of light years from Earth, Mister Spock. No colonies or vessels out this far.", 'Not the Earth, another Earth. Another Earth?', 'Hold us in a fixed orbit, Mister Spock.', 'Still no response, communications?', "We'll beam down. Alert security. Prepare to transport landing party to surface. We'll land in the vicinity of the distress signals now being received.", 'Identical. Earth, as it was in the early 1900s.', 'Mister Spock.', 'But with the mind of a child. Bones, what is it?', 'We want to help you.', 'What is?', 'Come on!', 'How old is this thing?', 'Come out. We mean you no harm.', "I'm not going to hurt you.", "I won't hurt you.", 'I only want to talk to you.', 'Come on.', "I won't hurt you.", "Come on. It's all right. Come on.", 'Take the guards, have a look outside. Radioactive readings, chemical pollutions, any further sign of life.', "We didn't do anything like that.", "Well, of course not. We're here to help.", 'What happened here? Where is everybody?', "No, I don't. Won't you tell me?", 'What are Grups?', 'You said something about the Grups doing bad things, yelling, hurting, burning.', "You're doing fine.", "But what about the children, the Onlies? Didn't the awful things affect them?", 'More of you? How many?', "What's your name?", 'Miri. A pretty name for a pretty young woman.', 'Very pretty.', 'Miri said all the adults died.', 'There must be records somewhere and answers to some of our questions. Miri, do you know any buildings where the doctors used to work?', 'Will you take me there?', "It's important. Please.", "Yes. It's Jim.", 'Good. I like yours, too. I like you.', "I wouldn't lie to you.", 'Why, thank you.', 'Yes, Lieutenant?', "Under no circumstances do I want anyone to beam down from the ship. We can't take any chances with further contamination.", "My orders still stand, Lieutenant. You can help us best by clearing the computer banks and standing by. Kirk out. Bones, why do you think the symptoms haven't appeared in Mister Spock?", 'Intermediate experimentation report project on life prolongation.', 'All the adults are dead. Only the children are left alive.', 'At least they have up to now.', 'That would explain why there are no adults.', 'Who die when they enter adolescence.', "Loneliness? I don't know, curiosity? I think children have an instinctive need for adults. They want to be told right and wrong.", 'Try again. See if you can find anything outside. Hey, clean up that desk for me, will you?', 'Thank you.', 'That would certainly answer the question of what happened to their parents.', "I wouldn't examine that dream too closely, Yeoman. It might not turn out to be very pretty.", "I don't think so.", "There's no adult interpretation. I think we're dealing with children. Immensely old perhaps, but nonetheless children. We've got to do something about the others.", "You couldn't get close to the other kids?", "I'm going to try. Miri? Come here. You want to go someplace with me?", "Dead. I don't understand it. My phaser wasn't set to kill.", "We could use some more, if you don't mind.", "There couldn't be any doubt about what you found here?", 'What about Miri?', "And you? The disease doesn't seem to be interested in you.", "Of course, Mister Spock. We still don't know what we're fighting.", 'Are You certain about the time we have left?', 'Is there any possibility', "There's no data, no starting point.", 'Janice, take Miri for a walk.', 'But do you know what they were up to?', "You two will have to recreate their thinking. If you can isolate that virus, we'll be able to develop a vaccine.", 'I know.', 'The children!', 'Anything?', 'And you?', "Haven't you found a thing yet?", "We're all frightened.", 'Never mind that, what did you find?', "Where is she, Miri? Where is she, Miri? Where's Janice?", 'Where is she? Has something happened to her?', "No, I don't feel all right! None of us feel all right! Can't you see what's going on?", "I've got to find Janice.", "We're trying, Mister Spock. We're trying very hard.", 'This is the vaccine?', 'Did you hear them? We only have a few hours left.', "You've got to care. Miri, I'm going to tell you something. You, your friends, all the Onlies are going to get the disease unless we succeed in what we're doing. You've seen your friends get it.", "Not sometimes. All the times, Miri! As soon as you start growing up the way you are. Don't you know why you don't like to play games anymore, why you don't see your friends the way you used to? It's because you're becoming a young woman, and the moment you become a young woman, you get the disease. All of you.", "All the time, Miri! It's happening to you right now! Look at it. Look at it, Miri, it's in you!", 'Listen to me. Listen to me!', "This isn't a game. It never was a game.", "Listen to me! You've got our communicators, the boxes we talk into. We need them to talk to the ship.", "No blah blah blah! Because if we don't talk to the ship, if you don't help us, there won't be any games anymore. There won't be anything. Nothing, no Grups, no Onlies, nobody left forever and ever.", "Now listen to me. You've got to help us before it's too late. Let Janice go. Give me those communicators before it's too late.", "You've seen your friends change one by one as they grew up. Did you ever see one of them not change? One by one, they got the disease, and they became like, Iike those creatures you're afraid of, like Louise. One by one they changed and got the disease. The disease like I've got, like Miri has. You understand what I'm talking about. You're not babies. We can help you!", "It's waiting for you. It may only be a matter of months.", "Look at my arms! That's what's going to happen to you unless you let me help you.", "And the little ones. What's going to happen to them after you've gone, after you've turned into creatures like Louise? Oh, they'll still be here, but not for long, because the food's all gone. You've eaten it. Maybe six months left, that's all, and then nothing left to eat, nobody left to take care of them. They'll die, too.", "All right, you want a foolie? All right. I dare you, I double-dare you. Look at the blood on my face. Now look at your hands. Blood on your hands. Now who's doing the hurting? Not the Grups, it's you hurting, yelling, maybe killing, just like the Grups you remember and creatures you're afraid of. You're acting like them, and you're going to be just like them unless you let me help you. I'm a Grup, and I want to help you. I'm begging you, let me help you or there won't be anything left at all. Please.", 'Three hours, eleven minutes left. Thank you, Lieutenant. Keep this channel open. Clear your computers. What happened to him?', 'Look at his face.', "Just children, three hundred years old and more. I've already contacted Space Central. They'll send teachers, advisers.", "They'll be all right.", 'Yes. I never get involved with older women, Yeoman. Mister Spock?', 'Full ahead. Warp factor one.']
Flattened Dialogue: Earth-style distress signal. SOS. We're hundreds of light years from Earth, Mister Spock. No colonies or vessels out this far. Not the Earth, another Earth. Another Earth? Hold us in a fixed orbit, Mister Spock. Still no response, communications? We'll beam down. Alert security. Prepare to transport landing party to surface. We'll land in the vicinity of the distress signals now being received. Identical. Earth, as it was in the early 1900s. Mister Spock. But with the mind of a child. Bones, what is it? We want to help you. What is? Come on! How old is this thing? Come out. We mean you no harm. I'm not going to hurt you. I won't hurt you. I only want to talk to you. Come on. I won't hurt you. Come on. It's all right. Come on. Take the guards, have a look outside. Radioactive readings, chemical pollutions, any further sign of life. We didn't do anything like that. Well, of course not. We're here to help. What happened here? Where is everybody? No, I don't. Won't you tell me? What are Grups? You said something about the Grups doing bad things, yelling, hurting, burning. You're doing fine. But what about the children, the Onlies? Didn't the awful things affect them? More of you? How many? What's your name? Miri. A pretty name for a pretty young woman. Very pretty. Miri said all the adults died. There must be records somewhere and answers to some of our questions. Miri, do you know any buildings where the doctors used to work? Will you take me there? It's important. Please. Yes. It's Jim. Good. I like yours, too. I like you. I wouldn't lie to you. Why, thank you. Yes, Lieutenant? Under no circumstances do I want anyone to beam down from the ship. We can't take any chances with further contamination. My orders still stand, Lieutenant. You can help us best by clearing the computer banks and standing by. Kirk out. Bones, why do you think the symptoms haven't appeared in Mister Spock? Intermediate experimentation report project on life prolongation. All the adults are dead. Only the children are left alive. At least they have up to now. That would explain why there are no adults. Who die when they enter adolescence. Loneliness? I don't know, curiosity? I think children have an instinctive need for adults. They want to be told right and wrong. Try again. See if you can find anything outside. Hey, clean up that desk for me, will you? Thank you. That would certainly answer the question of what happened to their parents. I wouldn't examine that dream too closely, Yeoman. It might not turn out to be very pretty. I don't think so. There's no adult interpretation. I think we're dealing with children. Immensely old perhaps, but nonetheless children. We've got to do something about the others. You couldn't get close to the other kids? I'm going to try. Miri? Come here. You want to go someplace with me? Dead. I don't understand it. My phaser wasn't set to kill. We could use some more, if you don't mind. There couldn't be any doubt about what you found here? What about Miri? And you? The disease doesn't seem to be interested in you. Of course, Mister Spock. We still don't know what we're fighting. Are You certain about the time we have left? Is there any possibility There's no data, no starting point. Janice, take Miri for a walk. But do you know what they were up to? You two will have to recreate their thinking. If you can isolate that virus, we'll be able to develop a vaccine. I know. The children! Anything? And you? Haven't you found a thing yet? We're all frightened. Never mind that, what did you find? Where is she, Miri? Where is she, Miri? Where's Janice? Where is she? Has something happened to her? No, I don't feel all right! None of us feel all right! Can't you see what's going on? I've got to find Janice. We're trying, Mister Spock. We're trying very hard. This is the vaccine? Did you hear them? We only have a few hours left. You've got to care. Miri, I'm going to tell you something. You, your friends, all the Onlies are going to get the disease unless we succeed in what we're doing. You've seen your friends get it. Not sometimes. All the times, Miri! As soon as you start growing up the way you are. Don't you know why you don't like to play games anymore, why you don't see your friends the way you used to? It's because you're becoming a young woman, and the moment you become a young woman, you get the disease. All of you. All the time, Miri! It's happening to you right now! Look at it. Look at it, Miri, it's in you! Listen to me. Listen to me! This isn't a game. It never was a game. Listen to me! You've got our communicators, the boxes we talk into. We need them to talk to the ship. No blah blah blah! Because if we don't talk to the ship, if you don't help us, there won't be any games anymore. There won't be anything. Nothing, no Grups, no Onlies, nobody left forever and ever. Now listen to me. You've got to help us before it's too late. Let Janice go. Give me those communicators before it's too late. You've seen your friends change one by one as they grew up. Did you ever see one of them not change? One by one, they got the disease, and they became like, Iike those creatures you're afraid of, like Louise. One by one they changed and got the disease. The disease like I've got, like Miri has. You understand what I'm talking about. You're not babies. We can help you! It's waiting for you. It may only be a matter of months. Look at my arms! That's what's going to happen to you unless you let me help you. And the little ones. What's going to happen to them after you've gone, after you've turned into creatures like Louise? Oh, they'll still be here, but not for long, because the food's all gone. You've eaten it. Maybe six months left, that's all, and then nothing left to eat, nobody left to take care of them. They'll die, too. All right, you want a foolie? All right. I dare you, I double-dare you. Look at the blood on my face. Now look at your hands. Blood on your hands. Now who's doing the hurting? Not the Grups, it's you hurting, yelling, maybe killing, just like the Grups you remember and creatures you're afraid of. You're acting like them, and you're going to be just like them unless you let me help you. I'm a Grup, and I want to help you. I'm begging you, let me help you or there won't be anything left at all. Please. Three hours, eleven minutes left. Thank you, Lieutenant. Keep this channel open. Clear your computers. What happened to him? Look at his face. Just children, three hundred years old and more. I've already contacted Space Central. They'll send teachers, advisers. They'll be all right. Yes. I never get involved with older women, Yeoman. Mister Spock? Full ahead. Warp factor one.

Title: Miri
Dialogue: ['Not a vessel, a ground source. The third planet in this solar system, according to my instruments.', "Measuring the planet now, Captain. It's spheroid-shaped, circumference twenty four thousand eight hundred seventy four miles. Mass six times ten to the twenty first power tons. Mean density five point five one seven. Atmosphere oxygen, nitrogen.", 'Affirmative, Captain.', 'More the, er, mid-1900s I would say, Captain, approximately 1960.', 'Readings indicate that natural deterioration has been taking place on this planet for at least several centuries.', 'Not conclusive, Yeoman. The evidence would suggest that the distress signal is automated.', 'Definitely humanoid, in spite of the distortion.', 'About three hundred years.', 'Right, Captain.', 'Guards! Cover me.', "Children, Captain. Lots of them. We couldn't begin to get close to them. They just seemed to scurry away, like animals. Only children.", 'Being a red-blooded human obviously has its disadvantages. Now there you have a museum piece, Doctor. Lens type, manually operated, light-activated.', 'Progress report, genetics section, Life Prolongation Project.', 'This was three hundred years ago, Captain.', 'But children become adults.', 'Doctor, there are certain glandular changes which take place upon entering puberty, are there not?', 'Is it not possible that these children here, as they enter puberty, contract the disease?', "It's illogical. It does not follow. All the adults on this planet died three hundred years ago, but there are children in the streets.", 'There may be other emotions at work in this case, Captain.', "She's becoming a woman.", 'Spock here.', 'Acknowledged, Lieutenant. I have their calculations now.', 'According to their life prolongation plan, what they thought they were accomplishing, a person would age only one month for every one hundred years of real time.', 'Exactly, Yeoman. Evidently through some miscalculation, this virus annihilated the entire adult population in a very short period, leaving only the children.', 'Could very well be immensely old.', "Difficult, if we can't even get a glimpse of them.", 'Impossible. They know the area too well, like mice.', 'Is at least three hundred years older than you are, Yeoman. Think about it.', 'Acknowledged.', "This fellow made these notes in the last weeks after the disaster began. I disregard these last entries. He said himself he was too sick, too far gone to be sure he wasn't already mad, and I agree, but based on the entries he made before that, I know how much time we have. The ship's computers will verify my figures.", "Our guess was correct. They contract the disease as they enter puberty and their metabolism changes. The notes would indicate it doesn't become acute for a month or so. I estimate she has perhaps five or six weeks left.", 'The older the victim, the more rapid the progress of the disease.', "I am a carrier. Whatever happens, I can't go back to the ship, and I do want to go back to the ship, Captain.", 'I presume my calculations are correct.', 'Spock here.', 'Verified, Captain. We have seven days.', "Unfortunately, they weren't successful. We've seen the results.", 'No, nothing.', "Communicators, Captain, they're gone.", 'The nitrogen cycle, it has to be.', 'That is a very good question.', "That's not all, Captain. We've got to find those communicators.", "We've got to have those communicators, Jim.", 'Without them, it could be a beaker full of death.', 'We must. The vaccine could be fatal.', "Bickering is pointless. I'll check on the Captain's progress.", 'Not yet.', 'He injected himself with the vaccine. He was unconscious when I found him.', "The blemishes are fading. They're fading. Who will understand the medical mind?", 'Captain?', 'Warp factor one, Captain.']

According to their life prolongation plan, what they thought they were accomplishing, a person would age only one month for every one hundred years of real time. Exactly, Yeoman. Evidently through some miscalculation, this virus annihilated the entire adult population in a very short period, leaving only the children. Could very well be immensely old. This fellow made these notes in the last weeks after the disaster began. I disregard these last entries. He said himself he was too sick, too far gone to be sure he wasn't already mad, and I agree, but based on the entries he made before that, I know how much time we have. The ship's computers will verify my figures. Our guess was correct. They contract the disease as they enter puberty and their metabolism changes. The notes would indicate it doesn't become acute for a month or so. I estimate she has perhaps five or six weeks left. The older the victim, the more rapid the progress of the disease. Title: Miri
Dialogue: ["Now, this is marvellous. the most horrible conglomeration of antique architecture I've ever seen.", 'Of course somebody will fix it.', 'A seizure of some type.', "It's dead. It's incredible.", "Its metabolic rate. It's impossibly high as if it's burning itself up, almost as if it aged a century in just the past few minutes.", 'I wonder what happened to her, that she should be so terrified of us.', 'Foolie?', "You said the Grups got sick. Is that why there aren't any of them around?", 'A plague, Captain. That could explain a lot of it.', "That creature which attacked us was certainly no child. Perhaps it died of the disease the girl's talking about.", "A veritable zoo of bacteria. Beam down a biocomputer and a portable electronic microscope. If I'm dealing with viruses, I'll need better equipment than I have here.", "I don't know. Probably the little bugs or whatever they are have no appetite for green blood.", 'Spare me the analysis, Mister Spock, please. It is enough that it works.', "Life prolongation. Didn't have much luck, did they?", 'Tubular with extreme multiplicability. Appear to have affinity for nucleic acids. Give me what you have.', 'Of course. It changes the entire body system. You know that. Of course you know that. Why?', 'Glandular, post-pubescent. Could be.', 'But how do they keep the line going?', 'She likes you, Jim.', 'Answers it very well.', 'A few days ago or a week ago that creature that attacked us could have been just like Miri. A child entering puberty on this planet means a death sentence.', 'Only a matter of time before we all go mad, destroy each other, till the last of us finally destroys himself.', 'What about us?', "No, but we know what it is and how fast it does it. It's progressing. We'll begin to feel it inside soon. Intense fever, great pain in the extremities, fuzziness of vision. Of course, those are the early symptoms. There'll be more.", "I think I've found it.", 'Only one half intact.', 'More or less. The idea was to create a new series of diseases, a chain reaction of viruses meant essentially to extend the life of the human cell immeasurably.', 'Is that all, Captain? We have five days, you know.', "Jim, We've absolutely got to have those communicators. Without them, we don't have the computers, and without the computers, we don't have a chance.", 'Would you like to take a crack at it?', 'Jim, I found something!', 'The last slide I examined, I failed to make the necessary adjustment. The slowing down of my own responses', 'The disease, Captain, the one they created three hundred years ago.', "A chance. At least it's a race now, and we've just wasted a minute.", 'It looks right.', "But the question is, what's the dosage?", "That's not good enough! This could be it, but we can't test it without the ship's computers.", "That's what the computers will tell us.", "We can't wait for those communicators any longer.", 'The disease certainly is. How long do we have left? Hours, minutes? How much longer do you want to wait?', 'Spock!', 'And truant officers, I presume.']
Flattened Dialogue: Now, this is marvellous. the most horrible conglomeration of antique architecture I've ever seen. Of course somebody will fix it. A seizure of some type. It's dead. It's incredible. Its metabolic rate. It's impossibly high as if it's burning itself up, almost as if it aged a century in just the past few minutes. I wonder what happened to her, that she should be so terrified of us. Foolie? You said the Grups got sick. Is that why there aren't any of them around? A plague, Captain. That could explain a lot of it. That creature which attacked us was certainly no child. Perhaps it died of the disease the girl's talking about. A veritable zoo of bacteria. Beam down a biocomputer and a portable electronic microscope. If I'm dealing with viruses, I'll need better equipment than I have here. I don't know. Probably the little bugs or whatever they are have no appetite for green blood. Spare me the analysis, Mister Spock, please. It is enough that it works. Life prolongation. Didn't have much luck, did they? Tubular with extreme multiplicability. Appear to have affinity for nucleic acids. Give me what you have. Of course. It changes the entire body system. You know that. Of course you know that. Why? Glandular, post-pubescent. Could be. But how do they keep the line going? She likes you, Jim. Answers it very well. A few days ago or a week ago that creature that attacked us could have been just like Miri. A child entering puberty on this planet means a death sentence. Only a matter of time before we all go mad, destroy each other, till the last of us finally destroys himself. What about us? No, but we know what it is and how fast it does it. It's progressing. We'll begin to feel it inside soon. Intense fever, great pain in the extremities, fuzziness of vision. Of course, those are the early symptoms. There'll be more. I think I've found it. Only one half intact. More or less. The idea was to create a new series of diseases, a chain reaction of viruses meant essentially to extend the life of the human cell immeasurably. Is that all, Captain? We have five days, you know. Jim, We've absolutely got to have those communicators. Without them, we don't have the computers, and without the computers, we don't have a chance. Would you like to take a crack at it? Jim, I found something! The last slide I examined, I failed to make the necessary adjustment. The slowing down of my own responses The disease, Captain, the one they created three hundred years ago. A chance. At least it's a race now, and we've just wasted a minute. It looks right. But the question is, what's the dosage? That's not good enough! This could be it, but we can't test it without the ship's computers. That's what the computers will tell us. We can't wait for those communicators any longer. The disease certainly is. How long do we have left? Hours, minutes? How much longer do you want to wait? Spock! And truant officers, I presume.

Title: Dagger of the Mind
Dialogue: ['Having trouble, gentlemen?', "You're beaming cargo down to a penal colony, Mister Berkeley.", 'U.S.S. Enterprise to Tantalus colony.', 'Request opening in your force field for beaming down of cargo.', 'Energise. Any incoming cargo?', 'Oh, Mister Berkeley, you might refamiliarise yourself with the manual on penal colony procedures.', 'I think you can take the time to lock this up first.', 'I would like to have met Doctor Adams. Have you ever been to a penal colony since they started following his theories?', "You're behind the times, Bones. They're more like resort colonies now.", 'Enterprise acknowledging. Stand by. Security alert three.', 'Security control, this is the Bridge. Come in.', 'Enterprise to Tantalus colony.', 'Doctor Adams? This is Captain Kirk. It appears we may have an inmate of yours aboard the ship.', "Make that definite, Doctor. He's aboard.", "We'll keep you posted, Doctor. Kirk out.", "I'm Captain Kirk.", 'At gunpoint?', 'No promises. Give me the weapon.', 'Take him to Sickbay. Reverse course. Head back for Tantalus colony.', 'Your report said he was quite talkative.', 'Not our problem, Bones.', 'What did you say your name was?', 'Estimated arrival at Tantalus?', "What's so fascinating?", 'Doctor Van Gelder?', 'Committed to Tantalus colony when?', 'Ship to surface, Tantalus colony.', 'U.S.S. Enterprise to Tantalus colony.', "This is Captain Kirk. I'd like to speak to Doctor Adams.", 'Doctor Adams, regarding your escaped man', 'No casualties, sir. This man is Doctor Simon Van Gelder?', 'No harm to him, sir. We thought you might enlighten us as to his condition.', 'Tragedy, Doctor.', 'Er, Doctor Adams, please stand by. Explain.', "You don't believe him, and you can't explain it. Bones, are you aware that in the last twenty years Doctor Adams has done more to revolutionise, to humanise prisons and the treatment of prisoners than all the rest of humanity had done in forty centuries? I've been to those penal colonies since they've begun following his methods, and they're not cages anymore.", "They're clean, decent hospitals for sick minds.", 'Doctor Adams, regarding Van Gelder.', "Thank you, Doctor. I'll take it up with the ship's surgeon. Stand by. Well, Bones, you've got the ball. You care to recommend a better place?", 'An assumption, Doctor.', "Doctor Adams, this is rather embarrassing. By strict interpretation of our starship regulation, I'm required to initiate an investigation of this so that a proper report", "Affirmative, Doctor. I've visited rehab colonies before. Enterprise out. Find me someone in your department with psychiatric and penology experience, if possible.", "Mission, routine investigation and report as per ship surgeon's medical log. As for my last entry, it seems I will get to meet Doctor Adams at last. However, I would have preferred other circumstances. Sickbay. Report, Doctor.", "And you'd prefer to keep him here until I complete my investigation anyway.", 'Thank you, Doctor. Bridge out. Mister Spock.', 'Co-ordinates?', 'Yes, I remember.', 'Yes, yes, I remember.', 'Mister Spock, you tell McCoy that she had better check out as the best assistant I ever had. Energise.', 'In here, I presume, Doctor.', 'This is another time, another place, and another situation.', 'Elevator, and going down quite a ways.', "Doctor Helen Noel. It's a pleasure to finally meet you, sir.", 'I believe regulations call for me to check my weapon.', 'Doctor.', 'Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.', "Your landing co-ordinates were right on the nose, Mister Spock. We arrived safely, and we're here with Doctor Adams right now. Kirk out.", 'Before you came here', 'May I ask what crime you committed?', 'Quite a tour, Doctor. Very impressive.', 'Doctor.', 'Hmm?', 'May I see it?', 'Shall we leave it up to the doctor?', 'One of the advantages of being a Captain, Doctor, is being able to ask for advice without necessarily having to take it.', "One question, Doctor. If it doesn't do any good", 'How does it work?', "I didn't mean to suggest that he had. The reason I asked, sir, was you haven't mentioned where Doctor Van Gelder's injury occurred.", 'Thank you.', "In Doctor Adams' study, Mister Spock. Why?", 'Affirmative.', "Yes. He was injured there. I've seen the room. Doctor Adams explained", 'the mistake Van Gelder made.', 'Go ahead, Mister Spock. Anything further?', 'Thank you, Doctor Adams.', 'Stand by, Mister Spock. Doctor Adams has left with some things to attend to. What is it, Mister Spock?', 'Tell McCoy the technical expert he sent along with me insists that any concern is unjustified. According to Adams, Van Gelder created his own problem.', 'Not really.', "I think we'll spend the night here, Mister Spock.", 'Affirmative.', 'Kirk out.', 'Good evening.', 'What did you think of the inmates we saw here this afternoon?', "I didn't.", 'But a bit blank.', "I'd like to see that treatment room again. You say you're somewhat familiar with the theory behind it?", "And if he's lying, he'll continue to lie, and I won't find out a thing. The only way I can be sure is to see that machine at work, or is that too impractical and unscientific of me, Doctor? Well?", 'I have no desire to damage my brain. Can this be handled with reasonable safety? Yes or no?', 'And will you be able to determine if that beam is harming me in the slightest?', 'Mm-hmm.', "Anytime you're ready, Doctor, just for a second or two.", 'Nothing happened.', 'Try a harmless suggestion.', "You know, when we finally get through this I'd like to locate and raid a kitchen somewhere.", 'Remarkably effective for a device that Doctor Adams was going to abandon.', 'Yes. Pick something unusual, an unusual suggestion, something we can both be sure of.', 'Merry Christmas.', 'My crew is sworn to secrecy.', 'You want me to manufacture a lie, wrap it up as a Christmas present for you?', 'Helen.', "For years, I've loved you.", "Helen! Helen, don't go! I need you, Helen!", 'I must drop it.', 'Kirk to Enterprise. Argh! Kirk to Enterprise. Argh!', "Helen. Helen, for years I've loved you. Helen.", "I've loved you.", 'For years.', 'Yes. Yes, I remember. I remember. Helen. Look. The duct. The duct. Give me a hand here. Pull. Air conditioning. It has to connect with other ducts and tunnels. You can get through this. It might lead to the power supply. Short-circuited, it would cut off the security force field. Have you had any training in hyper-power circuits?', "Megavoltage. Touch the wrong line, and you're dead.", 'I believe in you.', 'I trust you.', "I, argh, I don't know.", "I don't know.", 'Helen, are you all right?', 'Doctor Adams? Doctor A. The treatment room. Follow me.', 'The power came on.', 'But he was alone. Can you imagine the mind emptied by that thing? Without even a tormentor for company.', 'Thank you.', "Not when you've sat in that room. Take us out of orbit, Mister Spock. Ahead warp factor one."]

This is another time, another place, and another situation. Elevator, and going down quite a ways. Doctor Helen Noel. It's a pleasure to finally meet you, sir. I believe regulations call for me to check my weapon. Doctor. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in. Your landing co-ordinates were right on the nose, Mister Spock. We arrived safely, and we're here with Doctor Adams right now. Kirk out. Before you came here May I ask what crime you committed? Quite a tour, Doctor. Very impressive. Doctor. Hmm? May I see it? Shall we leave it up to the doctor? One of the advantages of being a Captain, Doctor, is being able to ask for advice without necessarily having to take it. One question, Doctor. If it doesn't do any good How does it work? I didn't mean to suggest that he had. The reason I asked, sir, was you haven't mentioned where Doctor Van Gelder's injury occurred. Thank you. In Doctor Adams' study, Mister Spock. Why? Affirmative. Yes. He was injured there. I've seen the room. Doctor Adams explained the mistake Van Gelder made. Go ahead, Mister Spock. Anything further? Thank you, Doctor Adams. Stand by, Mister Spock. Doctor Adams has left with some things to attend to. What is it, Mister Spock? Tell McCoy the technical expert he sent along with me insists that any concern is unjustified. According to Adams, Van Gelder created his own problem. Not really. I think we'll spend the night here, Mister Spock. Affirmative. Kirk out. Good evening. What did you think of the inmates we saw here this afternoon? I didn't. But a bit blank.
