Title: Dagger of the Mind
Dialogue: ['A cage is a cage, Jim.', 'And, of course, your people found an answer.', "Abnormal, of course, but it's not schizophrenia, tissue damage, or any condition I'm acquainted with, Jim. And you know after getting him here, it took almost a triple dose of sedative to put him under.", "But not very informative. He claimed one thing, then he seemed to forget, and then he'd start to claim something else, but always with just the ring of truth in it. I'd sure like to study this one, Jim.", 'You see what I mean?', 'Erased?', "Jim, that doesn't quite ring true.", "I don't believe him. I can't explain it, but the more I study that patient", 'Jim', 'Jim, listen!', "There are no superior facilities, he knows that. But that's not the question. If something unusual is going on down there", "I'm required to enter any reasonable doubts into my medical log. That requires you to answer in your log. Sorry, Jim.", 'Yes, sir.', "Van Gelder's still violently agitated, Captain.", "Oh, I'm assigning your technical aide, Captain. One of our psychiatrists does have a background in rehabilitative therapy. Doctor Noel, standing by in the transporter room now.", 'McCoy here. Received and understood.', 'But we still have some doubts up here, Captain. Can you tell us any more?', "Spock, if there's the slightest possibility it might help.", "If there's any way we can look into this man's mind to see if what he's seeing is real or delusion", 'Now look, Spock, Jim Kirk could be in real trouble. Will it work or not?', "I understand. Good, the reading's levelling.", 'Jim!', "He's dead, Captain.", "It's hard to believe that a man could die of loneliness."]
Flattened Dialogue: A cage is a cage, Jim. And, of course, your people found an answer. Abnormal, of course, but it's not schizophrenia, tissue damage, or any condition I'm acquainted with, Jim. And you know after getting him here, it took almost a triple dose of sedative to put him under. But not very informative. He claimed one thing, then he seemed to forget, and then he'd start to claim something else, but always with just the ring of truth in it. I'd sure like to study this one, Jim. You see what I mean? Erased? Jim, that doesn't quite ring true. I don't believe him. I can't explain it, but the more I study that patient Jim Jim, listen! There are no superior facilities, he knows that. But that's not the question. If something unusual is going on down there I'm required to enter any reasonable doubts into my medical log. That requires you to answer in your log. Sorry, Jim. Yes, sir. Van Gelder's still violently agitated, Captain. Oh, I'm assigning your technical aide, Captain. One of our psychiatrists does have a background in rehabilitative therapy. Doctor Noel, standing by in the transporter room now. McCoy here. Received and understood. But we still have some doubts up here, Captain. Can you tell us any more? Spock, if there's the slightest possibility it might help. If there's any way we can look into this man's mind to see if what he's seeing is real or delusion Now look, Spock, Jim Kirk could be in real trouble. Will it work or not? I understand. Good, the reading's levelling. Jim! He's dead, Captain. It's hard to believe that a man could die of loneliness.

Title: Dagger of the Mind
Dialogue: ['Message, Captain. Switching to speaker.', 'Security alert, condition three. All sections go to alert condition three. We may have an intruder aboard.', 'Repeat, all sections to alert condition three. Intruder aboard.', 'Captain, section C deck fourteen, reporting trouble. Someone in Engineering uniform.', "Security alert, condition three. Approximately six foot four male, early forties. Approach with caution. This man's extremely dangerous.", 'Repeat, approach with extreme caution. Bridge out.', 'Transporter crewman found unconscious, Captain. Cargo case open and empty.', "Hailing frequency's open, sir.", 'Oh, Captain, there was a message from Tantalus colony, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Message, Captain. Switching to speaker. Security alert, condition three. All sections go to alert condition three. We may have an intruder aboard. Repeat, all sections to alert condition three. Intruder aboard. Captain, section C deck fourteen, reporting trouble. Someone in Engineering uniform. Security alert, condition three. Approximately six foot four male, early forties. Approach with caution. This man's extremely dangerous. Repeat, approach with extreme caution. Bridge out. Transporter crewman found unconscious, Captain. Cargo case open and empty. Hailing frequency's open, sir. Oh, Captain, there was a message from Tantalus colony, sir.

Title: Dagger of the Mind
Dialogue: ['I have them, Captain. Closing off deck fourteen, search in progress.', 'Negative in the deck area, Captain. He may have gotten out. Expanding search to adjoining sections.', 'Interesting. Your Earth people glorify organised violence for forty centuries, but you imprison those who employ it privately.', 'We disposed of emotion, Doctor. Where there is no emotion there is no motive for violence.', 'Fifty seven minutes, thirty seconds, Captain.', "An identification tape from our ship's library on Doctor Simon Van Gelder.", "Doctor Van Gelder, Captain. No mistake. There's a full ID tape on him.", "Assigned there six months ago as Doctor Adams' associate.", 'Gentlemen, I suggest you ask Doctor Adams if he wants Van Gelder returned.', 'I believe we should, Jim.', 'Problem, Captain?', 'Enterprise. Spock here.', 'Affirmative, Captain. Enterprise out.', 'Neural neutraliser. Can you explain that, Doctor Van Gelder?', 'This room. What happens there?', 'Can you give us your present location, Captain?', "Then you're with Doctor Adams now.", 'Captain, Van Gelder has made reference to a particular treatment room. The term was neural neutraliser.', 'Van Gelder is extremely agitated, Captain, and warns that you are in danger.', "Please repeat, Captain. I didn't receive that.", 'When do you plan to beam back up, Captain?', 'And you will continue to check in every four hours?', 'Destroy how? What?', "Enterprise log. First officer Spock, acting captain. I must now use an ancient Vulcan technique to probe into Van Gelder's tortured mind.", "I've never used it on a human, Doctor.", "It's a hidden, personal thing to the Vulcan people, part of our private lives.", 'It could be dangerous. Do you understand? It requires I make pressure changes in your nerves, your blood vessels.', 'This will not affect you, Doctor McCoy, only the person I touch. It is not hypnosis.', 'You begin to feel a strange euphoria. Your body floats.', 'Open your mind. We move together. Our minds sharing the same thoughts.', 'What is our name? Who are we?', 'Doctor Adams. The neural neutraliser. What did he do to us?', 'Yes.', 'Yes.', 'Yes.', 'Yes.', 'Empty.', 'Lonely.', 'Empty.', 'Emergency channel D.', 'Keep trying.', 'Get some security people and follow me down. Energise.', 'Enterprise, this is Spock. Force field has been eliminated.', "It was from Van Gelder. He thought you'd like to know the treatment room had been dismantled and the equipment destroyed.", 'Acknowledged, Captain. Warp factor one.']
Flattened Dialogue: I have them, Captain. Closing off deck fourteen, search in progress. Negative in the deck area, Captain. He may have gotten out. Expanding search to adjoining sections. Interesting. Your Earth people glorify organised violence for forty centuries, but you imprison those who employ it privately. We disposed of emotion, Doctor. Where there is no emotion there is no motive for violence. Fifty seven minutes, thirty seconds, Captain. An identification tape from our ship's library on Doctor Simon Van Gelder. Doctor Van Gelder, Captain. No mistake. There's a full ID tape on him. Assigned there six months ago as Doctor Adams' associate. Gentlemen, I suggest you ask Doctor Adams if he wants Van Gelder returned. I believe we should, Jim. Problem, Captain? Enterprise. Spock here. Affirmative, Captain. Enterprise out. Neural neutraliser. Can you explain that, Doctor Van Gelder? This room. What happens there? Can you give us your present location, Captain? Then you're with Doctor Adams now. Captain, Van Gelder has made reference to a particular treatment room. The term was neural neutraliser. Van Gelder is extremely agitated, Captain, and warns that you are in danger. Please repeat, Captain. I didn't receive that. When do you plan to beam back up, Captain? And you will continue to check in every four hours? Destroy how? What? Enterprise log. First officer Spock, acting captain. I must now use an ancient Vulcan technique to probe into Van Gelder's tortured mind. I've never used it on a human, Doctor. It's a hidden, personal thing to the Vulcan people, part of our private lives. It could be dangerous. Do you understand? It requires I make pressure changes in your nerves, your blood vessels. This will not affect you, Doctor McCoy, only the person I touch. It is not hypnosis. You begin to feel a strange euphoria. Your body floats. Open your mind. We move together. Our minds sharing the same thoughts. What is our name? Who are we? Doctor Adams. The neural neutraliser. What did he do to us? Yes. Yes. Yes. Yes. Empty. Lonely. Empty. Emergency channel D. Keep trying. Get some security people and follow me down. Energise. Enterprise, this is Spock. Force field has been eliminated. It was from Van Gelder. He thought you'd like to know the treatment room had been dismantled and the equipment destroyed. Acknowledged, Captain. Warp factor one.

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Dialogue: ['One degree to overlap. Stand by to photograph. Now.', 'Negative, Lieutenant. We are the first to reach this far.', 'Deflectors, full intensity.', 'Evasive maneuvers, Mister Sulu.', 'Sound alarm.', 'Countermand alarm. All engines full stop.', 'Ahead slow. Steer a course around it, Mister Sulu.', 'Quite unnecessary to raise your voice, Mister Bailey. All engines stop. Sound the alert.', 'Have a look at this, Captain.', "Undetermined. Whatever it is, it's blocking our way. When we move, it moves as well.", 'Negative. More some type of device.', 'Spock here.', 'Negative. Whatever it is, it seems to just want to hold us here.', 'Negative.', 'All decks have reported green, Mister Bailey.', 'And when the Captain arrives he will expect a full report on', 'It does sound most inconvenient, however. Have you considered having it removed?', 'Spock here.', 'Negative.', 'Affirmative. No answer from the cube.', 'Already standing by.', 'Reporting, sir. Sensors show it is solid, but its composition is unknown to us.', 'I believe it adds up to either one of two possibilities. First, a space buoy of some kind.', 'Flypaper.', 'Negative. It would make us appear too weak.', 'Radiation from the short end of the spectrum increasing.', 'Radiation increasing.', 'Radiation nearing the tolerance level.', 'Radiation at the tolerance level.', 'Radiation passing the tolerance level, entering lethal zone.', 'Growing. We can take only a few more seconds of this.', 'Nothing, Captain. No contacts, no objects in any direction.', "Speculate? No. Logically, we'll discover the intelligence which sent out the cube.", "Probably both, and if you're asking the logical decision to make", "Has it occurred to you that there's a certain inefficiency in constantly questioning me on things you've already made up your mind about?", 'Exercise rating, Captain. Ninety four percent.', 'Agreed.', "We're picking up an object, sir. Much larger, coming toward us.", 'Exceptionally strong contact. Not visual yet. Distant spectrograph. Metallic, similar to cube. Much greater energy reading.', "Tractor beam, Captain. Something's grabbed us, hard.", 'Fascinating.', 'Reading goes off my scale, Captain. Must be a mile in diameter.', "Captain, we're being invaded by exceptionally strong sensor probes everywhere. Our electrical systems, our engines.", "They're shutting off some of our systems, Captain. Brilliant. Extremely sophisticated in their methods.", 'Enough to warn other Earth ships.', 'Marker on course. Heading back the way we', 'Might be interesting to see what they look like if I can locate where that voice is coming from.', 'Switching to screen. I believe I can get something visual.', 'I was curious to see how they appeared.', 'Jim.', "They're certainly aware by now that we're totally incapable of it.", 'In chess, when one is outmatched, the game is over. Checkmate.', "I'm s, I regret that I can find no other logical alternative.", 'However, it was well played. I regret not having learned more about this Balok. In some manner he was reminiscent of my father.', 'Quite the contrary. She considered herself a very fortunate Earth woman.', 'A very interesting game, this poker.', 'I have visual contact, Captain.', 'About two thousand metric tons.', 'Engine systems coming on, Captain.', 'Tractor beam again.', "He's sneaked power down a bit.", "We're superheating. Intermix temperature, seven thousand four hundred degrees. Seven five, seven six, eight thousand degrees.", "Two thousand degrees above maximum. Eight four, eight five, eight six. She'll blow soon!", 'That may not be wise. He got a signal through to the mother ship.', 'For it, Captain?', 'Captain, request permission to']

Whatever it is, it seems to just want to hold us here. Negative. All decks have reported green, Mister Bailey. And when the Captain arrives he will expect a full report on It does sound most inconvenient, however. Have you considered having it removed? Spock here. Negative. Affirmative. No answer from the cube. Already standing by. Reporting, sir. Sensors show it is solid, but its composition is unknown to us. I believe it adds up to either one of two possibilities. First, a space buoy of some kind. Flypaper. Negative. It would make us appear too weak. Radiation from the short end of the spectrum increasing. Radiation increasing. Radiation nearing the tolerance level. Radiation at the tolerance level. Radiation passing the tolerance level, entering lethal zone. Growing. We can take only a few more seconds of this. Nothing, Captain. No contacts, no objects in any direction. Speculate? No. Logically, we'll discover the intelligence which sent out the cube. Probably both, and if you're asking the logical decision to make Has it occurred to you that there's a certain inefficiency in constantly questioning me on things you've already made up your mind about? Exercise rating, Captain. Ninety four percent. Agreed. We're picking up an object, sir. Much larger, coming toward us. Exceptionally strong contact. Not visual yet. Distant spectrograph. Metallic, similar to cube. Much greater energy reading. Tractor beam, Captain. Something's grabbed us, hard. Fascinating. Reading goes off my scale, Captain. Must be a mile in diameter. Captain, we're being invaded by exceptionally strong sensor probes everywhere. Our electrical systems, our engines. They're shutting off some of our systems, Captain. Brilliant. Extremely sophisticated in their methods. Enough to warn other Earth ships. Marker on course. Heading back the way we Might be interesting to see what they look like if I can locate where that voice is coming from. Switching to screen. I believe I can get something visual. I was curious to see how they appeared. Jim. They're certainly aware by now that we're totally incapable of it. In chess, when one is outmatched, the game is over. Checkmate. I'm s, I regret that I can find no other logical alternative. However, it was well played. I regret not having learned more about this Balok. In some manner he was reminiscent of my father. Quite the contrary. She considered herself a very fortunate Earth woman. A very interesting game, this poker. I have visual contact, Captain. About two thousand metric tons. Engine systems coming on, Captain. Tractor beam again. He's sneaked power down a bit. We're superheating. Intermix temperature, seven thousand four hundred degrees. Seven five, seven six, eight thousand degrees. Two thousand degrees above maximum. Eight four, eight five, eight six. She'll blow soon! That may not be wise. He got a signal through to the mother ship. For it, Captain? Captain, request permission to

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Dialogue: ['Just a few seconds more.', "That's a boy. Keep it up. Work up a little sweat, it'll will do you good.", 'Stop. Winded?', "Finally finished a physical on you, didn't I. What am I, a doctor or a moon shuttle conductor? If I jumped every time a light came on around here, I'd end up talking to myself.", 'Same report.', 'Your timing is lousy, Jim.', 'Your men are tired.', 'I never say that.', "I'm especially worried about Bailey. Navigator's position's rough enough for a seasoned man.", 'Oh? How so sure? Because you spotted something you liked in him, something familiar, like yourself say about, oh, eleven years ago?', "I don't need textbooks to know you could've promoted him too fast. Listen to that voice.", "Well, they're not. After what they've been through they really should", 'No, I never say that, either.', 'What are you going to do with that six percent when they give it to you, Jim?', 'Your weight was up a couple of pounds, remember?', 'No, no. No, I never eat until the crew eats.', "What's the matter, Jim. Don't you trust yourself?", "Balok's message. It was heard all over the ship.", 'Easy, Bailey.', 'Practically end of watch.', "Let's go.", 'Assuming we get out of this, Captain', 'Well, then about Bailey. Let me enter it in my medical records as simple fatigue.', 'And your mistake. You overworked him, pushed him, expected too much from him.', "I intend to challenge your actions in my records. I'll state that I warned you about Bailey's condition. Now that's no bluff.", "For having other things on your mind? My fault. I don't how the devil you keep from punching me in the face.", 'Love to teach it to you.', 'I thought the power was off in the galley.', "Jim, don't you think", "No, but you won't let that stop you.", 'And your crew?']

Because you spotted something you liked in him, something familiar, like yourself say about, oh, eleven years ago? I don't need textbooks to know you could've promoted him too fast. Listen to that voice. Well, they're not. After what they've been through they really should No, I never say that, either. What are you going to do with that six percent when they give it to you, Jim? Your weight was up a couple of pounds, remember? No, no. No, I never eat until the crew eats. What's the matter, Jim. Don't you trust yourself? Balok's message. It was heard all over the ship. Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Dialogue: ['Just a few seconds more.', "You're killing me. You're killing me.", "You'd be the last one I'd tell. Kirk here. What's going on?", "What's that?", 'A vessel of some kind?', "I'll be right up. You could see the alarm lights flashing from there, McCoy. Why didn't you tell me?", 'Bridge. Captain to Bridge.', 'Any changes?', 'Any indication of danger from it?', "I'll change first then. Captain out.", 'Captain to Bridge.', 'Any signs of life?', 'Have you tried all hailing frequencies?', 'Have the department heads meet me on the Bridge.', 'Lieutenant Uhura.', 'Navigation.', 'Scotty.', "I'll buy speculation.", 'Life sciences.', "I'll keep that in mind, Mister Bailey, when this becomes a democracy.", 'Anything further, gentlemen?', 'Second?', "And you don't recommend sticking around.", "It's time for action, gentlemen. Mister Bailey", "Countermand. I'll select what kind of action.", "Are you explaining Mister Bailey? I haven't requested an explanation. Now, as I was about to say, Navigator, plot us a spiral course away from the cube.", 'Engage, Mister Sulu. Quarter speed.', "Let's see if it'll give way. Ahead half speed.", 'All stop. Hold position.', 'Power astern, half speed.', 'Engines astern, full speed.', 'Helm, give us warp speed.', 'Phaser Crew stand ready.', 'Lock phasers on target. Mister Bailey, lock phasers.', 'Fire main phasers.', "Care to speculate on what we'll find if we go on ahead?", 'Intelligence different from ours or superior?', "No, I'm not. The mission of the Enterprise is to seek out and contact alien life.", 'It gives me emotional security. Navigator, set a course ahead.', 'Engage.', "Mister Bailey, phaser crews were sluggish. You were slow in locking them into your directional beam. Helmsman, engineering decks could have been faster, too. Programme a series of simulated attacks and evasion maneuvers. Keep repeating the exercise until we're proficient, gentlemen.", "Captain's quarters. Aren't you the one who always says a little suffering is good for the soul?", "I think he'll cut it.", "Why, Doctor, you've been reading your textbooks again?", "What's next? They're not machines, Jim?", "Doctor McCoy, I've heard you say that man is ultimately superior to any mechanical device.", "I could've sworn I heard you say that. Kirk here.", "Let's try for one hundred, Mister Spock.", "I'm going to take it, and I'm going to", 'What the devil is this? Green leaves?', 'Will you stop hovering over me, Yeoman?', 'Bring some for the doctor, too.', 'Thank you, Yeoman.', 'When I find the headquarters genius that assigned me a female yeoman', "I've already got a female to worry about. Her name's the Enterprise.", 'Kirk here.', 'Coming.', 'Half speed. Prepare for evasive action.', 'All engines stop.', 'Phaser crews stand ready.', "What's its mass, Mister Spock?", 'Reduce image. Let me see all of it.', 'Ship to ship.', 'This is the United Earth ship Enterprise. We convey greetings and await your reply. What is it, Mister Bailey?', 'Pick it up.', 'Ship to ship.', 'This is the Captain of the Enterprise speaking. The warning nature of your space buoy was unknown to us. Our vessel was blocked. When we attempted to disengage', 'Does the recorder marker have this on its tapes?', 'Mister Bailey, dispatch recorder marker. Mister Bailey?', "Captain to crew. Those of you who have served for long on this vessel have encountered alien lifeforms. You know the greatest danger facing us is ourselves, an irrational fear of the unknown. But there's no such thing as the unknown, only things temporarily hidden, temporarily not understood. In most cases we have found that intelligence capable of a civilisation is capable of understanding peaceful gestures. Surely a lifeform advanced enough for space travel is advanced enough to eventually understand our motives. All decks stand by. Captain out. Ship to ship.", 'This is the Captain of the USS Enterprise. We came seeking friendship but we have no wish to trespass. To demonstrate our goodwill, our vessel will now return the way it came. We Lay in a course ahead, Mister Bailey.', 'Engage, warp factor one.', 'Switch to impulse.', 'Yes, of course you were.', 'They want us to lose our heads.', "Bailey, you're relieved! Escort him to his quarters, Doctor.", 'Ship to ship.', "This is the Captain of the Enterprise speaking. It is the custom of Earth people to try and avoid misunderstanding whenever possible. We destroyed your space buoy as a simple act of self-preservation. When we attempted to move away from it, it emitted radiation harmful to our species. If you've examined our ship and its tapes, you know this to be true.", "What's the matter with them out there? They must know we mean them no harm.", "There must be something to do, something I've overlooked.", 'Is that your best recommendation?', "Nobody's given up yet.", "That's my decision, Doctor.", "I'm ordering you to drop it. I have no time for you, your theories, your quaint philosophies.", 'Any time you can bluff me, Doctor.', "All right, Doctor. Let's hope we have time to argue about it. Not chess, Mister Spock, poker. Do you know the game? Ship to ship.", 'This is the Captain of the Enterprise. Our respect for other lifeforms requires that we give you this warning. One critical item of information that has never been incorporated into the memory banks of any Earth ship. Since the early years of space exploration, Earth vessels have had incorporated into them a substance known as corbomite. It is a material and a device which prevents attack on us. If any destructive energy touches our vessel, a reverse reaction of equal strength is created, destroying', 'Destroying the attacker! It may interest you to know that since the initial use of corbomite more than two of our centuries ago, no attacking vessel has survived the attempt. Death has little meaning to us. If it has none to you then attack us now. We grow annoyed at your foolishness.', 'Doc. Sorry.', 'Permission granted.', 'It does have advantages over chess.', 'Here it comes. Is it raise or call?', 'Hold on that. Let him sweat for a change. Ship to ship.', 'Request denied.', "It's a small ship.", 'I want a right angled course. Shear away from him no matter which way he turns.', 'Maximum acceleration when I give the word.', 'Engage.', 'More power.', 'Shear away, Mister Bailey.', 'Now, Mister Sulu. Impulse power two.', 'All engines stop.', "Then we're not home yet.", 'Any reply?', 'Plot a course for it, Mister Bailey.', "Dead ahead. This is the Captain speaking. First Federation vessel is in distress. We're preparing to board it. There are lives at stake. By our standards, alien life but lives nevertheless. Captain out.", 'Mister Scott, ready the transporter room.', 'Mister Sulu, bring us to within one hundred metres. Ahead slow.', "What's the mission of this vessel, Doctor? To seek out and contact alien life, and an opportunity to demonstrate what our high-sounding words mean. Any questions? I'll take two men with me. Doctor McCoy to examine and treat the aliens if necessary, and you, Mister Bailey.", 'The face of the unknown. I think I owe you a look at it.', "Denied. If I'm wrong, if it's a trap, I want you here.", 'Transporter ready?', 'Air sample?', 'Thank you, Scotty. Ready, Doctor?', 'Energise.', "It's a dummy. A puppet of some kind.", "I'm Captain Kirk.", 'Commander Balok.', 'Commander, that puppet.', 'I see.', 'But you probed our memory banks.', 'Yes. Both our cultures would benefit. Do you know where we can find a volunteer, Mister Bailey?', "But you'd find out more about us that way, and I'd get a better officer in return."]

Title: The Corbomite Maneuver
Dialogue: ['Motive power? Beats me what makes it go.', "I'd sell it if I had any. That's a solid cube. How something like that can sense us coming, block us, move when we move, well it beats me. That's my report.", 'You have an annoying fascination for timepieces, Mister Sulu.', 'Then may heaven have helped your mother.', 'Engines need work badly, Captain. Can you hold it here a few hours?', 'Aye, sir.', "Well, yes, sir, but it's risky. We're locked on what appears to be a main deck.", 'Breathable. In fact, a slightly higher oxygen content than our own. Communicator, phaser weapon.', 'Bend low, gentlemen. It reads pretty cramped over there. Ready to transport.']
Flattened Dialogue: Motive power? Beats me what makes it go. I'd sell it if I had any. That's a solid cube. How something like that can sense us coming, block us, move when we move, well it beats me. That's my report. You have an annoying fascination for timepieces, Mister Sulu. Then may heaven have helped your mother. Engines need work badly, Captain. Can you hold it here a few hours? Aye, sir. Well, yes, sir, but it's risky. We're locked on what appears to be a main deck. Breathable. In fact, a slightly higher oxygen content than our own. Communicator, phaser weapon. Bend low, gentlemen. It reads pretty cramped over there. Ready to transport.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ['We received a subspace message asking us to divert here immediately.', 'Mister Spock received a starbase transmission, a message from the former commander of the Enterprise, Fleet Captain Pike, urgently requesting that we divert here.', 'If my first officer states he received a transmission from', 'Why?', 'When he was promoted to Fleet Captain.', 'I took over the Enterprise from him. Spock served with him for several years.', "Chris, if there's anything I can do for you.", "Once more, Jose. Spock stated he received a message for us to come here. He entered same in his log. That's all the proof I require.", 'Then I suggest the record tapes have been deliberately changed. A computer expert can change record tapes, duplicate voices, say anything, say nothing.', 'If he had wanted to see Captain Pike he could have requested a leave. I would have granted it.', "Who would want to divert us here? There's no trouble in the space sector we're patrolling now. No alien problems.", 'Helen described', 'Miss Piper, a Vulcan can no sooner be disloyal than he can exist without breathing. That goes for his present commander as well as his past.', "There's no way he could even have asked for that message to be sent?", 'This is Captain Kirk. You have confirmation, Miss Uhura.', "Mister Spock is with me here. He'll answer all questions. Kirk out.", 'He keeps blinking no. No to what?', 'How long will he live?', 'He keeps blinking no.', 'Bones, could this have anything to do with Spock?', 'What I mean is either a message was received. It was one of two things. Either someone sent a message diverting us here, or someone on board the ship lied about receiving it. Could that someone be Mister Spock?', "He's also half human.", "Someone's interfering with my command and my ship. I don't know who it is, but I mean to find out. Even you. If I thought you had the technical know-how I'd suspect you, but you don't. Spock does.", "There's a false entry in the log right now which doesn't jibe with the established facts. How do you explain that.", 'For eyes of Starfleet Command only.', 'What every ship Captain knows. General Order 7, no vessel under any condition, emergency or otherwise, is to visit Talos Four.', 'The Enterprise, commanded by Captain Christopher Pike.', "Kirk to Doctor McCoy. I'm recording you this message, Bones, so there will be no misunderstanding. I'm sorry to have to make it an order. You're not to disturb Captain Pike with any questions. Simply take good care of him. Follow Spock's instructions to the letter. Kirk out.", 'Spock is headed for Talos Four, all right.', 'Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Enterprise, come in!', 'Blast you any way. You had no right to come along.', 'Two hours of oxygen left.', "Part of me is hoping the Enterprise won't come back for us. We step on that deck, Spock is finished. Court-martialed, disgraced.", 'Spock would have some logical reason for going there.', 'Store our shuttlecraft on the hangar deck, Mister Scott. Beam us directly aboard.', "Accepting command. Where's Mister Spock?", 'Reverse power. Hold this position. Tell whoever gave those orders to report', 'Disengage computer control, Uhura.', 'Computer control, come in.', 'Disengage from helm.', 'This is the Captain. On voice command, you will override all contrary instructions. Voice command, disengage from helm.', "This hearing is convened. Mister Spock, you're aware of your right to counsel of your choice?", 'Request denied.', 'A mutiny requires a trial board of no less than three command officers. Since there are only two of that rank available', 'Denied. Captain Pike is a complete invalid.', "By asking why, you've opened the door to any evidence he may wish to present. Apparently what he had in mind.", "Screen off. Chris, was that really you on the screen? That's impossible. Mister Spock, no vessel makes record tapes in that detail, that perfect. What were we watching?", 'I am forced to contest that, Commodore. I want to see more.', 'That has nothing to do with it.', 'Screen on, Mister Scott.', "We still haven't heard the full story. I vote to continue.", "Not a deadlock. There's still one member of the trial board to be heard from.", 'Yes.', 'What is it?', 'Plead signal for you, sir. Go ahead, Uhura.', "Receiving transmissions from Talos Four? Then the images we've been seeing are", "Do you know what you're doing? Have you lost your mind?", 'Lock him up.']
Flattened Dialogue: We received a subspace message asking us to divert here immediately. Mister Spock received a starbase transmission, a message from the former commander of the Enterprise, Fleet Captain Pike, urgently requesting that we divert here. If my first officer states he received a transmission from Why? When he was promoted to Fleet Captain. I took over the Enterprise from him. Spock served with him for several years. Chris, if there's anything I can do for you. Once more, Jose. Spock stated he received a message for us to come here. He entered same in his log. That's all the proof I require. Then I suggest the record tapes have been deliberately changed. A computer expert can change record tapes, duplicate voices, say anything, say nothing. If he had wanted to see Captain Pike he could have requested a leave. I would have granted it. Who would want to divert us here? There's no trouble in the space sector we're patrolling now. No alien problems. Helen described Miss Piper, a Vulcan can no sooner be disloyal than he can exist without breathing. That goes for his present commander as well as his past. There's no way he could even have asked for that message to be sent? This is Captain Kirk. You have confirmation, Miss Uhura. Mister Spock is with me here. He'll answer all questions. Kirk out. He keeps blinking no. No to what? How long will he live? He keeps blinking no. Bones, could this have anything to do with Spock? What I mean is either a message was received. It was one of two things. Either someone sent a message diverting us here, or someone on board the ship lied about receiving it. Could that someone be Mister Spock? He's also half human. Someone's interfering with my command and my ship. I don't know who it is, but I mean to find out. Even you. If I thought you had the technical know-how I'd suspect you, but you don't. Spock does. There's a false entry in the log right now which doesn't jibe with the established facts. How do you explain that. For eyes of Starfleet Command only. What every ship Captain knows. General Order 7, no vessel under any condition, emergency or otherwise, is to visit Talos Four. The Enterprise, commanded by Captain Christopher Pike. Kirk to Doctor McCoy. I'm recording you this message, Bones, so there will be no misunderstanding. I'm sorry to have to make it an order. You're not to disturb Captain Pike with any questions. Simply take good care of him. Follow Spock's instructions to the letter. Kirk out. Spock is headed for Talos Four, all right. Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Shuttlecraft to Enterprise, come in. Enterprise, come in! Blast you any way. You had no right to come along. Two hours of oxygen left. Part of me is hoping the Enterprise won't come back for us. We step on that deck, Spock is finished. Court-martialed, disgraced. Spock would have some logical reason for going there. Store our shuttlecraft on the hangar deck, Mister Scott. Beam us directly aboard. Accepting command. Where's Mister Spock? Reverse power. Hold this position. Tell whoever gave those orders to report Disengage computer control, Uhura. Computer control, come in. Disengage from helm. This is the Captain. On voice command, you will override all contrary instructions. Voice command, disengage from helm. This hearing is convened. Mister Spock, you're aware of your right to counsel of your choice? Request denied. A mutiny requires a trial board of no less than three command officers. Since there are only two of that rank available Denied. Captain Pike is a complete invalid. By asking why, you've opened the door to any evidence he may wish to present. Apparently what he had in mind. Screen off. Chris, was that really you on the screen? That's impossible. Mister Spock, no vessel makes record tapes in that detail, that perfect. What were we watching? I am forced to contest that, Commodore. I want to see more. That has nothing to do with it. Screen on, Mister Scott. We still haven't heard the full story. I vote to continue. Not a deadlock. There's still one member of the trial board to be heard from. Yes. What is it? Plead signal for you, sir. Go ahead, Uhura. Receiving transmissions from Talos Four? Then the images we've been seeing are Do you know what you're doing? Have you lost your mind? Lock him up.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ['Eleven years, four months, five days.', "Captain Pike, may I remain for a moment? You know why I've come, Captain. It's only six days away at maximum warp and I have it well-planned. I have never disobeyed your orders before, Captain, but this time I must. I know. I know it is treachery and it's mutiny. but I must do this. I have no choice.", 'I have security clearance, Chief.', 'This is Mister Spock.', "The ship's computers will handle the helm on this voyage, Mister Hansen. Course will be computed and set automatically.", "You will not discuss this with ship's crew or starbase personnel. Do you read?", "Stand by. We'll warp out of orbit in one hour.", "The Enterprise knows where she's going, Mister Hansen.", 'Maintain radio silence, Lieutenant. This is First Officer Spock. Per Starfleet orders this date, I have been placed in temporary command of the Enterprise. While our destination is secret, our mission is relatively simple. Starbase Command has assigned Captain Kirk medical rest leave until our return. His instructions are that you will obey my orders as you would his. First Officer out.', 'And no one from the ship made such a call.', 'Doctor, I regret they elected to keep certain things from you. Will you come with me, please.', 'Doctor, one moment, please.', 'Take no action, Mister Hansen.', "You have your orders, Mister Hansen. We'll make no contact.", 'Lock on to sensors. Measure object now following the Enterprise.', "Stop. How long before shuttlecraft's fuel supply forces return to starbase?", 'Computer control. Lock on to shuttlecraft following us.', 'Go to tape Abel Seven Baker. Execute instructions.', 'This is the First Officer speaking. Security, send an armed team to the Bridge. Transporter Room, stand by to beam Captain Kirk aboard. Effective until then, Lieutenant Hansen is in operational command.', 'First Officer out. Doctor, as senior officer present, I present myself to you for arrest.', 'The charge is mutiny, Doctor. I never received orders to take command.', 'Doctor.', "Adequate, Doctor. I'll make no trouble.", 'Sir, I waive counsel. Further, I waive rights to this hearing and request immediate court-martial.', 'May I inquire on what grounds, Captain?', 'Sir, I must point out that there are three officers of command rank available. Yourself, Commodore Mendez, and Captain Christopher Pike.', "I believe you'll find he's still on the active duty list.", 'I am.', 'Are your comments a part of the record, sir?', 'Thank you. Request monitor screen be engaged.', 'To comply with the request you just made, sir, that I explain the importance of going to Talos Four.', 'This is thirteen years ago. The Enterprise and its commander, Captain Christopher Pike.', 'Definitely something out there, Captain, headed this way.', 'I cannot tell you at this time, sir.', 'Unless the court asks a prisoner why, Commodore. You did ask that question.', "As I stated, gentlemen, this was thirteen years ago. We were on routine patrol when the ship's sensors detected something ahead. At first we were not certain what it was.", 'Their call letters check with a survey expedition. S.S. Columbia disappeared in that region approximately eighteen years ago.', 'Records show the Talos group has never been explored. Solar system similar to Earth, eleven planets. Number four seems to be Class M, oxygen atmosphere.', "We aren't going to go, to be certain?", "Mister Spock here. We're intercepting a follow-up message, sir. There are crash survivors on Talos.", 'Captain, please tell the court this is not imagination, nor some clever photographic record. Are we seeing the actual events of thirteen years ago? Yes, gentlemen. On that screen as it happened, the incredible experience of Captain Christopher Pike on Talos Four. If, after witnessing this, the court wishes to turn this vessel back, I will release this ship to manual control.', 'Preliminary lab survey ready, sir.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Spock here.', "There is no survivors' encampment, Number One. This is all some sort of trap. We've lost the Captain. Do you read?", 'Are coming from Talos Four, sir.', 'The Commodore must be aware that Captain Kirk knew nothing of this.', 'Sir, I respectfully decline.', "Captain, Jim, please don't stop me. Don't let him stop me. It's your career and Captain Pike's life. You must see the rest of the transmission."]
Flattened Dialogue: Eleven years, four months, five days. Captain Pike, may I remain for a moment? You know why I've come, Captain. It's only six days away at maximum warp and I have it well-planned. I have never disobeyed your orders before, Captain, but this time I must. I know. I know it is treachery and it's mutiny. but I must do this. I have no choice. I have security clearance, Chief. This is Mister Spock. The ship's computers will handle the helm on this voyage, Mister Hansen. Course will be computed and set automatically. You will not discuss this with ship's crew or starbase personnel. Do you read? Stand by. We'll warp out of orbit in one hour. The Enterprise knows where she's going, Mister Hansen. Maintain radio silence, Lieutenant. This is First Officer Spock. Per Starfleet orders this date, I have been placed in temporary command of the Enterprise. While our destination is secret, our mission is relatively simple. Starbase Command has assigned Captain Kirk medical rest leave until our return. His instructions are that you will obey my orders as you would his. First Officer out. And no one from the ship made such a call. Doctor, I regret they elected to keep certain things from you. Will you come with me, please. Doctor, one moment, please. Take no action, Mister Hansen. You have your orders, Mister Hansen. We'll make no contact. Lock on to sensors. Measure object now following the Enterprise. Stop. How long before shuttlecraft's fuel supply forces return to starbase? Computer control. Lock on to shuttlecraft following us. Go to tape Abel Seven Baker. Execute instructions. This is the First Officer speaking. Security, send an armed team to the Bridge. Transporter Room, stand by to beam Captain Kirk aboard. Effective until then, Lieutenant Hansen is in operational command. First Officer out. Doctor, as senior officer present, I present myself to you for arrest. The charge is mutiny, Doctor. I never received orders to take command. Doctor. Adequate, Doctor. I'll make no trouble. Sir, I waive counsel. Further, I waive rights to this hearing and request immediate court-martial. May I inquire on what grounds, Captain? Sir, I must point out that there are three officers of command rank available. Yourself, Commodore Mendez, and Captain Christopher Pike. I believe you'll find he's still on the active duty list. I am. Are your comments a part of the record, sir? Thank you. Request monitor screen be engaged. To comply with the request you just made, sir, that I explain the importance of going to Talos Four. This is thirteen years ago. The Enterprise and its commander, Captain Christopher Pike. Definitely something out there, Captain, headed this way. I cannot tell you at this time, sir. Unless the court asks a prisoner why, Commodore. You did ask that question. As I stated, gentlemen, this was thirteen years ago. We were on routine patrol when the ship's sensors detected something ahead. At first we were not certain what it was. Their call letters check with a survey expedition. S.S. Columbia disappeared in that region approximately eighteen years ago. Records show the Talos group has never been explored. Solar system similar to Earth, eleven planets. Number four seems to be Class M, oxygen atmosphere. We aren't going to go, to be certain? Mister Spock here. We're intercepting a follow-up message, sir. There are crash survivors on Talos. Captain, please tell the court this is not imagination, nor some clever photographic record. Are we seeing the actual events of thirteen years ago? Yes, gentlemen. On that screen as it happened, the incredible experience of Captain Christopher Pike on Talos Four. If, after witnessing this, the court wishes to turn this vessel back, I will release this ship to manual control. Preliminary lab survey ready, sir. Yes, sir. Spock here. There is no survivors' encampment, Number One. This is all some sort of trap. We've lost the Captain. Do you read? Are coming from Talos Four, sir. The Commodore must be aware that Captain Kirk knew nothing of this. Sir, I respectfully decline. Captain, Jim, please don't stop me. Don't let him stop me. It's your career and Captain Pike's life. You must see the rest of the transmission.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ["What's his problem, Commodore?", 'The delta rays?', "They've tried questioning him. He's almost agitated himself into a coma.", "As long as any of us. Blast medicine anyway. We've learned to tie into every human organ in the body except one. The brain. The brain is what life is all about. Now, that man can think any thought that we can, and love, hope, dream as much as we can, but he can't reach out, and no one can reach in.", 'No to what? They could question him for days, weeks, before they stumble on the right thing.', "I don't read you at all, Jim.", "Jim, forgetting how well we both know Spock, the simple fact that he's a Vulcan means he's incapable of telling a lie.", 'And that half is completely submerged. To be caught acting like us or even thinking like us would completely embarrass him.', 'He would not make a false entry.', "I can't, but to question Spock of all people? Me, yes. I could run off half-cocked given a good reason. So could you, but not Spock. It's impossible.", 'McCoy here.', 'Well, what is it? Sickness? Injury? How bad is it?', "Probably somebody discovered a hangnail. I'll beam up and let you know, Jim.", "What's going on around here? Who said Jim needed a medical rest leave? And this call about me being needed aboard the ship. I've checked everywhere.", "That's right.", "What is this, Spock? Captain, are you all right? I see that you're still signaling", "I keep wondering who might be after us in a shuttlecraft and I keep coming up with the same answers, but I can't be right, can l, Mister Spock.", 'Is it the captain, Mister Spock?', 'You what?', 'Mister Spock is, er, under arrest. Is confinement to quarters enough?', 'Well, confine him.']
Flattened Dialogue: What's his problem, Commodore? The delta rays? They've tried questioning him. He's almost agitated himself into a coma. As long as any of us. Blast medicine anyway. We've learned to tie into every human organ in the body except one. The brain. The brain is what life is all about. Now, that man can think any thought that we can, and love, hope, dream as much as we can, but he can't reach out, and no one can reach in. No to what? They could question him for days, weeks, before they stumble on the right thing. I don't read you at all, Jim. Jim, forgetting how well we both know Spock, the simple fact that he's a Vulcan means he's incapable of telling a lie. And that half is completely submerged. To be caught acting like us or even thinking like us would completely embarrass him. He would not make a false entry. I can't, but to question Spock of all people? Me, yes. I could run off half-cocked given a good reason. So could you, but not Spock. It's impossible. McCoy here. Well, what is it? Sickness? Injury? How bad is it? Probably somebody discovered a hangnail. I'll beam up and let you know, Jim. What's going on around here? Who said Jim needed a medical rest leave? And this call about me being needed aboard the ship. I've checked everywhere. That's right. What is this, Spock? Captain, are you all right? I see that you're still signaling I keep wondering who might be after us in a shuttlecraft and I keep coming up with the same answers, but I can't be right, can l, Mister Spock. Is it the captain, Mister Spock? You what? Mister Spock is, er, under arrest. Is confinement to quarters enough? Well, confine him.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ['Starbase Operation, Mister Hansen.', 'Enterprise to Starbase. Request confirmation.', "Repeat, Enterprise to Starbase. Orders received. We need operating confirmation from the ship's Captain.", 'Come in, Starbase. Come in, Captain Kirk.', "Someone's trying to hail us, sir.", 'Captain from Bridge. The engines are coming on.', "We can't disengage, Captain. The helm does not respond.", "It's for Commodore Mendez.", 'Commodore Mendez, urgent. Subspace monitors show Enterprise receiving transmissions from planet Talos Four in violation of Starfleet General Orders.', 'Captain Kirk is here by relieved. You are ordered to assume command of the Enterprise. Disable vessel if necessary to prevent further contact. Message signed ComSol, Starfleet Command.']
Flattened Dialogue: Starbase Operation, Mister Hansen. Enterprise to Starbase. Request confirmation. Repeat, Enterprise to Starbase. Orders received. We need operating confirmation from the ship's Captain. Come in, Starbase. Come in, Captain Kirk. Someone's trying to hail us, sir. Captain from Bridge. The engines are coming on. We can't disengage, Captain. The helm does not respond. It's for Commodore Mendez. Commodore Mendez, urgent. Subspace monitors show Enterprise receiving transmissions from planet Talos Four in violation of Starfleet General Orders. Captain Kirk is here by relieved. You are ordered to assume command of the Enterprise. Disable vessel if necessary to prevent further contact. Message signed ComSol, Starfleet Command.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ['Library computer.', 'Computed. Object is a Class F shuttlecraft. Duranium metal shell, ion engine power', 'Computed. Shuttlecraft is already past point of safe return.', 'Locked on. Tractor beam ready.', 'Computer.', 'Unable to comply.', "Unable to comply. Any such attempt will cross-circuit vessel's life-supporting system. Computer control cannot be disengaged until vessel reaches planet Talos Four."]
Flattened Dialogue: Library computer. Computed. Object is a Class F shuttlecraft. Duranium metal shell, ion engine power Computed. Shuttlecraft is already past point of safe return. Locked on. Tractor beam ready. Computer. Unable to comply. Unable to comply. Any such attempt will cross-circuit vessel's life-supporting system. Computer control cannot be disengaged until vessel reaches planet Talos Four.

Title: The Menagerie, Part I
Dialogue: ['All right, Captain. Locked on to you.']

Title: The Menagerie, Part II
Dialogue: ['Guilty.', 'Guilty.', 'Guilty.', 'Are coming from Talos Four, sir.', "Captain, Jim, please. Don't stop me. Don't let him stop me. It's your career and Captain Pike's life. You must see the rest of the transmission.", "You have no choice, sir. I'm sorry. The Keeper has taken over control of our screen. Do you understand, sir? As you saw before, Captain Pike had been knocked unconscious and captured by the Talosians.", 'The inhabitants of this planet must live deep underground, probably manufacture food and other needs down there. Our tests indicate the planet surface, without considerably more vegetation or some animals, simply too barren to support life.', "Exactly. An illusion placed in our minds by this planet's inhabitants.", "If we start buzzing about down there, we're liable to find their mental power's so great they could reach out and swat this ship as though it were a fly.", "A brilliant deduction by Captain Pike, gentlemen. Yes, he was still inside his cell, but knowing that couldn't help him.", 'And could make him live any place, any time, any situation they wished. He would see, taste, suffer with the same reality as you gentlemen sitting there.', 'Because they know that Captain Pike is fatigued. We can reconvene later.', 'They want him back alive, sir.', "If you'll be patient, the answers to your questions", "My answer to your question would be quite unbelievable, sir. I regret we'll have to wait and see it there.", 'Standing by, Number One.', 'Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.', "Our circuits are beginning to heat. We'll have to cease power.", 'Much more, Captain.', 'If our measurements and readings are an illusion also, one could find oneself materialised inside solid rock.', 'The women!', 'Gentlemen, a moment, please.', "Signal you want them to wait. Captain, please. It's your life now, at least a chance for life.", "No, Captain. there's more to it. Watch.", "Talos controls the vessel now, sir, as they did thirteen years ago. You've asked me why. You'll see the answer now.", 'Mister Spock here.', 'All decks prepare for hyperdrive.', 'Ask you to face the death penalty, too? One of us was enough, Captain.', 'Thank you, sir, for both of us.', "I see no reason to insult me, sir. I believe I've been completely logical about the whole affair."]
Flattened Dialogue: Guilty. Guilty. Guilty. Are coming from Talos Four, sir. Captain, Jim, please. Don't stop me. Don't let him stop me. It's your career and Captain Pike's life. You must see the rest of the transmission. You have no choice, sir. I'm sorry. The Keeper has taken over control of our screen. Do you understand, sir? As you saw before, Captain Pike had been knocked unconscious and captured by the Talosians. The inhabitants of this planet must live deep underground, probably manufacture food and other needs down there. Our tests indicate the planet surface, without considerably more vegetation or some animals, simply too barren to support life. Exactly. An illusion placed in our minds by this planet's inhabitants. If we start buzzing about down there, we're liable to find their mental power's so great they could reach out and swat this ship as though it were a fly. A brilliant deduction by Captain Pike, gentlemen. Yes, he was still inside his cell, but knowing that couldn't help him. And could make him live any place, any time, any situation they wished. He would see, taste, suffer with the same reality as you gentlemen sitting there. Because they know that Captain Pike is fatigued. We can reconvene later. They want him back alive, sir. If you'll be patient, the answers to your questions My answer to your question would be quite unbelievable, sir. I regret we'll have to wait and see it there. Standing by, Number One. Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one. Our circuits are beginning to heat. We'll have to cease power. Much more, Captain. If our measurements and readings are an illusion also, one could find oneself materialised inside solid rock. The women! Gentlemen, a moment, please. Signal you want them to wait. Captain, please. It's your life now, at least a chance for life. No, Captain. there's more to it. Watch. Talos controls the vessel now, sir, as they did thirteen years ago. You've asked me why. You'll see the answer now. Mister Spock here. All decks prepare for hyperdrive. Ask you to face the death penalty, too? One of us was enough, Captain. Thank you, sir, for both of us. I see no reason to insult me, sir. I believe I've been completely logical about the whole affair.

Title: The Menagerie, Part II
Dialogue: ['Why? Why does Spock want to take to that forbidden world his former captain. Mutilated by a recent space disaster, now a shell of a man, unable to speak or move? The only answer Spock would give was on the hearing-room screen. How Spock could do this he refused to explain, but there before our eyes, actual images from thirteen years ago of Captain Pike as he was when he commanded this vessel, of Spock in those days, and of how the Enterprise had become the first and only starship to visit Talos Four. They had received a distress signal from that planet and discovered there, still alive after many years, the survivors of a missing vessel, only to find it was all an illusion. No survivors, no encampment, it was all a trap set by a race of beings who could make a man believe he was seeing anything they wished him to see, and Captain Pike was gone, a prisoner for some unknown purpose.', "And the images we've been seeing are", "Do you know what you're doing? Have you lost your mind?", 'The court-martial of Mister Spock has been convened in closed session. Despite all we can do, images continue to be transmitted to us from Talos Four.', 'The Talosians controlled his brain.', 'Then they care about the Captain.', 'Why? Just to maintain a supply of zoo specimens?', "That's Vina again, as the green Orion slave girl?", 'Strange evidence from the past, how the Talosians, planning to breed a society of human slaves, tempted Captain Pike with the Earth woman they held in captivity. And as she appeared to him in many forms, each more exciting than the last, Pike was beginning to weaken.', 'Well, Mister Spock?', 'You keep talking about life, Mister Spock. A chance for life. How? As a prisoner, caged, a zoo specimen, living the illusions that amuse his keepers?', 'Guilty as charged.', "Commodore, don't you think that", 'Mister Spock, even if regulations are explicit, you could have come to me and explained.', 'Yes.', 'Chris, do you want to go there? Mister Spock, would you care to take Captain Pike to the transporter room, see him off?', "Er, Mister Spock, when you're finished, please come back and see me. I want to talk to you. This regret table tendency you've been showing lately towards flagrant emotionalism"]
Flattened Dialogue: Why? Why does Spock want to take to that forbidden world his former captain. Mutilated by a recent space disaster, now a shell of a man, unable to speak or move? The only answer Spock would give was on the hearing-room screen. How Spock could do this he refused to explain, but there before our eyes, actual images from thirteen years ago of Captain Pike as he was when he commanded this vessel, of Spock in those days, and of how the Enterprise had become the first and only starship to visit Talos Four. They had received a distress signal from that planet and discovered there, still alive after many years, the survivors of a missing vessel, only to find it was all an illusion. No survivors, no encampment, it was all a trap set by a race of beings who could make a man believe he was seeing anything they wished him to see, and Captain Pike was gone, a prisoner for some unknown purpose. And the images we've been seeing are Do you know what you're doing? Have you lost your mind? The court-martial of Mister Spock has been convened in closed session. Despite all we can do, images continue to be transmitted to us from Talos Four. The Talosians controlled his brain. Then they care about the Captain. Why? Just to maintain a supply of zoo specimens? That's Vina again, as the green Orion slave girl? Strange evidence from the past, how the Talosians, planning to breed a society of human slaves, tempted Captain Pike with the Earth woman they held in captivity. And as she appeared to him in many forms, each more exciting than the last, Pike was beginning to weaken. Well, Mister Spock? You keep talking about life, Mister Spock. A chance for life. How? As a prisoner, caged, a zoo specimen, living the illusions that amuse his keepers? Guilty as charged. Commodore, don't you think that Mister Spock, even if regulations are explicit, you could have come to me and explained. Yes. Chris, do you want to go there? Mister Spock, would you care to take Captain Pike to the transporter room, see him off? Er, Mister Spock, when you're finished, please come back and see me. I want to talk to you. This regret table tendency you've been showing lately towards flagrant emotionalism

Title: The Menagerie, Part II
Dialogue: ['Message from Starbase Eleven, sir. Received images from Talos Four. In view of historic importance of Captain Pike in space exploration, General Order Seven prohibiting contact Talos Four is suspended this occasion. No action contemplated against Spock. Proceed as you think best. Signed, Mendez, J.I., Commodore, Starbase Eleven.']
Flattened Dialogue: Message from Starbase Eleven, sir. Received images from Talos Four. In view of historic importance of Captain Pike in space exploration, General Order Seven prohibiting contact Talos Four is suspended this occasion. No action contemplated against Spock. Proceed as you think best. Signed, Mendez, J.I., Commodore, Starbase Eleven.

Title: The Conscience of the King
Dialogue: ['Interesting. An Arcturian Macbeth.', "You mean to tell me you've called me three light years off my course just to accuse an actor of being Kodos?", "You said you discovered a new food concentrate. What am I supposed to put in my log, that you lied? That you diverted a starship with false information? You're not only in trouble, you've put me in trouble, too.", 'Kodos is dead.', 'Tom, the authorities closed the book on that case years ago.', 'Martha, you tell him.', "Kodos is dead. I'm satisfied of that.", "He's dead.", "And I have to get back to my ship and figure out how I'm going to enter all this in my log. Tom. Martha.", 'History files. Subject, former Governor Kodos of Tarsus Four, also known as Kodos the Executioner. After that, background on actor Anton Karidian.', 'Stop. Information on Anton Karidian.', 'Stop. Give comparative identification between actor Karidian and Governor Kodos.', "Give information on actor Karidian prior to Kodos' death.", 'Photograph Kodos. Photograph Karidian. Now photograph both.', "Mister Spock. You know Doctor Leighton, don't you? Would you say he's given to fantasy?", 'With a very long memory.', "We'll delay departure for a time. I'm beaming back down to the planet.", "Where's Tom?", 'The others are on the patio.', 'Why not? I saw your performance today. May I extend my appreciation?', 'Captain James Kirk, Starship Enterprise.', 'I had hoped to meet your father, here, tonight, personally.', 'An actor turning away his admirers? Very unusual.', "Then I'll talk to Lady Macbeth.", "So, Lady Macbeth. Interesting. What's your next move?", "She's a good ship. Thank you. You were very impressive as Lady Macbeth.", "Very impressive. Lenore. I'd like to see you again.", 'Not necessarily.', "You don't have a schedule now, do you?", 'Exactly.', "Good. I'll make our apologies to our hostess. I'll meet you outside.", 'About what?', "It's Tom Leighton. He's dead.", "I don't know. I'll try and find out.", 'Kirk to Enterprise.', 'Put me through to Captain Jon Daily of the AstraI Queen on orbit station, and put it on scramble.', 'Can you do me a favour?', "Don't make your pick-up here.", "I'll pick them up. And if there's any trouble, it'll be my responsibility.", 'Just keep this between the two of us and accept my thanks. Over and out. Kirk to Enterprise.', 'Transporter room, ready to beam up.', "I think we're due for a pick-up.", 'Tell her to come up to the Bridge, Lieutenant.', "I'm the Captain.", "You probably wouldn't believe me if I told you I arranged it.", "Can't you make other arrangements?", "It'd be a shame if that happened.", 'Well.', 'The regulations are very clear about taking on passengers.', 'What have you got to trade?', 'You make it sound very interesting. The crew has been on patrol for a long time. They could use a break in the monotony.', "You've got me backed into a corner. The men would never forgive me if I deprived them of your performance, and your presence.", 'Mister Spock, prepare to leave orbit as soon as the Karidian company is aboard the ship.', 'Benecia Colony.', "If my memory needs refreshing, Mister Spock, I'll ask you for it. In the meantime, follow my orders.", 'Mister Spock, ETA the Benecia Colony.', 'Data on question submitted to personnel files.', 'Stop. Give list.', 'Stop. Is that star service Lieutenant Kevin Riley?', 'Stop. Mister Spock.', 'Lieutenant Kevin Riley in communications, I wish to have him transferred down to the engineering decks.', "I'm sending him back.", "I don't wish to discuss it, Mister Spock. Please follow my orders.", 'It was illogical for him to bring those players aboard.', "This is the observation deck. That's the flight deck down there with the shuttle craft.", "Isn't it?", 'Anything.', "If I had ordered soft lights, I'd also have arranged for music and flowers. Unfortunately, it isn't so. On the Enterprise, we try to duplicate earth conditions of night and day as closely as possible.", "It's very old.", 'Come from a very human source.', 'You can count on it.', "I'd rather talk about you. Title: The Conscience of the King
Dialogue: ['Library computer.', 'Working. Kodos the Executioner, summary. Governor of Tarsus Four twenty Earth years ago. Invoked martial law. On stardate 2794.7,', 'Director and star of travelling company of actors sponsored by galactic cultural exchange project, touring official installations last nine years. Title: The Conscience of the King
Dialogue: ['A good empirical research scientist. Steady, reputable, occasionally brilliant.', 'I have no information on that, Captain. We are ready to leave orbit.', 'Ready to resume course, Captain.', 'What kind? Personnel? Cargo?', 'How did you know this lady was coming aboard?', 'May I inquire as to our course, Captain?', 'Benecia Colony is eight light years off our course.', "We'll arrive stardate 2825.3, Captain, approximately fifteen hundred Benecia time.", 'Captain.', 'He came up from engineering, Captain.', "Any explanation? He's a fine young officer. He's bound to consider this transfer a disciplinary action.", "Spare me your philosophical metaphors, Doctor. The Captain is acting strangely. I'm asking if you've noticed.", "My father's race was spared the dubious benefits of alcohol.", 'It occurred. I dismissed it.', 'Did you know that he suddenly transferred Lieutenant Riley to engineering?', 'No, thank you.', 'Full personal dossiers on the following names. Doctor Thomas Leighton, Anton Karidian, Lieutenant Kevin Riley, and Captain James T. Kirk.', 'Correlate. Check their past histories. Report any item, any past episode or experience they all have in common.', 'I will continue, Doctor. According to our library banks, it started on the Earth colony of Tarsus Four, when the food supply was attacked by an exotic fungus and largely destroyed. There were over eight thousand colonists and virtually no food. And that was when Governor Kodos seized full power and declared emergency martial law.', 'You may not have heard it all. Kodos began to separate the colonists. Some would live, be rationed whatever food was left. The remainder would be immediately put to death. Apparently he had his own theories of eugenics.', 'Perhaps not. But he was certainly among the most ruthless, to decide arbitrarily who would survive and who would not, using his own personal standards, and then to implement his decision without mercy. Children watching their parents die. Whole families destroyed. Over four thousand people. They died quickly, without pain, but they died. Relief arrived, but too late to prevent the executions. And Kodos? There never was a positive identification of his body.', 'His history begins almost to the day where Kodos disappeared.', "He'd better. There were nine eye witnesses who survived the massacre, who'd actually seen Kodos with their own eyes. Jim Kirk was one of them. With the exception of Riley and Captain Kirk, every other eye witness is dead. And my library computer shows that wherever they were, on Earth, on a colony, or aboard ship, the Karidian Company of Players was somewhere near when they died.", "You've got to pull him through.", "If he dies, the only one who'll be able to identify Kodos is the Captain. And he'll be the next target.", 'Someone tried to poison him.', "I don't believe that and neither do you. I want the Captain to see that report.", 'Now.', 'Can we predict the same for you, Captain?', 'Lieutenant Riley was a witness. So were you.', 'Someone tried to kill him.', 'You should be told the difference between empiricism and stubbornness, Doctor. I checked with the library computer, just as you did. I got the same information.', 'Is my personal business when it might interfere with the smooth operation of this ship.', 'It could happen.', 'Even in this corner of the galaxy, Captain, two plus two equals four. Almost certainly an attempt will be made to kill you. Why do you invite death?', 'He is.', 'Logic, Captain. Doctor Leighton was murdered while the Karidian Company was on Planet Q. Now an attempt has been made against Riley while the company is on board the Enterprise.', 'Shh. Listen. Do you hear it? That low hum.', 'On overload.', "You can't stay.", 'Evacuate this section. Seal it off. Clear section C4 and C5.', 'I believe we have a match, Captain.', 'Ready to leave Benecia orbit, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: A good empirical research scientist. Steady, reputable, occasionally brilliant. I have no information on that, Captain. We are ready to leave orbit. Ready to resume course, Captain. What kind? Personnel? Cargo? How did you know this lady was coming aboard? May I inquire as to our course, Captain? Benecia Colony is eight light years off our course. We'll arrive stardate 2825.3, Captain, approximately fifteen hundred Benecia time. Captain. He came up from engineering, Captain. Any explanation? He's a fine young officer. He's bound to consider this transfer a disciplinary action. Spare me your philosophical metaphors, Doctor. The Captain is acting strangely. I'm asking if you've noticed. My father's race was spared the dubious benefits of alcohol. It occurred. I dismissed it. Did you know that he suddenly transferred Lieutenant Riley to engineering? No, thank you. Full personal dossiers on the following names. Doctor Thomas Leighton, Anton Karidian, Lieutenant Kevin Riley, and Captain James T. Kirk. Correlate. Check their past histories. Report any item, any past episode or experience they all have in common. I will continue, Doctor. According to our library banks, it started on the Earth colony of Tarsus Four, when the food supply was attacked by an exotic fungus and largely destroyed. There were over eight thousand colonists and virtually no food. And that was when Governor Kodos seized full power and declared emergency martial law. You may not have heard it all. Kodos began to separate the colonists. Some would live, be rationed whatever food was left. The remainder would be immediately put to death. Apparently he had his own theories of eugenics. Perhaps not. But he was certainly among the most ruthless, to decide arbitrarily who would survive and who would not, using his own personal standards, and then to implement his decision without mercy. Children watching their parents die. Whole families destroyed. Over four thousand people. They died quickly, without pain, but they died. Relief arrived, but too late to prevent the executions. And Kodos? There never was a positive identification of his body. His history begins almost to the day where Kodos disappeared. He'd better. There were nine eye witnesses who survived the massacre, who'd actually seen Kodos with their own eyes. Jim Kirk was one of them. With the exception of Riley and Captain Kirk, every other eye witness is dead. And my library computer shows that wherever they were, on Earth, on a colony, or aboard ship, the Karidian Company of Players was somewhere near when they died. You've got to pull him through. If he dies, the only one who'll be able to identify Kodos is the Captain. And he'll be the next target. Someone tried to poison him. I don't believe that and neither do you. I want the Captain to see that report. Now. Can we predict the same for you, Captain? Lieutenant Riley was a witness. So were you. Someone tried to kill him. You should be told the difference between empiricism and stubbornness, Doctor. I checked with the library computer, just as you did. I got the same information. Is my personal business when it might interfere with the smooth operation of this ship. It could happen. Even in this corner of the galaxy, Captain, two plus two equals four. Almost certainly an attempt will be made to kill you. Why do you invite death? He is. Logic, Captain. Doctor Leighton was murdered while the Karidian Company was on Planet Q. Now an attempt has been made against Riley while the company is on board the Enterprise. Shh. Listen. Do you hear it? That low hum. On overload. You can't stay. Evacuate this section. Seal it off. Clear section C4 and C5. I believe we have a match, Captain. Ready to leave Benecia orbit, Captain.

Title: Balance of Terror

With that kind of power consumption, they may not be able to see us.', 'Parallel course.', "Negative. You and Mister Sulu will match its course and speed with the object on our sensors exactly, move for move. If he has sensors, I want him to think we're a reflection, an echo. Under no circumstances are you to cross into the Neutral Zone without my direct orders.", 'Cancel battle stations. All decks, standby alert.', 'Mister Stiles.', 'Mister Stiles, are you questioning my orders?', 'Very well. All decks, security alert.', 'Pipe it in.', 'Put it on the screen.', "I didn't quite get that, Mister Stiles.", 'Repeat it.', "I assume you're complimenting Mister Spock on his ability to decode.", "Well, here's one thing you can be sure of, Mister.
