Title: The Galileo Seven
Dialogue: ['Negative ionic concentration one point six four times ten to the ninth power metres, Radiation wave length three hundred seventy angstroms. Harmonics upward along entire spectrum.']
Flattened Dialogue: Negative ionic concentration one point six four times ten to the ninth power metres, Radiation wave length three hundred seventy angstroms. Harmonics upward along entire spectrum.

Title: The Galileo Seven
Dialogue: ['What a mess.', "You don't really expect to get an answer, do you?", 'Logical.', 'Very bad, Mister Spock.', "We've lost a great deal of fuel. We have no chance at all to reach escape velocity. And if we ever hope to make orbit, we'll have to lighten our load by at least five hundred pounds.", 'Aye, you could put it that way.', "It's too delicate. It may not be able to take the pressure as it is.", "If you'll give me a hand with this conduit.", "Pressure's dropping. We're losing everything.", "One of the lines gave. The strain of coming through the atmosphere and the added load when we tried to bypass. Yes, that's done it. We have no fuel.", 'We have no fuel! What alternatives?', "It's dangerous, but it might work.", 'I can adjust the main reactor to function with a substitute fuel supply.', "Aye, we do. Our phasers. I can adapt them and use their energy. It'll take time, but it's possible.", 'Aye.', 'If I can get a full load, we should be able to achieve orbit with all hands. Not that we can maintain it long.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Another hour, maybe two.', 'Doctor, a phaser can only drain so fast.', "You've got your hands full.", "They're in good shape, but they won't lift us off, if that's what you're getting at.", 'That they will, Mister Spock!', 'Ready, Mister Spock.', "I daren't use any more. Not and be sure of ignition.", 'Aye.', "That's enough!", "That's it.", 'If we shed every ounce, we might be able to achieve orbit.', 'A few hours, no longer. But if we time it right, we can cut out of orbit and save enough fuel for a controlled re=entry.', 'We have very few alternatives, Mister Spock.', "Maybe eight minutes if the weight's right.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', "We should be moving, but we're not.", 'What are you doing?', "We'll never be able to hold orbit.", 'No, Mister Spock.', 'Fifteen pounds psi. Approximately enough for one orbit, sir.', 'Tapping our boosters ended our last chance for a soft landing.', 'Mister Spock, you said a while ago that there were always alternatives.', 'Orbit attitude, Mister Spock. With our present fuel, that gives us about forty five minutes.', 'Mister Spock!', 'He jettisoned the fuel and ignited it.', "The orbit'll start decaying as soon as the fuel's exhausted. Say six minutes.", "A distress signal? It's like sending up a flare. Mister Spock, that was a good gamble. Perhaps it was worth it.", 'Orbit decaying, Mister Spock. Ten seconds to atmosphere.']
Flattened Dialogue: What a mess. You don't really expect to get an answer, do you? Logical. Very bad, Mister Spock. We've lost a great deal of fuel. We have no chance at all to reach escape velocity. And if we ever hope to make orbit, we'll have to lighten our load by at least five hundred pounds. Aye, you could put it that way. It's too delicate. It may not be able to take the pressure as it is. If you'll give me a hand with this conduit. Pressure's dropping. We're losing everything. One of the lines gave. The strain of coming through the atmosphere and the added load when we tried to bypass. Yes, that's done it. We have no fuel. We have no fuel! What alternatives? It's dangerous, but it might work. I can adjust the main reactor to function with a substitute fuel supply. Aye, we do. Our phasers. I can adapt them and use their energy. It'll take time, but it's possible. Aye. If I can get a full load, we should be able to achieve orbit with all hands. Not that we can maintain it long. Aye, aye, sir. Another hour, maybe two. Doctor, a phaser can only drain so fast. You've got your hands full. They're in good shape, but they won't lift us off, if that's what you're getting at. That they will, Mister Spock! Ready, Mister Spock. I daren't use any more. Not and be sure of ignition. Aye. That's enough! That's it. If we shed every ounce, we might be able to achieve orbit. A few hours, no longer. But if we time it right, we can cut out of orbit and save enough fuel for a controlled re=entry. We have very few alternatives, Mister Spock. Maybe eight minutes if the weight's right. Aye, aye, sir. We should be moving, but we're not. What are you doing? We'll never be able to hold orbit. No, Mister Spock. Fifteen pounds psi. Approximately enough for one orbit, sir. Tapping our boosters ended our last chance for a soft landing. Mister Spock, you said a while ago that there were always alternatives. Orbit attitude, Mister Spock. With our present fuel, that gives us about forty five minutes. Mister Spock! He jettisoned the fuel and ignited it. The orbit'll start decaying as soon as the fuel's exhausted. Say six minutes. A distress signal? It's like sending up a flare. Mister Spock, that was a good gamble. Perhaps it was worth it. Orbit decaying, Mister Spock. Ten seconds to atmosphere.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ['Forward readings, Mister Spock.', "Ahead warp factor three, Mister Sulu. Colony Beta Six wants their supplies. Let's get across this void in a hurry.", "Sunlight, palm trees. We're nine hundred light years from that kind of desert, Bones.", 'Something, Mister Spock?', 'Can you verify that, Navigator?', 'Put it on visual.', 'And yet, here it is. No time to investigate. Science stations, gather data for computer banks. Uhura, notify the discovery on subspace radio.', "Let's get out of its range. Veer forty degrees to starboard, Mister Sulu.", 'Sulu!', 'What happened? Fill me in.', "I'm Captain James Kirk of the United Starship Enterprise.", 'Who are you? Where do you come from?', "Then you've been looking in on the doings nine hundred years past.", 'General Trelane.', 'For what purpose have you imprisoned us here?', 'Our missions are peaceful, not for conquest. When we do battle, it is only because we have no choice.', 'I must ask you to let us go back to our ship.', 'Not yet. Put it on stun, not to kill, DeSalle.', 'This is Mister DeSalle, our navigator. Doctor McCoy, our medical officer. Mister Sulu, our helmsman, and Carl Jaeger, meteorologist.', 'Who will you start with, my crew? Are we your next targets?', "That's correct.", 'Like the transporter system aboard the Enterprise.', 'This drawing room, did you create it by rearranging matter on this planet?', 'I see. How did you manage', "Come on, let's go. We're getting out of here.", 'Not alive?', "Fire without heat, mistaking all this for present day Earth without taking into account the time differential. Whatever we're dealing with, he certainly isn't all knowledgeable. He makes mistakes.", "Trelane, we haven't planned", 'If your admiration is genuine, you must have respect for our sense of duty too. Our ship has need of us. We have tasks to perform.', 'For how long?', 'Until what is over?', 'Trelane, even if we wanted to stay, our companions are missing us.', 'There are four hundred men and women aboard that ship.', 'No.', "This game has gone on long enough. Those are crucial operating personnel. You can't", "It means, Trelane, the party's over, thanks to Mister Spock.", 'Everyone to stations. Report, Mister Spock. How were our scanners able to penetrate that radiation field?', 'Prepare to warp out of here at once. Maximum speed.', "Scotty, we're going to need every ounce of your engines. We're going to put a hundred million miles between us and that madman.", 'Trelane.', 'On the contrary. I commend his action.', 'Get off my ship.', "We're not going anywhere.", 'DeSalle.', 'Trelane, let him go.', 'This is General Trelane.', 'Lieutenant Uhura of communications.', 'No doubt.', 'Yeoman Teresa Ross. I believe you have met our science officer Mister Spock.', 'Until we can think our way out. Meanwhile, we accept his hospitality.', "You don't find this unexpected, Mister Spock?", "And if he's fallible, he can't be all powerful. Which means he has something helping him.", 'A machine? A device? Something which does these things for him.', "That mirror. It's part of his audience, his ego. He never wanders from it.", 'Explain.', 'What about it?', "No, no, Mister Spock, that's not the reason. What kind of a machine could do these things?", 'Good. I agree. That leaves me free', "If I'm not mistaken, Mister Spock, I think I can turn his lights off at the source. Don't be too upset by what you see, gentlemen. After all, his actions are those of an immature, unbalanced mind.", 'You only heard part of it. I just started.', "Yes. I want you to leave my crewmen alone. I want you to leave my crewwomen alone too. You're not to dance with him. I don't like it.", "I don't want you accepting his gifts, either.", "I don't care what you believe, just keep your hands off her!", "I've had enough of your insulting attentions to her.", "If it's fighting that you want, you may have it.", 'If you have the courage.', 'Are you ready?', "Enough talk. Let's get on with it.", 'We shoot together.', 'All right.', 'Try to contact the ship.', "Go on, Trelane. Look at it. It's over. Your power is blanked out. You're finished.", "Trelane! Everyone, we're getting out of here. Now. This is the Captain. Commence beaming up. Maximum speed.", 'Set course for Colony Beta Six.', 'Full power acceleration from orbit, Mister Scott.', 'Emergency warp at the earliest possible moment, Mister Sulu.', "Not yet. They may trace our beam. Wait until we're well out of range.", 'We can take an educated guess. At the point we entered their solar system.', 'Good.', 'Yes, I think you might. Turn in your glass slippers. The ball is over.', 'Hard to believe it ever happened.', 'Hard to port, Mister Sulu.', 'Gothos? Mister Sulu, have we been going in circles?', 'Hard over, Mister Sulu.', 'With us as the mouse.', 'Ninety degrees to starboard, Mister Sulu.', 'Ninety degrees sub-port, Mister Sulu. Adjust.', 'Decelerate into orbit. Prepare transporter room.', "Yes, I am, Doctor McCoy. I am going to see our playful Mister Trelane and whatever it takes to make him give up our ship. Stand by communications. Mister Spock. If you don't receive a message from me within the hour, leave the vicinity at once. No turning back.", 'Trelane.', "I've had enough of your games.", "I haven't come to plead in your court, Trelane.", "I've come for one purpose. To get back my ship.", "We've made you angry with our will to survive, haven't we?", 'Then vent your anger on me alone. I was the one who led the others. I was the one who shot out your mirror machine.', "I took that chance. I'm willing to pay the price for chancing wrong.", 'Yes, anything! Just allow the Enterprise to continue its journey. You pompous', 'Those people have done you no harm.', "We're living beings, not playthings for your amusement.", "I'm glad you weren't disappointed.", "Trelane, if you think I'm going to cheerfully and obediently stick my head in that noose", "That's your problem, Trelane. Everything is easy. It's given you a bad habit. You're not aware of it, but you have it. You don't think, Trelane. That's your problem. You miss opportunities, like your anger before and mine right now. Oh, you enjoy it, but you couldn't have accomplished it without me, and you know why? Because you're a bumbling, inept fool.", "Here you have an opportunity to experience something really unique, and you're wasting it. You want to commit murder? Go ahead, but where's the sport in a simple hanging?", 'Yes. The terror of murder. The suspense. The fun.', 'A personal conflict between us. Not like the duel before, but the real thing. The stakes, a human life. Mine.', "That's the idea.", "Yes, but you can do better than that. There's still not enough sport in just killing me with a sword.", "It strikes me very well. But you'll have to make it worth my while, Trelane. Why not up the stakes?", "Yes. While we're playing our game, free my ship. Let it continue on its way. In return, I'll give you a contest you'll remember.", 'Let me notify the Enterprise that it can go.', 'Enterprise. Enterprise, can you hear me?', 'Enterprise. Enterprise.', 'Remember, Trelane. You promised to let my ship go.', "You haven't won, Trelane.", "But you haven't won anything.", 'No! Does it still taste as sweet?', "But I'm not defeated.", "You've got a lot to learn about winning, Trelane.", "In fact, you've got a lot to learn about everything, haven't you?", 'Who are you? Who is Trelane?', 'Captain to Enterprise. Captain to Enterprise.', "Beam me up, Mister Spock. We're free to go.", 'Normal orbit approach procedures, Mister Sulu.', 'Mister Spock. Still thinking about Trelane, is that it?', 'God of war, Mister Spock.', 'Then a small boy, and a very naughty one at that.', 'Then he was a very strange small boy. One the other hand, he was probably doing things comparable to the same mischievous pranks you played when you were a boy.', "Yes. Dipping little girls' curls in inkwells. Stealing apples from the neighbours' trees. Tying cans on", 'Forgive me, Mister Spock. I should have known better.']

Yeoman Teresa Ross. I believe you have met our science officer Mister Spock. Until we can think our way out. Meanwhile, we accept his hospitality. You don't find this unexpected, Mister Spock? And if he's fallible, he can't be all powerful. Which means he has something helping him. A machine? A device? Something which does these things for him. That mirror. It's part of his audience, his ego. He never wanders from it. Explain. What about it? No, no, Mister Spock, that's not the reason. What kind of a machine could do these things? Good. I agree. That leaves me free If I'm not mistaken, Mister Spock, I think I can turn his lights off at the source. Don't be too upset by what you see, gentlemen. After all, his actions are those of an immature, unbalanced mind. You only heard part of it. I just started. Yes. I want you to leave my crewmen alone. I want you to leave my crewwomen alone too. Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ['Gravimetric readings, no significant change, zero space density.', 'The precise meaning of the word desert is a waterless, barren wasteland. I fail to understand your romantic nostalgia for such a place.', 'Thank you, Doctor McCoy. Moving on schedule into quadrant nine oh four. Beta Six is eight days distant.', "Unusual, Captain. I'm now getting a sizable space-displacement reading.", 'Inconceivable this body has gone unnoted on all our records.', 'Emergency! Full reverse power!', 'Function is normal. Continuous sensor sweeps. Lieutenant Uhura, have you checked all wave bands?', 'The decision will be mine, Doctor. I have the responsibility for your safety. Mister Jaeger, describe your geophysical findings for the surface below.', 'Estimate survival time of two unprotected individuals down there.', 'Greetings and felicitations. Hmm. Send this, Lieutenant. USS Enterprise to signaler on planet surface. Identify self.', "Hip hip hoorah? And I believe it's pronounced tally ho.", "I'll entertain any theories, Mister DeSalle. Any at all.", "You're quite correct, Doctor. Prepare transporter room.", 'No, Mister Scott. Neither you nor I can be spared here. Mister DeSalle, equip the landing party with full communications, armament, and life-support gear. Mister Jaeger, your geophysical knowledge may be crucial down there. Doctor McCoy will accompany. If those peculiar signals are coming from Captain Kirk or Lieutenant Sulu, their rationality is in question. Dismissed.', "Very good. Transmit coordinates to Mister Scott. Once on the planet's surface, you'll establish contact with us immediately. Use the laser beacon if necessary. Ready, Scott?", 'Activate.', "I don't, Mister Scott. It simply exists. Artificial perhaps, or a freak of nature. The fact remains that life can exist in that area.", 'Apply a fine tuning on our sensors. Locate any life forms in that stable area.', "Affirmative. But if the Captain is down there and alive, that's where he'll have to be. We'll attempt to transport up any living beings our sensors detect.", 'Or stand by and do nothing, Mister Scott.', "They didn't, Captain. Not clearly. We merely beamed up all life forms in a given area.", 'I am Spock.', 'My father is from the planet Vulcan.', 'Not generally. But there have been exceptions.', 'Affirmative.', 'I object to you. I object to intellect without discipline. I object to power without constructive purpose.', 'It may be unappetizing, Doctor, but it is very logical.', 'Fascinating is a word I use for the unexpected. In this case, I should think interesting would suffice.', 'That his food has no taste, his wine no flavour? No. It simply means that Trelane knows all of the Earth forms, but none of the substance.', 'Evidently.', 'Is it ego, or something else?', 'The mirror.', 'You noted yourself he never gets very far from it. I suppose it could be vanity.', 'A machine with the ability to turn energy into matter guided by thought waves. It would have a very complex memory bank, and would be extremely sophisticated.', "I think not. A device capable of keeping out this planet's natural atmosphere would be immense.", 'Captain.', 'The machine.', 'Can we know his range is, Captain?', 'Collision course.', 'That was the planet Gothos, Captain.', 'Gothos again, Captain.', 'Cat and mouse game.', 'Or it toward us.', "Captain, we're receiving you.", 'Captain.', 'For the record, how do we describe him? Pure mentality? Force of intellect? Embodied energy? Superbeing? He must be classified, sir.', 'I hardly find that fitting.', 'It will make a strange entry in the library banks.', 'Mischievous pranks, Captain?', 'I shall be delighted, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Gravimetric readings, no significant change, zero space density. The precise meaning of the word desert is a waterless, barren wasteland. I fail to understand your romantic nostalgia for such a place. Thank you, Doctor McCoy. Moving on schedule into quadrant nine oh four. Beta Six is eight days distant. Unusual, Captain. I'm now getting a sizable space-displacement reading. Inconceivable this body has gone unnoted on all our records. Emergency! Full reverse power! Function is normal. Continuous sensor sweeps. Lieutenant Uhura, have you checked all wave bands? The decision will be mine, Doctor. I have the responsibility for your safety. Mister Jaeger, describe your geophysical findings for the surface below. Estimate survival time of two unprotected individuals down there. Greetings and felicitations. Hmm. Send this, Lieutenant. USS Enterprise to signaler on planet surface. Identify self. Hip hip hoorah? And I believe it's pronounced tally ho. I'll entertain any theories, Mister DeSalle. Any at all. You're quite correct, Doctor. Prepare transporter room. No, Mister Scott. Neither you nor I can be spared here. Mister DeSalle, equip the landing party with full communications, armament, and life-support gear. Mister Jaeger, your geophysical knowledge may be crucial down there. Doctor McCoy will accompany. If those peculiar signals are coming from Captain Kirk or Lieutenant Sulu, their rationality is in question. Dismissed. Very good. Transmit coordinates to Mister Scott. Once on the planet's surface, you'll establish contact with us immediately. Use the laser beacon if necessary. Ready, Scott? Activate. I don't, Mister Scott. It simply exists. Artificial perhaps, or a freak of nature. The fact remains that life can exist in that area. Apply a fine tuning on our sensors. Locate any life forms in that stable area. Affirmative. But if the Captain is down there and alive, that's where he'll have to be. We'll attempt to transport up any living beings our sensors detect. Or stand by and do nothing, Mister Scott. They didn't, Captain. Not clearly. We merely beamed up all life forms in a given area. I am Spock. My father is from the planet Vulcan. Not generally. But there have been exceptions. Affirmative. I object to you. I object to intellect without discipline. I object to power without constructive purpose. It may be unappetizing, Doctor, but it is very logical. Fascinating is a word I use for the unexpected. In this case, I should think interesting would suffice. That his food has no taste, his wine no flavour? No. It simply means that Trelane knows all of the Earth forms, but none of the substance. Evidently. Is it ego, or something else? The mirror. You noted yourself he never gets very far from it. I suppose it could be vanity. A machine with the ability to turn energy into matter guided by thought waves. It would have a very complex memory bank, and would be extremely sophisticated. I think not. A device capable of keeping out this planet's natural atmosphere would be immense. Captain. The machine. Can we know his range is, Captain? Collision course. That was the planet Gothos, Captain. Gothos again, Captain. Cat and mouse game. Or it toward us. Captain, we're receiving you. Captain. For the record, how do we describe him? Pure mentality? Force of intellect? Embodied energy? Superbeing? He must be classified, sir. I hardly find that fitting. It will make a strange entry in the library banks. Mischievous pranks, Captain? I shall be delighted, Captain.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ['Void, star desert. The word conjures up pictures of dunes, oases, mirages.', "That doesn't surprise me, Mister Spock. I can't imagine a mirage ever disturbing those mathematically perfect brain waves of yours.", "I second DeSalle's request. What are we waiting for?", "One thing is certain. Obviously there's life on that planet.", 'Where are your storms, Jaeger?', 'No response.', 'In the name of heaven, where are we?', "There's no reading. They're like waxworks figures.", "You disappeared from the bridge after Sulu. We've been looking for you for four hours.", 'Better say, what is he? I monitored him, and what I found was unbelievable.', 'Not in the way we define life. No trace. Zero.', "It doesn't even show that he exists at all, alive or dead.", 'Captain, receiving a transporter signal.', "Which means Trelane is not a life form as we know it, or he'd be beaming through now.", "I'm quaking, but I don't know if it's from laughter or terror.", 'Well, it was a. Oh, forget it.', 'You should taste his food. Straw would taste better than his meat, and water a hundred times better than his brandy. Nothing has any taste at all.', "There's that magic word again. Does your logic find this fascinating, Mister Spock?", "Captain, you're not beaming down."]
Flattened Dialogue: Void, star desert. The word conjures up pictures of dunes, oases, mirages. That doesn't surprise me, Mister Spock. I can't imagine a mirage ever disturbing those mathematically perfect brain waves of yours. I second DeSalle's request. What are we waiting for? One thing is certain. Obviously there's life on that planet. Where are your storms, Jaeger? No response. In the name of heaven, where are we? There's no reading. They're like waxworks figures. You disappeared from the bridge after Sulu. We've been looking for you for four hours. Better say, what is he? I monitored him, and what I found was unbelievable. Not in the way we define life. No trace. Zero. It doesn't even show that he exists at all, alive or dead. Captain, receiving a transporter signal. Which means Trelane is not a life form as we know it, or he'd be beaming through now. I'm quaking, but I don't know if it's from laughter or terror. Well, it was a. Oh, forget it. You should taste his food. Straw would taste better than his meat, and water a hundred times better than his brandy. Nothing has any taste at all. There's that magic word again. Does your logic find this fascinating, Mister Spock? Captain, you're not beaming down.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ['Strong interference on subspace, Captain. The planet must be a natural radio source.', 'All of them, Mister Spock. No response.', 'Mister Spock. Look.', "No more messages from below, sir, but I've locked onto their original source.", 'Doctor, what was it? What was down there?', "I don't know how to play this.", 'Shall I make a full report to Spacefleet Command, sir?', 'Still no sign of pursuit. Instruments clear, sir.', 'Colony Beta Six clears us for normal approach, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Strong interference on subspace, Captain. The planet must be a natural radio source. All of them, Mister Spock. No response. Mister Spock. Look. No more messages from below, sir, but I've locked onto their original source. Doctor, what was it? What was down there? I don't know how to play this. Shall I make a full report to Spacefleet Command, sir? Still no sign of pursuit. Instruments clear, sir. Colony Beta Six clears us for normal approach, sir.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ['Forty degrees.', 'Where are we?', 'Is he kidding?', 'Captain, where could he possibly come from? Who is this maniac?', "You mean, it shows he's dead?", 'No.', "We haven't even got our phasers.", 'Captain, how far do we go along with this charade?', 'Laid in, sir.', 'Standing by to warp, sir.', "Captain, we're about to warp.", 'No, sir. All instruments show on course.', 'Turning, Captain. Nut not veering off from it.', 'Turn completed, and still accelerating toward the planet.', 'Warping down, Captain. Our warp factor four.']
Flattened Dialogue: Forty degrees. Where are we? Is he kidding? Captain, where could he possibly come from? Who is this maniac? You mean, it shows he's dead? No. We haven't even got our phasers. Captain, how far do we go along with this charade? Laid in, sir. Standing by to warp, sir. Captain, we're about to warp. No, sir. All instruments show on course. Turning, Captain. Nut not veering off from it. Turn completed, and still accelerating toward the planet. Warping down, Captain. Our warp factor four.

Title: The Squire of Gothos
Dialogue: ["We've searched again from stem to stern. If they're not down on that planet, they're nowhere.", 'Request assignment to the search party, sir.', 'Ready, Mister Spock.', "Aye, it's there, Mister Spock. Peaceful as Earth, but how do you explain it?", "Aye, it could, but it couldn't move around much.", "If we find any, it doesn't follow that it would be our people.", 'Shooting in the dark, Mister Spock?', 'Aye aye, sir.', 'Full power, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: We've searched again from stem to stern. If they're not down on that planet, they're nowhere. Request assignment to the search party, sir. Ready, Mister Spock. Aye, it's there, Mister Spock. Peaceful as Earth, but how do you explain it? Aye, it could, but it couldn't move around much. If we find any, it doesn't follow that it would be our people. Shooting in the dark, Mister Spock? Aye aye, sir. Full power, sir.

Title: Arena
Dialogue: ["You'll enjoy Commodore Travers. He sets a good table.", 'Probably. Rank hath its privileges.', 'Scotty. Kirk here.', "Good, Commodore. We're on our way.", "We'll beam down immediately, Commodore. Kirk out.", 'This colony is isolated, exposed, out on the edge of now here. He probably wants additional advice.', 'Energise.', 'Kirk to Enterprise. Red alert.', 'Cestus Three has been destroyed.', 'Full alert. Tricorder readings, Mister Spock. Life detection.', "Faked. All this happened several days ago. Lang, over there. Look for survivors. Kelowitz, that way. O'Herlihy, stick with me.", 'Come on, Bones.', "Keep him alive, Bones. I want to know what's been happening here.", 'Survivors?', 'Where?', "O'Herlihy.", 'Cover! Kirk to Enterprise, lock on transporters. Beam us up.', 'Keep those screens up. Fire all phasers.', "Take all action necessary to protect the ship. We'll hold out here.", 'Keep those screens up. Worry about us when the ship is safe.', 'Kirk out.', "If they lower those screens to beam us up, they'll be open to phaser attack.", "We're stuck with it, Mister Spock. We'll have to make do with what we've got.", "Kelowitz, Lang, flank out. Lay down fire on co-ordinates Mister Spock gave you. Even if you don't see them. Keep your heads down.", "We're helpless down here. And the Enterprise", "It's my ship, Mister Spock. I should be there. We can't even get at them.", 'Can you remember the layout of this place? The arsenal?', "I'll risk it.", 'Kirk here. Report.', 'Never mind about me. What about the ship?', 'Arm your photon torpedoes.', 'Any identification on the attacking vessel?', 'Sulu. Sulu, our communications are being interfered with. Now get this straight.', 'You do anything you think necessary to protect the ship. Leave orbit, maximum warp, anything. Clear?', 'Never mind about me. Protect my ship!', 'Good. Contact me when you can. Kirk out.', "We'll see how ingenious they are. Here, give me a hand with this grenade launcher. Lang!", "Sulu's taken her out of orbit.", 'Did you see them?', 'An evaluation, Mister Kelowitz. Where do you think they are?', "It'll be a lot closer to them. Stand clear.", 'Kirk here.', "Lock on to the alien, Mister Sulu. I don't want to lose her.", "I want a search party of thirty medical personnel beamed down immediately to search for survivors. Notify the transporter room. Lock onto us. We're beaming up.", 'Can you tell me what happened?', 'Yes, I know.', 'Easy. Easy.', 'Lieutenant, the Enterprise received two messages, ostensibly from Cestus Three. One for the Enterprise to go there, and the other for myself and my tactical crew to beam down to the surface.', 'It was a trap. Getting the Enterprise to come to Cestus Three, getting us and our whole crew to come ashore.', 'The reason is crystal clear. The Enterprise is the only protection in this section of the Federation. Destroy the Enterprise, and everything is wide open.', 'I have all the proof I need on Cestus Three.', 'How can you explain a massacre like that? No, Mister Spock. The threat is clear and immediate. Invasion.', "I intend to. If we can keep them in the dark as to our strength, they'll never dare move against us. Captain to helmsman.", 'Is the alien still making warp five?', 'Initiate warp six.', 'Overtake. Phaser banks, lock on to the enemy vessel. Stand by for firing orders. All hands, this is the Captain. We are going into battle. All hands, battle stations. Red alert. I repeat, red alert. This is no drill. This is no drill.', 'Mister DePaul.', 'Position.', 'All scanners lock into computer banks. I want a complete record of this. Mister Spock, what do we have on this general area?', 'Anything on intelligent life forms?', 'Mister Sulu, status, alien vessel.', 'Warp factor seven.', 'Something the matter, Mister Spock?', 'Thank you, Mister Spock. I mean to catch them.', "They'll have to prove it. Yes, Mister Spock?", 'Of course.', 'Colony Cestus Three has been obliterated, Mister Spock.', "If the aliens go unpunished, they'll be back, attacking other Federation installations.", "There's no time for that. It's a matter of policy. Out here, we're the only policemen around. And a crime has been committed. Do I make myself clear?", "I'm delighted, Mister Spock. Report, Mister Sulu.", 'Warp factor eight.', 'Captain to phaser banks. All components at battle ready. All banks primed.', 'Yes, Mister Sulu.', 'Good. Mister DePaul.', 'Our position.', "Is it on the alien's course?", 'By the alien ship?', 'Any interference? Resistance?', 'Mister Spock?', 'Mister Sulu, is the alien still heading away from that solar system?', 'Lieutenant Uhura, anything further on those scanning beams?', 'Yes, what is it?', 'He may be turning to fight.', 'Are you sure?', "Then we've got them. Go to Red Alert. Prepare to fire phaser banks. Sensors, lock on. Mister Sulu, continue closing. Mister Spock, lock phasers into computer. Computers will control attack.", 'From warp eight? Have you lost your mind?', 'Mister Scott, report.', 'Phaser banks. Report.', 'Damage Control, report.', 'Tractor beam?', 'This is Kirk.', "I don't understand.", 'What makes you think you can interfere with', 'Just a minute', 'The Enterprise is dead in space, stopped cold during her pursuit of an alien raider by mysterious forces, and I have been somehow whisked off the bridge and placed on the surface of an asteroid, facing the Captain of the alien ship. Weaponless, I face the creature the Metrons called a Gorn. Large, reptilian. Like most humans, I seem to have an instinctive revulsion to reptiles. I must fight to remember that this is an intelligent, highly advanced individual, the Captain of a starship, like myself, undoubtedly a dangerously clever opponent.', "This is Captain James Kirk of the Starship Enterprise. Who ever finds this please get it to Starfleet Command. I'm engaged in personal combat with a creature apparently called a Gorn.", "He's immensely strong. Already he has withstood attacks from me that would have killed a human being. Fortunately, though strong, he is not agile. The agility and, I hope, the cleverness, is mine.", "The Metrons, the creatures that sent us both here, said that the surface of the planet provides the raw material to construct weapons. There's very little here. Scrub brush, rocks, an abundance of mineral deposits, but no weapons in the conventional sense. Still, I need to find one. Bare-handed against the Gorn, I have no chance.", 'A large deposit of diamonds on the surface. Perhaps the hardest substance known in the universe. Beautifully crystallized and pointed, but too small to be useful as a weapon. An incredible fortune in stones yet I would trade them all for a hand phaser, or a good solid club. Yet the Metrons said there would be weapons, if I could find them. Where? What kind?', "This may be my last entry. I am almost exhausted. Unless I find the weapon the Metron mentioned I have very little time left. Native sulphur, diamonds. This place is a mineralogist's dream. Yet there is something about sulphur. Something very old. Something? If only I could remember.", 'Who is this, the Metron?', 'All right. What do you want?', 'Like you were at Cestus Three?', 'You butchered helpless human beings', "No. No, I won't kill you. Maybe you thought you were protecting yourself when you attacked the outpost.", "No, I won't kill him! Do you hear? You'll have to get your entertainment someplace else!", "You're a Metron?", 'You seem more like a boy.', 'How?', 'What happened to the Gorn?', "No. That won't be necessary. We can talk. Maybe reach an agreement.", "I don't know. I don't know. All right, everybody. Back to your posts. Let's get out of here.", 'Mister Sulu.', "Don't try and figure it out, Mister Sulu. Just plot a course for us back to Cestus Three.", "We're a most promising species, Mister Spock, as predators go. Did you know that?", "I don't. Not anymore. And maybe in a thousand years or so, we'll be able to prove it. Never mind, Mister Spock. It doesn't make much sense to me either. Take us back to where we're supposed to be, Mister Sulu. Warp factor one."]

Title: Arena
Dialogue: ['I wonder if he brought his personal chef along with him to Cestus Three.', 'How well we both know that.', "Spock, isn't it enough the commodore is famous for his hospitality? I, for one, could use a good non-reconstituted meal.", 'You bet your pointed ears I am. Ready whenever you are, Captain.', 'Captain, over there.', "Careful, careful. Shock, radiation burns, internal injuries for certain. He's in a bad way, Captain.", "He'll be dead in half an hour if we don't get him some decent care.", 'What are you going to do, Mister Spock?', 'What about the Captain?', "Now, you're the one that's always talking about logic. What about some logic now? Where's the Captain, Mister Spock?", "The ship, our engines, our weapons. It's just inconceivable that we are immobilised.", 'We appeal to you in the name of civilisation. Put a stop to this.', 'If there were only some way we could contact him.', 'So?', 'Can that be true? Was Cestus Three an intrusion on their space?', 'Then we could be in the wrong.', 'The Gorn simply might have been trying to protect themselves.', 'What is it, Spock?', "What's he doing?", 'What force?', 'Can he do it?']
Flattened Dialogue: I wonder if he brought his personal chef along with him to Cestus Three. How well we both know that. Spock, isn't it enough the commodore is famous for his hospitality? I, for one, could use a good non-reconstituted meal. You bet your pointed ears I am. Ready whenever you are, Captain. Captain, over there. Careful, careful. Shock, radiation burns, internal injuries for certain. He's in a bad way, Captain. He'll be dead in half an hour if we don't get him some decent care. What are you going to do, Mister Spock? What about the Captain? Now, you're the one that's always talking about logic. What about some logic now? Where's the Captain, Mister Spock? The ship, our engines, our weapons. It's just inconceivable that we are immobilised. We appeal to you in the name of civilisation. Put a stop to this. If there were only some way we could contact him. So? Can that be true? Was Cestus Three an intrusion on their space? Then we could be in the wrong. The Gorn simply might have been trying to protect themselves. What is it, Spock? What's he doing? What force? Can he do it?

Title: Arena
Dialogue: ["Captain. I wonder why he's insistent that our tactical aides come down.", 'Perhaps, Captain, but nevertheless', 'Doctor, you are a sensualist.', 'Those messages we got, Captain, the one directing us here yesterday.', 'Captain, impulses that direction. Very weak, possibly a survivor.', 'Getting another life reading, Captain.', 'Not survivors. Not warm-blooded. Living creatures, but not human.', 'Azimuth ninety three degrees, range one five seven zero yards.', "We're hopelessly outnumbered here, Captain. It's those disruptors versus our hand phasers.", 'Sulu is an experienced combat officer.', 'Nor can they at us at the moment. Not unless they moved their original position. That intervening high ground.', 'About one hundred yards in that direction. But after an attack as thorough as this one', 'How is he, Doctor?', "They're moving. I've got to get to the Captain.", "Locked on to the enemy, Captain. They're moving toward the high ground. They've locked on to my tricorder.", 'Very ingenious. They fed back my own impulses and built up an overload.', 'Any word from the Enterprise?', 'Very clever. As to the reason?', 'You allude to invasion, Captain, yet positive proof', 'Not necessarily, sir. Several possible explanations', "Very well, then. If that's the case, you must make certain that the alien vessel never reaches its home base.", 'Virtually nothing, Captain. No records of any explorations. There are rumours of certain strange signals on subspace channels. However, none has ever been recorded.', 'Nothing specific, Captain. Unscientific rumours only. More like space legends.', 'A sustained warp seven speed will be dangerous, Captain.', 'You mean to destroy the alien ship, Captain?', 'I thought perhaps the hot pursuit alone might be sufficient. Destruction might be unnecessary.', 'The destruction of the alien vessel will not help that colony, Jim.', 'I merely suggested that a regard for sentient life', 'Very clear, Captain.', 'It would appear someone is curious about us.', 'Computer lock ready, Captain. All systems standing by.', 'Same as the alien, Captain.', 'All systems report normal, Captain. No ascertainable damage.', "We're being held in place, Captain, apparently from that solar system.", 'We are being held.', 'No, sir. An unidentifiable power.', 'Have you tried overload?', 'How about bypassing the transformer banks? Feed the impulse engines directly.', 'Lieutenant Uhura, have sensors learned anything about the nature of the force which holds us here?', 'No indication of its composition? Gravimetric? Magnetic? Electronic?', 'Leave channel one open, Lieutenant, just in case.', "I'm going to wait, Doctor. There's little else I can do.", 'If I could help him, I would. I cannot.', "He's out there, Doctor. Out there somewhere in a thousand cubic parsecs of space, and there's absolutely nothing we can do to help him.", 'This is the U.S.S. Enterprise calling the Metrons. Our channels are open. Come in, please. We urgently desire a conference. Please answer.', 'But it has happened, Doctor.', "Yes, indeed, Doctor, if only there were. Notice the substance encrusting that rock. Yes. Unless I'm mistaken, it's potassium nitrate.", 'Perhaps nothing, Doctor. Perhaps everything.', 'It may well be possible, Doctor. We know very little about that section of the galaxy.', 'Perhaps. That is something best decided by diplomats.', 'Yes.', 'Fascinating. Good. Good. He knows, Doctor. He has reasoned it out.', 'Yes. Yes.', 'Recall your basic chemistry, Doctor. Gunpowder.', 'If he has the time, Doctor. If he has the time.', 'After you touched off your primitive cannon, Captain, we lost the picture the Metron was sending us.', 'Most of it. I would be interested in knowing what finally happened.', "I've frequently had my doubts.", 'A thousand years, Captain?']

Title: Arena
Dialogue: ['What is it, Captain?', "Captain, we're coming under attack. Unidentified ship quartering in.", "We can't beam you up. I've just rigged up defensive screens.", 'Firing phasers, Captain. The alien has screens up, too.', 'Are you under attack, Captain?', 'We could drop screens.', 'Captain, are you all right?', 'We returned fire with all phaser banks. Title: Arena
Dialogue: ["We'll either catch them or blow up, Captain. They may be faster than we are.", "We're dead, Captain. Locked up. Frozen tight. All propulsion systems read zero.", "They're all normal, sir. Atmosphere, heat, light. No variance.", "I don't know, sir, but whatever it is, we canna move.", 'Aye, sir. It does no good.', 'I tried that, sir. Nothing.']
Flattened Dialogue: We'll either catch them or blow up, Captain. They may be faster than we are. We're dead, Captain. Locked up. Frozen tight. All propulsion systems read zero. They're all normal, sir. Atmosphere, heat, light. No variance. I don't know, sir, but whatever it is, we canna move. Aye, sir. It does no good. I tried that, sir. Nothing.

Title: Arena
Dialogue: ["Captain, sensors report we're being scanned.", "No, sir. It's from that solar system ahead.", "No, sir, Just scanning beams. It's on an unusual wave length.", "There's no hostility, sir. They're not tractors or weapons of any sort, Just increasing in intensity. Steady. Regular. It's growing stronger, sir.", 'No, sir. They report they definitely emanate from that solar system ahead.', 'Nothing, sir.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Captain! Are you all right?']

They're not tractors or weapons of any sort, Just increasing in intensity. Steady. Regular. It's growing stronger, sir. No, sir. They report they definitely emanate from that solar system ahead. Nothing, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Captain! Are you all right?

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Dialogue: ["Except for secondary systems, everything is out, sir. We're on impulse power only.", 'If Mister Scott is still with us, auxiliaries should be on momentarily. Are you all right, Lieutenant?', 'Mister Scott is still with us.', 'Captain? Casualty reports indicate only minor injuries. Engineering reports warp engines non-operational. Mister Scott overrode the automatic helm setting and is holding us in orbit on impulse power.', 'Earth, Captain. We were on a general course in this direction when we were pulled in by the star. Apparently the breakaway threw us on in the same direction.', 'We are too low in the atmosphere to retain this orbit, Captain. Engineering reports we have sufficient impulse power to achieve escape velocity.', 'Apparently, Captain, so are we.', 'Whiplash propelled us into a time warp, Captain. Backward. Exact chronometer readings in a few moments.', 'Verified. Scanners report some type of craft approaching from below us. Under cloud cover and closing.', 'Positive identification, Captain. Aircraft is an interceptor, equipped with missiles, possibly armed with nuclear warheads. If he hits us with one, he might damage us severely, perhaps beyond our capacity to repair under current circumstances.', 'Captain, this type of aircraft might be too fragile to take our tractor beam.', 'Aircraft is breaking up, Captain.', 'Bridge to Captain Kirk.', 'The aircraft has completely broken up, Captain. Shall we turn off the tractor beam?', 'Neither have I.', 'Captain.', "We've achieved a stable orbit out of Earth's atmosphere. Our deflectors are operative, enough to prevent our being picked up again as a UFO. And Mister Scott wishes to speak to you about the engines.", 'Captain Christopher.', "We cannot return him to Earth, Captain. He already knows too much about us and is learning more. I do not specifically refer to Captain Christopher, but suppose an unscrupulous man were to gain certain knowledge of man's future? Such a man could manipulate key industries, stocks, and even nations. and in so doing, change what must be. And if it is changed, Captain, you and I and all that we know might not even exist.", 'Yes, sir.', 'I have investigated it, Captain. To correct the fault will require an overhaul of the entire computer system and a minimum of three weeks at a Starbase.', 'It also has an unfortunate tendency to giggle.', "We put in at Cygnet Fourteen for general repair and maintenance. Cygnet Fourteen is a planet dominated by women. They seemed to feel the ship's computer system lacked a personality. They gave it one. Female, of course.", 'I have run a computer check on all historical tapes. They show no record of any relevant contribution by John Christopher.', 'Bridge to Captain Kirk.', 'Have some new information regarding Captain Christopher. Important I see you both immediately.', 'Yes, sir. Bridge out.', 'Crude methods, but effective.', 'I made an error in my computations.', 'I find that we must return Captain Christopher to Earth after all.', 'Poor choice of words on my part. I neglected, in my initial run-through, to correlate the possible contributions by offspring. I find, after running a crosscheck on that factor, that your son Colonel Shaun Geoffrey Christopher headed, or will head, the first successful Earth-Saturn probe, which is a rather significant', 'The doctor is correct. Unless we return Captain Christopher to Earth, There will be no Colonel Shaun Geoffrey Christopher to go to Saturn.', 'Acknowledging that we must return Captain Christopher, there are several problems, prime of which is the explanation of his return. We tracked his plane wreckage down after our tractor beam crushed it. It crashed in an open section of southern Nebraska.', 'And Captain Christopher himself complicated the matter.', "Captain, our tractor beam caught and crushed an Air Force plane. It'll be impossible to explain this as anything other than a genuine UFO. Possibly alien, definitely destructive.", "A theory. A reverse application of what happened to us. Logically, it could work. Also, logically, there are a hundred variables, any one of which could put us in a worse position than we're in now.", "Not at all. You'll simply be one of the thousands who thought he saw a UFO.", 'Fifteen minutes, twenty eight seconds.', 'It is a fact, Doctor, that prowling by stealth is more time-consuming than a direct approach. In our case', 'I am.', 'You may be correct, Doctor. Open communicator channel.', 'Beam up immediately.', "We'll know in a moment, Doctor.", 'Spock here. Are you all right, Captain?', "I don't believe there'll be trouble in that respect, Captain.", 'Our guest seems quite satisfied to remain where he is.', 'Your decision to beam up was quite correct, Mister Sulu.', 'Spock here.', "Do so now, engineer. We'll need all power to test our theory.", 'Poor photography.', 'I am aware of that, Doctor. This is the first officer. Captain Christopher to the briefing room.', 'Quite logical, Captain. Can you give us the co-ordinates to beam down a landing party near those interrogation rooms?', "I can't do that, Captain.", 'Mister Sulu, you and Captain Christopher will beam down with me. The captain will provide the co-ordinates for the transporter chief.', 'One for you, one for me. Set them on heavy stun force.', 'In fact, I do. But only to a certain point.', 'Energise.', 'He knew the exact beam down co-ordinates for this section of the base. It was necessary to bring him along.', 'I suspected he might not wish to return with us.', 'Mister Scott and I both agree that the only possible solution is the slingshot effect, like the one that put us here. My computations indicate that if we fly toward the sun, seek out its magnetic attraction, then pull away at full power, the whiplash will propel us into another time warp.', "Logically, as we move faster and faster toward the sun, we'll begin to move backward in time. We'll actually go back beyond yesterday, beyond the point when we first appeared in the sky. Then, breaking free will shoot us forward in time, and we'll transport you back before any of this happened.", "Since we've passed Mercury, the sun's pull on us has increased greatly. From here, we'll move even faster. And Captain, notice the chronometers. They've started backward. Minute by minute, the speed of time passage will now increase.", 'Approaching breakaway point. On the countdown. Ten, nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.', "We've broken free and heading back.", 'Chronometers moving forward again, Captain.', 'Computed.', "Twenty minutes, sir. It'll be close.", 'Ten minutes. Nine, eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one.', 'Approaching second beaming, Captain.', 'Now.', 'Approaching our century, Captain. Braking should begin now.', 'Fifty years to go.', 'Forty, thirty.']

I neglected, in my initial run-through, to correlate the possible contributions by offspring. Unless we return Captain Christopher to Earth, There will be no Colonel Shaun Geoffrey Christopher to go to Saturn. Acknowledging that we must return Captain Christopher, there are several problems, prime of which is the explanation of his return. We tracked his plane wreckage down after our tractor beam crushed it. It crashed in an open section of southern Nebraska. And Captain Christopher himself complicated the matter. Captain, our tractor beam caught and crushed an Air Force plane. It'll be impossible to explain this as anything other than a genuine UFO. Possibly alien, definitely destructive. A theory. A reverse application of what happened to us. Logically, it could work. Also, logically, there are a hundred variables, any one of which could put us in a worse position than we're in now. Not at all. You'll simply be one of the thousands who thought he saw a UFO. Fifteen minutes, twenty eight seconds. It is a fact, Doctor, that prowling by stealth is more time-consuming than a direct approach. In our case I am. You may be correct, Doctor. Open communicator channel. Beam up immediately. Your decision to beam up was quite correct, Mister Sulu. Spock here. Do so now, engineer. We'll need all power to test our theory. Poor photography. I am aware of that, Doctor. Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Dialogue: ['Yes, sir.', "Captain, normal Starfleet channel has nothing but static. I'm getting something on another frequency, but it's not Starfleet.", "Captain, I'm getting ground to air transmission.", 'Captain.', 'Frequency open, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Yes, sir. Captain, normal Starfleet channel has nothing but static. I'm getting something on another frequency, but it's not Starfleet. Captain, I'm getting ground to air transmission. Captain. Frequency open, sir.

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Dialogue: ["Yes, sir. Helm answering. She's sluggish, sir.", "Picking up, sir, but she's still slow in responding.", "Me, too. If this one's like those, it'll make the devil's noise if you start it.", "I didn't hear anything.", 'The emergency signal.', 'Five thirty in that time zone, maybe a little after.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Shall I issue phasers?', 'Yes, sir.', 'Mister Spock ran them through. They were the right ones. We got them all.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Warp factor three, sir.', "Sir, our speed is increasing. We're travelling at over warp eight.", "It's maximum now, sir. She's fighting it.", "Gaining speed now, Captain. We're now at warp four, warp seven. Eight. Off the dial, sir.", 'Past Pluto, sir.', 'Engines cutting back, sir. No decrease in speed.', 'The engines!']

We're travelling at over warp eight. It's maximum now, sir. She's fighting it. Gaining speed now, Captain. We're now at warp four, warp seven. Eight. Off the dial, sir. Past Pluto, sir. Engines cutting back, sir. No decrease in speed. The engines!

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Dialogue: ['Tractor beam on, sir. We have the target.', 'Engine room to Captain Kirk.', "Progress report, sir. Everything's jury-rigged, but we're coming along with the repairs. We could re-energise in about four hours, but", "Well sir, as I say, the engines are being repaired, but we've no place to go in this time. If you, if you see what I mean?", 'Sir?', 'Engine room to Mister Spock.', "We've completed re-energising the warp engines, sir. We can re-fire them anytime.", 'Aye, sir. Engine room out.', "Oh, we'll do that all right, Captain. We'll not be getting so close that my engines couldn't pull us out. What I am worried about, sir, that we may not have much control when we're thrown forward again.", "Braking control, sir. If I can't stop us soon enough, we may overshoot our time, and if I stop the engines suddenly the strain may tear us apart. Anyway we do it, it's a mighty rough ride.", 'Pulling away from the sun weakened them, sir. They may blow apart if I reverse.', 'Aye, sir.', "Engine room to Bridge. Engines are on full reverse. They're buckling! Bridge!"]

We could re-energise in about four hours, but Well sir, as I say, the engines are being repaired, but we've no place to go in this time. If you, if you see what I mean? Sir? Engine room to Mister Spock. We've completed re-energising the warp engines, sir. We can re-fire them anytime. Aye, sir. Engine room out. Oh, we'll do that all right, Captain. We'll not be getting so close that my engines couldn't pull us out. What I am worried about, sir, that we may not have much control when we're thrown forward again. Braking control, sir. If I can't stop us soon enough, we may overshoot our time, and if I stop the engines suddenly the strain may tear us apart. Anyway we do it, it's a mighty rough ride. Pulling away from the sun weakened them, sir. They may blow apart if I reverse. Aye, sir. Engine room to Bridge. Engines are on full reverse. They're buckling! Bridge!

Title: Tomorrow is Yesterday
Dialogue: ["Well, Jim, with the exception of a slight bruise or two, our Captain is as healthy as a proverbial horse. He'll be coming out of it in a minute or two.", "Jim, what if we can't go back? What do we do, sit up here and wait for our supplies to run out, our power to die? It has to eventually, you know. We certainly can't go back to Earth. It would be worse than the Captain being returned. There are four hundred and thirty of us, and that means four hundred and thirty chances of altering the future.", "I'm glad to hear it.", 'Maybe he could be retrained, reeducated.', "If you're going to get nasty, I'm going to leave.", "It's just a joke, Captain.", 'Oh? This could be an historic occasion.', 'You mean yet.', 'How long have they been down there now?', "Well, shouldn't they be coming up?", "Shouldn't you be working on your time warp calculations, Mister Spock?", "It's been too long. Jim should have at least signaled by now.", 'Only one signal. What happened?', "Blast your theories and observations, Mister Spock. What about Jim? He's down there alone, probably under arrest. He doesn't have a communicator, and we can't locate him or beam him back aboard without one.", 'If something went wrong']

Title: Court Martial
Dialogue: ['No. But the death of the crewman.', 'Kirk to Enterprise.', "Where's Mister Spock with that computer log extract?", 'Kirk out.', 'I agree. I waited until the last possible moment. We were on Red Alert. The storm got worse. I had to jettison the pod.', 'What took you so long, Mister Spock?', 'Jamie.', "That's not so. He was my friend.", 'You have my sworn deposition.', "Timothy, I haven't seen you since the Vulcanian expedition. Well, I see our graduating class from the Academy is well represented. Corrigan. Teller. How you doing, Mike?", 'Couple of days.', 'In a hurry to see me go?', 'You can talk plainer than that.', 'Go on. Finish. Ben was a friend of yours, and', "Go on. I'm waiting to hear the rest.", "What would be the point? You've already made up your minds. Excuse me, Bones.", 'Ready.', "Yes. He was an instructor at the Academy when I was a midshipman, but that didn't stand in the way of our beginning a close friendship. His daughter Jamie, who was here last night, was named after me.", "It's no secret. We were assigned to the same ship some years later. I relieved him on watch once and found a circuit open to the atomic matter piles that should've been closed. Another five minutes, it could have blown up the ship.", 'United Starship Republic, number 1371.', 'I closed the switch and logged the incident. He drew a reprimand and was sent to the bottom of the promotion list.', 'Yes. He had been at the Academy for an unusually long time as an instructor. As a result, he was late in being assigned to a starship. The delay, he felt, looked bad on his record. My action, he believed, made things worse.', 'Weather scan indicated an ion storm dead ahead. I sent Finney into the pod.', 'His name was at the top of the duty roster.', "He may have blamed me that he never rose to command a ship, but I don't assign jobs on the basis of who blames me. It was Finney's turn, and I assigned him. He had just checked in with me from the pod when we hit the leading edge of the storm. Not too bad at first. I signalled a Yellow Alert. Then we began encountering pressure, variant stress, force seven, the works. I finally signaled a Red Alert. Finney knew he had a matter of seconds. I gave him those seconds and more. But apparently it wasn't enough.", "I don't know. There's been a mistake.", 'Mister Spock is running a survey right now, but the odds are next to impossible.', 'Is that the way you see it?', 'A physical breakdown. Possibly even mental collapse.', "I'd be admitting a man died because", 'By what, Commodore Stone?', "That's as far as you go, sir. I'm telling you I was there on the Bridge. I know what happened. I know what I did.", "So that's the way we do it now? Sweep it under the rug, and me along with it? Not on your life. I intend to fight.", 'Draw it? I demand it. And right now, Commodore Stone. Right now.', 'Areel. Doctor McCoy said you were here. I should have felt it in the air, like static electricity.', "You look marvellous. You haven't changed a bit.", "Oh, you've heard about that, have you?", "I remember. Let's forget it. We have a lot of lost time to make up for.", 'The confidence of an innocent man.', "Look, Let's not talk shop.", 'I never could talk you into anything. All right. Fire away.', 'What other choice is there?', 'You, perhaps?', 'Well, a girl with your ability should be able to handle two cases at once.', "You still haven't made any recommendation.", "Areel, you still haven't told me how you know so much about what the prosecution's going to do.", 'Yes. What is all this?', "I hope I'm not crowding you.", 'Oh, I like them fine, but a computer takes less space.', 'Why not?', 'And what would be the point?', "You have to be either an obsessive crackpot who's escaped from his keeper or Samuel T. Cogley, attorney at law.", "I'm afraid so.", 'I have no objections, sir.', 'I do, sir.', 'Not guilty.', 'Yes, sir, there was.', "Firstly, I am at a loss to explain the errors in the extract from the computer log. We were in an ion storm. Everyone here in this court knows the dangers involved. I was in command. The decisions were mine, no one else's. Charges of malice have been raised. There was no malice. Lieutenant Commander Finney was a member of my crew, and that's exactly the way he was treated. It has been suggested that I panicked on the bridge and jettisoned the ion pod prematurely. That is not so. You've heard some of the details of my record. This was not my first crisis. It was one of many. During it, I did what my experience and training required me to do. I took the proper steps in the proper order. I did exactly what had to be done, exactly when it should have been done.", 'Given the same circumstances I would do the same thing without hesitation, because the steps I took in the order I took them were absolutely necessary if I were to save my ship. And nothing is more important than my ship.', "We'll need somebody in the pod for readings.", 'Post him.', 'Stand by on alert status, Mister Spock.', 'Warp factor one, Mister Hanson.', 'Tie in.', 'Make it fast, Ben. I may have to go to Red Alert.', 'Hold our course, Mister Hanson.', 'Engineering, then ion pod.', 'One third more thrust.', 'Stand by to get out of there, Ben.', 'Steady as she goes, Mister Hanson.', "But that's not the way it happened.", 'Are you suggesting that I did?', "Two days ago, I would've staked anything on my judgment.", 'I spent my whole life training for decisions just like that one. My whole life. Is it possible that when the moment came? No. I know what I did. You can pull out if you want to.', 'Kirk here.', "I'll tell you what you found. Nothing, right?", 'Not bitter enough to forget to thank you for your efforts.', "No. It's not all bad, Mister Spock. Who knows. You may be able to beat your next captain at chess. Kirk out.", "Jamie. This is Lieutenant Commander Finney's daughter.", "It's too late for that, Jamie, but I'm glad you don't blame me anymore for what happened.", "Don't say any more.", 'I know, and I thank you. I have to go and change. You ready?', 'I instituted a phase one search.', "It's a painstaking, thorough attempt in and around the ship to find a man who's presumably injured and unable to respond.", 'I beg your pardon?', 'Yes.', 'Possibly.', "Gentlemen, for the purposes of this experiment, it'll be necessary for all personnel, except for members of the court and the command crew, to leave the ship. I am ordering all others to report to the transporter room.", "Our impulse engines have been shut down. We'll maintain orbit by momentum.", 'We hope to be finished long before that.', 'Ready, Mister Spock?', 'Gentlemen, this computer has an auditory sensor. It can, in effect, hear sounds. By installing a booster, we can increase that capability on the order of one to the fourth power. The computer should bring us every sound occurring on the ship.', 'Doctor McCoy? All right, Mister Spock.', "Turn it down a little. Gentlemen, that sound is caused by the heartbeats of all the people on board the ship. Doctor McCoy will use this white sound device to mask out each person's heartbeat so that it will be eliminated from the sounds we are hearing.", "That's all of us, except for crewman in the transporter room. Mister Spock, eliminate his heartbeat. That accounts for everyone.", 'Seal off B deck, sections 18Y through 23D.', "It would seem so. Commodore, this is my problem. I'd appreciate it if no one left the bridge.", "Sam Cogley had gone a shore to bring Jamie Finney on board. We felt Jamie's presence would make Finney easier to handle in the event Finney really were alive.", 'Ben.', 'Ben Finney.', 'Ben, where are you?', "I'm glad you're alive.", "Ben! Ben, it's not too late. We can help you.", 'Put the phaser down, Ben.', 'What about my ship?', "Mister Spock, what's our orbit status?", 'Ben. Why kill innocent people?', 'I logged the mistake, Ben. Blame me, not them.', "It's not too late. You can be helped. But if you kill those people", 'Is Jamie included in that deal?', "She's on board by now. Yes. She's on board.", 'Beaten and sobbing, Finney told me where he had sabotaged the prime energy circuits.', "The damage he'd caused was considerable, but not irreparable. With luck, I would be able to effect repairs before our orbit decayed completely.", 'At the risk of sounding like a mystic, that depends on the stars.', "I didn't have much of a chance to thank him.", "I wouldn't be a bit surprised.", "Let's try. See? No change. Discipline goes on.", 'Goodbye, Areel. Better luck next time.', "She's a very good lawyer."]

I speak from pure logic. If I let go of a hammer on a planet that has a positive gravity, I need not see it fall to know that it has in fact fallen.', 'Gentlemen, human beings have characteristics just as inanimate objects do. Title: Court Martial
Dialogue: ["Come on, Jim. Let's go.", 'Jim.', 'If you have any doubt, that was indeed Captain James Kirk of the Enterprise.', 'In these trying times, one of the few. Doctor Leonard McCoy. Flattened Dialogue: Recording inquiry. Matter. Captain Kirk, James T. Subject. Circumstances of death, Lieutenant Commander Finney, Benjamin. Ship nomenclature. Specify. Noted. Charge, culpable negligence. Specification in that on Stardate 2945.7, by such negligence, Captain Kirk, James T., did cause loss of life, to wit, the life of Records Officer Lieutenant Commander Finney, Benjamin. To all recorded charges and specifications, what is the plea? Spock, serial number S179-276SP. Service rank, Lieutenant Commander. Position, First officer, science officer. Title: The Return of the Archons
Dialogue: ["O'Neil, we've got to keep going. Come on, get up.", "The Captain gave us an order. We've got to find some clue.", 'Scouting party to Enterprise.', 'Come in.', 'Captain, beam us up quick. Emergency.', "Mister O'Neil, stand tight. They'll beam us up any minute.", "O'Neil!", 'What? Who?', "You. You're not of the Body.", 'You, you did it. They knew we were Archons. These are the clothes they wear, not these.', 'Landru. Landru.', "They're wonderful. They're the sweetest, friendliest people in the universe. It's paradise, my friend. Paradise.", 'Paradise. Paradise.', 'Relieving you.']
Flattened Dialogue: O'Neil, we've got to keep going. Come on, get up. The Captain gave us an order. We've got to find some clue. Scouting party to Enterprise. Come in. Captain, beam us up quick. Emergency. Mister O'Neil, stand tight. They'll beam us up any minute. O'Neil! What? Who? You. You're not of the Body. You, you did it. They knew we were Archons. These are the clothes they wear, not these. Landru. Landru. They're wonderful. They're the sweetest, friendliest people in the universe. It's paradise, my friend. Paradise. Paradise. Paradise. Relieving you.

Title: The Return of the Archons
Dialogue: ['What is it, Mister Sulu?', "Transporter room, lock onto Sulu and O'Neil. Beam up immediately.", "Sulu, what is it? Where's Lieutenant O'Neil?", "Lieutenant O'Neil. Where is he?", 'Doctor McCoy.', 'Sulu, take it easy.', 'Sit down. What happened?', "Lieutenant O'Neil. Where is he?", 'Materialisation completed. Kirk out.', "Like Sulu. If everybody on this planet is like him. Let's go.", 'Joy to you.', 'Yes.', "This Festival, it starts at six o'clock?", "Let's get out of here.", "Yes, that's right. We're from the valley.", 'Yes.', 'We heard that you might have rooms for us.', 'We have no plans to attend the Festival, sir.', "I'd like to hear more about this Festival, and Landru.", 'What about Landru?', "Landru. My guess is we have until morning. Let's put the time to good use. Doctor, do atmospheric readings to determine whether there's anything in the air to account for all this. Mister Lindstrom, correlate all that you've seen with any other sociological parallels, if any.", 'Spock. Spock, Lindstrom. Doc.', "He'll give her a shot. It'll calm her down. Trust us.", 'What about Landru? Who is he?', 'No.', 'What if we are?', 'We can take care of ourselves.', 'What do you mean, absorbed?', "We're not going anywhere.", "I said we're not going anywhere.", "Everything we've seen here so far seems to indicate some sort of compulsive involuntary stimulus to action.", 'Why did you kill that man?', "You tell Landru that we'll come in our own time and that we'll speak to him.", 'Where to?', 'Quite a festival they had.', 'What do you make of all this?', "Now they're back to normal.", 'What is it?', 'Phasers on stun. Which way, Reger?', "We'll handle Landru, Just get us out of this.", "I don't want to hurt them. Warn them back.", 'Phasers on stun, wide field. Fire.', 'Fire.', 'Security.', "Lieutenant O'Neil. He's one of our men.", 'Bring him along.', "We still don't know what's happened to the Archons. Which way? Bring him along.", 'A lighting panel.', 'Before Landru? How long ago was that?', "But not inconsistent with what we've seen. Security.", 'Those staffs. Hollow tubes. Antennae for some sort of broadcast power. What is it, Mister Spock?', 'Absorbed?', 'What others?', 'Who?', 'Give him a shot. Keep him asleep. Reger, I want some answers. This underground. If Landru is so powerful, how do you survive?', 'The Archons. Tell me about them.', 'Pulled them down from the skies? A starship? Mister Spock, those power readings you took, are they?', 'Kirk to Enterprise, come in.', 'Status report.', 'Orbit condition.', "Keep your shield up. Do everything you can to maintain orbit. We'll try and locate the source of the beam and stop it here.", 'What is it?', 'But beautiful, Mister Spock, with no apparatus at this end.', 'You are holding my ship. I demand that you release it.', 'We mean you no harm. Ours is a mission of peace and good will.', 'Put that away. Landru, listen to me.', 'Mister Spock. Wake up. Mister Lesley.', "He was gone when I woke up, along with the other guard and Mister O'Neil.", 'Where is here?', "No. All our phasers are gone. I checked. That's locked.", "Enough analysis. Let's think of a way to get out of here. What about the Lawgivers' inability to cope with the unexpected?", "Are you suggesting the Lawgivers are mere computers, that they aren't human?", 'Doc. How?', 'Doc!', "Don't you know me?", 'Think, man. The Enterprise. The ship. Remember?', 'You do remember!', 'No.', "All right. Work on Bones. See if you can't", 'Joy to you, friend. Peace and contentment will fill you. You will know the peace of Landru.', 'Peace and tranquillity to you. Are you all right?', 'I understand. Landru.', 'And?', 'Joy be yours, and tranquillity, my friend.', 'The Body is one.', 'My friends. What is your theory, Mister Spock?', 'And when something unexplained happens, their routine is disrupted.', 'Landru.', "You're thinking the same thing I am. Mister Spock, the plug must be pulled.", 'Landru must die.', 'That refers to a living, growing culture. Do you think this one is?', 'What we need is more information about Landru. You said you wanted us to help you.', "Never mind what the prophecy says. If you want to be liberated from Landru, we'll need your help.", 'Peace', 'to you, friend. Joy and tranquillity.', "Doc, I don't want to hurt you.", 'Spock.', "Isn't that somewhat old-fashioned? Robes.", 'Where is Landru?', 'Where do we find him?', 'In this building?', "You're going to take us there. Spock, call the Enterprise.", 'Snap out of it! Start acting like men.', "Scotty, stand by. We're doing the best we can. How's Mister Sulu?", 'Put a guard on him.', "That's an order. Watch him. Captain out.", 'What happened to him?', "You said you wanted freedom. It's time you learned that freedom is never a gift. It has to be earned. Come on. We're going to find Landru.", "It's too late for that.", "All right, it's up to you. Take us to Landru.", 'Open it.', 'Open it.', "Landru! Landru. We are the Archons. We are the Archons. We've come to speak. We are the Archons. We want to talk to you.", 'We have no intention of causing harm.', 'We do not intend to die.', 'Listen to me.', "Yes, Mister Spock. Let's have a look at the projector.", 'Of course. It had to be. Landru.', 'But no soul.', 'Pull out its plug, Mister Spock.', 'Landru died six thousand years ago.', 'But not his wisdom. He may have programmed you, but he could not have given you a soul. You are a machine.', 'Yes. What is the good?', 'Landru is dead. You are a machine. A question has been put to you. Answer it.', 'Then I put it to you that you have disobeyed the Prime Directive. You are harmful to the Body.', 'The body is dying. You are destroying it.', 'What have you done to do justice to the full potential of every individual of the Body?', 'Without freedom of choice, there is no creativity. Without creativity, there is no life. The body dies. The fault is yours.', 'Landru, answer the question.', 'You must create the good. That is the will of Landru, nothing else.', 'Then the evil must be destroyed. That is the Prime Directive. And you are the evil.', 'You are the evil. The evil must be destroyed. Fulfill the Prime Directive.', 'You', 'are the evil. Fulfill the Prime Directive.', "Well, Marplon, you're on your own now. I hope you're up to it. And you can get rid of those robes. If I were you, I'd start look for another job. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in.", 'What about the ship?', "Excellent, Scotty. Stand by to beam up landing party. Let's go and see how the others are doing. Marplon can finish up here.", 'What?', "But only a machine, Mister Spock. The original Landru programmed it with all his knowledge but he couldn't give it his wisdom, his compassion, his understanding, his soul, Mister Spock.", "You'd make a splendid computer, Mister Spock.", 'Yes, Lindstrom.', "How's it going?", 'Sounds most promising. Good luck.', 'Yes. And we never got it. Just lucky, I guess.']

But not inconsistent with what we've seen. Security. Those staffs. Hollow tubes. Antennae for some sort of broadcast power. What is it, Mister Spock? Absorbed? What others? Who? Give him a shot. Keep him asleep. Reger, I want some answers. This underground. If Landru is so powerful, how do you survive? The Archons. Tell me about them. Pulled them down from the skies? A starship? We'll try and locate the source of the beam and stop it here. What is it? But beautiful, Mister Spock, with no apparatus at this end. You are holding my ship. I demand that you release it. Let's think of a way to get out of here. What about the Lawgivers' inability to cope with the unexpected? Are you suggesting the Lawgivers are mere computers, that they aren't human? Doc. How? Doc! Don't you know me? Think, man. The Enterprise. The ship. Remember? You do remember! No. All right. Work on Bones. See if you can't Joy to you, friend. Peace and contentment will fill you. You will know the peace of Landru. Peace and tranquillity to you. Are you all right? I understand. Landru. And? Joy be yours, and tranquillity, my friend. The Body is one. My friends. What is your theory, Mister Spock? And when something unexplained happens, their routine is disrupted. Landru. You're thinking the same thing I am. Mister Spock, the plug must be pulled.
