Title: The Return of the Archons
Dialogue: ['Doctor McCoy, transporter room. Quickly.', "Captain, we're under attack. There are heat beams of some kind coming up from the planet surface.", "Our shields are holding, but they're taking all our power.", "If we try to warp out or move on impulse, we'll lose our shields and burn up like a cinder.", "Checking. We're going down, Captain. Unless we can get those beams off us so we can use our engines, we're due to hit atmosphere in less than twelve hours.", "Impossible to break away. I've tried the emergency bypass circuits but they haven't been effective.", "Mister Spock, I've been trying to reach you.", "The orbit's still decaying. I give it six hours, more or less.", "Those heat beams are still on us. You've got to cut them off, Mister Spock, or we'll cook.", "He's peaceful enough, but he worries me.", 'On Sulu?', 'Captain, are you all right?', "The heat rays are gone, Captain, and Mister Sulu's back to normal."]
Flattened Dialogue: Doctor McCoy, transporter room. Quickly. Captain, we're under attack. There are heat beams of some kind coming up from the planet surface. Our shields are holding, but they're taking all our power. If we try to warp out or move on impulse, we'll lose our shields and burn up like a cinder. Checking. We're going down, Captain. Unless we can get those beams off us so we can use our engines, we're due to hit atmosphere in less than twelve hours. Impossible to break away. I've tried the emergency bypass circuits but they haven't been effective. Mister Spock, I've been trying to reach you. The orbit's still decaying. I give it six hours, more or less. Those heat beams are still on us. You've got to cut them off, Mister Spock, or we'll cook. He's peaceful enough, but he worries me. On Sulu? Captain, are you all right? The heat rays are gone, Captain, and Mister Sulu's back to normal.

Title: The Return of the Archons
Dialogue: ["Odd. The expression on that man's face. The mindlessness. Vacant contentment.", "Evidently they're not prepared to deal with out right disobedience. How did you know?", 'Your analysis seems logical.', 'Fascinating. This is merely a hollow tube, Captain. No mechanism.', 'Totally illogical. Yesterday, without apparent cause or reason, they wrought total havoc. Yet today, now', 'Telepathy, Captain.', 'Amazing in this culture.', 'It took a very advanced technology to construct a device like this. Inconsistent with this environment', 'Strong power generations, Captain. Near here, but radiating in all directions.', 'An underground? How are you organised?', 'Powerful enough to destroy a starship? Affirmative.', 'Captain.', "Sensor beams, very strong. We're being probed. In this direction.", 'Block them out.', "Too strong, Captain. Can't be blocked.", 'Projection, Captain. Unreal.', "He doesn't hear you, Captain.", "Where's Doctor McCoy?", "I should say they've been here and been removed.", 'Evidently a maximum security establishment. Are you armed?', 'The natural result of being subjected to a hypersonic.', 'Sound waves. Stronger, they might have killed us. As it was, they merely rendered us unconscious.', "We shouldn't depend on that happening again, Captain. In a society as well organised as this one seems to be, I cannot conceive of such an oversight going uncorrected. Interesting, however. Their reaction to your defiance was remarkably similar to the reaction of a computer when fed insufficient or contradictory data.", "Quite human, Captain. It's simply that all the facts are not yet in. There are gaps.", 'Like Sulu.', "You've been corrected, Captain. You'd better go.", 'Doctor McCoy, what will happen to him?', "Impossible. He's under extremely powerful control.", 'Little else we can do, unless you can think of a way to get through that door.', 'And apparently commanding powers far beyond our comprehension. Not simple, not ridiculous. Very, very dangerous.', 'What about the Captain?', 'We are not Archons, Marplon.', 'Where is Reger?', 'Who is Landru?', 'Joy be with you. Peace and contentment.', 'Captain.', 'Quite all right. Be careful of Doctor McCoy.', 'I am formulating a theory, Captain.', 'Not here. The doctor.', 'This is a soulless society, Captain. It has no spirit, no spark. All is indeed peace and tranquillity. The peace of the factory, the tranquillity of the machine. All parts working in unison.', 'Until new orders are received. The question is, who gives those orders?', 'There is no Landru, Captain, not in the human sense.', 'Sir?', 'Captain, our Prime Directive of non-interference.', 'Captain.', 'Spock to Enterprise. status report.', 'Report, Scott.', 'Captain.', 'Useless, Captain. A projection.', "A machine. This whole society is a machine's concept of perfection. Peace, harmony.", "The good of the Body, Captain. That's the key.", 'Are you aiding the body, or are you destroying it?', 'Not necessary, Captain. They have no guidance. Possibly for the first time in their lives.', 'Then the body dies. Creativity is necessary for the health of the Body.', "What's left of him, after he built and programmed this machine six thousand years ago.", 'Marvellous.', 'The late Landru, Captain. A marvellous feat of engineering. A computer capable of directing the lives of millions of human beings.', 'Predictably metaphysical. I prefer the concrete, the graspable, the provable.', 'That is very kind of you, Captain.', 'How often mankind has wished for a world as peaceful and secure as the one Landru provided.']

Your analysis seems logical. Fascinating. This is merely a hollow tube, Captain. No mechanism. Totally illogical. Yesterday, without apparent cause or reason, they wrought total havoc. Yet today, now Telepathy, Captain. Amazing in this culture. It took a very advanced technology to construct a device like this. Inconsistent with this environment Strong power generations, Captain. Near here, but radiating in all directions. An underground? How are you organised? Powerful enough to destroy a starship? Affirmative. Captain. Sensor beams, very strong. We're being probed. In this direction. Block them out. Too strong, Captain. Can't be blocked. Projection, Captain. Unreal. He doesn't hear you, Captain. Where's Doctor McCoy? Stronger, they might have killed us. As it was, they merely rendered us unconscious. We shouldn't depend on that happening again, Captain. In a society as well organised as this one seems to be, I cannot conceive of such an oversight going uncorrected. Interesting, however. Their reaction to your defiance was remarkably similar to the reaction of a computer when fed insufficient or contradictory data. Quite human, Captain. It's simply that all the facts are not yet in. There are gaps. Like Sulu. You've been corrected, Captain. You'd better go. Doctor McCoy, what will happen to him? Impossible. He's under extremely powerful control. Little else we can do, unless you can think of a way to get through that door. And apparently commanding powers far beyond our comprehension. Not simple, not ridiculous. Very, very dangerous. What about the Captain? We are not Archons, Marplon. Where is Reger? Who is Landru? Joy be with you. Peace and contentment. Captain. Quite all right. Be careful of Doctor McCoy. I am formulating a theory, Captain. Not here. The doctor. This is a soulless society, Captain. It has no spirit, no spark. All is indeed peace and tranquillity. The peace of the factory, the tranquillity of the machine. All parts working in unison. Until new orders are received. The question is, who gives those orders? There is no Landru, Captain, not in the human sense. Sir? Captain, our Prime Directive of non-interference. Captain. Spock to Enterprise. status report. Report, Scott. Captain. Useless, Captain. A projection. A machine. This whole society is a machine's concept of perfection. Peace, harmony. The good of the Body, Captain. That's the key. Are you aiding the body, or are you destroying it? Not necessary, Captain. They have no guidance. Possibly for the first time in their lives. Then the body dies. Creativity is necessary for the health of the Body. What's left of him, after he built and programmed this machine six thousand years ago. Marvellous. The late Landru, Captain. A marvellous feat of engineering. A computer capable of directing the lives of millions of human beings. Predictably metaphysical. I prefer the concrete, the graspable, the provable. That is very kind of you, Captain. How often mankind has wished for a world as peaceful and secure as the one Landru provided.

Title: The Return of the Archons
Dialogue: ['Excuse me.', "She's asleep.", 'Captain.', 'Put him over there.', "He'll be coming around soon, Captain.", "Give me a decision, Captain. He's coming out of it.", 'Hello, friend. We were told to wait here.', 'Can I help you, friend?', 'We all know one another and Landru.', 'You speak very strangely, friend. Are you from away?', 'Ask Landru. He remembers. He knows and he watches. You are strange. Are you not of the Body?', 'He goes to joy, peace, and tranquillity. He goes to meet Landru. Happiness is to all of us, blessed by Landru.', 'You speak in strange whispers. This is not the way of Landru.', 'And peace and harmony. Are you of the Body?', 'Blessed be the Body, and health to all of its parts.', 'Joy to you all, friends.', "You're not of the Body!", "You're not!", 'Lawgivers!', 'Lawgivers! Traitor! Traitors! Traitors!', 'Traitors!']
Flattened Dialogue: Excuse me. She's asleep. Captain. Put him over there. He'll be coming around soon, Captain. Give me a decision, Captain. He's coming out of it. Hello, friend. We were told to wait here. Can I help you, friend? We all know one another and Landru. You speak very strangely, friend. Are you from away? Ask Landru. He remembers. He knows and he watches. You are strange. Are you not of the Body? He goes to joy, peace, and tranquillity. He goes to meet Landru. Happiness is to all of us, blessed by Landru. You speak in strange whispers. This is not the way of Landru. And peace and harmony. Are you of the Body? Blessed be the Body, and health to all of its parts. Joy to you all, friends. You're not of the Body! You're not! Lawgivers! Lawgivers! Traitor! Traitors! Traitors! Traitors!

Title: The Return of the Archons

Title: Space Seed
Dialogue: ['Are you certain of your sensor readings?', 'Origin?', 'Thank you.', "We're reading it, Lieutenant. I thought you said it couldn't possibly be an Earth vessel.", 'An emotional Earth weakness of mine. There it is.', 'An old Earth vessel, similar to the DY=500 class.', "Then it's a derelict, its signal left on automatic.", 'Weapons status.', 'Bioscanners report.', 'All decks go to full alert.', 'Weapons department, maintain battle stations. All other decks standby alert.', 'Alien bodies, Bones?', 'Then you can check the registry.', 'All right, all right, gentlemen. As you were. Rig for tractor beam, Helm. Lock onto that vessel.', 'The Bridge is yours, Mister Spock. Care to join the landing party, Doctor?', "I'm not. Oh, I'll need somebody familiar with the late 20th-Century Earth. Here's a chance for that historian to do something for a change. What's her name? McIvers?", 'Very interesting. You ready, Bones?', "You're an old-fashioned boy, McCoy. Where's that historian? Come on, Lieutenant", 'Energise.', 'Suspended animation.', "Is it possible they're still alive after centuries of travel?", 'Scotty?', 'Could he be the leader? The leader. Lieutenant?', 'The others?', 'Circuit shorting.', 'Can we?', 'What happens if we get him out of there?', 'How long have you been sleeping? Two centuries we estimate. Landing party to Enterprise. Come in.', "Lock in on McCoy's beam. He's transporting back with a casualty we discovered here.", 'Kirk to boarding party.', 'Scotty, any records, log books of any kind?', 'How many alive?', 'Kirk out. Seventy two alive. A group of people dating back to the 1990s. A discovery of some importance, Mister Spock. There are a great many unanswered questions about those years.', "Botany Bay. That was the name of a penal colony on shores of Australia, wasn't it? If they took that name for their vessel", 'Oh?', "Yes. So much for my theory. I'm still waiting to hear yours.", 'And that irritates you, Mister Spock.', 'Yeah.', 'My apologies, Mister Spock. You suspect some danger in them?', "Well, we'd better get some facts. Rig for towing.", 'Make course for Starbase Twelve.', 'Bones?', 'My compliments.', "An improved breed of human. That's what the Eugenics War was all about.", "I'd like to talk to you.", 'If I were to rate your performance as a member of the landing party today I', 'Lieutenant, at any one time, the safety of this entire vessel might depend upon the performance of a single crewman, and the fact that you find a man strangely compelling to you personally', 'And men were more adventuresome then. Bolder, more colourful.', "Good. If I can have honesty, it's easier to overlook mistakes. That's all.", 'Fair?', 'Bridge.', 'On my way.', 'James Kirk, commanding the starship Enterprise.', 'And your name?', 'Our heading is Starbase Twelve, a planet in the Gamma 400 star system. Our command base in this sector. Is that of any use to you?', 'Seventy two of your life-support canisters are still functioning.', 'As soon as we reach Starbase Twelve.', 'And now', 'Khan. Nothing else?', 'What was the exact date of your lift off? We know it was sometime in the early 1990s, but', 'The facts I need, Mister Khan, will take very little time. For example, the nature of your expedition.', 'Yes, I understand. You have two hundred years of catching up to do.', "They're available to any patient on the viewing screen. Doctor McCoy will show you how to tie into the library tapes.", 'This Khan is not what I expected of a twentieth century man.', "Common courtesy, Mister Spock. He'll spend the rest of his days in our time. It's only decent to help him catch up. Would you estimate him to be a product of selective breeding?", 'Well, they were hardly supermen. They were aggressive, arrogant. They began to battle among themselves.', 'Interesting, if true. They created a group of Alexanders, Napoleons.', "That fact isn't in the history texts.", "Lieutenant McGivers' idea to welcome Khan to our century. Just how strongly is she attracted to him?", "My curiosity's official, not personal, Bones.", 'Forgive my curiosity, Mister Khan, but my officers are anxious to know more about your extraordinary journey.', 'You have a tendency to express ideas in military terms, Mister Khan. This is a social occasion.', 'You fled. Why? Were you afraid?', 'But you left at the very time mankind needed courage.', 'We?', 'Name, Khan, as we know him today. Name, Khan Noonien Singh.', 'He was the best of the tyrants and the most dangerous. They were supermen, in a sense. Stronger, braver, certainly more ambitious, more daring.', 'Mister Spock, we humans have a streak of barbarism in us. Appalling, but there, nevertheless.', 'Mister Spock, you misunderstand us. We can be against him and admire him all at the same time.', "Totally. This is the Captain. Put a twenty four hour security on Mister Khan's quarters, effective immediately.", 'Unusual treatment for Khan Noonien Singh.', "I'd like those answers now. First, the purpose of your star flight.", "Why? Because I'm not a product of controlled genetics?", "Thank you. They've all been answered.", 'Maintain. Bridge.', 'Sound security alert.', 'Atmospheric controls cut off.', 'Engineering. Scotty. This is the Bridge.', "What's going on down there?", 'Flood all decks with neural gas.', 'Contact Starbase Twelve.', 'Negative.', "I'm a little pleased myself. Situation?", "Our only chance is the intruder control circuit. Although he's cut it off at the Bridge.", 'Gas all decks but this one.', "Where's Khan?", 'Kirk here.', 'This hearing is now in session. Under the authority vested in me by Starfleet Command, I declare all charges and specifications in this matter have been dropped.', 'Mister Spock, our heading takes us near the Ceti Alpha star system.', "But no more than Australia's Botany Bay colony was at the beginning. Those men went on to tame a continent, Mister Khan. Can you tame a world?", 'Yes. I understand. Lieutenant Marla McGivers. Given a choice of court martial or accompanying them there.', 'This hearing is closed.', "The statement Lucifer made when he fell into the pit. 'It is better to rule in hell than serve in heaven.'", 'Yes, Mister Spock, it would indeed.']

Bolder, more colourful. Good. If I can have honesty, it's easier to overlook mistakes. That's all. Fair? Bridge. On my way. James Kirk, commanding the starship Enterprise. And your name? As soon as we reach Starbase Twelve. And now Khan. Nothing else? What was the exact date of your lift off? You have two hundred years of catching up to do. They're available to any patient on the viewing screen. Doctor McCoy will show you how to tie into the library tapes. This Khan is not what I expected of a twentieth century man. Common courtesy, Mister Spock. He'll spend the rest of his days in our time. It's only decent to help him catch up. Would you estimate him to be a product of selective breeding? Well, they were hardly supermen. They were aggressive, arrogant. They began to battle among themselves. Interesting, if true. They created a group of Alexanders, Napoleons. That fact isn't in the history texts. Lieutenant McGivers' idea to welcome Khan to our century. Just how strongly is she attracted to him? My curiosity's official, not personal, Bones. Forgive my curiosity, Mister Khan, but my officers are anxious to know more about your extraordinary journey. You have a tendency to express ideas in military terms, Mister Khan. This is a social occasion. You fled. Why? Were you afraid? But you left at the very time mankind needed courage. We? Name, Khan, as we know him today. Name, Khan Noonien Singh. He was the best of the tyrants and the most dangerous. They were supermen, in a sense. Stronger, braver, certainly more ambitious, more daring. Mister Spock, we humans have a streak of barbarism in us. Appalling, but there, nevertheless. Mister Spock, you misunderstand us. We can be against him and admire him all at the same time. Totally. This is the Captain. Put a twenty four hour security on Mister Khan's quarters, effective immediately. Unusual treatment for Khan Noonien Singh. I'd like those answers now. First, the purpose of your star flight. Why? Because I'm not a product of controlled genetics? Thank you. They've all been answered. Maintain. Bridge. Sound security alert. Atmospheric controls cut off. Engineering. Scotty. This is the Bridge. What's going on down there? Flood all decks with neural gas. Where's Khan? Kirk here. This hearing is now in session. Under the authority vested in me by Starfleet Command, I declare all charges and specifications in this matter have been dropped. Can you tame a world? Yes. I understand. Lieutenant Marla McGivers. Given a choice of court martial or accompanying them there. This hearing is closed. The statement Lucifer made when he fell into the pit. 'It is better to rule in hell than serve in heaven.' Yes, Mister Spock, it would indeed.

Title: Space Seed
Dialogue: ['Definitely a space vessel of some type.', 'Unknown. It could hardly be an Earth ship. There have been no flights into this sector for years.', 'I fail to understand why it always gives you pleasure to see me proven wrong.', 'Much older. DY-100 class, to be exact. Captain, the last such vessel was built centuries ago, back in the 1990s.', 'Or an old Earth ship being used by aliens.', 'Sensor reading, Captain. Some sort of equipment functioning on that vessel.', 'Hull surface is pitted with meteor scars. However, scanners make out a name. SS Botany Bay.', 'No such vessel listed. Records of that period are fragmentary, however. The mid=1990s was the era of your last so-called World War.', 'Of course. Your attempt to improve the race through selective breeding.', 'Lieutenant McGivers.', 'Attention. The following personnel report to transporter room. Engineering Officer Scott, Lieutenant McGivers. Acknowledge.', 'A strange, violent period in your history. I find no record what so ever of an SS Botany Bay. Captain, the DY-100 class vessel was designed for interplanetary travel only. With simple nuclear-powered engines, star travel was considered impractical at that time. It was ten thousand to one against their making it to another star system. And why no record of the trip?', "If you're suggesting this was a penal deportation vessel, you've arrived at a totally illogical conclusion.", 'Your Earth was on the verge of a dark ages. Whole populations were being bombed out of existence. A group of criminals could have been dealt with far more efficiently than wasting one of their most advanced spaceships.', 'Even a theory requires some facts, Captain. So far I have none.', 'Irritation?', 'I am not capable of that emotion.', 'Insufficient facts always invites danger, Captain.', 'Aye, sir.', "I note he's making considerable use of our technical library.", 'There is that possibility, Captain. His age would be correct. In 1993, a group of these young supermen did seize power simultaneously in over forty nations.', 'Because the scientists overlooked one fact. Superior ability breeds superior ambition.', 'I have collected some names and made some counts. By my estimate, there were some eighty or ninety of these young supermen unaccounted for when they were finally defeated.', 'Would you reveal to war-weary populations that some eighty Napoleons might still be alive?', 'And how you managed to keep it out of the history books.', 'There was the war to end tyranny. Many considered that a noble effort.', 'Unify, sir? Like a team of animals under one whip?', 'Under dozens of petty dictatorships.', 'Then your sympathies were with', 'From 1992 through 1996, absolute ruler of more than a quarter of your world. From Asia through the Middle East.', 'Gentlemen, this romanticism about a ruthless dictator is', 'And as little freedom.', 'Gentlemen.', 'Illogical.', 'Turbo elevators inoperative. Jammed, Captain.', "Useless. They're on override in Engineering.", 'Impossible. Intruder control systems inoperative. Mister Khan was very thorough in his study of our tech manuals.', 'Brilliant. Every contingency anticipated.', 'Surprised to see you, Captain, though pleased.', 'Khan is holding our staff in the briefing room. His men have control of the ship.', "There's a relay junction down the corridor.", 'Anesthesia gas in all sections except Engineering. Someone just closed that line.', 'Captain, acknowledge. Unable to flood Engineering section. I suspect', "Negative. We must retake the vessel while the anesthesia lasts. Meet me in the Armoury. I'm blowing it clear first. Spock out.", 'Quite correct, Captain. Planet number five there is habitable, although a bit savage, somewhat inhospitable.', 'It would be interesting, Captain, to return to that world in a hundred years and to learn what crop has sprung from the seed you planted today.']
Flattened Dialogue: Definitely a space vessel of some type. Unknown. It could hardly be an Earth ship. There have been no flights into this sector for years. I fail to understand why it always gives you pleasure to see me proven wrong. Much older. DY-100 class, to be exact. Captain, the last such vessel was built centuries ago, back in the 1990s. Or an old Earth ship being used by aliens. Sensor reading, Captain. Some sort of equipment functioning on that vessel. Hull surface is pitted with meteor scars. However, scanners make out a name. SS Botany Bay. No such vessel listed. Records of that period are fragmentary, however. The mid=1990s was the era of your last so-called World War. Of course. Your attempt to improve the race through selective breeding. Lieutenant McGivers. Attention. The following personnel report to transporter room. Engineering Officer Scott, Lieutenant McGivers. Acknowledge. A strange, violent period in your history. I find no record what so ever of an SS Botany Bay. Captain, the DY-100 class vessel was designed for interplanetary travel only. With simple nuclear-powered engines, star travel was considered impractical at that time. It was ten thousand to one against their making it to another star system. And why no record of the trip? If you're suggesting this was a penal deportation vessel, you've arrived at a totally illogical conclusion. Your Earth was on the verge of a dark ages. Whole populations were being bombed out of existence. A group of criminals could have been dealt with far more efficiently than wasting one of their most advanced spaceships. Even a theory requires some facts, Captain. So far I have none. Irritation? I am not capable of that emotion. Insufficient facts always invites danger, Captain. Aye, sir. I note he's making considerable use of our technical library. There is that possibility, Captain. His age would be correct. In 1993, a group of these young supermen did seize power simultaneously in over forty nations. Because the scientists overlooked one fact. Superior ability breeds superior ambition. I have collected some names and made some counts. By my estimate, there were some eighty or ninety of these young supermen unaccounted for when they were finally defeated. Would you reveal to war-weary populations that some eighty Napoleons might still be alive? And how you managed to keep it out of the history books. There was the war to end tyranny. Many considered that a noble effort. Unify, sir? Like a team of animals under one whip? Under dozens of petty dictatorships. Then your sympathies were with From 1992 through 1996, absolute ruler of more than a quarter of your world. From Asia through the Middle East. Gentlemen, this romanticism about a ruthless dictator is And as little freedom. Gentlemen. Illogical. Turbo elevators inoperative. Jammed, Captain. Useless. They're on override in Engineering. Impossible. Intruder control systems inoperative. Mister Khan was very thorough in his study of our tech manuals. Brilliant. Every contingency anticipated. Surprised to see you, Captain, though pleased. Khan is holding our staff in the briefing room. His men have control of the ship. There's a relay junction down the corridor. Anesthesia gas in all sections except Engineering. Someone just closed that line. Captain, acknowledge. Unable to flood Engineering section. I suspect Negative. We must retake the vessel while the anesthesia lasts. Meet me in the Armoury. I'm blowing it clear first. Spock out. Quite correct, Captain. Planet number five there is habitable, although a bit savage, somewhat inhospitable. It would be interesting, Captain, to return to that world in a hundred years and to learn what crop has sprung from the seed you planted today.

Title: Space Seed
Dialogue: ["I'm picking up a signal, sir. Captain, that's the old Morse code call signal.", 'All decks acknowledging, sir.', 'Go ahead, boarding party. We read you.', 'Security alert, Captain. Communication channels are down, Captain.', 'All channels are totally jammed, Captain.', 'Record tapes engaged and ready, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: I'm picking up a signal, sir. Captain, that's the old Morse code call signal. All decks acknowledging, sir. Go ahead, boarding party. We read you. Security alert, Captain. Communication channels are down, Captain. All channels are totally jammed, Captain. Record tapes engaged and ready, Captain.

Title: Space Seed
Dialogue: ["Life science bioscanners are picking up heart beats from over there. Can't be human, though. They're too faint, and average only four beats per minute.", "We're continuing to pick up some form of heart action over there. Very faint, very slow. Seems to be coming from about sixty or seventy bodies, as near as I can tell.", "Could be. There's no sign of breathing or other form of respiration.", 'The Eugenics Wars.', "Now, wait a minute. Not our attempt, Mister Spock. A group of ambitious scientists. I'm sure you know the type. Devoted to logic, completely unemotional", "Well, if you're actually giving me a choice", 'No. I signed aboard this ship to practice medicine, not to have my atoms scattered back and forth across space by this gadget.', "It's theoretically possible. I've never heard of it being tested for this long a period.", 'Jim, I have a new reading. The lights must have triggered some mechanism.', "We've triggered something, all right. His heart beat's increasing. Now passing eight beats per minute. There are some signs of respiration beginning.", 'Heart beat now approaching forty per minute. The respiration pattern is firming up.', 'Heart beat now fifty two and increasing.', 'Maybe. Heart beat dropping.', "Heartbeat now thirty, dropping fast. It's a heart flutter. He's dying.", "He'll die in seconds if we don't.", "That'll be all.", "He'll live.", "No, I'm good, but not that good. There's something inside this man that refuses to accept death. Look at that. Even as he is now, his heart valve action has twice the power of yours and mine. Lung efficiency is fifty percent better.", "I'd estimate he could lift us both with one arm. It will be interesting to see if his brain matches his body.", 'It appears he will, Lieutenant.', "A pity you wasted your life on command, Jim. You'd have made a fair psychologist.", 'Sickbay to lab. Anything new on those bios?', 'Good. McCoy out.', 'Well, either choke me or cut my throat. Make up your mind.', "You're in You're in bed, holding a knife at your doctor's throat.", 'It would be most effective if you would cut the carotid artery, just under the left ear.', "I was simply trying to avoid an argument. You're aboard the United Spaceship Enterprise. Your vessel is in tow.", 'That is correct.', 'I have a patient here with many questions, Captain.', 'Jim. A little later might be better.', 'Very impressive. Are we expecting a fleet admiral for dinner?', "Well, there aren't any regulations against romance, Jim.", 'Well, he has a magnetism. Almost electric. You felt it. And it could over power McGivers with her preoccupation with the past.', 'The last of the tyrants to be overthrown.', 'No wars until he was attacked.', "To be conquered by you. A starship would make that most simple, wouldn't it?", 'Jim. Agreed you have the authority']
Flattened Dialogue: Life science bioscanners are picking up heart beats from over there. Can't be human, though. They're too faint, and average only four beats per minute. We're continuing to pick up some form of heart action over there. Very faint, very slow. Seems to be coming from about sixty or seventy bodies, as near as I can tell. Could be. There's no sign of breathing or other form of respiration. The Eugenics Wars. Now, wait a minute. Not our attempt, Mister Spock. A group of ambitious scientists. I'm sure you know the type. Devoted to logic, completely unemotional Well, if you're actually giving me a choice No. I signed aboard this ship to practice medicine, not to have my atoms scattered back and forth across space by this gadget. It's theoretically possible. I've never heard of it being tested for this long a period. Jim, I have a new reading. The lights must have triggered some mechanism. We've triggered something, all right. His heart beat's increasing. Now passing eight beats per minute. There are some signs of respiration beginning. Heart beat now approaching forty per minute. The respiration pattern is firming up. Heart beat now fifty two and increasing. Maybe. Heart beat dropping. Heartbeat now thirty, dropping fast. It's a heart flutter. He's dying. He'll die in seconds if we don't. That'll be all. He'll live. No, I'm good, but not that good. There's something inside this man that refuses to accept death. Look at that. Even as he is now, his heart valve action has twice the power of yours and mine. Lung efficiency is fifty percent better. I'd estimate he could lift us both with one arm. It will be interesting to see if his brain matches his body. It appears he will, Lieutenant. A pity you wasted your life on command, Jim. You'd have made a fair psychologist. Sickbay to lab. Anything new on those bios? Good. McCoy out. Well, either choke me or cut my throat. Make up your mind. You're in You're in bed, holding a knife at your doctor's throat. It would be most effective if you would cut the carotid artery, just under the left ear. I was simply trying to avoid an argument. You're aboard the United Spaceship Enterprise. Your vessel is in tow. That is correct. I have a patient here with many questions, Captain. Jim. A little later might be better. Very impressive. Are we expecting a fleet admiral for dinner? Well, there aren't any regulations against romance, Jim. Well, he has a magnetism. Almost electric. You felt it. And it could over power McGivers with her preoccupation with the past. The last of the tyrants to be overthrown. No wars until he was attacked. To be conquered by you. A starship would make that most simple, wouldn't it? Jim. Agreed you have the authority

Title: Space Seed
Dialogue: ['Well, it looks like that ship was expecting us. We read heat coming on, complete oxygen atmosphere.', "Definitely Earth-type mechanism, sir. Twentieth century vessel. Old type atomic power. Bulky, solid. I think they used to call them transistor units. I'd love to tear this baby apart.", "Beats me what's happening.", 'This one was probably programmed to be triggered first.', "There's no change, and they're mixed types. Western, mid-European, Latin, Oriental.", 'Probably some dust.', "It'd take an hour to figure it out.", 'Scott here.', 'Negative, Captain. It appears they were in suspended animation when the ship took off.', 'Twelve units have malfunctioned, leaving seventy two still operating. Thirty of those are women.', "I must confess, gentlemen. I've always held a sneaking admiration for this one.", 'There were no massacres under his rule.', 'Captain!', 'Where is Captain Kirk?', "I don't know. He got out just as the gas", "This is Scott. Captain's headed for the Engineering section. I'll follow in case", "It's a shame for a good Scotsman to admit it, but I'm not up on Milton."]
Flattened Dialogue: Well, it looks like that ship was expecting us. We read heat coming on, complete oxygen atmosphere. Definitely Earth-type mechanism, sir. Twentieth century vessel. Old type atomic power. Bulky, solid. I think they used to call them transistor units. I'd love to tear this baby apart. Beats me what's happening. This one was probably programmed to be triggered first. There's no change, and they're mixed types. Western, mid-European, Latin, Oriental. Probably some dust. It'd take an hour to figure it out. Scott here. Negative, Captain. It appears they were in suspended animation when the ship took off. Twelve units have malfunctioned, leaving seventy two still operating. Thirty of those are women. I must confess, gentlemen. I've always held a sneaking admiration for this one. There were no massacres under his rule. Captain! Where is Captain Kirk? I don't know. He got out just as the gas This is Scott. Captain's headed for the Engineering section. I'll follow in case It's a shame for a good Scotsman to admit it, but I'm not up on Milton.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['Nothing yet, Lieutenant?', "Nothing yet, Ambassador. We're awaiting a reply. Today's the first time we've had any evidence they've picked up our signal.", 'Are you sure?', 'Code seven-ten means under no circumstances are we to approach that planet. No circumstances what so ever.', 'Mister Fox, it is their planet.', 'By disregarding code seven-ten, you might well involve us in an interplanetary war.', "You are. I'm thinking about this ship, my crew.", "Yes, Mister Spock. This is the Captain. Condition Yellow Alert. Phaser crews stand by. Deflector shields up. We're going in. Peacefully, I hope. But peacefully or not, we're going in.", 'Anything else?', "Not alone. I'm taking some security people with me.", "I can't risk beaming you down there until I know what kind of reception you're going to receive. Your safety is my responsibility. Those are my orders, sir. Mister Spock.", 'What co-ordinates?', 'Final sensor readings?', "Ship's defences?", "Good. Landing party will pick up phaser number one's from the arsenal. Keep them inconspicuous. Mister Scott.", 'The ship is yours. Take care of her until I come back.', "We'll do our best. Let's go.", "I'm Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the United Federation of Planets.", 'Yes?', 'I had orders to come here. Why did your people tell us to stay away?', 'I see no danger here.', "I'm Captain Kirk. This is my first officer, Mister Spock, Lieutenants Galloway, Osborne, Yeoman Tamula.", 'My mission is to establish diplomatic relations between your people and mine.', 'Would you mind telling me why?', "You're still at war?", 'You conceal it very well. Mister Spock?', 'To say the least.', "Don't you take shelter?", 'What is it?', 'Do you hear any explosions, Mister Spock?', 'Mea, if this is an attack, may I ask what weapons the enemy is using?', 'Kirk to Bridge. Scotty?', "Scanners operative on the planet's surface?", 'Anything unusual?', 'Thank you. Kirk out.', "Sir, I have been in contact with my ship, which has had this entire planet under surveillance. All during this so-called attack of yours, we have been monitoring you. There's been no attack, no explosions, no radiations, no disturbances whatsoever. If this is some sort of game you're playing", "Computer don't kill a half million people.", 'To report?', "You mean to tell me your people just walk into a disintegration machine when they're told to?", 'What has happened?', 'We require a great deal. I wish to speak to Anan Seven.', "He'll have more casualty lists than he knows what to do with if he doesn't get in here and talk to me.", "Your duty doesn't include stepping into a disintegrator and disappearing.", 'Is that all it means to you? To report and die?', 'Then how can you stand', "No, I don't see that at all.", 'Yes. Anan Seven.', 'Good news, Mister Scott. The Eminians have agreed to the establishment of full normal diplomatic relations.', "They've also extended an invitation to all personnel to come ashore, for shore leave. They've assured me that our people will have a wonderful time.", 'Are you sure you can do it, Mister Spock?', 'Do your best.', 'Thank you, Mister Spock.', "We get our communicators back and try and contact the ship. Mister Spock, we'll need more weapons.", "We'll try to take it easy, but if we're forced to kill", 'A disintegration machine.', "Mea. What do you think you're doing?", "You're not going in there.", "No you're not.", "Mister Spock, that guard. I'll cover you.", 'All right, you people, clear out of the way.', 'Throwing a monkey wrench into the machinery.', "I've done it. Come on, let's get out of here.", "The last place they'll look for us is the place we escaped from. Cover the door.", 'Are you that anxious to die?', 'Mister Spock, how did that little raid work out?', 'Will it reach the ship?', "Work on it. We've got to contact the ship. Mea, I want you to give me a complete layout of this building complex. How do I get to the War Room?", "Now listen to me. I'm trying to help you. To save your life and the lives of millions like you. If you help me, maybe I can do it. If you don't, you'll die, we'll die, and the killing will go on. Or are you that fond of the war?", "We're going to try and stop the killing. We're trying to help. Believe me.", 'Tell me what I want to know. Please.', "I didn't come to drink.", "A very efficient weapon. I'm not afraid of using it.", 'I am?', "We're less cold-blooded about it than you are.", 'I want to contact my ship. Where are my communicators?', 'You take a lot of chances, Councilman.', "If I were you, I'd think about saving my life.", "I'm not interested in discussing our differences. You don't seem to realise the risk you're taking. We don't make war with computers and herd the casualties into suicide stations. We make the real thing, Councilman. I could destroy this planet.", "I don't need the ship for that.", "That's exactly what I mean.", "You seem to think I'm joking. Where are the communicators?", 'Something like that.', 'My people are not responsible for your agreements.', 'That seems to frighten you.', "Yes. You're quite right.", "I'm a barbarian. You said it yourself.", 'Oh, no. You were quite accurate. I plan to prove it to you.', 'Scotty, General Order Twenty Four. Two hours! In two hours!', "All that it means is that I won't be around for the destruction. You heard me give General Order Twenty Four. That means in two hours the Enterprise will destroy Eminiar Seven.", "I didn't start it, Councilman, but I'm liable to finish it.", "You're wrong. It hasn't begun.", 'You have less than two hours, Councilman.', "Stop it? I'm counting on it.", 'Hold it! Over there. You, over there. Move, move, move.', "Now we'll talk.", 'No. I need the help. In there, Mister Spock.', 'Kirk to Enterprise. Come in, Scotty.', "Everything's secure here. Maintain position. If everything goes according to plan, you can beam us up in ten minutes. If you don't hear from us, carry out General Order Twenty Four on schedule.", "Cross your fingers. Kirk out. Death, destruction, disease, horror. That's what war is all about, Anan. That's what makes it a thing to be avoided. You've made it neat and painless. So neat and painless, you've had no reason to stop it. And you've had it for five hundred years. Since it seems to be the only way I can save my crew and my ship, I'm going to end it for you, one way or another. Mister Ambassador.", 'Would you mind taking these people out into the corridor and holding them there.', 'You. Come with me. Mister Osborne.', 'Our communicators, weapons.', 'All right, Mister Spock.', 'Yes, go on.', 'Good. Get him out of here.', "Let's go.", 'Against the wall!', "Yes, I do. I've given you back the horrors of war. The Vendikans now assume that you've broken your agreement and that you're preparing to wage real war with real weapons. They'll want do the same. Only the next attack they launch will do a lot more than count up numbers in a computer. They'll destroy cities, devastate your planet. You of course will want to retaliate. If I were you, I'd start making bombs. Yes, Councilman, you have a real war on your hands. You can either wage it with real weapons, or you might consider an alternative. Put an end to it. Make peace.", "All right. It's instinctive. But the instinct can be fought. We're human beings with the blood of a million savage years on our hands, but we can stop it. We can admit that we're killers, but we're not going to kill today. That's all it takes. Knowing that we won't kill today. Contact Vendikar. I think you'll find that they're just as terrified, appalled, horrified as you are, that they'll do anything to avoid the alternative I've given you. Peace or utter destruction. It's up to you.", 'Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty?', "Cancel implementation of General Order Twenty Four. Alert transporter room. We're ready to beam up.", 'Lay in a course for Argona Two, Navigator. Mister Scott.', 'Good.', "Did I, Mister Spock? They've been killing three million people a year. It had been going on for five hundred years. An actual attack wouldn't have killed any more people than one of their computer attacks, but it would have ended their ability to make war. The fighting would have been over permanently.", 'No. It was a calculated risk. Still, the Eminians keep a very orderly society, and actual war is a very messy business. A very, very messy business. I had a feeling that they would do anything to avoid it, even talk peace.', 'Sometimes a feeling, Mister Spock, is all we humans have to go on.', 'Why, Mister Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles.']
Flattened Dialogue: Nothing yet, Lieutenant? Nothing yet, Ambassador. We're awaiting a reply. Today's the first time we've had any evidence they've picked up our signal. Are you sure? Code seven-ten means under no circumstances are we to approach that planet. No circumstances what so ever. Mister Fox, it is their planet. By disregarding code seven-ten, you might well involve us in an interplanetary war. You are. I'm thinking about this ship, my crew. Yes, Mister Spock. This is the Captain. Condition Yellow Alert. Phaser crews stand by. Deflector shields up. We're going in. Peacefully, I hope. But peacefully or not, we're going in. Anything else? Not alone. I'm taking some security people with me. I can't risk beaming you down there until I know what kind of reception you're going to receive. Your safety is my responsibility. Those are my orders, sir. Mister Spock. What co-ordinates? Final sensor readings? Ship's defences? Good. Landing party will pick up phaser number one's from the arsenal. Keep them inconspicuous. Mister Scott. The ship is yours. Take care of her until I come back. We'll do our best. Let's go. I'm Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the United Federation of Planets. Yes? I had orders to come here. Why did your people tell us to stay away? I see no danger here. I'm Captain Kirk. This is my first officer, Mister Spock, Lieutenants Galloway, Osborne, Yeoman Tamula. My mission is to establish diplomatic relations between your people and mine. Would you mind telling me why? You're still at war? You conceal it very well. Mister Spock? To say the least. Don't you take shelter? What is it? Do you hear any explosions, Mister Spock? Mea, if this is an attack, may I ask what weapons the enemy is using? Kirk to Bridge. Scotty? Scanners operative on the planet's surface? Anything unusual? Thank you. Kirk out. Sir, I have been in contact with my ship, which has had this entire planet under surveillance. All during this so-called attack of yours, we have been monitoring you. There's been no attack, no explosions, no radiations, no disturbances whatsoever. If this is some sort of game you're playing Computer don't kill a half million people. To report? You mean to tell me your people just walk into a disintegration machine when they're told to? What has happened? We require a great deal. I wish to speak to Anan Seven. He'll have more casualty lists than he knows what to do with if he doesn't get in here and talk to me. Your duty doesn't include stepping into a disintegrator and disappearing. Is that all it means to you? To report and die? Then how can you stand No, I don't see that at all. Yes. Anan Seven. Good news, Mister Scott. The Eminians have agreed to the establishment of full normal diplomatic relations. They've also extended an invitation to all personnel to come ashore, for shore leave. They've assured me that our people will have a wonderful time. Are you sure you can do it, Mister Spock? Do your best. Thank you, Mister Spock. We get our communicators back and try and contact the ship. Mister Spock, we'll need more weapons. We'll try to take it easy, but if we're forced to kill A disintegration machine. Mea. What do you think you're doing? You're not going in there. No you're not. Mister Spock, that guard. I'll cover you. All right, you people, clear out of the way. Throwing a monkey wrench into the machinery. I've done it. Come on, let's get out of here. The last place they'll look for us is the place we escaped from. Cover the door. Are you that anxious to die? Mister Spock, how did that little raid work out? Will it reach the ship? Work on it. We've got to contact the ship. Mea, I want you to give me a complete layout of this building complex. How do I get to the War Room? Now listen to me. I'm trying to help you. To save your life and the lives of millions like you. If you help me, maybe I can do it. If you don't, you'll die, we'll die, and the killing will go on. Or are you that fond of the war? We're going to try and stop the killing. We're trying to help. Believe me. Tell me what I want to know. Please. I didn't come to drink. A very efficient weapon. I'm not afraid of using it. I am? We're less cold-blooded about it than you are. I want to contact my ship. Where are my communicators? You take a lot of chances, Councilman. If I were you, I'd think about saving my life. I'm not interested in discussing our differences. You don't seem to realise the risk you're taking. We don't make war with computers and herd the casualties into suicide stations. We make the real thing, Councilman. I could destroy this planet. I don't need the ship for that. That's exactly what I mean. You seem to think I'm joking. Where are the communicators? Something like that. My people are not responsible for your agreements. That seems to frighten you. Yes. You're quite right. I'm a barbarian. You said it yourself. Oh, no. You were quite accurate. I plan to prove it to you. Scotty, General Order Twenty Four. Two hours! In two hours! All that it means is that I won't be around for the destruction. You heard me give General Order Twenty Four. That means in two hours the Enterprise will destroy Eminiar Seven. I didn't start it, Councilman, but I'm liable to finish it. You're wrong. It hasn't begun. You have less than two hours, Councilman. Stop it? I'm counting on it. Hold it! Over there. You, over there. Move, move, move. Now we'll talk. No. I need the help. In there, Mister Spock. Kirk to Enterprise. Come in, Scotty. Everything's secure here. Maintain position. If everything goes according to plan, you can beam us up in ten minutes. If you don't hear from us, carry out General Order Twenty Four on schedule. Cross your fingers. Kirk out. Death, destruction, disease, horror. That's what war is all about, Anan. That's what makes it a thing to be avoided. You've made it neat and painless. So neat and painless, you've had no reason to stop it. And you've had it for five hundred years. Since it seems to be the only way I can save my crew and my ship, I'm going to end it for you, one way or another. Mister Ambassador. Would you mind taking these people out into the corridor and holding them there. You. Come with me. Mister Osborne. Our communicators, weapons. All right, Mister Spock. Yes, go on. Good. Get him out of here. Let's go. Against the wall! Yes, I do. I've given you back the horrors of war. The Vendikans now assume that you've broken your agreement and that you're preparing to wage real war with real weapons. They'll want do the same. Only the next attack they launch will do a lot more than count up numbers in a computer. They'll destroy cities, devastate your planet. You of course will want to retaliate. If I were you, I'd start making bombs. Yes, Councilman, you have a real war on your hands. You can either wage it with real weapons, or you might consider an alternative. Put an end to it. Make peace. All right. It's instinctive. But the instinct can be fought. We're human beings with the blood of a million savage years on our hands, but we can stop it. We can admit that we're killers, but we're not going to kill today. That's all it takes. Knowing that we won't kill today. Contact Vendikar. I think you'll find that they're just as terrified, appalled, horrified as you are, that they'll do anything to avoid the alternative I've given you. Peace or utter destruction. It's up to you. Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty? Cancel implementation of General Order Twenty Four. Alert transporter room. We're ready to beam up. Lay in a course for Argona Two, Navigator. Mister Scott. Good. Did I, Mister Spock? They've been killing three million people a year. It had been going on for five hundred years. An actual attack wouldn't have killed any more people than one of their computer attacks, but it would have ended their ability to make war. The fighting would have been over permanently. No. It was a calculated risk. Still, the Eminians keep a very orderly society, and actual war is a very messy business. A very, very messy business. I had a feeling that they would do anything to avoid it, even talk peace. Sometimes a feeling, Mister Spock, is all we humans have to go on. Why, Mister Spock, you almost make me believe in miracles.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['Nothing, Captain. Hailing frequencies are open.', "Captain, message coming in from Eminiar Seven. Sir, it's code seven-ten.", 'Positive. It repeats over and over.', 'Mister Scott, message coming in from the Captain.', 'A channel is open, Mister Ambassador. You will be speaking to Anan Seven, head of the High Council of the Eminian Union.', "Mister Scott, it's Mister Spock.", 'Message from Eminiar Seven, Captain. Ambassador Fox reports negotiations underway with Vendikar. Outlook hopeful.']
Flattened Dialogue: Nothing, Captain. Hailing frequencies are open. Captain, message coming in from Eminiar Seven. Sir, it's code seven-ten. Positive. It repeats over and over. Mister Scott, message coming in from the Captain. A channel is open, Mister Ambassador. You will be speaking to Anan Seven, head of the High Council of the Eminian Union. Mister Scott, it's Mister Spock. Message from Eminiar Seven, Captain. Ambassador Fox reports negotiations underway with Vendikar. Outlook hopeful.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['In view of code seven-ten, Captain, may I suggest', "We know very little about them. Their civilisation is advanced. They've had space flight for several centuries, but they've never ventured beyond their own solar system. When first contacted more than fifty years ago, Eminiar Seven was at war with its nearest neighbour.", 'The Earth expedition making the report failed to return from its mission. The USS Valiant. Listed as missing in space.', 'Transporter room standing by, Captain.', "We've selected a site which from the traffic seems to be near an official establishment.", "No hostility directed toward us. No apparent notice taken of us at all, which seems strange. They did scan us when we assumed orbit. Obviously, they know we're here.", 'Screens down, but all defensive details on general alert status, Captain.', 'Sir, we have completely scanned your planet. We find it highly advanced, prosperous in a material sense, comfortable for your people, and peaceful in the extreme. Yet you say you are at war. There is no evidence of this.', 'With whom are you at war?', 'Strange.', 'Are these attacks frequent?', 'None, Captain. Yeoman Tamula.', 'Tricorder readings. Radiation. Disturbances of any kind.', 'Computers, Captain. They fight their war with computers. Totally.', 'Then the attack by Vendikar was theoretical.', 'There is a certain scientific logic about it.', 'I do not approve. I understand.', 'Limited telepathic abilities are inherent in Vulcanians, Captain. It may work. It may not.', 'My pleasure, Captain.', 'I understand.', 'An entrance, Captain, but no exit. They go in, but they do not come out.', 'So I would assume.', "Sir, there's a multi-legged creature crawling on your shoulder.", 'We captured four of their disrupter-type weapons, two complete outfits of male clothing, and perhaps most important of all, one of their communication devices.', 'Not at this time. Its range is restricted in comparison with ours. I may be able to alter its components, but it will take time.', 'Spock to Enterprise, come in.', 'Is the ship all right?', "The Captain is overdue. We've suffered no casualties among us. This is important. Under no circumstances shall any one beam down from the Enterprise. They'd be killed the moment they arrived.", 'The Ambassador?', 'Orbit out to maximum phaser range and stand by for further orders. Spock out.', 'Find the Ambassador and the Captain. Yeoman Tamula, you stay here and prevent this young lady from immolating herself. Knock her down if necessary. This is a killing situation. Do what you must to protect yourself. Clear?', 'Please, Mister Fox. Ladies and gentlemen, please move quickly away from the chamber or you may be injured.', 'Practicing a peculiar variety of diplomacy, sir.', "I'll take you to a place of comparative safety, then I must find the Captain.", "By now, Mister Ambassador, I'm sure you realise that normal diplomatic procedures are ineffective here.", 'Very well, sir. We need all the help we can get.', "I had assumed you needed help. I see I'm in error.", "These are the attack computers, Captain. That one's defence, that one computes the casualties. They're all tied in with a subspace transmission unit, which keeps them in constant contact with their Vendikan counterparts.", 'At the moment contact is broken, it abrogates the agreement between the two warring parties.', "This one's the key. The circuit is now locked. Destroy this one, and they'll all go.", "There's a chance it may work, Captain.", 'Captain, you took a big chance.', 'A feeling is not much to go on.', 'Captain, you almost make me believe in luck.']
Flattened Dialogue: In view of code seven-ten, Captain, may I suggest We know very little about them. Their civilisation is advanced. They've had space flight for several centuries, but they've never ventured beyond their own solar system. When first contacted more than fifty years ago, Eminiar Seven was at war with its nearest neighbour. The Earth expedition making the report failed to return from its mission. The USS Valiant. Listed as missing in space. Transporter room standing by, Captain. We've selected a site which from the traffic seems to be near an official establishment. No hostility directed toward us. No apparent notice taken of us at all, which seems strange. They did scan us when we assumed orbit. Obviously, they know we're here. Screens down, but all defensive details on general alert status, Captain. Sir, we have completely scanned your planet. We find it highly advanced, prosperous in a material sense, comfortable for your people, and peaceful in the extreme. Yet you say you are at war. There is no evidence of this. With whom are you at war? Strange. Are these attacks frequent? None, Captain. Yeoman Tamula. Tricorder readings. Radiation. Disturbances of any kind. Computers, Captain. They fight their war with computers. Totally. Then the attack by Vendikar was theoretical. There is a certain scientific logic about it. I do not approve. I understand. Limited telepathic abilities are inherent in Vulcanians, Captain. It may work. It may not. My pleasure, Captain. I understand. An entrance, Captain, but no exit. They go in, but they do not come out. So I would assume. Sir, there's a multi-legged creature crawling on your shoulder. We captured four of their disrupter-type weapons, two complete outfits of male clothing, and perhaps most important of all, one of their communication devices. Not at this time. Its range is restricted in comparison with ours. I may be able to alter its components, but it will take time. Spock to Enterprise, come in. Is the ship all right? The Captain is overdue. We've suffered no casualties among us. This is important. Under no circumstances shall any one beam down from the Enterprise. They'd be killed the moment they arrived. The Ambassador? Orbit out to maximum phaser range and stand by for further orders. Spock out. Find the Ambassador and the Captain. Yeoman Tamula, you stay here and prevent this young lady from immolating herself. Knock her down if necessary. This is a killing situation. Do what you must to protect yourself. Clear? Please, Mister Fox. Ladies and gentlemen, please move quickly away from the chamber or you may be injured. Practicing a peculiar variety of diplomacy, sir. I'll take you to a place of comparative safety, then I must find the Captain. By now, Mister Ambassador, I'm sure you realise that normal diplomatic procedures are ineffective here. Very well, sir. We need all the help we can get. I had assumed you needed help. I see I'm in error. These are the attack computers, Captain. That one's defence, that one computes the casualties. They're all tied in with a subspace transmission unit, which keeps them in constant contact with their Vendikan counterparts. At the moment contact is broken, it abrogates the agreement between the two warring parties. This one's the key. The circuit is now locked. Destroy this one, and they'll all go. There's a chance it may work, Captain. Captain, you took a big chance. A feeling is not much to go on. Captain, you almost make me believe in luck.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['Yes, sir.', 'Aye, aye, sir. And have a bonny trip.', 'Scott here, Captain.', 'Of course, sir. As per orders.', 'Nothing, sir. All quiet.', "Aye, Doctor, that we should, but we haven't, and we cannot raise them. You know, if there'd been trouble, they should have at least managed to get word back to us.", 'What would you suggest?', 'Would you have me open fire?', 'Scott here, Captain.', "Mister Fox'll be glad to hear about that.", 'Er, Captain?', 'All personnel?', "Aye, aye, Captain. We'll start forming shore parties immediately. Scott out. Well now, what do you think of that?", 'Well, I do. Computer, last message received and recorded from Captain Kirk.', "Run it through analyser. Question. Is it or is it not the Captain's voice?", 'A voice duplicator?', "Well, they've got them, Doctor, and now they're trying to get us.", 'Yes, Mister DePaul?', "Well, now. They're taking pot shots at us. Holding, Mister DePaul?", 'Aye, but what about our Captain and the landing party down there somewhere?', "If they're alive, and if we can find them. That's a big planet.", "We can't fire full phasers with our screens up, and We can't lower our screens with their disruptors on us. Of course I could treat them to a few dozen photon torpedoes.", "Mister Fox, we're under attack. They're trying to knock us down.", 'Of course, but', "I'm responsible for the safety of this ship.", "But they're the ones who're looking for a fight, Mister Fox.", 'Diplomats. The best diplomat I know is a fully activated phaser bank.', 'Maintain status, Mister DePaul.', 'No, sir, I will not.', "I'll not lower the screens, not until the Captain tells me to.", 'I know about your authority, but the screens stay up.', "No, sir. I won't lower the screens.", "That you can, sir, but I won't lower the screens.", "Aye. The haggis is in the fire for sure, but I'll not lower my defences on the word of that mealy-mouthed gentleman down below. Not until I know what happened to the Captain.", 'Scotty here, Mister Spock. Go ahead.', "We've been through a bit, but we're all right now. How about the Captain and you?", 'That ties it. That popinjay Fox went down a couple minutes ago.', 'I knew it had a rotten ring to it.', 'This is the USS Enterprise.', 'Open a channel, Lieutenant. This is the commander of the USS Enterprise.', 'All cities and installations on Eminiar Seven have been located, identified, and fed into our fire-control system. In one hour and forty five minutes', 'The entire inhabited surface of your planet will be destroyed.', 'You have that long to surrender your hostages.', 'Aye, Captain, are you all right?', 'Aye, aye, Captain. Is there anything else we can do?', 'Scott here, Captain.', 'Space details set, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Yes, sir. Aye, aye, sir. And have a bonny trip. Scott here, Captain. Of course, sir. As per orders. Nothing, sir. All quiet. Aye, Doctor, that we should, but we haven't, and we cannot raise them. You know, if there'd been trouble, they should have at least managed to get word back to us. What would you suggest? Would you have me open fire? Scott here, Captain. Mister Fox'll be glad to hear about that. Er, Captain? All personnel? Aye, aye, Captain. We'll start forming shore parties immediately. Scott out. Well now, what do you think of that? Well, I do. Computer, last message received and recorded from Captain Kirk. Run it through analyser. Question. Is it or is it not the Captain's voice? A voice duplicator? Well, they've got them, Doctor, and now they're trying to get us. Yes, Mister DePaul? Well, now. They're taking pot shots at us. Holding, Mister DePaul? Aye, but what about our Captain and the landing party down there somewhere? If they're alive, and if we can find them. That's a big planet. We can't fire full phasers with our screens up, and We can't lower our screens with their disruptors on us. Of course I could treat them to a few dozen photon torpedoes. Mister Fox, we're under attack. They're trying to knock us down. Of course, but I'm responsible for the safety of this ship. But they're the ones who're looking for a fight, Mister Fox. Diplomats. The best diplomat I know is a fully activated phaser bank. Maintain status, Mister DePaul. No, sir, I will not. I'll not lower the screens, not until the Captain tells me to. I know about your authority, but the screens stay up. No, sir. I won't lower the screens. That you can, sir, but I won't lower the screens. Aye. The haggis is in the fire for sure, but I'll not lower my defences on the word of that mealy-mouthed gentleman down below. Not until I know what happened to the Captain. Scotty here, Mister Spock. Go ahead. We've been through a bit, but we're all right now. How about the Captain and you? That ties it. That popinjay Fox went down a couple minutes ago. I knew it had a rotten ring to it. This is the USS Enterprise. Open a channel, Lieutenant. This is the commander of the USS Enterprise. All cities and installations on Eminiar Seven have been located, identified, and fed into our fire-control system. In one hour and forty five minutes The entire inhabited surface of your planet will be destroyed. You have that long to surrender your hostages. Aye, Captain, are you all right? Aye, aye, Captain. Is there anything else we can do? Scott here, Captain. Space details set, Captain.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['I tell you, we should have heard something by now.', "We can't just sit here.", "Me? I'm a doctor. If I were an officer of the line, I'd", 'Of course not.', "I don't know.", "Well, I guess that answers our questions, Mister Scott. They're not very friendly, are they?", 'We get them out.', 'Not too big for the Enterprise to handle if it has to.', "They're holding our Captain.", "Mister Fox, they faked a message from the Captain, they've launched an attack against our ship. Now you want us to trust them openly?", "Well, Scotty, now you've done it.", "But you didn't know that it would work."]
Flattened Dialogue: I tell you, we should have heard something by now. We can't just sit here. Me? I'm a doctor. If I were an officer of the line, I'd Of course not. I don't know. Well, I guess that answers our questions, Mister Scott. They're not very friendly, are they? We get them out. Not too big for the Enterprise to handle if it has to. They're holding our Captain. Mister Fox, they faked a message from the Captain, they've launched an attack against our ship. Now you want us to trust them openly? Well, Scotty, now you've done it. But you didn't know that it would work.

Title: A Taste of Armageddon
Dialogue: ['In place.', 'Negative. A close copy.', 'Ninety eight percent probability.']
Flattened Dialogue: In place. Negative. A close copy. Ninety eight percent probability.

Title: This Side of Paradise
Dialogue: ['Standard orbit, Mister Painter.', 'Yes, Lieutenant.', "Maintain transmission pattern until we've established orbit.", 'Mister Spock, there were one hundred and fifty men, women, and children in that colony. What are the chances of survivors?', 'Are you saying that those people built a future in a place knowing they might not survive?', "And what about us? Can we afford to send people to the planet's surface?", "Thank you, Mister Painter. Mister Spock, equip a landing party of five to accompany me to the planet's surface. Include Doctor McCoy and a biologist. I'll want them in ten minutes.", "Another dream that failed. There's nothing sadder. It took these people a year to make the trip from Earth. They came all that way and died.", "Actually, Mister Sandoval, we didn't come here because of your silent radio.", "But these people shouldn't be alive.", "Gentlemen, we're debating in a vacuum. Let's go get some answers.", 'What was the reason for the dispersal?', 'Mister Sandoval, we do have a mission here. Examinations, tests.', "We'll try not to interfere with your work.", 'Anything?', 'Kirk here.', 'Sulu had the same observation. Any explanations?', 'Very well. Continue investigations. Kirk out.', 'Yes, especially in view of the fact that the records for this expedition indicate that they did have some for breeding and food purposes. Apparently, none of them survived.', 'Yes, I thought you might.', 'He promised to throw away his shingle.', 'Go ahead, Lieutenant.', 'Make your point.', "It's like a jigsaw puzzle all one colour. No key to where the pieces fit in. Why?", 'Kirk here.', 'Trouble?', 'On my way.', "What's so strange about that?", 'Instrument malfunction?', "Mister Sandoval, within the hour I've received orders from Starfleet Command to evacuate all personnel from this colony. Naturally, you'll inform your people to begin preparations. We will have accommodations for you aboard the Enterprise.", "It's not an arbitrary decision on my part. I have my orders.", 'What about your animals?', "That doesn't answer my question, sir. Why did all your animals die?", 'Sandoval.', "You're being unreasonable.", "Excuse me. My orders are to remove all the colonists. That's exactly what I intend to do, with or without your help.", "No, I think we'll use a", 'We have orders to evacuate all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven.', "No, he didn't. Spock? See to the landing parties, would you, Mister Sulu.", 'Spock?', 'Spock!', 'Spock, is that you?', 'Where are you?', "Spock, I don't know what you think you're doing, but this is an order. Report back to me at the settlement in ten minutes. We're evacuating all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven.", "You don't think so, what?", 'Spock, report to me immediately.', 'Spock? Acknowledge.', "Spock. The frequency is open, but he doesn't answer.", 'No. I thought you said you might like him if he mellowed a little.', 'You said that.', 'Yes, take over the landing party detail and start getting those colonists aboard.', "The frequency is open. It'll act as a homing device. Contact DeSalle. Have him meet you here. Make sure the landing party work in teams of two. I don't want anybody left alone down here.", 'Spock. Mister Spock.', 'Mister Spock. Are you out of your mind? You were told to report to me at once.', "You? Yes, I can see that. Miss Kalomi, you'll have to come back to the settlement and prepare to transport up to the ship.", "Mister Sulu, Mister Spock is under arrest, and he's in your custody until we get back to the Enterprise.", "What's?", "I don't know what these plants are or how they work, but you're all going back to the settlement with me, and those colonists are going aboard the ship.", 'How many of those did you beam up?', 'This is the Captain. Beam me up.', 'I most certainly do. Energise.', 'Lieutenant, put me through to Admiral Komack at Starfleet.', "What do you mean, you can't do that. Follow standard procedure. That's an order.", 'Out?', 'Get back to your stations. Get back to your stations.', 'I said get back to your station.', 'This is mutiny, mister.', "I've heard that word a lot lately. Perfect. Everything's perfect.", "I'll bet you've even grown your tonsils back.", 'Look, Bones, I need your help. Can you run tests, blood samples, anything at all to give us a lead on what these things are, how to counteract them?', 'Bones. Bones.', "Where's McCoy?", 'In your own private paradise.', 'Where did they originate?', "That's paradise?", "No wants. No needs. We weren't meant for that. None of us. Man stagnates if he has no ambition, no desire to be more than he is.", 'Except a challenge.', "I'm going back to the ship.", 'Engineering? Scotty? Biochemistry lab? Security? Is there anyone on board? This is the Captain.', "Captain's log, stardate 3417.7. Except for myself, all crew personnel have transported to the surface of the planet. Mutinied. Lieutenant Uhura has effectively sabotaged the communications station. I can only contact the surface of the planet. The ship can be maintained in orbit for several months, but even with automatic controls, I cannot pilot her alone. In effect, I am marooned here. I'm beginning to realise just how big this ship really is, how quiet. I don't know how to get my crew back, how to counteract the effect of the spores. I don't know what I can offer against paradise.", 'Enterprise to Mister Spock.', "I've joined you. I understand now.", 'There are some things in my quarters I want to pack.', 'Kirk out.', "No. No! I can't leave! Emotions. Violent emotions. Needs. Anger. Captain's log, supplemental. I think I've discovered the answer, but to carry out my plan entails considerable risk. Mister Spock is much stronger than the ordinary human being. Aroused, his great physical strength could kill. But it's a risk I'll have to take.", 'Enterprise to Mister Spock.', "It's Jim.", "I've been packing some things, and I realise there's some equipment here that we should have down at the settlement.", "You know we can't come back on board once the last of us has left.", "No, I think you and I can handle it. Why don't you beam up now?", 'Energising.', "All right, you mutinous, disloyal, computerised, half-breed, we'll see about you deserting my ship.", "What makes you think you're a man? You're an overgrown jackrabbit, an elf with a hyperactive thyroid.", "Of course you don't understand. You don't have the brains to understand. All you have is printed circuits.", 'What can you expect from a simpering, devil-eared freak whose father was a computer and his mother an encyclopedia?', 'Your father was a computer, like his son. An ambassador from a planet of traitors. A Vulcan never lived who had an ounce of integrity.', "You're a traitor from a race of traitors. Disloyal to the core, rotten like the rest of your subhuman race, and you've got the gall to make love to that girl.", "Does she know what she's getting, Spock? A carcass full of memory banks who should be squatting in a mushroom, instead of passing himself off as a man? You belong in a circus, Spock, not a starship. Right next to the dog-faced boy.", "Had enough? I didn't realise what it took to get under that thick hide of yours. Anyhow, I don't know what you're so mad about. It isn't every first officer who gets to belt his Captain several times.", 'Believe me, Mister Spock, it was painful in more ways than one.', "You said they were benevolent and peaceful. Violent emotions overwhelm them, destroy them. I had to make you angry enough to shake off their influence. That's the answer, Mister Spock.", 'I had something else in mind. Can you put together a subsonic transmitter. Something we can hook into the communications station and broadcast over the communicator?', "Good. Let's get to work.", "Well, if we're both in the Brig, who's going to build the subsonic transmitter?", "Mister Spock, Miss Kalomi is strictly your concern, but should you talk to her while she's still under the influence of the spores?", 'The Captain discovered that strong emotions and needs destroy the spore influence.', 'As though somebody had put itching powder on their skin.', 'Put him on the speaker. Kirk here.', "Start making preparations, Mister Sandoval. We'll begin transporting your people aboard as soon as more of our crew checks in.", 'Good.', "No, no, Bones. This time we walked out on our own. Maybe we weren't meant for paradise. Maybe we were meant to fight our way through. Struggle, claw our way up, scratch for every inch of the way. Maybe we can't stroll to the music of the lute. We must march to the sound of drums.", "We haven't heard much from you about Omicron Ceti Three, Mister Spock."]
Flattened Dialogue: Standard orbit, Mister Painter. Yes, Lieutenant. Maintain transmission pattern until we've established orbit. Mister Spock, there were one hundred and fifty men, women, and children in that colony. What are the chances of survivors? Are you saying that those people built a future in a place knowing they might not survive? And what about us? Can we afford to send people to the planet's surface? Thank you, Mister Painter. Mister Spock, equip a landing party of five to accompany me to the planet's surface. Include Doctor McCoy and a biologist. I'll want them in ten minutes. Another dream that failed. There's nothing sadder. It took these people a year to make the trip from Earth. They came all that way and died. Actually, Mister Sandoval, we didn't come here because of your silent radio. But these people shouldn't be alive. Gentlemen, we're debating in a vacuum. Let's go get some answers. What was the reason for the dispersal? Mister Sandoval, we do have a mission here. Examinations, tests. We'll try not to interfere with your work. Anything? Kirk here. Sulu had the same observation. Any explanations? Very well. Continue investigations. Kirk out. Yes, especially in view of the fact that the records for this expedition indicate that they did have some for breeding and food purposes. Apparently, none of them survived. Yes, I thought you might. He promised to throw away his shingle. Go ahead, Lieutenant. Make your point. It's like a jigsaw puzzle all one colour. No key to where the pieces fit in. Why? Kirk here. Trouble? On my way. What's so strange about that? Instrument malfunction? Mister Sandoval, within the hour I've received orders from Starfleet Command to evacuate all personnel from this colony. Naturally, you'll inform your people to begin preparations. We will have accommodations for you aboard the Enterprise. It's not an arbitrary decision on my part. I have my orders. What about your animals? That doesn't answer my question, sir. Why did all your animals die? Sandoval. You're being unreasonable. Excuse me. My orders are to remove all the colonists. That's exactly what I intend to do, with or without your help. No, I think we'll use a We have orders to evacuate all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven. No, he didn't. Spock? See to the landing parties, would you, Mister Sulu. Spock? Spock! Spock, is that you? Where are you? Spock, I don't know what you think you're doing, but this is an order. Report back to me at the settlement in ten minutes. We're evacuating all colonists to Starbase Twenty Seven. You don't think so, what? Spock, report to me immediately. Spock? Acknowledge. Spock. The frequency is open, but he doesn't answer. No. I thought you said you might like him if he mellowed a little. You said that. Yes, take over the landing party detail and start getting those colonists aboard. The frequency is open. It'll act as a homing device. Contact DeSalle. Have him meet you here. Make sure the landing party work in teams of two. I don't want anybody left alone down here. Spock. Mister Spock. Mister Spock. Are you out of your mind? You were told to report to me at once. You? Yes, I can see that. Miss Kalomi, you'll have to come back to the settlement and prepare to transport up to the ship. Mister Sulu, Mister Spock is under arrest, and he's in your custody until we get back to the Enterprise. What's? I don't know what these plants are or how they work, but you're all going back to the settlement with me, and those colonists are going aboard the ship. How many of those did you beam up? This is the Captain. Beam me up. I most certainly do. Energise. Lieutenant, put me through to Admiral Komack at Starfleet. What do you mean, you can't do that. Follow standard procedure. That's an order. Out? Get back to your stations. Get back to your stations. I said get back to your station. This is mutiny, mister. I've heard that word a lot lately. Perfect. Everything's perfect.
