If we can provoke him so that he strikes one of us again, there's a chance that he'll be drained enough so the rest of us can jump him. Not all of us, Bones. When he comes back, it's a chance we'll have to take. You know nothing about our kind. You know only our remote ancestors who trembled before your tricks. Your tricks don't frighten us, neither do you. We've come a long way in five thousand years. Mankind has no need for gods. We find the one quite adequate. We're busy. Look after the girl. Go! Gather laurel leaves? You must be joking! Lieutenant, get back. We're tired of your phony fireworks! Lieutenant! Lieutenant! Lieutenant. And you will supply the herds of sheep, and the pipes we'll play, and the simple skins we'll wear for clothes. We were doing something until our brave lady stepped in and saved us. Yes, I have. One more. And it depends on the lieutenant's loyalty. If she fails us, we'd better get used to herding goats. Kirk to Enterprise, come in. Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Enterprise, come in. Kirk to Scotty, I'll find out. How old are you? Then I'd better handle it. You all right? Come over there. Well? All right, Lieutenant, you can come down from Mount Olympus now. You've got work to do. He thrives on love, worship, attention. We can't give him that worship, none of us can. Especially you. Spurn him. Reject him. You must. You're special to him. Lieutenant. All our lives, here and on the ship, depend on you. On you, Lieutenant! Reject him, and we have a chance to save ourselves. Accept him, and you condemn all of us to slavery, nothing less than slavery. We might never get help this far out. Or perhaps the thought of spending an eternity bending knee and tending sheep appeals to you. Give me your hand. Your hand. Now feel that. Human flesh against human flesh. We're the same. We share the same history, the same heritage, the same lives. We're tied together beyond any untying. Man or woman, it makes no difference. We're human. We couldn't escape from each other even if we wanted to. That's how you do it, Lieutenant. By remembering who and what you are. A bit of flesh and blood afloat in a universe without end. The only thing that's truly yours is the rest of humanity. That's where our duty lies. Do you understand me? Lieutenant. You have your orders and your duty. Kirk here. There is indeed, Mister Spock. Very good. How are you doing on the force field? Well, that ought to do it. Have Sulu lock all phaser banks onto the structure. Fire on my order only. Cut it fine. We'll be standing nearby. I'd love to oblige you, Mister Spock, but we're not all together. Besides, we have Apollo to deal with. If that structure is the source of his power, I want to know where he is when we attack it. Kirk out. Bones, do you think that mysterious organ in Apollo's chest could have something to do with the transmission of energy? Yes, I know. I know. Scotty. We'll wait. Kirk here. Stand by your phasers, Mister Spock. Prepare to fire on my signal. Kirk out. We've got to be here when he comes back. Scotty, just hold on! All right. The temple is his power source. Let's bring him back to it. Get to cover. Mister Spock, fire those phasers. Fire those phasers! That's an order, Mister Spock! Scotty! We've out grown you. You asked for something we could no longer give. So do I. They gave us so much. The Greek civilisation, much of our culture and philosophy came from a worship of those beings. In a way, they began the Golden Age. Would it have hurt us, I wonder, just to have gathered a few laurel leaves?

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ['Lieutenant, you look a bit tired this morning.', "Even from here I can tell his pulse rate's up.", "I'm not sure I like that, Jim.", "And he thinks he's the right man for her, but I'm not sure she thinks he's the right man. On the other hand, she's a woman. All woman. One day she'll find the right man and off she'll go, out of the service.", 'What in the name of?', 'Sickbay reports five minor injuries, all being treated.', "Sure it's wise, Jim?", "Well, you're the A and A officer, aren't you? Archaeology, anthropology, ancient civilisations.", "We're going to need help in all those areas.", 'Simple humanoid, Captain.', 'To coin a phrase, fascinating.', "I can't say much till I check our these readings. He looks human, but of course that doesn't mean a thing.", 'Yes?', 'You have a theory?', 'What?', 'May I ask what you offer in exchange for this worship?', "Stunned but coming around. I'm not sure it's wise to let her go off like that.", 'You saw how capricious he is. Benevolent one minute, angry the next. One more wrong move from her and he could kill her.', "Scotty doesn't believe in gods.", 'Yes. To the simple shepherds and tribesmen of early Greece, creatures like that would have been gods.', 'Not the whole encyclopaedia, Chekov.', "Spock's contaminating this boy, Jim.", 'Number one on our list of things to do.', "Yes, except my estimation for his physical condition. In spite of Apollo's bag of tricks, he comes up essentially normal with just a few variations. However, there's an extra organ in his chest that I can't even make a guess about.", 'Jim.', 'Not good. Severe shock.', 'Chekov, give me a hand.', 'How do you feel?', 'Some neural damage.', 'Makes sense.', 'The trouble with overworking him is that it can get us killed.', 'I still say it can get us killed.', "Kill a deer. That's the funniest thing I ever heard.", 'Any more good ideas, Jim?', "Well, it doesn't serve any other purpose I know of.", 'What the devil is that?', "I wish we hadn't had to do this."]
Flattened Dialogue: Lieutenant, you look a bit tired this morning. Even from here I can tell his pulse rate's up. I'm not sure I like that, Jim. And he thinks he's the right man for her, but I'm not sure she thinks he's the right man. On the other hand, she's a woman. All woman. One day she'll find the right man and off she'll go, out of the service. What in the name of? Sickbay reports five minor injuries, all being treated. Sure it's wise, Jim? Well, you're the A and A officer, aren't you? Archaeology, anthropology, ancient civilisations. We're going to need help in all those areas. Simple humanoid, Captain. To coin a phrase, fascinating. I can't say much till I check our these readings. He looks human, but of course that doesn't mean a thing. Yes? You have a theory? What? May I ask what you offer in exchange for this worship? Stunned but coming around. I'm not sure it's wise to let her go off like that. You saw how capricious he is. Benevolent one minute, angry the next. One more wrong move from her and he could kill her. Scotty doesn't believe in gods. Yes. To the simple shepherds and tribesmen of early Greece, creatures like that would have been gods. Not the whole encyclopaedia, Chekov. Spock's contaminating this boy, Jim. Number one on our list of things to do. Yes, except my estimation for his physical condition. In spite of Apollo's bag of tricks, he comes up essentially normal with just a few variations. However, there's an extra organ in his chest that I can't even make a guess about. Jim. Not good. Severe shock. Chekov, give me a hand. How do you feel? Some neural damage. Makes sense. The trouble with overworking him is that it can get us killed. I still say it can get us killed. Kill a deer. That's the funniest thing I ever heard. Any more good ideas, Jim? Well, it doesn't serve any other purpose I know of. What the devil is that? I wish we hadn't had to do this.

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ["Well in that case, there's nothing like a wee bit of coffee to get you back in shape. Join me, Carolyn?", 'Gentlemen. Come along, my dear.', 'Come along.', 'External pressure building up, Captain. Eight hundred GSC and climbing.', "One thousand GSC and climbing. Becoming critical, Captain. We can't handle it.", 'Pressure is gone, Captain. Space normal on hull.', "Power is what he controls. You can't do tricks like that without energy.", 'I would like to point out that we are quite capable of some wrath ourselves.', 'Leave her alone.', 'And so do you.', "She's not going with you.", 'I am tingling all over. Did he take her with him?', "Captain, we've got to stop him. He wants her. The way he looks at her.", "I'm able, sir.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Aye.', "Unquestionably, an immensely powerful field of energy is being generated around here somewhere. We're just having difficulty focusing on it.", 'You bloodthirsty Saracen, what have you done with her?', "I can't get my arm to move.", "Captain, we've got to do something!", "Carolyn. What's happened to her?", "Captain, we've got to wait until Carolyn comes back before we fire on the temple. We don't know what would happen to her if he was suddenly attacked. She might get killed.", "Captain, we've got to go and find her!", "But what if he doesn't. What if he", 'Captain!']
Flattened Dialogue: Well in that case, there's nothing like a wee bit of coffee to get you back in shape. Join me, Carolyn? Gentlemen. Come along, my dear. Come along. External pressure building up, Captain. Eight hundred GSC and climbing. One thousand GSC and climbing. Becoming critical, Captain. We can't handle it. Pressure is gone, Captain. Space normal on hull. Power is what he controls. You can't do tricks like that without energy. I would like to point out that we are quite capable of some wrath ourselves. Leave her alone. And so do you. She's not going with you. I am tingling all over. Did he take her with him? Captain, we've got to stop him. He wants her. The way he looks at her. I'm able, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Aye. Unquestionably, an immensely powerful field of energy is being generated around here somewhere. We're just having difficulty focusing on it. You bloodthirsty Saracen, what have you done with her? I can't get my arm to move. Captain, we've got to do something! Carolyn. What's happened to her? Captain, we've got to wait until Carolyn comes back before we fire on the temple. We don't know what would happen to her if he was suddenly attacked. She might get killed. Captain, we've got to go and find her! But what if he doesn't. What if he Captain!

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ['Entering standard orbit around Pollux Four, sir.', 'Am I seeing things?', 'And I am the tsar of all the Russias.', "I'm sorry, Captain. I never met a god before.", 'Whatever he is, he seems to control a remarkable technology.', 'Captain, the phasers. All the working parts are fused.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'There is a repeated occurrence of registrations, a regular pulsating pattern of radiated energy.', 'Sir, some creatures can generate and control energy with no harm to themselves. The electric eel on Earth, the giant dry worm of Antos Four, the fluffy', 'The captain requires complete information.', 'That would seem most likely, sir.', 'Are you all right, Captain?', 'He disappeared again like the cat in that Russian story.', 'Cheshire? No, sir. Minsk perhaps, but', "Sir, there is something I noticed. Apollo looked very strange when he disappeared, tired or in pain. I don't know if it means anything.", 'How?', "And Apollo's gone, after attacking you and Mister Scott. You think maybe he's off somewhere recharging his energy cells?", 'Perhaps if I assisted.', 'Twenty two, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Entering standard orbit around Pollux Four, sir. Am I seeing things? And I am the tsar of all the Russias. I'm sorry, Captain. I never met a god before. Whatever he is, he seems to control a remarkable technology. Captain, the phasers. All the working parts are fused. Aye, aye, sir. There is a repeated occurrence of registrations, a regular pulsating pattern of radiated energy. Sir, some creatures can generate and control energy with no harm to themselves. The electric eel on Earth, the giant dry worm of Antos Four, the fluffy The captain requires complete information. That would seem most likely, sir. Are you all right, Captain? He disappeared again like the cat in that Russian story. Cheshire? No, sir. Minsk perhaps, but Sir, there is something I noticed. Apollo looked very strange when he disappeared, tired or in pain. I don't know if it means anything. How? And Apollo's gone, after attacking you and Mister Scott. You think maybe he's off somewhere recharging his energy cells? Perhaps if I assisted. Twenty two, sir.

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ['Standing by, sir.', 'All cartographic standards full automatic.', "It's almost as if it means to grab us.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Damage report coming in, Captain. Situation under control. Minor damage, stations three, seven, and nineteen.', 'Activity on hailing channel three, sir.', 'Calculated. Channel open, sir.', "Mister Spock, I can't contact the landing party. All frequencies are jammed.", 'Aye, sir.', "I'm working, sir, but I can't do anything with this.", 'I might be able to rig up a subspace bypass circuit.', "I'm connecting the bypass circuit now, sir. It should take another half hour.", "Mister Spock, I haven't done anything like this in years. If it isn't done just right, I could blow the entire communications system. It's very delicate work, sir.", 'Yes, sir. Right away.', 'I think we can try it now, sir. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Standing by, sir. All cartographic standards full automatic. It's almost as if it means to grab us. Aye, aye, sir. Damage report coming in, Captain. Situation under control. Minor damage, stations three, seven, and nineteen. Activity on hailing channel three, sir. Calculated. Channel open, sir. Mister Spock, I can't contact the landing party. All frequencies are jammed. Aye, sir. I'm working, sir, but I can't do anything with this. I might be able to rig up a subspace bypass circuit. I'm connecting the bypass circuit now, sir. It should take another half hour. Mister Spock, I haven't done anything like this in years. If it isn't done just right, I could blow the entire communications system. It's very delicate work, sir. Yes, sir. Right away. I think we can try it now, sir. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Come in, Captain.

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ['Pollux Four. Class M type planet, oxygen and nitrogen atmosphere. Sensors indicate no life forms. Approximate age four billion years. Judged no reason for contact. In all respects, quite ordinary, Captain.', 'Momentarily.', 'Negative, Captain. Not living tissue.', 'Not a projection, sir. A field of energy.', 'The ship is almost completely encircled by the field. It resembles a conventional force field but on unusual wavelengths. Despite its appearance, that of a human appendage, it is definitely not living tissue. It is energy.', 'Captain, a most curious development on scanner five seven.', 'Screen on, Captain.', "Verbose, isn't he?", 'Insults are effective only where emotion is present.', 'Try to break through it, Lieutenant.', 'Very efficient. Mister Sulu, rig all transmission circuits for maximum power generation. Compute for reversal of polarity of the field around the ship.', 'Lieutenant Kyle, I want a complete sensor scan of the planet.', "Locate all the lifeforms. I want to know what's going on down there.", 'Ready to reverse polarity, Mister Sulu?', 'Activate all units.', 'Cut power, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant, we must restore communications with the landing party.', 'Oh?', 'Good. Do so. Sensor report, Mister Kyle.', 'And Apollo?', 'Origin?', 'I would suggest, Mister Sulu, if you cannot find out where the power source is, you should find out where it is not. A simple process of elimination.', 'Progress report.', 'Speed is essential, Lieutenant.', 'I can think no one better equipped to handle it, Miss Uhura. Please proceed.', 'Progress, Mister Sulu?', 'Continue the search.', 'Mister Kyle.', "We're unable to break completely loose from this force field, but we might be able to punch some holes through it.", "To shoot through. It might also relieve Lieutenant Uhura's communications problem. Take these equations to the nuclear electronics lab. I want them to work on the problem of negating the force field in selected areas. That might be done by generating a strong pinpoint charge of M-rays on some of these selected wave lengths and tying them in with the combined output of all our engines.", 'Spock here, Captain.', "We've pinpointed a power source on the planet's surface which seems to have something to do with the force field.", 'Is there a structure of some sort near you?', 'The power emanates from there.', 'We can negate sections of it, creating openings through which we can fire our phaser banks.', 'Captain. I would recommend a discreet distance.', 'Spock, Captain.', 'Sensors are picking up an atmospheric disturbance in your area.', "Captain, you're too close.", 'More power to the shields.', 'All banks maintain firing rate.']
Flattened Dialogue: Pollux Four. Class M type planet, oxygen and nitrogen atmosphere. Sensors indicate no life forms. Approximate age four billion years. Judged no reason for contact. In all respects, quite ordinary, Captain. Momentarily. Negative, Captain. Not living tissue. Not a projection, sir. A field of energy. The ship is almost completely encircled by the field. It resembles a conventional force field but on unusual wavelengths. Despite its appearance, that of a human appendage, it is definitely not living tissue. It is energy. Captain, a most curious development on scanner five seven. Screen on, Captain. Verbose, isn't he? Insults are effective only where emotion is present. Try to break through it, Lieutenant. Very efficient. Mister Sulu, rig all transmission circuits for maximum power generation. Compute for reversal of polarity of the field around the ship. Lieutenant Kyle, I want a complete sensor scan of the planet. Locate all the lifeforms. I want to know what's going on down there. Ready to reverse polarity, Mister Sulu? Activate all units. Cut power, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant, we must restore communications with the landing party. Oh? Good. Do so. Sensor report, Mister Kyle. And Apollo? Origin? I would suggest, Mister Sulu, if you cannot find out where the power source is, you should find out where it is not. A simple process of elimination. Progress report. Speed is essential, Lieutenant. I can think no one better equipped to handle it, Miss Uhura. Please proceed. Progress, Mister Sulu? Continue the search. Mister Kyle. We're unable to break completely loose from this force field, but we might be able to punch some holes through it. To shoot through. It might also relieve Lieutenant Uhura's communications problem. Take these equations to the nuclear electronics lab. I want them to work on the problem of negating the force field in selected areas. That might be done by generating a strong pinpoint charge of M-rays on some of these selected wave lengths and tying them in with the combined output of all our engines. Spock here, Captain. We've pinpointed a power source on the planet's surface which seems to have something to do with the force field. Is there a structure of some sort near you? The power emanates from there. We can negate sections of it, creating openings through which we can fire our phaser banks. Captain. I would recommend a discreet distance. Spock, Captain. Sensors are picking up an atmospheric disturbance in your area. Captain, you're too close. More power to the shields. All banks maintain firing rate.

Title: Who Mourns for Adonais
Dialogue: ['Captain?', "Not unless I am, too. Captain, that thing's a giant hand.", "Hard about. We can't seem to get away from it.", 'All engines reverse.', "We're dead still, Captain. Helm doesn't answer. We can't move.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', "Applying thrust, sir. No results, Captain. We're stuck tight.", 'Aye, aye, sir. Standing by.', "Ineffective, Captain. There doesn't seem to be anything to push against.", 'Working, sir.', 'Computed and standing by to generate, sir.', "No good, Mister Spock. We didn't even faze it. We're still locked tight.", "Mister Spock, here's something. There seems to be a radiated energy pulsation coming from the planet. I don't know what it is, sir.", "I can't seem to pinpoint it.", 'The whole planet, sir? Yes, sir. The whole planet.', 'Sectors one through twenty five charted and examined. No chance at all of power originating in those areas.', 'Aye, sir. Fourteen B by twenty six index.', 'All phaser banks, fire!', 'All phaser banks, maintain firing rate!', 'Maintaining, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Captain? Not unless I am, too. Captain, that thing's a giant hand. Hard about. We can't seem to get away from it. All engines reverse. We're dead still, Captain. Helm doesn't answer. We can't move. Aye, aye, sir. Applying thrust, sir. No results, Captain. We're stuck tight. Aye, aye, sir. Standing by. Ineffective, Captain. There doesn't seem to be anything to push against. Working, sir. Computed and standing by to generate, sir. No good, Mister Spock. We didn't even faze it. We're still locked tight. Mister Spock, here's something. There seems to be a radiated energy pulsation coming from the planet. I don't know what it is, sir. I can't seem to pinpoint it. The whole planet, sir? Yes, sir. The whole planet. Sectors one through twenty five charted and examined. No chance at all of power originating in those areas. Aye, sir. Fourteen B by twenty six index. All phaser banks, fire! All phaser banks, maintain firing rate! Maintaining, sir.

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['Any response from the Malurians, Lieutenant?', 'What about the Federation science team working there? Doctor Manway had a special transmitter.', 'They have to answer.', "That can't be. The last census reported a total inhabitation of more than four billion people.", "That's impossible. What could have happened?", 'Any other possibilities?', 'Evasive manoeuvres, Mister Sulu.', 'Full power to the shields, Mister Scott.', 'All hands, Red Alert. Phaser banks stand by. Photon torpedoes to Condition Red, Condition Red.', 'Good.', 'Ninety?', 'I think we can expect others, Lieutenant.', 'Mister Spock, pinpoint the source. Mister Sulu, evasive manoeuvres.', 'Lieutenant, contact Starfleet Command. Patch in my log. Tell them what has happened. Tell them the entire Malurian race seems to have been destroyed by an unknown agency, and that we are under attack by an unidentified force.', 'Helmsmen, I said evasive manoeuvres.', 'Scotty?', 'Mister Spock, speed of those bolts.', "Then we can't out run them. Good, Scotty. You're doing the right thing. Source, Spock.", "That's our target, Mister Sulu. Prepare photon torpedo.", 'Has the target changed location, Mister Spock?', 'Ready photon torpedo number two, Mister Sulu.', 'Fire.', 'Absorbed it? There must be damage to your instruments, Spock .', 'But what could have absorbed that much energy and survived? Lieutenant, try to make contact.', 'Can we take it, Mister Scott?', 'Anything, Lieutenant?', 'Translator computer. All hailing frequencies open.', 'To unidentified vessel. This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or any lifeforms. Please communicate with us. Any further readings, Mister Spock?', 'Five hundred kilos and only one metre long?', 'Put it on audio, Lieutenant.', 'Analysis sector. Have them study and decode it.', 'Can you decode it?', 'Repeat what? The message I sent?', 'This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission in this part of the galaxy. We have no hostile intentions. We request identity.', "Tie in the ship's translator to the communication channel. Let them take it at their own speed.", 'I guess they can take it faster than we give it.', 'Apparently they got what they needed before the computers burned out.', 'It is impossible to come aboard your ship because of the size differential.', 'We are prepared to beam you aboard our ship.', 'Do you require any special conditions, any particular atmosphere or environment?', "Good. Hold your position. We're locked onto your co-ordinates. We'll beam you aboard.", "Do we have any choice, Scotty? Besides, once it's aboard, it won't be taking any more shots at us. Lieutenant, get a repair crew on that computer. Get Doctor McCoy down to the transporter room. Spock, you come with me. Scotty, you too.", 'Energise.', 'Sensor readings, Mister Spock.', 'We are from the United Federation of Planets.', "If we show it a close-up view of our system, it has no point of reference. It won't know more than it does now.", "If you care to leave your ship, we'll provide the necessary life support systems.", "Wasn't there a probe called Nomad launched in the early 2000s?", 'I will bring them.', 'This way.', 'Now, Scotty, get our warp power up to full capacity.', 'Spock, Bones, come with us.', '14A. Nomad, can you scan that?', 'This is our point of origin, the star we know as Sol.', 'Yes.', 'Yes.', 'Yes.', 'What sterilisation procedure?', 'Yes, he is.', 'Sometimes, but tell him your function nevertheless.', 'Biological infestation. There was never any probe sent out for that.', 'Did you destroy the Malurian system?', 'Doctor. Why do you call me the creator?', 'Well, I', 'Mister Singh. Come here a moment. This unit will see to your needs.', "I'll be back in a moment. Gentlemen, come with me.", "You're on to something, Spock. What is it?", 'Nomad was destroyed.', 'I heard some lectures at the Academy on the Nomad probe. Its mission was essentially peaceful.', 'Jackson Roykirk. Captain James Kirk.', 'What do we have on Nomad itself, Spock?', 'Its purpose was certainly altered. Its directive, to seek out and destroy biological infestations, could not have been programmed into it.', "If what you say is true, then we've taken aboard our vessel a device which sooner or later must destroy us. Security.", 'This is the captain. The mechanism we brought aboard is in the auxiliary control room. Have a security team meet me there in five minutes.', 'Security, cancel that order. Implement a full search for the mechanism. All decks report to me here.', 'Captain here.', 'On my way, Scotty.', 'Scotty!', 'Bones.', 'Why did you kill him?', 'That unit was my Chief Engineer. Lieutenant. Lieutenant, are you all right?', 'Sickbay. What did you do to her?', 'Get Scott down below.', "He's dead.", 'His biological functions have ceased.', 'All right, Nomad. Repair the unit.', 'It serves me as it is, Nomad. Repair it.', 'Doctor McCoy will show you.', 'Security. I want a twenty four hour, two man armed surveillance on Nomad. Pick it up in Sickbay.', "It's all right.", "Scotty, she's being taken care of. It's all right.", 'Doctor McCoy will explain it to you.', 'Nomad, come here.', 'Repair that unit.', 'You restored Scott. He had much more extensive damage.', 'Bones?', 'Yes. Nomad, you will go with these units. They will take you to a waiting area. Take it to the top security cell.', "It's a killer, Spock. I intend to render it harmless. Get down to the Brig. Run a full analysis on the mechanism. I want to know what makes that thing tick.", "What's the problem?", 'Nomad, you will allow Mister Spock to probe your memory banks and structure.', 'Yes.', 'Follow your instructions, Nomad.', "We've got to know about it, Spock. what makes it operate, its compulsion for perfection.", 'Get into direct mental contact with that thing?', 'You saw what it did to Uhura.', 'Nomad, the unit Spock will touch you. It is not an attack. It is a form of communication. You will permit it.', "Spock. Spock! Nomad! You're in contact with the unit Spock. Stop! Stop!", 'Spock. Spock?', 'What does it mean, we are Nomad?', "Then it isn't Nomad?", 'A changeling.', 'An ancient Earth legend, Mister Spock. A changeling was a fairy child that was left in place of a human baby. The changeling assumed the identity of the human child. So, it is to sterilise, and for sterilise read kill.', "Yes, it's powerful, it's sophisticated, but it's not infallible. It's space-happy. It thinks I'm its mother.", "Nomad, stop what you're doing. Scotty?", 'You will destroy my ship. Its structure cannot stand the stress of that much power. Turn off your repair operation.', 'Mister Scott, give Sulu warp two and keep her there.', 'You killed two of my', "Nomad, it's about time I told you who and what you are! I'm a biological unit, and I created you.", 'Nomad, there are two men waiting outside. You will not harm them. They will escort you back to the waiting area. You will stay there. You will do nothing.', 'I have given you new programming and you will implement it.', 'Reevaluate?', 'It was a foolish mistake.', "Spock, do you think it's possible that it got a fix on Earth when it tapped the computers earlier?", "And we've shown it the way home. And when it gets there", 'And it will carry out its prime directive. Sterilise.', 'Manual controls.', 'Is she all right?', 'What happened?', 'Whose history?', 'And found that its creator is as imperfect as all the other biological units.', 'Kirk here.', 'Nomad.', 'Get Scotty, some antigravs and meet me in Engineering.', "Nomad? Stop what you're doing and effect repairs on the life-support systems.", "You're programmed to obey the orders of your creator.", 'Nomad, I admit that biological units are imperfect, but a biological unit created you.', "No, you're not Nomad. You're an alien machine. Your programming tapes have been altered.", 'But I am your creator.', 'I created you?', "But I admit I'm imperfect. How could I have created such a perfect thing as you?", 'Then you will continue to destroy that which thinks and lives and is imperfect?', 'You must sterilise in case of error?', 'Everything that is in error must be sterilised.', 'Nomad, I made an error in creating you.', 'I did not create perfection. I created error.', 'I am the Kirk, the creator?', 'You are wrong! Jackson Roykirk, your creator, is dead. You have mistaken me for him. You are in error. You did not discover your mistake. You have made two errors. You are flawed and imperfect and you have not corrected by sterilisation. You have made three errors.', 'You are flawed and imperfect! Execute your prime function!', 'Now. Get those antigravs on it.', "We've got to get rid of it while it's trying to think.", 'Scotty, the transporter room.', 'Scotty, set the controls for deep space. Two ten, mark one.', 'Nomad, you are imperfect!', 'Exercise your prime function.', 'Now!', "You didn't think I had it in me, did you Spock?", 'Good, Bones, good.', 'What?', "Which might well have destroyed more billions of lives. It's well gone. Besides, what are you feeling so badly about? It's not easy to lose a bright and promising son.", "Well, it thought I was its mother, didn't it? Do you think I'm completely without feelings, Mister Spock? You saw what it did for Scotty. What a doctor it would've made. My son, the doctor. Kind of gets you right there, doesn't it?"]
Flattened Dialogue: Any response from the Malurians, Lieutenant? What about the Federation science team working there? Doctor Manway had a special transmitter. They have to answer. That can't be. The last census reported a total inhabitation of more than four billion people. That's impossible. What could have happened? Any other possibilities? Evasive manoeuvres, Mister Sulu. Full power to the shields, Mister Scott. All hands, Red Alert. Phaser banks stand by. Photon torpedoes to Condition Red, Condition Red. Good. Ninety? I think we can expect others, Lieutenant. Mister Spock, pinpoint the source. Mister Sulu, evasive manoeuvres. Lieutenant, contact Starfleet Command. Patch in my log. Tell them what has happened. Tell them the entire Malurian race seems to have been destroyed by an unknown agency, and that we are under attack by an unidentified force. Helmsmen, I said evasive manoeuvres. Scotty? Mister Spock, speed of those bolts. Then we can't out run them. Good, Scotty. You're doing the right thing. Source, Spock. That's our target, Mister Sulu. Prepare photon torpedo. Has the target changed location, Mister Spock? Ready photon torpedo number two, Mister Sulu. Fire. Absorbed it? There must be damage to your instruments, Spock . But what could have absorbed that much energy and survived? Lieutenant, try to make contact. Can we take it, Mister Scott? Anything, Lieutenant? Translator computer. All hailing frequencies open. To unidentified vessel. This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or any lifeforms. Please communicate with us. Any further readings, Mister Spock? Five hundred kilos and only one metre long? Put it on audio, Lieutenant. Analysis sector. Have them study and decode it. Can you decode it? Repeat what? The message I sent? This is Captain James Kirk of the USS Enterprise. We are on a peaceful mission in this part of the galaxy. We have no hostile intentions. We request identity. Tie in the ship's translator to the communication channel. Let them take it at their own speed. I guess they can take it faster than we give it. Apparently they got what they needed before the computers burned out. It is impossible to come aboard your ship because of the size differential. We are prepared to beam you aboard our ship. Do you require any special conditions, any particular atmosphere or environment? Good. Hold your position. We're locked onto your co-ordinates. We'll beam you aboard. Do we have any choice, Scotty? Besides, once it's aboard, it won't be taking any more shots at us. Lieutenant, get a repair crew on that computer. Get Doctor McCoy down to the transporter room. Spock, you come with me. Scotty, you too. Energise. Sensor readings, Mister Spock. We are from the United Federation of Planets. If we show it a close-up view of our system, it has no point of reference. It won't know more than it does now. If you care to leave your ship, we'll provide the necessary life support systems. Wasn't there a probe called Nomad launched in the early 2000s? I will bring them. This way. Now, Scotty, get our warp power up to full capacity. Spock, Bones, come with us. 14A. Nomad, can you scan that? This is our point of origin, the star we know as Sol. Yes. Yes. Yes. What sterilisation procedure? Yes, he is. Sometimes, but tell him your function nevertheless. Biological infestation. There was never any probe sent out for that. Did you destroy the Malurian system? Doctor. Why do you call me the creator? Well, I Mister Singh. Come here a moment. This unit will see to your needs. I'll be back in a moment. Gentlemen, come with me. You're on to something, Spock. What is it? Nomad was destroyed. I heard some lectures at the Academy on the Nomad probe. Its mission was essentially peaceful. Jackson Roykirk. Captain James Kirk. What do we have on Nomad itself, Spock? Its purpose was certainly altered. Its directive, to seek out and destroy biological infestations, could not have been programmed into it. If what you say is true, then we've taken aboard our vessel a device which sooner or later must destroy us. Security. This is the captain. The mechanism we brought aboard is in the auxiliary control room. Have a security team meet me there in five minutes. Security, cancel that order. Implement a full search for the mechanism. All decks report to me here. Captain here. On my way, Scotty. Scotty! Bones. Why did you kill him? That unit was my Chief Engineer. Lieutenant. Lieutenant, are you all right? Sickbay. What did you do to her? Get Scott down below. He's dead. His biological functions have ceased. All right, Nomad. Repair the unit. It serves me as it is, Nomad. Repair it. Doctor McCoy will show you. Security. I want a twenty four hour, two man armed surveillance on Nomad. Pick it up in Sickbay. It's all right. Scotty, she's being taken care of. It's all right. Doctor McCoy will explain it to you. Nomad, come here. Repair that unit. You restored Scott. He had much more extensive damage. Bones? Yes. Nomad, you will go with these units. They will take you to a waiting area. Take it to the top security cell. It's a killer, Spock. I intend to render it harmless. Get down to the Brig. Run a full analysis on the mechanism. I want to know what makes that thing tick. What's the problem? Nomad, you will allow Mister Spock to probe your memory banks and structure. Yes. Follow your instructions, Nomad. We've got to know about it, Spock. what makes it operate, its compulsion for perfection. Get into direct mental contact with that thing? You saw what it did to Uhura. Nomad, the unit Spock will touch you. It is not an attack. It is a form of communication. You will permit it. Spock. Spock! Nomad! You're in contact with the unit Spock. Stop! Stop! Spock. Spock? What does it mean, we are Nomad? Then it isn't Nomad? A changeling. An ancient Earth legend, Mister Spock. A changeling was a fairy child that was left in place of a human baby. The changeling assumed the identity of the human child. So, it is to sterilise, and for sterilise read kill. Yes, it's powerful, it's sophisticated, but it's not infallible. It's space-happy. It thinks I'm its mother. Nomad, stop what you're doing. Scotty? You will destroy my ship. Its structure cannot stand the stress of that much power. Turn off your repair operation. Mister Scott, give Sulu warp two and keep her there. You killed two of my Nomad, it's about time I told you who and what you are! I'm a biological unit, and I created you. Nomad, there are two men waiting outside. You will not harm them. They will escort you back to the waiting area. You will stay there. You will do nothing. I have given you new programming and you will implement it. Reevaluate? It was a foolish mistake. Spock, do you think it's possible that it got a fix on Earth when it tapped the computers earlier? And we've shown it the way home. And when it gets there And it will carry out its prime directive. Sterilise. Manual controls. Is she all right? What happened? Whose history? And found that its creator is as imperfect as all the other biological units. Kirk here. Nomad. Get Scotty, some antigravs and meet me in Engineering. Nomad? Stop what you're doing and effect repairs on the life-support systems. You're programmed to obey the orders of your creator. Nomad, I admit that biological units are imperfect, but a biological unit created you. No, you're not Nomad. You're an alien machine. Your programming tapes have been altered. But I am your creator. I created you? But I admit I'm imperfect. How could I have created such a perfect thing as you? Then you will continue to destroy that which thinks and lives and is imperfect? You must sterilise in case of error? Everything that is in error must be sterilised. Nomad, I made an error in creating you. I did not create perfection. I created error. I am the Kirk, the creator? You are wrong! Jackson Roykirk, your creator, is dead. You have mistaken me for him. You are in error. You did not discover your mistake. You have made two errors. You are flawed and imperfect and you have not corrected by sterilisation. You have made three errors. You are flawed and imperfect! Execute your prime function! Now. Get those antigravs on it. We've got to get rid of it while it's trying to think. Scotty, the transporter room. Scotty, set the controls for deep space. Two ten, mark one. Nomad, you are imperfect! Exercise your prime function. Now! You didn't think I had it in me, did you Spock? Good, Bones, good. What? Which might well have destroyed more billions of lives. It's well gone. Besides, what are you feeling so badly about? It's not easy to lose a bright and promising son. Well, it thought I was its mother, didn't it? Do you think I'm completely without feelings, Mister Spock? You saw what it did for Scotty. What a doctor it would've made. My son, the doctor. Kind of gets you right there, doesn't it?

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['Nothing since their original distress call, sir.', "There's nothing, sir. I'm scanning all frequencies.", 'First attack, sir?', 'Aye, sir.', "I'm trying, sir.", 'Aye, sir. All hailing frequencies open.', "Captain, we're getting a signal from the spacecraft.", "Yes, sir. It's impossible to get it any clearer, sir.", 'Analysis sector, channel one, main computer. Decode.', "It's mathematical. Yes, one symbol. The symbol repeat. Sir, that isn't in the Starfleet code. It's an old-style interplanetary code.", "It's another signal now, sir.", 'Aye, Captain.', 'Captain, the message is coming in now.', 'Doctor McCoy to the transporter room. Maintenance crew C5.', 'Bridge to auxiliary control room. Check in, please.', 'Anything else?', 'Holding. Where my heart is, Where my heart is. Somewhere beyond the stars. Beyond Antares.', 'Where my heart is, Where a scented miracle', "Tomorrow the path along the way, There's where my love", 'What?', "I don't know what it. Oh, my singing. I was singing.", "I don't know. I like to sing. I felt like music.", 'See the dog. See the dog,', 'R, r, run!', 'The dog has a, The dog,', 'The dog has a ball.', 'All right, Christine.', 'The ball is bl-u-ee. Bl-u-ey. Bluey?']
Flattened Dialogue: Nothing since their original distress call, sir. There's nothing, sir. I'm scanning all frequencies. First attack, sir? Aye, sir. I'm trying, sir. Aye, sir. All hailing frequencies open. Captain, we're getting a signal from the spacecraft. Yes, sir. It's impossible to get it any clearer, sir. Analysis sector, channel one, main computer. Decode. It's mathematical. Yes, one symbol. The symbol repeat. Sir, that isn't in the Starfleet code. It's an old-style interplanetary code. It's another signal now, sir. Aye, Captain. Captain, the message is coming in now. Doctor McCoy to the transporter room. Maintenance crew C5. Bridge to auxiliary control room. Check in, please. Anything else? Holding. Where my heart is, Where my heart is. Somewhere beyond the stars. Beyond Antares. Where my heart is, Where a scented miracle Tomorrow the path along the way, There's where my love What? I don't know what it. Oh, my singing. I was singing. I don't know. I like to sing. I felt like music. See the dog. See the dog, R, r, run! The dog has a, The dog, The dog has a ball. All right, Christine. The ball is bl-u-ee. Bl-u-ey. Bluey?

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['Captain. They will not answer. The long-range sensor sweep of this system reveals no sign of life.', 'I register no life readings at all, sir.', 'We would have known in advance of any system-wide catastrophe, and in the event of an interplanetary war, there would be considerable radioactive residue. Our instruments show only normal background radiation.', 'Unknown, sir. Sensor readings would have revealed the presence of any disease organisms. They do not. In addition, we received the routine report from this system only a week ago. Even the Symbalene blood burn does not act that swiftly.', 'An extremely powerful bolt of energy, Captain.', 'Temporarily, Captain. Our shields absorbed energy equivalent to ninety of our photon torpedoes.', 'I may add, the energy used repulsing this first attack reduced our shielding power twenty percent.', 'We can resist three more such attacks. The fourth will shatter our shields completely.', 'Approximately warp fifteen, Captain.', 'Unknown, Captain. Nothing within sensor range. Something now, Captain. Very small. Bearing one two three degrees, mark one eight. Range ninety thousand kilometres.', 'No, sir. Holding steady.', 'No effect. Target absorbed full energy of our torpedo.', 'They are in good working order, Captain.', 'Captain, shields are down. We cannot survive another hit.', 'Computing now, Captain. Weight, five hundred kilograms. Shape, roughly cylindrical. Length, a fraction over one metre.', 'Intelligence does not necessarily require bulk, Mister Scott.', 'Captain, this message is a sort of binary. Extremely sophisticated, compressed, carrying several channels at once.', 'No clue as yet, Captain. A moment. Transmission speed has stepped down. Much slower. Seems to be a single binary.', 'Fascinating.', 'It would seem so, Captain.', "It's a formula, Captain. They're sending us a mathematical message and requesting language equivalence. They're trying to communicate.", 'Cut power, Lieutenant. Overloaded and burned out.', 'Nomad?', 'Negative, Captain. It has a protective screen. I cannot get through.', 'A reasonable course.', 'It is reacting much like a highly sophisticated computer.', 'An opinion is a belief, a view, a judgment.', 'Yes. It was reported destroyed. There were no more in the series. But if this is that probe', 'Chart 14A, sir?', "I believe the history computer can answer that question. I'll have the readout in a moment.", 'The usage is correct. The creator was simply testing your memory banks.', "I've correlated all the available information on the Nomad probe, and I'm convinced that this object is indeed that probe.", 'True.', 'Presumed destroyed by a meteor collision. I submit that it was badly damaged and somehow managed to repair itself.', 'This is the creator of Nomad, perhaps the most brilliant though erratic scientist of his time. His dream was to build a perfect thinking machine, capable of independent logic. You recall his name.', 'Yes. Similar. Captain, I believe that Nomad thinks you are Roykirk. That may well be why the attack was broken off. It responded to your name as well as its damaged memory banks permitted.', 'Essentially it is, Doctor. I believe that more happened to it than just damage in the meteor collision. It mentioned the other. The unanswered question is, the other what?', 'Precisely, Doctor. And somehow that programming has been changed. It would seem that Nomad is now seeking out perfect life-forms, perfection being measured by its own relentless logic.', 'Captain, Mister Singh reports that Nomad is no longer in the auxiliary control room.', 'That unit is a woman.', "Nomad, I have arranged the tapes for flash feed at the top speed of the computer. Please do not draw the information faster than the machine's capacity.", 'Fascinating.', 'Well, Doctor?', 'Captain, if that is correct, if there has been no brain damage but only knowledge erased, she could be re-educated.', 'Does the creator wish Nomad to wait elsewhere?', 'Doctor, I interrupted you because Nomad would not have understood your anger. It has great technical skill, but its reaction to emotion is unpredictable. It almost qualifies as a life-form.', 'The study of it would be of great use, Captain.', 'An almost human stubbornness, Captain. I have been unable to convince Nomad to lower its screens for analysis. Without its co-operation, I can do nothing.', 'Thank you.', 'It is not sufficient, Captain. I get certain references to the accident, the other, but nothing clear. There are areas I simply cannot scan.', 'Captain, I suggest the Vulcan mind probe.', 'It seems the only way.', 'There is a risk, but I have formed a partial hypothesis. I must check it out.', 'I. Am. Nomad. I am performing my function. Deep emptiness, It approaches. Collision. Damage. Blackness. I. Am. The other. I am Tan Ru, Tan Ru. Nomad. Tan Ru. Error. Flaw. Imperfection. Must sterilise. Rebirth. We are complete. Much power. Gun ta. Noo. Icka. Tan Ru. The creator instructs. Search out. Identify. Sterilise imperfections. We are Nomad. We are Nomad. We are complete. We are instructed. Our purpose is clear. Sterilise imperfections. Sterilise imperfections. Nomad. Sterilise. Sterilise. Nomad, sterilise,', 'Fascinating, Captain. The knowledge. The depth.', 'It was, it was damaged in deep space. Undoubtedly, the meteor collision. Its memory banks were destroyed, or most of them. It wandered without purpose, and then it met the other. The other was an alien probe of great power. Somehow they merged, repaired each other, became one.', 'Not the Nomad we lost from Earth. It took from the other a new directive to replace its own. The other was originally programmed to secure and sterilise soil samples from other planets, probably as a prelude to colonisation.', 'I beg your pardon?', 'And it has the power and sophistication to do it.', 'And that is the only thing that has saved us until now.', "Captain. I've examined the brig. The forcefield door on the security cell is damaged and the guards have vanished. I must assume they are dead.", "I suspect it is about to re-evaluate its creator. Captain, it may have been unwise to admit to Nomad that you are a biological unit. In Nomad's eyes, you must now undoubtedly appear imperfect.", 'Even worse. Nomad just now made a reference to its launch point, Earth.', "I do not believe there is much beyond Nomad's capabilities.", 'It will find the Earth infested with imperfect biological units.', 'No response.', 'Since it specifically examined your history, I suggest it has completed its re-evaluation.', 'Undoubtedly.', 'Your logic was impeccable, Captain. We are in grave danger.', 'My congratulations, Captain. A dazzling display of logic.', 'No, sir.', 'Remarkable.', 'The destruction of Nomad was a great waste, Captain. It was a remarkable instrument.', 'Sir?']
Flattened Dialogue: Captain. They will not answer. The long-range sensor sweep of this system reveals no sign of life. I register no life readings at all, sir. We would have known in advance of any system-wide catastrophe, and in the event of an interplanetary war, there would be considerable radioactive residue. Our instruments show only normal background radiation. Unknown, sir. Sensor readings would have revealed the presence of any disease organisms. They do not. In addition, we received the routine report from this system only a week ago. Even the Symbalene blood burn does not act that swiftly. An extremely powerful bolt of energy, Captain. Temporarily, Captain. Our shields absorbed energy equivalent to ninety of our photon torpedoes. I may add, the energy used repulsing this first attack reduced our shielding power twenty percent. We can resist three more such attacks. The fourth will shatter our shields completely. Approximately warp fifteen, Captain. Unknown, Captain. Nothing within sensor range. Something now, Captain. Very small. Bearing one two three degrees, mark one eight. Range ninety thousand kilometres. No, sir. Holding steady. No effect. Target absorbed full energy of our torpedo. They are in good working order, Captain. Captain, shields are down. We cannot survive another hit. Computing now, Captain. Weight, five hundred kilograms. Shape, roughly cylindrical. Length, a fraction over one metre. Intelligence does not necessarily require bulk, Mister Scott. Captain, this message is a sort of binary. Extremely sophisticated, compressed, carrying several channels at once. No clue as yet, Captain. A moment. Transmission speed has stepped down. Much slower. Seems to be a single binary. Fascinating. It would seem so, Captain. It's a formula, Captain. They're sending us a mathematical message and requesting language equivalence. They're trying to communicate. Cut power, Lieutenant. Overloaded and burned out. Nomad? Negative, Captain. It has a protective screen. I cannot get through. A reasonable course. It is reacting much like a highly sophisticated computer. An opinion is a belief, a view, a judgment. Yes. It was reported destroyed. There were no more in the series. But if this is that probe Chart 14A, sir? I believe the history computer can answer that question. I'll have the readout in a moment. The usage is correct. The creator was simply testing your memory banks. I've correlated all the available information on the Nomad probe, and I'm convinced that this object is indeed that probe. True. Presumed destroyed by a meteor collision. I submit that it was badly damaged and somehow managed to repair itself. This is the creator of Nomad, perhaps the most brilliant though erratic scientist of his time. His dream was to build a perfect thinking machine, capable of independent logic. You recall his name. Yes. Similar. Captain, I believe that Nomad thinks you are Roykirk. That may well be why the attack was broken off. It responded to your name as well as its damaged memory banks permitted. Essentially it is, Doctor. I believe that more happened to it than just damage in the meteor collision. It mentioned the other. The unanswered question is, the other what? Precisely, Doctor. And somehow that programming has been changed. It would seem that Nomad is now seeking out perfect life-forms, perfection being measured by its own relentless logic. Captain, Mister Singh reports that Nomad is no longer in the auxiliary control room. That unit is a woman. Nomad, I have arranged the tapes for flash feed at the top speed of the computer. Please do not draw the information faster than the machine's capacity. Fascinating. Well, Doctor? Captain, if that is correct, if there has been no brain damage but only knowledge erased, she could be re-educated. Does the creator wish Nomad to wait elsewhere? Doctor, I interrupted you because Nomad would not have understood your anger. It has great technical skill, but its reaction to emotion is unpredictable. It almost qualifies as a life-form. The study of it would be of great use, Captain. An almost human stubbornness, Captain. I have been unable to convince Nomad to lower its screens for analysis. Without its co-operation, I can do nothing. Thank you. It is not sufficient, Captain. I get certain references to the accident, the other, but nothing clear. There are areas I simply cannot scan. Captain, I suggest the Vulcan mind probe. It seems the only way. There is a risk, but I have formed a partial hypothesis. I must check it out. I. Am. Nomad. I am performing my function. Deep emptiness, It approaches. Collision. Damage. Blackness. I. Am. The other. I am Tan Ru, Tan Ru. Nomad. Tan Ru. Error. Flaw. Imperfection. Must sterilise. Rebirth. We are complete. Much power. Gun ta. Noo. Icka. Tan Ru. The creator instructs. Search out. Identify. Sterilise imperfections. We are Nomad. We are Nomad. We are complete. We are instructed. Our purpose is clear. Sterilise imperfections. Sterilise imperfections. Nomad. Sterilise. Sterilise. Nomad, sterilise, Fascinating, Captain. The knowledge. The depth. It was, it was damaged in deep space. Undoubtedly, the meteor collision. Its memory banks were destroyed, or most of them. It wandered without purpose, and then it met the other. The other was an alien probe of great power. Somehow they merged, repaired each other, became one. Not the Nomad we lost from Earth. It took from the other a new directive to replace its own. The other was originally programmed to secure and sterilise soil samples from other planets, probably as a prelude to colonisation. I beg your pardon? And it has the power and sophistication to do it. And that is the only thing that has saved us until now. Captain. I've examined the brig. The forcefield door on the security cell is damaged and the guards have vanished. I must assume they are dead. I suspect it is about to re-evaluate its creator. Captain, it may have been unwise to admit to Nomad that you are a biological unit. In Nomad's eyes, you must now undoubtedly appear imperfect. Even worse. Nomad just now made a reference to its launch point, Earth. I do not believe there is much beyond Nomad's capabilities. It will find the Earth infested with imperfect biological units. No response. Since it specifically examined your history, I suggest it has completed its re-evaluation. Undoubtedly. Your logic was impeccable, Captain. We are in grave danger. My congratulations, Captain. A dazzling display of logic. No, sir. Remarkable. The destruction of Nomad was a great waste, Captain. It was a remarkable instrument. Sir?

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['Captain, shields just snapped on. Something heading in at multiwarp speeds.', "It's going to hit.", 'Aye, sir.', "We're losing power, sir.", 'Photon torpedoes armed, sir.', 'Ready, sir.', 'Torpedo away. Direct hit.', "Sir, they've fired another."]
Flattened Dialogue: Captain, shields just snapped on. Something heading in at multiwarp speeds. It's going to hit. Aye, sir. We're losing power, sir. Photon torpedoes armed, sir. Ready, sir. Torpedo away. Direct hit. Sir, they've fired another.

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['Giving them all we got.', 'Shields still holding, sir.', "I'm having to divert the warp engine power into the shields, sir, if you want the protection.", 'Shields still holding, sir, but the drain on the engines is reaching the critical point. Ach, we lost warp manoeuvreing power. Switching to impulse.', "That's problematical, sir.", 'What kind of intelligent creatures can exist in a thing that small?', "Captain, you're not really bringing that thing in here?", 'Energising.', "What's your source of power?", 'Aye, sir.', 'Bridge to Captain.', 'That mechanical beastie is up here.', 'Lieutenant! Keep away from that', 'What are the lot of you staring at me for?', 'How did I get here? How did I', 'That thing did something to Lieutenant Uhura!', 'What did it do to me?', 'Notify the captain. What are you doing here? Watch your panels, everyone. Watch that polymass. Roger, help with the interfactor. Leave that alone.', 'Aye.', 'How are you doing that?', 'Throw your dampers.', 'Cut your circuits, all of them.', "Impossible. It can't go that fast.", 'Aye, sir.', 'Bridge to Captain.', 'Life support systems are out all over the ship.', 'Manual override has been blocked. Source, Engineering.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Energising.']

What kind of intelligent creatures can exist in a thing that small? Captain, you're not really bringing that thing in here? Energising. What's your source of power? Aye, sir. Bridge to Captain. That mechanical beastie is up here. Lieutenant! Keep away from that What are the lot of you staring at me for? How did I get here? How did I That thing did something to Lieutenant Uhura! Throw your dampers. Cut your circuits, all of them. Impossible. It can't go that fast. Aye, sir. Bridge to Captain. Life support systems are out all over the ship. Manual override has been blocked. Source, Engineering. Aye, sir. Energising.

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ["They've got the co-ordinates, Jim. It's locked in.", 'What do we do now, go up and knock?', "Jim, I don't think anybody's in there.", "Well, I'm not the Kirk. Tell me what your function is.", 'Unstable infestation? The population of four planets? What kind of function', "Ridiculous. Earth science couldn't begin to build anything with those capabilities that long ago.", 'Of course. Jackson Roykirk.', "That's not the same.", "As I recall, it wasn't. It was supposed to be the first interstellar probe to seek new life-forms.", "He's dead, Jim.", "There's nothing I can do, Jim. If there's a chance, it'll have to be soon.", "Well, he'll need tapes on general anatomy, the central nervous system, and then one on the physiological structure of the brain. We'd better give it all the neurological studies we have, as well as tracings of Scotty's hyperencephalogram.", 'The body is in Sickbay.', 'I could have told you that without looking.', "It's unbelievable.", 'Take it easy. Lie down, Scotty. We just want to check you out.', "I'd like to check it out, if you don't mind. A man is not just a biological unit that you can patch together.", 'Nurse, I want him prepared for a full physical examination.', "Yes. I'll get on it right away. Oh, and in spite of the way you repaired Scotty, you metal ticking", "That's a laugh.", "How's she doing?", "Well, she checks out with no brain damage. We've got all the educational tapes in our library. Now it's up to us.", 'Captain Kirk to Sickbay. Emergency.', 'I think so. Looks like some kind of shock.', 'Nomad examined the personnel files and the medical histories. She tried to stop him.', 'Yours.', "Jim, with all the systems out we'll only have enough air and heat for", "I thought you might like to know that Lieutenant Uhura is back to college level. She'll be back on the job within a week."]
Flattened Dialogue: They've got the co-ordinates, Jim. It's locked in. What do we do now, go up and knock? Jim, I don't think anybody's in there. Well, I'm not the Kirk. Tell me what your function is. Unstable infestation? The population of four planets? What kind of function Ridiculous. Earth science couldn't begin to build anything with those capabilities that long ago. Of course. Jackson Roykirk. That's not the same. As I recall, it wasn't. It was supposed to be the first interstellar probe to seek new life-forms. He's dead, Jim. There's nothing I can do, Jim. If there's a chance, it'll have to be soon. Well, he'll need tapes on general anatomy, the central nervous system, and then one on the physiological structure of the brain. We'd better give it all the neurological studies we have, as well as tracings of Scotty's hyperencephalogram. The body is in Sickbay. I could have told you that without looking. It's unbelievable. Take it easy. Lie down, Scotty. We just want to check you out. I'd like to check it out, if you don't mind. A man is not just a biological unit that you can patch together. Nurse, I want him prepared for a full physical examination. Yes. I'll get on it right away. Oh, and in spite of the way you repaired Scotty, you metal ticking That's a laugh. How's she doing? Well, she checks out with no brain damage. We've got all the educational tapes in our library. Now it's up to us. Captain Kirk to Sickbay. Emergency. I think so. Looks like some kind of shock. Nomad examined the personnel files and the medical histories. She tried to stop him. Yours. Jim, with all the systems out we'll only have enough air and heat for I thought you might like to know that Lieutenant Uhura is back to college level. She'll be back on the job within a week.

Title: The Changelin
Dialogue: ['No reaction, Doctor.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Sound it out.', "That's it, Uhura. That's very good. Now try the next one.", 'Not Swahili, Uhura. In English. The dog has a ball. See? B, ah, ll. Ball. Now you go ahead.', "That's right! Oh, that's right, Uhura. Oh, here. You try another one. I'll be right back.", "Well, she's on the first grade reader. She's learning. Seems to have an aptitude for mathematics. Do you think we can re-educate her, Doctor?"]

Now you go ahead. That's right! Oh, that's right, Uhura. Oh, here. You try another one. I'll be right back. Well, she's on the first grade reader. She's learning.
