Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['We have shown the council historical proof that our missions are peaceful.', 'I admire your ethics and hope to prove ours. Kirk to Enterprise.', 'Report on magnetic storm, Mister Spock.', 'Rough ride?', 'Stand by to beam up landing party.', 'Plot an extended orbit to clear disturbance. Kirk out.', 'When may we resume discussion?', "But we won't. Consider that. Enterprise. Transporter room, energise.", 'Spock was right. It was a rough trip.', 'No change.', 'None.', "Yes. Doctor McCoy, you'd better look us over. That was a rough beam-up.", 'Mister Spock, have those transporter circuits checked.', 'Not now. Not now.', "I don't know. It's our Enterprise but it isn't. Maybe", 'Any of you feel dizzy when we were in the transporter beam?', 'When we first materialised.', 'It happened twice. First we were in our own transporter chamber, then we faded, and then when we finally materialised, we were here. Wherever this is.', "Yes, here. Not our universe, not our ship. Something parallel. A parallel universe co-existing with ours on another dimensional plane. Everything's duplicated, almost. Another Enterprise. Spock with a beard.", "Then our counterparts must have been transporting up at the exact same time. Similar storms on both universes disrupted the circuits. We're here, and they're on our Enterprise. Probably asking the same questions. Are we in another universe, and if so, how do we get back to our own? They'll use the computer, and we have to.", "Scotty, can you buy me some time. Get below and short out the main phaser couplings. They'll think the storm blew the stand-by circuits.", "Then get on this technology. It's all we have to work with if we want to get back home. The intercom may be monitored. Use your communicators for private messages. Subfrequency and scramble.", 'Lieutenant.', "Get to your post. Run today's communication from Starfleet Command. I want to know my exact orders and options, if any.", 'Bones.', "Uhura, you're the only one who can do it. I'll be right there.", "Bones. Let's take a look at the library. We have a lot to learn.", 'Communications status.', 'Stand by, Mister Sulu.', 'Kirk here.', 'Very good. Thank you, Mister Scott. Kirk out.', 'No.', 'Lieutenant Uhura, contact the Halkan council. I wish to talk to them again.', 'This is a new race. They offer other things of value besides dilithium crystals.', 'Put phasers on standby, Mister Sulu.', "I have my reasons, and I'll make them clear to you in my own good time.", 'It is useless to resist us.', 'You have twelve hours to consider your position.', 'We will level your planet and take what we want. That is destruction. You will die as a race.', 'We will not argue. Twelve hours. No more. Close communications. Turn phasers off.', 'I shall be in my quarters. Lieutenant Uhura, have Doctor McCoy and Mister Scott meet me there.', "You're at liberty to do so, Mister Spock.", 'Yes, he did your job.', 'Get him out of here.', "All right. You're working for me.", "You're in line. You might even make captain.", 'Not on my ship.', 'Yes, the booth. Carry on.', "It's called blood. Watch your step. The officers move up by assassination. Chekov tried it on me.", 'Report on technology.', 'Star readings?', "Let's find out where we stand. Computer.", "This is the Captain. Record security research, to be classified under my voice print or Mister Scott's.", 'Produce all data relevant to the recent ion storm. Correlate following hypothesis. Could a storm of such magnitude cause a power surge in the transporter circuits creating a momentary interdimensional contact with a parallel universe?', 'At such a moment, could persons in each universe, in the act of beaming, transpose with their counterparts in the other universe?', "Could conditions necessary to such an event be created artificially using the ship's power?", 'Record procedure. Scotty, can you do it?', "Let's find out. Computer.", 'Read out official record of current command.', 'Cancel. Now we know.', 'Good.', "I'll tell Uhura to create a diversion to distract Sulu, at your signal. Let's get back to our posts. Keep me advised.", 'On our Enterprise.', 'Why?', 'Logical, as always, Mister Spock.', "I haven't decided.", "I said I haven't decided.", 'You heard my orders.', 'Is that a threat?', 'Spock, do you think we should destroy the Halkans?', 'Conquest is easy, control is not. We may have bitten off more than we can chew.', 'Is my concern, not yours. You would find me a formidable enemy.', 'Release Chekov. Confine him to quarters.', 'He gambled, I won.', 'I was preoccupied.', "Further than that, if I'm successful.", 'Kirk here.', 'Yes.', 'Yes, Mister Spock.', "And if I don't?", "I don't intend to kill him.", "No, but I'll avoid killing Spock.", "I'll get out of his way.", 'Yes.', "It's not that bad.", "Well, if you don't take advantage of your opportunities", "I'll see to it that the circumstances of his failure will clear him.", 'How does Marlena want to fit in?', 'Scotty.', 'We have to get out of here within three hours. Spock has orders to kill me unless I complete the mission.', 'Explain.', 'How fast?', 'If we miss?', "All right. I'll be in the transporter room in ten minutes. I'll meet you in Sickbay afterward.", "I've never seen perfection, but no woman could come closer to it.", 'I still do.', "I've got to go.", "You don't have to do that.", 'You could. I simply meant that you could be anything you want to be.', "You're the Captain's woman until he says you're not.", 'Uhura?', "Scotty's signal should be coming through any moment. You know what to do.", "Keep Sulu's attention off that board.", 'Good luck. Kirk out.', 'What are you doing? Are you going to shoot me now, Spock? I thought I had until dawn.', "Shoot. You're wasting time.", "You're running a big risk, Spock.", 'How much time, Scotty?', 'Everything laid in, Scotty? The time lag so the operator can get into the transporter chamber?', "He is very much like our own Mister Spock, isn't he? You've got that minute.", 'What is this, Mister Sulu?', "Let's go, Bones.", 'No longer.', 'A friend. Activate the transporter. You saved us back at Sickbay with the Tantalus field.', "I can't. I'm sorry. Our power is balanced for four. There's no guarantee that we'll make it with five. All could die. Scotty?", "One is coming. I'd help you if I could, Marlena. Believe that.", "If you kill us, you'll still stay.", "Where's McCoy? Time, Scotty.", 'Auxiliary.', 'Can you bridge to your setup?', 'One of us will have to stay.', 'Get to the transporter chamber. You, too, Uhura.', "That's an order, Scotty.", 'McCoy.', "You're a man of integrity in both universes, Mister Spock.", 'In that time I have something to say. How long before the Halkan prediction of galactic revolt is realised?', 'The inevitable outcome?', 'The illogic of waste, Mister Spock. The waste of lives, potential, resources, time. I submit to you that your Empire is illogical because it cannot endure. I submit that you are illogical to be a willing part of it.', "If change is inevitable, predictable, beneficial, doesn't logic demand that you be a part of it?", 'But one man can change the present. Be the captain of this Enterprise, Mister Spock. Find a logical reason for sparing the Halkans and make it stick. Push till it gives. You can defend yourself better than any man in the fleet.', 'What about it, Spock?', 'In my cabin is a device that will make you invincible.', "What will it be? Past or future? Tyranny or freedom? It's up to you.", "In every revolution, there's one man with a vision.", 'Spock.', "What I don't understand is how were you able to identify our counterparts so quickly?", 'Probably. However, that Jim Kirk will find a few changes, if I read my Spocks correctly.', 'What worries me is the easy way his counterpart fitted into that other universe. I always thought Spock was a bit of a pirate at heart.', "I'm not sure, but I think we've been insulted.", 'Lieutenant, er, Lieutenant?', 'All right, Lieutenant. Carry on.', 'Uh, why do you ask?', "Oh, no. No, no. We haven't met before, exactly. She just seemed a nice, likable girl. I think we could become friends. It's possible."]
Flattened Dialogue: We have shown the council historical proof that our missions are peaceful. I admire your ethics and hope to prove ours. Kirk to Enterprise. Report on magnetic storm, Mister Spock. Rough ride? Stand by to beam up landing party. Plot an extended orbit to clear disturbance. Kirk out. When may we resume discussion? But we won't. Consider that. Enterprise. Transporter room, energise. Spock was right. It was a rough trip. No change. None. Yes. Doctor McCoy, you'd better look us over. That was a rough beam-up. Mister Spock, have those transporter circuits checked. Not now. Not now. I don't know. It's our Enterprise but it isn't. Maybe Any of you feel dizzy when we were in the transporter beam? When we first materialised. It happened twice. First we were in our own transporter chamber, then we faded, and then when we finally materialised, we were here. Wherever this is. Yes, here. Not our universe, not our ship. Something parallel. A parallel universe co-existing with ours on another dimensional plane. Everything's duplicated, almost. Another Enterprise. Spock with a beard. Then our counterparts must have been transporting up at the exact same time. Similar storms on both universes disrupted the circuits. We're here, and they're on our Enterprise. Probably asking the same questions. Are we in another universe, and if so, how do we get back to our own? They'll use the computer, and we have to. Scotty, can you buy me some time. Get below and short out the main phaser couplings. They'll think the storm blew the stand-by circuits. Then get on this technology. It's all we have to work with if we want to get back home. The intercom may be monitored. Use your communicators for private messages. Subfrequency and scramble. Lieutenant. Get to your post. Run today's communication from Starfleet Command. I want to know my exact orders and options, if any. Bones. Uhura, you're the only one who can do it. I'll be right there. Bones. Let's take a look at the library. We have a lot to learn. Communications status. Stand by, Mister Sulu. Kirk here. Very good. Thank you, Mister Scott. Kirk out. No. Lieutenant Uhura, contact the Halkan council. I wish to talk to them again. This is a new race. They offer other things of value besides dilithium crystals. Put phasers on standby, Mister Sulu. I have my reasons, and I'll make them clear to you in my own good time. It is useless to resist us. You have twelve hours to consider your position. We will level your planet and take what we want. That is destruction. You will die as a race. We will not argue. Twelve hours. No more. Close communications. Turn phasers off. I shall be in my quarters. Lieutenant Uhura, have Doctor McCoy and Mister Scott meet me there. You're at liberty to do so, Mister Spock. Yes, he did your job. Get him out of here. All right. You're working for me. You're in line. You might even make captain. Not on my ship. Yes, the booth. Carry on. It's called blood. Watch your step. The officers move up by assassination. Chekov tried it on me. Report on technology. Star readings? Let's find out where we stand. Computer. This is the Captain. Record security research, to be classified under my voice print or Mister Scott's. Produce all data relevant to the recent ion storm. Correlate following hypothesis. Could a storm of such magnitude cause a power surge in the transporter circuits creating a momentary interdimensional contact with a parallel universe? At such a moment, could persons in each universe, in the act of beaming, transpose with their counterparts in the other universe? Could conditions necessary to such an event be created artificially using the ship's power? Record procedure. Scotty, can you do it? Let's find out. Computer. Read out official record of current command. Cancel. Now we know. Good. I'll tell Uhura to create a diversion to distract Sulu, at your signal. Let's get back to our posts. Keep me advised. On our Enterprise. Why? Logical, as always, Mister Spock. I haven't decided. I said I haven't decided. You heard my orders. Is that a threat? Spock, do you think we should destroy the Halkans? Conquest is easy, control is not. We may have bitten off more than we can chew. Is my concern, not yours. You would find me a formidable enemy. Release Chekov. Confine him to quarters. He gambled, I won. I was preoccupied. Further than that, if I'm successful. Kirk here. Yes. Yes, Mister Spock. And if I don't? I don't intend to kill him. No, but I'll avoid killing Spock. I'll get out of his way. Yes. It's not that bad. Well, if you don't take advantage of your opportunities I'll see to it that the circumstances of his failure will clear him. How does Marlena want to fit in? Scotty. We have to get out of here within three hours. Spock has orders to kill me unless I complete the mission. Explain. How fast? If we miss? All right. I'll be in the transporter room in ten minutes. I'll meet you in Sickbay afterward. I've never seen perfection, but no woman could come closer to it. I still do. I've got to go. You don't have to do that. You could. I simply meant that you could be anything you want to be. You're the Captain's woman until he says you're not. Uhura? Scotty's signal should be coming through any moment. You know what to do. Keep Sulu's attention off that board. Good luck. Kirk out. What are you doing? Are you going to shoot me now, Spock? I thought I had until dawn. Shoot. You're wasting time. You're running a big risk, Spock. How much time, Scotty? Everything laid in, Scotty? The time lag so the operator can get into the transporter chamber? He is very much like our own Mister Spock, isn't he? You've got that minute. What is this, Mister Sulu? Let's go, Bones. No longer. A friend. Activate the transporter. You saved us back at Sickbay with the Tantalus field. I can't. I'm sorry. Our power is balanced for four. There's no guarantee that we'll make it with five. All could die. Scotty? One is coming. I'd help you if I could, Marlena. Believe that. If you kill us, you'll still stay. Where's McCoy? Time, Scotty. Auxiliary. Can you bridge to your setup? One of us will have to stay. Get to the transporter chamber. You, too, Uhura. That's an order, Scotty. McCoy. You're a man of integrity in both universes, Mister Spock. In that time I have something to say. How long before the Halkan prediction of galactic revolt is realised? The inevitable outcome? The illogic of waste, Mister Spock. The waste of lives, potential, resources, time. I submit to you that your Empire is illogical because it cannot endure. I submit that you are illogical to be a willing part of it. If change is inevitable, predictable, beneficial, doesn't logic demand that you be a part of it? But one man can change the present. Be the captain of this Enterprise, Mister Spock. Find a logical reason for sparing the Halkans and make it stick. Push till it gives. You can defend yourself better than any man in the fleet. What about it, Spock? In my cabin is a device that will make you invincible. What will it be? Past or future? Tyranny or freedom? It's up to you. In every revolution, there's one man with a vision. Spock. What I don't understand is how were you able to identify our counterparts so quickly? Probably. However, that Jim Kirk will find a few changes, if I read my Spocks correctly. What worries me is the easy way his counterpart fitted into that other universe. I always thought Spock was a bit of a pirate at heart. I'm not sure, but I think we've been insulted. Lieutenant, er, Lieutenant? All right, Lieutenant. Carry on. Uh, why do you ask? Oh, no. No, no. We haven't met before, exactly. She just seemed a nice, likable girl. I think we could become friends. It's possible.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Spock here.', 'Standard ion type, Captain, but quite violent and unpredictable.', 'If we stay.', 'Comply, Mister Sulu.', 'At norm, Mister Kyle. Controls at neutral.', 'Status of mission, Captain?', 'Standard procedure, Captain? Mister Sulu, you will programme phaser barrage on Halkan cities.', 'Their military capability, Captain?', 'Regrettable that this society has chosen suicide. Mister Kyle, you were instructed to compensate during the ion storm.', 'Carelessness with the equipment cannot be tolerated.', 'Your agoniser.', 'Your agoniser, please.', 'Mister Scott, the storm has caused some minor damage in your section. There are also injuries requiring your attention, Doctor. Well, gentlemen?', 'Yes.', 'Due to your error, Mister Kyle?', 'Possibly a result of the severe storm. Captain, do you feel any abnormal effects?', "Planet's rotation is carrying primary target beyond arc of phaser lock.", 'Lock on to secondary city.', 'Captain?', 'But we cannot expect their co-operation. They have refused the Empire. Command procedure dictates that we provide the customary example.', 'A serious breach of orders, Captain.', 'Twelve hours, Captain? That is unprecedented.', "Captain, you've placed yourself in a most grave position. This conduct must be reported.", 'I think not. Your authority on this ship is extremely limited, Captain. The four of you will remain her in the Brig and in custody until I discover how to return you to wherever it is you belong.', 'I can answer none of your questions at this time.', 'Apparently some kind of transposition has taken place. I find it extremely interesting.', 'Fascinating.', "Captain, I am pleased that you frustrated Mister Chekov's plan. I should regret your death.", 'I do not desire the captaincy. I much prefer my scientific duties. I am frankly content to be a lesser target.', "The agony booth is a most effective means of discipline. I presume you've ordered full duration.", 'Indeed. His act warrants death.', 'That is, of course, your affair. Captain, may I inquire if you intend to persist in your unusual course of action regarding the Halkans?', 'They are, of course, in contradiction to standard Empire procedure. You cannot ignore the consequences.', 'I do not threaten, Captain. I merely state facts. I have found you to be an excellent officer. Our missions together have been both successful and profitable. However, I shall not permit your aberrations to jeopardise my position.', 'Terror must be maintained or the Empire is doomed. It is the logic of history.', 'Captain, I do not wish to find myself opposing you, but if you continue on your present course, this confusing, inexplicable behaviour,', "I'm aware of that, Captain. I trust that you are aware of the reverse.", 'Mister Spock, Captain.', 'I have received a private communication from Starfleet Command. I am committing a breach of regulations by informing you of its contents.', 'I am instructed to wait until planet dawn over principal target to permit you to carry out our mission.', 'In that event, I am ordered to kill you and to proceed against the Halkans as the new captain of the Enterprise.', 'Computer?', 'Explain computer activity in the engineering section.', 'Who is conducting the research?', 'What is the nature of the research?', 'Why are you monitoring my communications, Mister Sulu?', 'That is my concern.', 'If I am successful, you see yourself a step nearer to the captaincy. I do not want to command the Enterprise, but if it should befall me, I suggest you remember that my operatives would avenge my death and some of them are Vulcans.', 'Please restrict your movements, Captain.', "I shall make that decision. Since your return from the planet, you've behaved in a most atypical and illogical manner. I want to know why.", "I shall not waste time with you. You're too inflexible, too disciplined once you've made up your mind. But Doctor McCoy has a plenitude of human weaknesses, sentimental, soft. You may not tell me what I want to know, but he will.", 'I have the phaser, Captain, and I do not intend to simply disappear as so many of your opponents have in the past. If you please. Sickbay.', 'Yes, of course. The entire landing party. Captain, stand over there. Doctor, it is time for answers.', 'Why did the captain let me live?', 'Our minds are merging, Doctor. Our minds are one. I feel what you feel. I know what you know.', 'I cut the transporter power. It was necessary to delay your beam-out until I could arrive. Take him.', 'Engineering, re-activate main transporter circuits.', 'You must return to your universe. I must have my captain back. I shall operate the transporter. You have two minutes and ten seconds.', 'Approximately two hundred and forty years.', 'The Empire shall be overthrown, of course.', 'You have one minute and twenty three seconds.', 'One man cannot summon the future.', 'A man must also have the power.', 'Indeed?', 'It is time.', 'Captain Kirk, I shall consider it.', 'Welcome home, Captain.', 'It was far easier for you as civilised men to behave like barbarians, than it was for them as barbarians to behave like civilised men. I assume they returned to their Enterprise at the same time you appeared here.', 'Indeed, gentlemen. May I point out that I had an opportunity to observe your counterparts here quite closely. They were brutal, savage, unprincipled, uncivilised, treacherous, In every way, splendid examples of homo sapiens, the very flower of humanity. I found them quite refreshing.', "You've met her before, Captain?", 'Your reaction, One of recognition.']
Flattened Dialogue: Spock here. Standard ion type, Captain, but quite violent and unpredictable. If we stay. Comply, Mister Sulu. At norm, Mister Kyle. Controls at neutral. Status of mission, Captain? Standard procedure, Captain? Mister Sulu, you will programme phaser barrage on Halkan cities. Their military capability, Captain? Regrettable that this society has chosen suicide. Mister Kyle, you were instructed to compensate during the ion storm. Carelessness with the equipment cannot be tolerated. Your agoniser. Your agoniser, please. Mister Scott, the storm has caused some minor damage in your section. There are also injuries requiring your attention, Doctor. Well, gentlemen? Yes. Due to your error, Mister Kyle? Possibly a result of the severe storm. Captain, do you feel any abnormal effects? Planet's rotation is carrying primary target beyond arc of phaser lock. Lock on to secondary city. Captain? But we cannot expect their co-operation. They have refused the Empire. Command procedure dictates that we provide the customary example. A serious breach of orders, Captain. Twelve hours, Captain? That is unprecedented. Captain, you've placed yourself in a most grave position. This conduct must be reported. I think not. Your authority on this ship is extremely limited, Captain. The four of you will remain her in the Brig and in custody until I discover how to return you to wherever it is you belong. I can answer none of your questions at this time. Apparently some kind of transposition has taken place. I find it extremely interesting. Fascinating. Captain, I am pleased that you frustrated Mister Chekov's plan. I should regret your death. I do not desire the captaincy. I much prefer my scientific duties. I am frankly content to be a lesser target. The agony booth is a most effective means of discipline. I presume you've ordered full duration. Indeed. His act warrants death. That is, of course, your affair. Captain, may I inquire if you intend to persist in your unusual course of action regarding the Halkans? They are, of course, in contradiction to standard Empire procedure. You cannot ignore the consequences. I do not threaten, Captain. I merely state facts. I have found you to be an excellent officer. Our missions together have been both successful and profitable. However, I shall not permit your aberrations to jeopardise my position. Terror must be maintained or the Empire is doomed. It is the logic of history. Captain, I do not wish to find myself opposing you, but if you continue on your present course, this confusing, inexplicable behaviour, I'm aware of that, Captain. I trust that you are aware of the reverse. Mister Spock, Captain. I have received a private communication from Starfleet Command. I am committing a breach of regulations by informing you of its contents. I am instructed to wait until planet dawn over principal target to permit you to carry out our mission. In that event, I am ordered to kill you and to proceed against the Halkans as the new captain of the Enterprise. Computer? Explain computer activity in the engineering section. Who is conducting the research? What is the nature of the research? Why are you monitoring my communications, Mister Sulu? That is my concern. If I am successful, you see yourself a step nearer to the captaincy. I do not want to command the Enterprise, but if it should befall me, I suggest you remember that my operatives would avenge my death and some of them are Vulcans. Please restrict your movements, Captain. I shall make that decision. Since your return from the planet, you've behaved in a most atypical and illogical manner. I want to know why. I shall not waste time with you. You're too inflexible, too disciplined once you've made up your mind. But Doctor McCoy has a plenitude of human weaknesses, sentimental, soft. You may not tell me what I want to know, but he will. I have the phaser, Captain, and I do not intend to simply disappear as so many of your opponents have in the past. If you please. Sickbay. Yes, of course. The entire landing party. Captain, stand over there. Doctor, it is time for answers. Why did the captain let me live? Our minds are merging, Doctor. Our minds are one. I feel what you feel. I know what you know. I cut the transporter power. It was necessary to delay your beam-out until I could arrive. Take him. Engineering, re-activate main transporter circuits. You must return to your universe. I must have my captain back. I shall operate the transporter. You have two minutes and ten seconds. Approximately two hundred and forty years. The Empire shall be overthrown, of course. You have one minute and twenty three seconds. One man cannot summon the future. A man must also have the power. Indeed? It is time. Captain Kirk, I shall consider it. Welcome home, Captain. It was far easier for you as civilised men to behave like barbarians, than it was for them as barbarians to behave like civilised men. I assume they returned to their Enterprise at the same time you appeared here. Indeed, gentlemen. May I point out that I had an opportunity to observe your counterparts here quite closely. They were brutal, savage, unprincipled, uncivilised, treacherous, In every way, splendid examples of homo sapiens, the very flower of humanity. I found them quite refreshing. You've met her before, Captain? Your reaction, One of recognition.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Aye, sir.', 'Yes, Mister Spock.', 'Mister Chekov, phaser setting for planetary target A.', 'Port batteries locked.', 'Still no interest, Uhura? Hmm? I could change your mind.', "Is the captain here? Is Spock here? When the cat's away", 'Phasers Locked on target A, Captain. Approaching optimum range. Commence fire, Captain? Captain?', 'Shall I correct orbit to new firing position?', 'Aye, sir.', 'Secondary target now moving beyond our phaser lock.', 'Aye, sir.', 'My security board has detected extensive use of computer, Mister Spock. I was about to inform you.', "It's not hard to guess the nature of your order from Starfleet Command. I suggest a connection. The captain suspects.", "He's working on escape or defence.", "Correct. It's your play. I hope you succeed, because the order would fall on me next and you know how Captain Kirk's enemies have a habit of disappearing.", "Now you're making sense.", "Any time's a good time.", 'You take a lot of chances, Lieutenant.', 'Mister Spock has orders to kill you, Captain. He will succeed, apparently. You will also appear to have killed him after a fierce battle. Regrettable, but it will leave me in command.']
Flattened Dialogue: Aye, sir. Yes, Mister Spock. Mister Chekov, phaser setting for planetary target A. Port batteries locked. Still no interest, Uhura? Hmm? I could change your mind. Is the captain here? Is Spock here? When the cat's away Phasers Locked on target A, Captain. Approaching optimum range. Commence fire, Captain? Captain? Shall I correct orbit to new firing position? Aye, sir. Secondary target now moving beyond our phaser lock. Aye, sir. My security board has detected extensive use of computer, Mister Spock. I was about to inform you. It's not hard to guess the nature of your order from Starfleet Command. I suggest a connection. The captain suspects. He's working on escape or defence. Correct. It's your play. I hope you succeed, because the order would fall on me next and you know how Captain Kirk's enemies have a habit of disappearing. Now you're making sense. Any time's a good time. You take a lot of chances, Lieutenant. Mister Spock has orders to kill you, Captain. He will succeed, apparently. You will also appear to have killed him after a fierce battle. Regrettable, but it will leave me in command.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Yes, sir.', "What is this? Everything's all messed up and changed around, out of place.", 'No, not everything. That spot, I spilt acid there a year ago. Jim, What in blazes is this?', "An exchange. If we're here", "What about the Halkans? We can't let them be destroyed.", "Here. Here. What's this?", 'And my Sickbay is a chamber of horrors. My assistants were betting on the tolerance of an injured man. How long it would take him to pass out from the pain.', "I'm a doctor, not an engineer.", 'Jim, the way this ship is run, what kind of people are we in this universe?', "Jim, if we're here, what do you suppose our counterparts doing back in our universe?", 'That ought to hold him for about six hours.', "Now it's up to the captain.", "Help me get him on the table. Well, come on. Help me get him on the table. He'll die without immediate treatment.", "We'll get home. This won't take long.", 'Shut up? I can save his life.', "Do you want me to stop, Jim? It'll only take a minute.", "A little time, he'll live.", "I can't let him die, Jim. You get on to the transporter room. I'll be there in five minutes.", 'I guarantee it. Now, go on, please.', 'Jim, I think I liked him with a beard better. It gave him character. Of course almost any change would be a distinct improvement.', "I'm sure."]
Flattened Dialogue: Yes, sir. What is this? Everything's all messed up and changed around, out of place. No, not everything. That spot, I spilt acid there a year ago. Jim, What in blazes is this? An exchange. If we're here What about the Halkans? We can't let them be destroyed. Here. Here. What's this? And my Sickbay is a chamber of horrors. My assistants were betting on the tolerance of an injured man. How long it would take him to pass out from the pain. I'm a doctor, not an engineer. Jim, the way this ship is run, what kind of people are we in this universe? Jim, if we're here, what do you suppose our counterparts doing back in our universe? That ought to hold him for about six hours. Now it's up to the captain. Help me get him on the table. Well, come on. Help me get him on the table. He'll die without immediate treatment. We'll get home. This won't take long. Shut up? I can save his life. Do you want me to stop, Jim? It'll only take a minute. A little time, he'll live. I can't let him die, Jim. You get on to the transporter room. I'll be there in five minutes. I guarantee it. Now, go on, please. Jim, I think I liked him with a beard better. It gave him character. Of course almost any change would be a distinct improvement. I'm sure.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Captain, what is all this?', 'Aye.', 'I did.', 'Captain, the transporter chief mentioned a surge of power. The transporter lock might have been affected by the ion storm and we just materialised somewhere else.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Aye, sir.', "I've been ordered to check phaser couplings for possible damage by the storm.", "Captain's orders.", "Never mind. I'll attend to it.", 'Phaser report, sir. No damage.', 'Mister Sulu is Security Chief, like the ancient Gestapo.', "Mostly variations in instrumentation. Nothing I can't handle.", "Everything's exactly where it should be, except us.", "Not by myself. I'll need help. And you'd be too conspicuous.", "Now you're an engineer. I'll have to tap the power we need from the warp engines and balance it for the four of us.", 'Captain? We can do it.', "We have to lay in the automatic transporter setting, but when we interrupt engine circuits to tie the power increase into the transporter, it'll show up on Sulu's security board. Of course, we'll only need a second.", 'Scotty here, sir.', "We've got another deadline, too, sir.", "The two-way matter transmission affected the local field density between the universes, and it's increasing. The field density between the two universes is starting to close very fast.', "All laid in, sir. Come on, McCoy! We're taking a chance of not getting back home.", "Fourteen minutes. Flattened Dialogue: Captain, what is all this? Aye. I did. Captain, the transporter chief mentioned a surge of power. The transporter lock might have been affected by the ion storm and we just materialised somewhere else. Aye, sir. Aye, sir. I've been ordered to check phaser couplings for possible damage by the storm. Captain's orders. Never mind. I'll attend to it. Phaser report, sir. No damage. Mister Sulu is Security Chief, like the ancient Gestapo. Mostly variations in instrumentation. Nothing I can't handle. Everything's exactly where it should be, except us. Not by myself. I'll need help. And you'd be too conspicuous. Now you're an engineer. I'll have to tap the power we need from the warp engines and balance it for the four of us. Captain? We can do it. We have to lay in the automatic transporter setting, but when we interrupt engine circuits to tie the power increase into the transporter, it'll show up on Sulu's security board. Of course, we'll only need a second. Scotty here, sir. We've got another deadline, too, sir. The two-way matter transmission affected the local field density between the universes, and it's increasing. We've got to move fast. Half hour at the most. We couldn't get out of here in a century. We're ready to bridge power from the engines to the transporter. You've got to get down there and free the board so we can lock in. Give me about ten minutes. I've got to complete a few more computations. Aye, sir. Hardly fifteen minutes, sir. The field density between the two universes is starting to close very fast. All laid in, sir. Come on, McCoy! We're taking a chance of not getting back home. Fourteen minutes. We've got to go! Captain, we've barely got ten minutes. It's working, sir. Five minutes, sir. The power's cut, sir. They're on to us. Aye, it's available. I can get us the power, but the automatic setting is linked to the transporter main. If we bypass, that means that someone has got to operate the controls manually. I'll stay, Captain. Jim. Aye, Captain. Captain, get in the chamber!

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['How did we get in these', "Captain, what's happened?", 'Maybe what, Captain?', 'Yes.', 'Another Captain Kirk, another Doctor McCoy, another', 'Yes, sir.', 'Yes, sir.', "Captain, I'm", 'Yes, sir.', 'You are away from your post, Mister.', "No storm damage, sir. All stations report normal. You're ordered to annihilate the Halkans unless they comply. No alternative.", 'Yes, sir.', 'Captain, I have the leader on the Halkan Council waiting on channel B.', 'Yes, Captain.', "I've got a pretty good idea, sir.", "I'll do my best, sir.", "You aren't very persistent, Mister Sulu. The game has rules. You're ignoring them. I protest and you come back. You didn't come back.", "I was getting bored. Of course this isn't the time.", "I'm afraid I changed my mind. Again.", 'So do you, Mister. So do you. Take over for me.', 'Mister Scott, all clear. On my way to Sickbay.']
Flattened Dialogue: How did we get in these Captain, what's happened? Maybe what, Captain? Yes. Another Captain Kirk, another Doctor McCoy, another Yes, sir. Yes, sir. Captain, I'm Yes, sir. You are away from your post, Mister. No storm damage, sir. All stations report normal. You're ordered to annihilate the Halkans unless they comply. No alternative. Yes, sir. Captain, I have the leader on the Halkan Council waiting on channel B. Yes, Captain. I've got a pretty good idea, sir. I'll do my best, sir. You aren't very persistent, Mister Sulu. The game has rules. You're ignoring them. I protest and you come back. You didn't come back. I was getting bored. Of course this isn't the time. I'm afraid I changed my mind. Again. So do you, Mister. So do you. Take over for me. Mister Scott, all clear. On my way to Sickbay.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Co-ordinates seven one two stroke four, Mister Sulu.', 'Deck five, sir?', 'So you die, Captain, and we all move up in rank. No one will question the assassination of a captain who has disobeyed prime orders of the Empire.']
Flattened Dialogue: Co-ordinates seven one two stroke four, Mister Sulu. Deck five, sir? So you die, Captain, and we all move up in rank. No one will question the assassination of a captain who has disobeyed prime orders of the Empire.

Title: Mirror, Mirror
Dialogue: ['Ready.', 'Recorded.', 'Affirmative.', 'Affirmative.', 'Affirmative.', 'Ready.', 'Captain James T. Kirk succeeded to command ISS Enterprise through assassination of Captain Christopher Pike. First action, suppression of Gorlan uprising through destruction of rebel home planet. Second action, execution of five thousand colonists on Vega Nine.', 'ready.', 'A security research is in progress.', 'The Captain and Mister Scott.', 'Programme is classified under voice index log.']
Flattened Dialogue: Ready. Recorded. Affirmative. Affirmative. Affirmative. Ready. Captain James T. Kirk succeeded to command ISS Enterprise through assassination of Captain Christopher Pike. First action, suppression of Gorlan uprising through destruction of rebel home planet. Second action, execution of five thousand colonists on Vega Nine. ready. A security research is in progress. The Captain and Mister Scott. Programme is classified under voice index log.

Title: The Apple
Dialogue: ['Start your readings.', "It is spectacular, isn't it?", "Well, the last scout ship reported some pretty strange sensor readings. Starfleet wants it investigated and the inhabitants contacted. We do what we're told.", 'Are you sure about that?', 'I know. Almost impossible.', "Just outside Moscow. All right. There's a village about seventeen kilometres away on bearing two three two. We'll head that way.", "What did somebody say? That paradise must've looked like this?", 'As soon as we get out of the way, beam the body up.', 'What is it?', "What's causing it?", "But you say there's nothing to worry about?", "Well, stay on top of it. We've got a job to down here. We might as well finish it.", "Yeah, it's nice. If we're a little more careful, we shouldn't run into any more trouble.", "We'll do the walking, Scotty. You get on the antimatter pod. If it gets worse, let me know, we'll beam up. Kirk out.", "Scotty will handle it. We've got a job to do. Turn up anything on your tricorder?", "That's strange.", 'Mallory.', "We're heading for the village. Avoid contact with the humanoids. I want you and Marple to make a full reconnaissance. And be careful. There may be other dangers besides poisonous plants. Keep in constant communication.", 'What is it?', "Mister Chekov, Yeoman Landon. I know you find each other fascinating, but we're not here to conduct a field experiment in human biology.", 'Whatever it is, it moves like a cat.', "Neither do I. All hands. We've been watched, we'll probably be watched. We're moving out. Formation L.", 'Would you mind being careful where you throw your rocks, Mister Spock?', 'Garden of Eden, with land mines.', 'Kirk here.', 'Why?', "We're heading there now, Scotty. You need any help?", "All right, Scotty. We'll try and find out what's going on down here. Kirk out.", 'Some kind of generator?', "What's that?", 'Peculiar stuff to find in paradise.', 'Kirk to Enterprise.', "We're beaming up. Notify transporter room. And make arrangements to pick up Mallory and Marple. They're scouting ahead of us.", 'All hands.', 'Energise.', "Scotty, energise. Scotty, what's the matter?", "Scotty, is the transporter malfunction tied in with trouble you're having with the antimatter pods?", 'Spock. Are you all right?', 'Just what do you think you were trying to do?', 'Stepped in front and took the thorns yourself.', 'I see. Well next time, just yell. I can step out of the way as quickly as the next man.', 'Trying to get yourself killed. Do you know how much Starfleet has invested in you?', 'Never mind. But thanks. Kaplan, take the post.', "Not only is something after us, but it's after the ship as well.", "Thirty seconds ago, there wasn't a cloud in the sky.", 'Come on!', 'Phasers. A beautiful day, Mister Spock. Not a cloud in the sky. Just like paradise.', 'Kirk here.', 'Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Come in!', 'Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Mallory!', 'On the double.', "Mallory! Marple, stand back! Watch it! The rocks! Kaplan. Hendorff. I know Kaplan's family. Now Mallory.", 'His father helped me get into the Academy.', "I could've prevented all of it.", "A walk in paradise, among the green grass and flowers. We should've beamed up at the first sign of trouble.", "I also have the option to disregard those orders if I consider them overly hazardous. This isn't that important a mission, Spock. Not worth the lives of three of my men. I drop my guard for a minute because I like the smell of growing things, and now three men are dead. And the ship's in trouble.", 'Marple, Chekov, at attention. Gentlemen, something or someone is behind that rock. I want it. Marple, cut around the rock to your right. Make a loud noise. Be careful. Spock, you and Chekov create a diversion and make it loud.', "I won't hurt you. Do you understand? I won't hurt you.", "Well, I won't strike you again. You've been following us, watching us. Why?", 'Who is Vaal?', 'Do you have a name?', "They're not going to hurt you. I promise you. Akuta, Akuta, we come in peace. We would like to speak to this Vaal.", 'Antennae?', 'You speak of the people of Vaal. Are they nearby?', 'Kirk here.', 'Scotty, are the warp drives still out?', 'Put it on maximum. Full emergency circuits.', 'Status, are you still holding?', 'Maintain full reverse thrust against the pull. Put a team on that warp drive. Get it working.', "Scotty, you're my Chief Engineer. You know everything about that ship there is to know. More than the men who designed it. If you can't get those warp engines working", "You're fired.", 'Tell me about Vaal.', 'Take me to him. I wish to speak to him.', "I'll take my chances.", 'But this is not the centre, Mister Spock.', 'A force field?', 'You all right?', 'Akuta, how do you talk to Vaal?', "Well, we can't get to it. We can't talk to it unless it wants to talk to us.", 'When does he get hungry?', 'Where are the others?', 'The children.', 'Little ones like yourselves. They grow.', 'Well, thank you. It does something for you.', 'Nothing makes sense down here. Kirk to Enterprise.', 'Status report, Scotty.', "I'm sick of hearing that word can't. Get that ship out of there.", 'Then use your imagination. Tie every ounce of power the ship has into the impulse engines. Discard the warp drive nacelles if you have to, and crack out of there with the main section, but get that ship out of there!', 'Do it. Kirk out.', 'Report.', 'I see. Opinion.', 'Add to that a simple diet, a perfectly controlled temperature, no natural enemies, apparently no vices, no replacements needed. Maybe it is paradise after all.', 'Mister Spock.', "Well, the field's down, people are going in. Let's see what kind of luck we have.", "That's not the way.", "But it needs to eat. Frequently. So it can't have any great power reserves.", 'What happens if Vaal weakens around feeding time? Spock, check the electromagnetic section of the astrophysics lab. Get an estimate of the total amount of energy being expended against the ship. Have them measure it hour by hour.', 'Mess call.', "Gentlemen, I think this philosophical argument can wait until our ship's out of danger. Kirk here.", 'Did it maintain, Scotty?', 'Good. Keep monitoring. How are you coming along with the circuit switchover?', "That's cutting it a bit fine, Scotty.", 'Kirk out.', "Yeoman, you're wasting energy.", 'Sit down, and have something to eat.', "That hasn't happened yet. I wonder what would happen? Yeoman, speculate. What would happen if someone on this planet died?", 'Accidents happen.', "They'd need a replacement. Opinion, Mister Spock?", "Mister Spock? You're the science officer. Why don't you explain it to the young lady.", "Bones was right. These people aren't living, they're existing. They don't create, they don't produce, they don't even think. They exist to service a machine.", 'These are people, not robots. They should have the opportunity of choice. We owe it to them to interfere.', "I'll take my chances. Why don't you have a look around? Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott?", "How's it going, Scotty?", 'You realise that within forty five minutes, the ship will be pulled down into the atmosphere?', 'Yes, I', 'Kirk out. What is it?', 'Vaal, we are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or your people.', "Let's get out of here!", 'Bones!', 'Marple!', 'Put them in the hut. Find out where the women are. Put them in there, too.', 'All right, Scotty, put her in full reverse. Get her out of there.', 'Scotty, what happened?', "You're fired. Four hundred people", "They'll die because I couldn't see a warning sign. I had to follow orders, always orders.", "Bones, that's it. Stay with Chekov. Keep those people from feeding Vaal. Don't let them feed Vaal. Keep them in the hut. Mister Spock.", 'Scotty, do you still have phaser power?', 'Lock all banks on the co-ordinates of the energy field located down here.', "If my guess is correct, they won't have to. Stand by.", "Good. The ship's pulling away must have weakened it considerable. It has to be fed, but its reserve capacity could hold out for days.", 'My plan exactly. Scotty.', 'Scotty, commence firing and maintain.', "Good. Let's see how long he can do it.", 'Scotty, cease fire.', 'Mister Scott, status report.', "Scotty, you're re-hired. As soon as the transporter's fixed, form an engineering detail with full analytical equipment and beam them down. Kirk out. Chekov, Bones. Let those people go.", "You'll learn to care for yourselves, with our help. And there's no trick to putting fruit on trees. You might enjoy it. You'll learn to build for yourselves, think for yourselves, work for yourselves, and what you create is yours. That's what we call freedom. You'll like it, a lot. And you'll learn something about men and women, the way they're supposed to be. Caring for each other, being happy with each other, being good to each other. That's what we call love. You'll like that, too, a lot. You and your children.", "The little ones? Look like you? Just go on the way you're going. You'll find out.", "Well, that's a good object lesson, Mister Spock. It's an example of what can happen when a machine becomes too efficient, does too much work for you.", "Yes, of course I'm aware of it. Adam and Eve tasted the apple and as a result were driven out of paradise.", 'Doctor, do I understand him correctly? Are you casting me in the role of Satan?', 'Is there anyone on this ship who even remotely looks like Satan?', "No, Mister Spock. I didn't think you would be."]
Flattened Dialogue: Start your readings. It is spectacular, isn't it? Well, the last scout ship reported some pretty strange sensor readings. Starfleet wants it investigated and the inhabitants contacted. We do what we're told. Are you sure about that? I know. Almost impossible. Just outside Moscow. All right. There's a village about seventeen kilometres away on bearing two three two. We'll head that way. What did somebody say? That paradise must've looked like this? As soon as we get out of the way, beam the body up. What is it? What's causing it? But you say there's nothing to worry about? Well, stay on top of it. We've got a job to down here. We might as well finish it. Yeah, it's nice. If we're a little more careful, we shouldn't run into any more trouble. We'll do the walking, Scotty. You get on the antimatter pod. If it gets worse, let me know, we'll beam up. Kirk out. Scotty will handle it. We've got a job to do. Turn up anything on your tricorder? That's strange. Mallory. We're heading for the village. Avoid contact with the humanoids. I want you and Marple to make a full reconnaissance. And be careful. There may be other dangers besides poisonous plants. Keep in constant communication. What is it? Mister Chekov, Yeoman Landon. I know you find each other fascinating, but we're not here to conduct a field experiment in human biology. Whatever it is, it moves like a cat. Neither do I. All hands. We've been watched, we'll probably be watched. We're moving out. Formation L. Would you mind being careful where you throw your rocks, Mister Spock? Garden of Eden, with land mines. Kirk here. Why? We're heading there now, Scotty. You need any help? All right, Scotty. We'll try and find out what's going on down here. Kirk out. Some kind of generator? What's that? Peculiar stuff to find in paradise. Kirk to Enterprise. We're beaming up. Notify transporter room. And make arrangements to pick up Mallory and Marple. They're scouting ahead of us. All hands. Energise. Scotty, energise. Scotty, what's the matter? Scotty, is the transporter malfunction tied in with trouble you're having with the antimatter pods? Spock. Are you all right? Just what do you think you were trying to do? Stepped in front and took the thorns yourself. I see. Well next time, just yell. I can step out of the way as quickly as the next man. Trying to get yourself killed. Do you know how much Starfleet has invested in you? Never mind. But thanks. Kaplan, take the post. Not only is something after us, but it's after the ship as well. Thirty seconds ago, there wasn't a cloud in the sky. Come on! Phasers. A beautiful day, Mister Spock. Not a cloud in the sky. Just like paradise. Kirk here. Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Come in! Mallory. Mallory, you all right? Mallory! On the double. Mallory! Marple, stand back! Watch it! The rocks! Kaplan. Hendorff. I know Kaplan's family. Now Mallory. His father helped me get into the Academy. I could've prevented all of it. A walk in paradise, among the green grass and flowers. We should've beamed up at the first sign of trouble. I also have the option to disregard those orders if I consider them overly hazardous. This isn't that important a mission, Spock. Not worth the lives of three of my men. I drop my guard for a minute because I like the smell of growing things, and now three men are dead. And the ship's in trouble. Marple, Chekov, at attention. Gentlemen, something or someone is behind that rock. I want it. Marple, cut around the rock to your right. Make a loud noise. Be careful. Spock, you and Chekov create a diversion and make it loud. I won't hurt you. Do you understand? I won't hurt you. Well, I won't strike you again. You've been following us, watching us. Why? Who is Vaal? Do you have a name? They're not going to hurt you. I promise you. Akuta, Akuta, we come in peace. We would like to speak to this Vaal. Antennae? You speak of the people of Vaal. Are they nearby? Kirk here. Scotty, are the warp drives still out? Put it on maximum. Full emergency circuits. Status, are you still holding? Maintain full reverse thrust against the pull. Put a team on that warp drive. Get it working. Scotty, you're my Chief Engineer. You know everything about that ship there is to know. More than the men who designed it. If you can't get those warp engines working You're fired. Tell me about Vaal. Take me to him. I wish to speak to him. I'll take my chances. But this is not the centre, Mister Spock. A force field? You all right? Akuta, how do you talk to Vaal? Well, we can't get to it. We can't talk to it unless it wants to talk to us. When does he get hungry? Where are the others? The children. Little ones like yourselves. They grow. Well, thank you. It does something for you. Nothing makes sense down here. Kirk to Enterprise. Status report, Scotty. I'm sick of hearing that word can't. Get that ship out of there. Then use your imagination. Tie every ounce of power the ship has into the impulse engines. Discard the warp drive nacelles if you have to, and crack out of there with the main section, but get that ship out of there! Do it. Kirk out. Report. I see. Opinion. Add to that a simple diet, a perfectly controlled temperature, no natural enemies, apparently no vices, no replacements needed. Maybe it is paradise after all. Mister Spock. Well, the field's down, people are going in. Let's see what kind of luck we have. That's not the way. But it needs to eat. Frequently. So it can't have any great power reserves. What happens if Vaal weakens around feeding time? Spock, check the electromagnetic section of the astrophysics lab. Get an estimate of the total amount of energy being expended against the ship. Have them measure it hour by hour. Mess call. Gentlemen, I think this philosophical argument can wait until our ship's out of danger. Kirk here. Did it maintain, Scotty? Good. Keep monitoring. How are you coming along with the circuit switchover? That's cutting it a bit fine, Scotty. Kirk out. Yeoman, you're wasting energy. Sit down, and have something to eat. That hasn't happened yet. I wonder what would happen? Yeoman, speculate. What would happen if someone on this planet died? Accidents happen. They'd need a replacement. Opinion, Mister Spock? Mister Spock? You're the science officer. Why don't you explain it to the young lady. Bones was right. These people aren't living, they're existing. They don't create, they don't produce, they don't even think. They exist to service a machine. These are people, not robots. They should have the opportunity of choice. We owe it to them to interfere. I'll take my chances. Why don't you have a look around? Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott? How's it going, Scotty? You realise that within forty five minutes, the ship will be pulled down into the atmosphere? Yes, I Kirk out. What is it? Vaal, we are on a peaceful mission. We mean no harm to you or your people. Let's get out of here! Bones! Marple! Put them in the hut. Find out where the women are. Put them in there, too. All right, Scotty, put her in full reverse. Get her out of there. Scotty, what happened? You're fired. Four hundred people They'll die because I couldn't see a warning sign. I had to follow orders, always orders. Bones, that's it. Stay with Chekov. Keep those people from feeding Vaal. Don't let them feed Vaal. Keep them in the hut. Mister Spock. Scotty, do you still have phaser power? Lock all banks on the co-ordinates of the energy field located down here. If my guess is correct, they won't have to. Stand by. Good. The ship's pulling away must have weakened it considerable. It has to be fed, but its reserve capacity could hold out for days. My plan exactly. Scotty. Scotty, commence firing and maintain. Good. Let's see how long he can do it. Scotty, cease fire. Mister Scott, status report. Scotty, you're re-hired. As soon as the transporter's fixed, form an engineering detail with full analytical equipment and beam them down. Kirk out. Chekov, Bones. Let those people go. You'll learn to care for yourselves, with our help. And there's no trick to putting fruit on trees. You might enjoy it. You'll learn to build for yourselves, think for yourselves, work for yourselves, and what you create is yours. That's what we call freedom. You'll like it, a lot. And you'll learn something about men and women, the way they're supposed to be. Caring for each other, being happy with each other, being good to each other. That's what we call love. You'll like that, too, a lot. You and your children. The little ones? Look like you? Just go on the way you're going. You'll find out. Well, that's a good object lesson, Mister Spock. It's an example of what can happen when a machine becomes too efficient, does too much work for you. Yes, of course I'm aware of it. Adam and Eve tasted the apple and as a result were driven out of paradise. Doctor, do I understand him correctly? Are you casting me in the role of Satan? Is there anyone on this ship who even remotely looks like Satan? No, Mister Spock. I didn't think you would be.

Title: The Apple
Dialogue: ['Well, I just might stake out a claim and settle down here, Jim.', "It's a shame to have to intrude.", 'More like the Garden of Eden, Ensign.', 'Dead.', "Jim, I don't like this.", "Some of the thorns like those that killed Hendorff. See the stuff on the end? It's like saplin, only it's a thousand times stronger.", "I filled him with enough masiform D to make the whole crew turn handsprings, and he's not responding. Got to get him back to the ship, Jim.", "If your blood were red instead of green, you wouldn't have an upset stomach.", "Jim, you couldn't have stopped any of this.", 'Well, there goes paradise.', 'Incredible.', "I just ran a thorough check on the natives, and there's a complete lack of harmful bacteria in their systems, no decalcification, no degeneration of tissue, no arteriosclerosis. In simple terms, Jim, they're not growing old, and I can't begin to tell you how old they are, twenty years or twenty thousand years.", "What's going on, Jim?", 'It would take a computerised Vulcan mind such as yours to make that kind of a statement.', 'There are certain absolutes, Mister Spock, and one of them is the right of humanoids to a free and unchained environment, the right to have conditions which permit growth.', "Jim, you're not just going to stand by and be blinded to what's going on here. These are humanoids, intelligent. They need to advance and grow. Don't you understand what my readings indicate? There's been no progress here in at least ten thousand years. This isn't life. It's stagnation.", "It might work for you, Mister Spock, but it doesn't work for me. Humanoids living so they can service a hunk of tin.", "From a machine? That I'd like to see.", "Second degree burns. Not serious, but I'll bet they smart.", 'Jim', 'Fine time to ring the dinner bell.', "I don't agree with you at all, Mister Spock.", 'Jim, I want you to hear this.', 'We put those people back on a normal course of social evolution. I see nothing wrong in that.']
Flattened Dialogue: Well, I just might stake out a claim and settle down here, Jim. It's a shame to have to intrude. More like the Garden of Eden, Ensign. Dead. Jim, I don't like this. Some of the thorns like those that killed Hendorff. See the stuff on the end? It's like saplin, only it's a thousand times stronger. I filled him with enough masiform D to make the whole crew turn handsprings, and he's not responding. Got to get him back to the ship, Jim. If your blood were red instead of green, you wouldn't have an upset stomach. Jim, you couldn't have stopped any of this. Well, there goes paradise. Incredible. I just ran a thorough check on the natives, and there's a complete lack of harmful bacteria in their systems, no decalcification, no degeneration of tissue, no arteriosclerosis. In simple terms, Jim, they're not growing old, and I can't begin to tell you how old they are, twenty years or twenty thousand years. What's going on, Jim? It would take a computerised Vulcan mind such as yours to make that kind of a statement. There are certain absolutes, Mister Spock, and one of them is the right of humanoids to a free and unchained environment, the right to have conditions which permit growth. Jim, you're not just going to stand by and be blinded to what's going on here. These are humanoids, intelligent. They need to advance and grow. Don't you understand what my readings indicate? There's been no progress here in at least ten thousand years. This isn't life. It's stagnation. It might work for you, Mister Spock, but it doesn't work for me. Humanoids living so they can service a hunk of tin. From a machine? That I'd like to see. Second degree burns. Not serious, but I'll bet they smart. Jim Fine time to ring the dinner bell. I don't agree with you at all, Mister Spock. Jim, I want you to hear this. We put those people back on a normal course of social evolution. I see nothing wrong in that.

Title: The Apple
Dialogue: ['The soil here is remarkably rich and fertile, Captain. Husbandry would be quite efficacious.', "Oh, quite sure. Readings indicate the entire planet is covered with growth like this. Curious, even at the poles there's very little variation in temperature which maintains a planet-wide average of seventy six degrees.", 'I find that most unusual, Captain.', 'Indeed. Subsurface vibrations for miles in all directions.', 'Quite strong, fairly regular, artificially produced.', 'Captain.', "There's a humanoid hiding directly behind us, moving with remarkable agility, bearing one eight.", 'A visitor. One wanting to retain his anonymity, I should say.', 'Anything?', 'Interesting. Extremely low specific gravity, some uraninite, hornblende, quartz. Fragile, good cleavage. An analysis should prove interesting.', 'Obviously highly unstable, Captain. This could be a find of some importance. In large quantities, it could be a considerable source of power.', 'If Scott is correct about the force from the surface, it may have to do with the vibrations I read earlier.', 'If so, an immense one. Probably subterranean.', 'Jim!', "Doctor McCoy's potion is acting like all his potions, turning my stomach. Other than that, I am quite well.", 'I surmised you were unaware of that plant, so I', 'I assure you, Captain, I had no intention of doing that.
