Title: The Apple
Dialogue: ['It makes me homesick. Just like Russia.', 'Of course, Doctor. The Garden of Eden was just outside Moscow. A very nice place. It must have made Adam and Eve very sad to leave.', 'What is it, Mister Spock?', "If you insist on worrying, worry about me. I've been wanting to get you in a place like this for a long time.", 'I was about to take some readings.', 'Mind your own business, sir! For your information, I have a very high efficiency rating.', 'What do you want, violence?', "Now we're welcome. A while ago this whole planet was trying to kill us. It doesn't make sense.", 'Any place we can be together is paradise.', "I don't know.", "Martha, I don't know. But if we do have to stay here, would it be so very bad?", 'Get back in there.', 'Get back in there. Now!']
Flattened Dialogue: It makes me homesick. Just like Russia. Of course, Doctor. The Garden of Eden was just outside Moscow. A very nice place. It must have made Adam and Eve very sad to leave. What is it, Mister Spock? If you insist on worrying, worry about me. I've been wanting to get you in a place like this for a long time. I was about to take some readings. Mind your own business, sir! For your information, I have a very high efficiency rating. What do you want, violence? Now we're welcome. A while ago this whole planet was trying to kill us. It doesn't make sense. Any place we can be together is paradise. I don't know. Martha, I don't know. But if we do have to stay here, would it be so very bad? Get back in there. Get back in there. Now!

Title: The Apple
Dialogue: ["Aye, Captain. It's a shame about Hendorff.", 'We seem to have a problem here, too.', "We're losing potency in our antimatter pods. I don't think it's serious, but we're looking into it.", "I'm not sure, sir, but we've run measurements on the electromagnetic field of the planet, and they are a wee bit abnormal. That might have something to do with it.", "Well, sir, I didn't exactly say that.", "I hear it's nice down there.", 'I could do with a nice walk in a garden with green leaves and grass.', 'Enterprise to Captain Kirk.', 'Scott, sir. Our antimatter pods are completely inert.', "I couldn't stop it, but I know why.", "Something from the surface. It's like a pail of water on a fire. A beam, maybe, or a transmission. And it's still on. I'm having it analysed, but it's like nothing I've seen before.", "And it's pinpointed in the area of that village we located down there.", "There's nothing you can do about it, sir.", "There doesn't seem to be any immediate danger.", 'Scott here, sir.', 'Aye, aye, sir. Transporter room, stand by to beam up landing party.', 'Standing by, sir.', 'Energise.', "We can't make transporter contact, sir. The entire system's inhibited. The way it is now, we couldn't beam up a fly.", "I don't know, sir. I'll check it and get back with you. Scott out.", 'Enterprise to Captain Kirk.', 'Condition red. Condition red. Captain, something has grabbed us from the planet surface', "Like a giant tractor beam, and we can't break loose.", 'Aye, sir. All we have is impulse power.', "They're all on, Captain.", 'Kyle?', 'Computer banks, Kyle. Feed in a rate, get me a figure. We might be able to pull out with warp drive, but without it', "We're like a fly on fly paper. Even worse", "We're starting to lose ground. Hurry up on that figure, Kyle.", "I've done that, Captain. They haven't been able to do a thing. It's no good, Captain. With maximum thrust against the pull", "We'll only be able to maintain full power for sixteen hours, then we burn up for sure.", "I'll do everything there is to do, sir. Scott out.", 'Scott here.', "No change, Captain. The orbit is decaying along computed lines. No success with the warp drive. We're going down and we can't stop it.", "Sir, we're doing everything within engineering reason.", "Sir, I'm going to switch over everything but the life-support systems and boost the impulse power, but that's just about as dangerous.", 'Scotty, sir. We have a reading on the power source Mister Spock requested. When we first monitored, it was generating alternating cycles totalling one hundred to the twentieth power Waltham units.', "No, sir. Power's dropping bit by bit. Nominal, but a definite drain.", "We're putting everything but the kitchen sink into impulse power, sir. It will take us another eight hours to complete the work.", "Aye, but if we don't break out, I'd rather we didn't have to wait too long for the end of it.", 'Here, sir.', 'Almost ready, sir. We need half an hour yet.', "I know that. As you said, that's cutting things fine.", "We're ready here, sir. All available power has been channelled into the impulse engines. We have twelve minutes before entering atmosphere.", 'Full reverse, Mister Kyle, all engines.', "Captain, we're doing it. We're pulling away!", "Captain, we've pulled away a little. We gained maybe an hour, but we blew almost every system in the ship doing it.", "There's nothing left to try again. I guess you'll have to fire me, sir.", 'Aye, but what', "Aye, sir, but they won't penetrate that force field.", 'Scott here, sir.', 'Mister Kyle, all phasers commence firing.', 'Tractor beam gone. Potency returning to antimatter pods.', "I'll have all engineering sections working on the circuits immediately. Transporter'll be ready in an hour."]
Flattened Dialogue: Aye, Captain. It's a shame about Hendorff. We seem to have a problem here, too. We're losing potency in our antimatter pods. I don't think it's serious, but we're looking into it. I'm not sure, sir, but we've run measurements on the electromagnetic field of the planet, and they are a wee bit abnormal. That might have something to do with it. Well, sir, I didn't exactly say that. I hear it's nice down there. I could do with a nice walk in a garden with green leaves and grass. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Scott, sir. Our antimatter pods are completely inert. I couldn't stop it, but I know why. Something from the surface. It's like a pail of water on a fire. A beam, maybe, or a transmission. And it's still on. I'm having it analysed, but it's like nothing I've seen before. And it's pinpointed in the area of that village we located down there. There's nothing you can do about it, sir. There doesn't seem to be any immediate danger. Scott here, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Transporter room, stand by to beam up landing party. Standing by, sir. Energise. We can't make transporter contact, sir. The entire system's inhibited. The way it is now, we couldn't beam up a fly. I don't know, sir. I'll check it and get back with you. Scott out. Enterprise to Captain Kirk. Condition red. Condition red. Captain, something has grabbed us from the planet surface Like a giant tractor beam, and we can't break loose. Aye, sir. All we have is impulse power. They're all on, Captain. Kyle? Computer banks, Kyle. Feed in a rate, get me a figure. We might be able to pull out with warp drive, but without it We're like a fly on fly paper. Even worse We're starting to lose ground. Hurry up on that figure, Kyle. I've done that, Captain. They haven't been able to do a thing. It's no good, Captain. With maximum thrust against the pull We'll only be able to maintain full power for sixteen hours, then we burn up for sure. I'll do everything there is to do, sir. Scott out. Scott here. No change, Captain. The orbit is decaying along computed lines. No success with the warp drive. We're going down and we can't stop it. Sir, we're doing everything within engineering reason. Sir, I'm going to switch over everything but the life-support systems and boost the impulse power, but that's just about as dangerous. Scotty, sir. We have a reading on the power source Mister Spock requested. When we first monitored, it was generating alternating cycles totalling one hundred to the twentieth power Waltham units. No, sir. Power's dropping bit by bit. Nominal, but a definite drain. We're putting everything but the kitchen sink into impulse power, sir. It will take us another eight hours to complete the work. Aye, but if we don't break out, I'd rather we didn't have to wait too long for the end of it. Here, sir. Almost ready, sir. We need half an hour yet. I know that. As you said, that's cutting things fine. We're ready here, sir. All available power has been channelled into the impulse engines. We have twelve minutes before entering atmosphere. Full reverse, Mister Kyle, all engines. Captain, we're doing it. We're pulling away! Captain, we've pulled away a little. We gained maybe an hour, but we blew almost every system in the ship doing it. There's nothing left to try again. I guess you'll have to fire me, sir. Aye, but what Aye, sir, but they won't penetrate that force field. Scott here, sir. Mister Kyle, all phasers commence firing. Tractor beam gone. Potency returning to antimatter pods. I'll have all engineering sections working on the circuits immediately. Transporter'll be ready in an hour.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Dialogue: ['Can you pinpoint it any closer, Lieutenant?', "But that's incredible. The star in this system is still intact. Only a nova could destroy like that.", 'Continue a search pattern.', "Every solar system in this sector blasted to rubble and still no sign of the Constellation. Matt Decker's in command. What could have happened to him?", 'Try to raise it, Lieutenant.', 'Approach course, Mister Sulu.', "It's the Constellation. Look at that.", 'She was attacked. Red alert! Red alert! Man your battle stations!', 'Mister Sulu?', 'Very good. Initiate a full sensor scan of the immediate area for any other vessel.', 'Lieutenant Palmer.', 'Keep trying. Mister Spock, full evaluation of the damage to the Constellation.', 'Life support systems?', 'Radiation levels?', 'All hands, go to Yellow Alert. Stand by battle stations. Lieutenant, have Doctor McCoy, Mister Scott, and a damage control party report to me in the transporter room.', "We're going to board her. Mister Spock, you're in command.", "Scotty, check the phaser banks. See if they've been fired. Bones, you come with me.", "No clutter, no half-empty cups of coffee. Whatever happened didn't happen without a warning.", "The crew wasn't abducted, they just left. Kirk to Enterprise.", 'No survivors, no bodies either.', 'Is it possible they could have beamed down to one of the two planets?', "We'll continue our search. Kirk out.", 'Phaser banks?', "But where are they? I can't imagine a man like Matt Decker abandoning ship while his life support systems were still operative.", "Matt. Matt, it's Jim Kirk.", 'Matt? Matt.', 'What happened to your ship, Matt?', 'What thing? What was it?', 'Answer me! What was it? What happened, Matt?', 'Go.', 'The fourth planet. Only two left now. Scotty, pull the microtapes from the sensor memory banks and beam them aboard to Spock. I want a full analysis, a complete report of what happened when they went in on that planet.', 'What happened to your crew?', 'What hit? What attacked you?', "Matt, where's your crew?", 'There is no third planet.', 'Go.', 'Deactivated? Scotty, could some kind of general energy dampening field do that, and would the same type of thing account for the heavy subspace interference?', 'What does it look like?', 'What is it, an alien ship? Or is it alive, or is it', 'Matt, your log stated that the fourth planet was breaking up. You went in to investigate.', 'Did you run a scanner check on it? What kind of a beam?', 'Kirk here.', "What about the Constellation's tapes?", 'A robot weapon that purposely destroys entire solar systems. Why?', 'What is the projected course of this thing?', 'Thank you. Stand by, Mister Spock. Kirk out.', "We don't know. An alien race, apparently from another galaxy.", 'Bones, did you ever hear of a doomsday machine?', "It's a weapon built primarily as a bluff. It's never meant to be used. So strong, it could destroy both sides in a war. Something like the old H-Bomb was supposed to be. That's what I think this is. A doomsday machine that somebody used in a war uncounted years ago. They don't exist anymore, but the machine is still destroying.", 'Take it easy.', "There's no ship to leave. It's a dead hulk! We'll take her in tow. I'll stay onboard and get her ready. You go back to the Enterprise with the doctor and let him help you.", 'Kirk to Enterprise. Have the transporter room beam Doctor McCoy and Commodore Decker on board immediately.', "We're blind here. What's it look like?", "Whatever it is, we can't let it go beyond us to the next solar system. We have to stop it. If it's a robot, what are the chances of deactivating it?", 'All right. Lower your deflector screens Long enough to beam us aboard.', 'Kirk here.', "Spock? Spock? Come in, Spock. Spock? We're stuck, blind, and deaf.", "Well, we just can't stand around while our ship is being attacked. Scotty, you've got to get me some manoeuvering power.", 'Then get me impulse power. Half-speed, quarter-speed, anything. If we get this hulk moving, maybe we can do something.', 'Then get moving.', "Washburn, you get in there. Let's see what we can do about this viewing screen. I've got to find out what's happening out there.", 'Kirk here.', 'What about the warp drive control circuits?', "You worry about your miracles, Scotty, I'll worry about mine. Get to work.", 'Washburn, try the 2G6 circuit.', 'Ready to give it a try?', 'Scotty, how you doing?', "Yes, I think What the devil's going on?", "Kirk to Enterprise. Come in. Enterprise, come in. Mister Spock, come in. Kirk to Enterprise. Scotty, where's that power?", 'Washburn, get down to Engineering. Assist Mister Scott.', 'Scotty, push it right to the edge. This ship has got to manoeuver.', 'Scotty, give me that power.', "That'll do. Full ahead, Mister Scott.", "That's it, Mister Scott. Keep that power coming.", 'Keep pouring it on, Scotty.', "We're moving, the Enterprise isn't. Maybe that thing will see us and let the Enterprise go. If I only had some phasers.", "Scotty, you've just earned your pay for the week. Stand by. Fire phasers.", "Mister Scott, it worked. Great. I think it's great. Scotty, get us out of here.", 'Enterprise. Enterprise, come in.', "Matt. What's going on? Give me Mister Spock.", 'What happened to Spock?', "You mean you're the lunatic who's responsible for almost destroying my ship?", 'Give me Spock.', "There's only one thing I want to say to you, Commodore. Get my ship out of there.", 'Mister Spock, ship status.', 'How long to repair warp drive?', 'Take evasive action, Mister Sulu.', "Not with my ship, you don't.", "Mister Spock, relieve Commodore Decker immediately. That's a direct order.", 'Blast regulations! Mister Spock, I order you to assume command on my personal authority as Captain of the Enterprise.', 'Good. Now, Mister Spock', 'Fine. Just make sure you stay ahead of it.', 'Yes, Scotty.', 'Keep it going, Scotty, keep it going. Mister Spock.', "I'm plotting an intercept course. Will rendezvous with you at fourteen thirteen point seven hours.", 'Kirk to Enterprise. Why are you launching a shuttlecraft?', "This is Kirk. Matt, you'll be killed.", 'No one expects you to die for an error in judgment.', "Matt. Matt, listen to me. You can't throw your life away like this. Matt, you're a starship commander. That makes you a valuable commodity.", 'We need you, your experience, your judgment. Matt!', "We're stronger with you than without you!", 'Kirk here.', "It's regrettable that he died for nothing.", 'What about that, Spock? Is it possible?', 'Negative.', 'Mister Scott and I will stay here, but beam the damage control party aboard.', 'Except possibly the destruction of that thing out there. Carry out your orders, Mister Spock.', "Spock, listen. Maybe Matt Decker didn't die for nothing. He had the right idea but not enough power to do it. Am I correct in assuming that a fusion explosion of ninety seven megatons will result if a starship impulse engine is overloaded?", 'Ninety seven point eight three five. Will it be powerful enough to destroy that thing out there?', 'Not through it, Spock, from inside it. Will it be enough?', 'Do the best you can and make it fast. Kirk to Scott.', "Good. Scotty, can you set the ship's impulse engines to overload?", 'I want you to rig a thirty second delay detonation device, and rig it so that it can be blown from up here.', 'Set it and get up here as fast as you can.', "Spock, you don't know?", "I intend to get a lot closer. I'm going to ram her right down that thing's throat.", "No. No, I don't intend to die, Mister Spock. We've rigged a delay detonation device. You'll have thirty seconds to beam me aboard the Enterprise before the Constellation's impulse engines blow.", 'A calculated risk, Mister Spock.', "A chance I'll have to take. Kirk out.", 'What about the detonator?', 'Understood. Mister Spock. Prepare to beam Scotty on board.', 'Thank you.', "I can't. Power level's dropping too fast. You'd better hurry.", 'Prepare to beam me aboard on my signal.', 'Beam me aboard.', 'Gentlemen, beam me aboard.', 'Gentlemen, I suggest you beam me aboard.', 'Mister Sulu, ease us back to minimum headway. Conserve power as much as possible. Lieutenant Palmer, tell Mister Scott to expedite repairs on the warp drive. Poor Matt. He gave his life in an attempt to save others. Not the worst way to go.', "Indeed it shall, Mister Spock. Ironic, isn't it? Way back in the 20th century, the H-Bomb was the ultimate weapon, their doomsday machine, and we used something like it to destroy another doomsday machine. Probably the first time such a weapon has ever been used for constructive purposes.", 'Well, I certainly hope not. I found one quite sufficient.']

I think it's great. Scotty, get us out of here. Enterprise. Enterprise, come in. Matt. What's going on? Give me Mister Spock. What happened to Spock? You mean you're the lunatic who's responsible for almost destroying my ship? Give me Spock. There's only one thing I want to say to you, Commodore. Get my ship out of there. Mister Spock, ship status. How long to repair warp drive? Take evasive action, Mister Sulu. Not with my ship, you don't. Mister Spock, relieve Commodore Decker immediately. That's a direct order. Blast regulations! Mister Spock, I order you to assume command on my personal authority as Captain of the Enterprise. Good. Now, Mister Spock Fine. Just make sure you stay ahead of it. Yes, Scotty. Keep it going, Scotty, keep it going. Mister Spock. I'm plotting an intercept course. Will rendezvous with you at fourteen thirteen point seven hours. Kirk to Enterprise. Why are you launching a shuttlecraft? This is Kirk. Matt, you'll be killed. No one expects you to die for an error in judgment. Matt. Matt, listen to me. You can't throw your life away like this. Matt, you're a starship commander. That makes you a valuable commodity. We need you, your experience, your judgment. Matt! We're stronger with you than without you! Kirk here. It's regrettable that he died for nothing. What about that, Spock? Is it possible? Negative. Mister Scott and I will stay here, but beam the damage control party aboard. Except possibly the destruction of that thing out there. Carry out your orders, Mister Spock. Spock, listen. Maybe Matt Decker didn't die for nothing. He had the right idea but not enough power to do it. Am I correct in assuming that a fusion explosion of ninety seven megatons will result if a starship impulse engine is overloaded? Ninety seven point eight three five. Will it be powerful enough to destroy that thing out there? Not through it, Spock, from inside it. Will it be enough? Do the best you can and make it fast. Kirk to Scott. Good. Scotty, can you set the ship's impulse engines to overload? I want you to rig a thirty second delay detonation device, and rig it so that it can be blown from up here. Set it and get up here as fast as you can. Spock, you don't know? I intend to get a lot closer. I'm going to ram her right down that thing's throat. No. No, I don't intend to die, Mister Spock. We've rigged a delay detonation device. You'll have thirty seconds to beam me aboard the Enterprise before the Constellation's impulse engines blow. A calculated risk, Mister Spock. A chance I'll have to take. Kirk out. What about the detonator? Understood. Mister Spock. Prepare to beam Scotty on board. Thank you. I can't. Power level's dropping too fast. You'd better hurry. Prepare to beam me aboard on my signal. Beam me aboard. Gentlemen, beam me aboard. Gentlemen, I suggest you beam me aboard. Mister Sulu, ease us back to minimum headway. Conserve power as much as possible. Lieutenant Palmer, tell Mister Scott to expedite repairs on the warp drive. Poor Matt. He gave his life in an attempt to save others. Not the worst way to go. Indeed it shall, Mister Spock. Ironic, isn't it? Way back in the 20th century, the H-Bomb was the ultimate weapon, their doomsday machine, and we used something like it to destroy another doomsday machine. Probably the first time such a weapon has ever been used for constructive purposes. Well, I certainly hope not. I found one quite sufficient.

Title: The Doomsday Machine
Dialogue: ["Sir, we're now within the limits of System L-370, but I can't seem to locate", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Entering limits of System L-374, sir. Scanners show the same evidence of destruction.', 'All phaser banks manned and ready, sir.', 'Aye, sir.', 'No other vessels in the area, Captain. All scanners show clear.', "It's closing on us, Mister Spock.", 'Aye, sir.', "It's veering off, back on course for the next solar system. The Rigel colony, sir.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Closing fast.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Direct hit. It just bounced off.', "We can't break loose!", "We haven't got it. We're being pulled inside.", "Aye, sir. We still can't move.", "We're loose, Commodore.", 'Standing by, sir.', "We're moving away, Commodore.", "It's closing with us again, sir.", "It's sucking in space rubble from those destroyed planets. Refueling itself.", "It's gaining on us, sir.", 'Mark twenty one, sir.', "Mister Spock, someone's opening the shuttlecraft bay doors.", "It's too late, sir.", "Mister Spock, sensors indicate a minute drop in the machine's power emanations. Do you think the shuttlecraft explosion might have done some damage?", "He's two thousand miles from the planet killer and closing fast.", 'Fifteen hundred miles and closing.', 'One thousand miles and closing.', 'Five hundred miles and closing.', 'Sixty, fifty, forty', 'Thirty.', 'Ten', 'Nine, eight', 'Seven.', 'Six.', 'Five, four']
Flattened Dialogue: Sir, we're now within the limits of System L-370, but I can't seem to locate Aye, aye, sir. Entering limits of System L-374, sir. Scanners show the same evidence of destruction. All phaser banks manned and ready, sir. Aye, sir. No other vessels in the area, Captain. All scanners show clear. It's closing on us, Mister Spock. Aye, sir. It's veering off, back on course for the next solar system. The Rigel colony, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Closing fast. Aye, aye, sir. Direct hit. It just bounced off. We can't break loose! We haven't got it. We're being pulled inside. Aye, sir. We still can't move. We're loose, Commodore. Standing by, sir. We're moving away, Commodore. It's closing with us again, sir. It's sucking in space rubble from those destroyed planets. Refueling itself. It's gaining on us, sir. Mark twenty one, sir. Mister Spock, someone's opening the shuttlecraft bay doors. It's too late, sir. Mister Spock, sensors indicate a minute drop in the machine's power emanations. Do you think the shuttlecraft explosion might have done some damage? He's two thousand miles from the planet killer and closing fast. Fifteen hundred miles and closing. One thousand miles and closing. Five hundred miles and closing. Sixty, fifty, forty Thirty. Title: The Doomsday Machine
Dialogue: ['Captain, sensors show this entire solar system has been destroyed. Nothing left but rubble and asteroids.', 'Nonetheless, Captain, sensors show nothing but debris where we charted seven planets last year.', 'Captain, the two inner most planets of this system appear to be intact.', 'I have it on the sensors, Captain. By configuration, a starship stopped in space. She appears to be drifting.', 'Sensors not recording normal energy output.', 'She may have been wrecked by whatever destroyed these solar systems.', 'All power plants dead, reserve energy banks operative at a very low power level.', 'Also operative at a low power level. The entire Bridge is damaged and uninhabitable. The rest of the ship seems able to sustain life.', 'Normal, but subspace interference makes readings difficult.', 'Acknowledged.', 'Enterprise, Spock here.', 'Improbable, Captain. The surface temperature of the inner planet is that of molten lead. The other has an atmosphere poisonous to human life.', 'Spock here, Captain.', 'Unable to raise Starfleet Command due to heavy subspace interference.', 'Attempting to remedy.', 'She was attacked by what appears to be essentially a robot, an automated weapon of immense size and power. Its apparent function is to smash planets to rubble and then digest the debris for fuel. It is, therefore, self-sustaining as long as there are planetary bodies for it to feed on.', 'Unknown, Captain. However, Mister Sulu has computed the path of the machine, using the destroyed solar systems as a base course. Projecting back on our star charts, we find that it came from outside, from another galaxy.', 'If it follows its present path, it will go through the most densely populated section of our galaxy.', 'Red alert! Red alert!', 'It came up on us fast, Captain, but we seem able to maintain our distance.', "It looks very much like Commodore Decker's planet killer. And it is pursuing us.", 'We are more manoeuvrable, but it is gaining on us. Sensors indicate some kind of total conversion drive.', 'No evidence of life, subspace interference level incredibly high.', 'I would say none, Captain. The energy generated by our power nacelles seems to attracts it. I doubt we could manoeuvre close enough without drawing a direct attack upon ourselves.', 'I also believe the nature of this machine precludes the possibility of easy access to its control mechanisms.', 'Closing, Captain.', 'Acknowledged.', 'Transporter Room, stand by to beam landing party aboard.', 'Evasive action, Mister Sulu.', 'Damage report, all stations.', 'Affect repairs. Captain Kirk, come in please.', "Captain, we've been attacked. The transporter is damaged. We're taking evasive action.", 'Damage in communications, Captain. Interference will', 'We have outrun it, Doctor.', 'Impulse and warp engines operative, transporter and communications under repair. Random chance seems to have operated in our favour.', 'I believe I said that, Doctor.', "Evidently programmed to ignore anything as small as a ship beyond a certain radius. We'll maintain a discreet distance and circle back to pick up the Captain.", "I am aware of the Rigel system's population, Commodore, but we are only one ship. Our deflector shields are strained, our subspace transmitter is useless. Logically, our primary duty is to survive in order to warn Starfleet Command.", 'Mister Sulu, you will lay in an evasive course back to the Constellation.', 'You will carry out my last order, Mister Sulu.', 'You have the right to do so, but I would advise against it.', 'You tried to destroy it once before, Commodore. The result was a wrecked ship and a dead crew.', "Sensors show the object's hull is solid neutronium. A single ship cannot combat it.", 'Unfortunately, Starfleet Order 104, Section B, leaves me no alternative. Paragraph 1A clearly states', 'If you can certify Commodore Decker medically or psychologically unfit for command, I can relieve him under Section C.', "You'll also be asked to produce your medical records to prove it.", 'Then your statement would not be considered valid.', "Deflector shields at full power. They can't take much more of this.", 'Deflectors holding, but weakening. We must retreat, Commodore. The energy drain', 'Commodore, I urgently recommend immediate withdrawal.', "It has ceased fire. We're being held in a tractor beam. We're being pulled inside, Commodore. You must veer off.", "We have lost warp power. If we don't break the tractor beam within sixty seconds, we never will.", "That, sir, is illogical. It is suicide. Attempted suicide would be proof that you are psychologically unfit for command. If you don't veer off, I shall relieve you on that basis.", 'Emergency impulse power.', "It's closing fast on the Constellation.", 'Commodore, I suggest', 'This machine seems to have a programmed defensive sphere. Any energy source entering that field is subject to attack.', 'Warp drive and deflectors will be out for a solar day. Repairs proceeding on transporter and communications.', 'We can maintain this speed for only seven hours before we exhaust our fuel, but it can refuel itself indefinitely.', "Illogical. We cannot destroy it. Therefore, we cannot save Rigel. We must transport the Captain and the others from the Constellation and escape this thing's subspace interference in order to warn Starfleet Command.", 'Can you raise Starfleet?', 'On audio, Lieutenant.', 'Commodore.', 'Warp drive out. Deflector shields down. Transporter under repair. We are on emergency impulse power.', 'At least one solar day.', "At our present rate of consumption, we'll exhaust our impulse power long before then.", 'Commodore Decker, you are relieved of command.', 'You may file a formal protest with Starfleet Command, assuming we survive to reach a Starbase. But you are relieved. Commodore. I do not wish to place you under arrest.', 'Vulcans never bluff.', 'Captain, I have assumed command.', 'One moment, sir. Commodore. I believe you are scheduled for medical examination. Mister Montgomery.', 'You will accompany the commodore to Sickbay.', 'Mister Sulu, change course. Seven zero mark two one.', 'Captain, we are taking an evasive course back to you. We will try to stay ahead of the object until we can transport you aboard.', 'Yes, sir.', 'Shut them, Mister Sulu.', 'Whoever it is, Captain, has no authorisation. Lieutenant, raise the shuttlecraft.', 'Commodore, I must insist that you return to the ship.', 'You cannot succeed, Commodore. Your only logical alternative is to return to the ship.', "He's gone. Constellation, come in, please.", 'Captain Kirk, come in please.', 'Sir, may I offer my condolences on the death of your friend. It is most regrettable.', 'The drop in power is definite, Captain but negligible. The object is still pursing us, thereby causing us to drain our power reserve at a much greater rate.', 'Transporter operational, Captain. Shall we beam you aboard?', "There's little to be gained by staying aboard the Constellation.", 'Acknowledged. Transporter Room. Beam damage control party aboard.', 'No, sir. Ninety seven point eight three five megatons.', 'Negative, Captain. Its hull is pure neutronium. There is no known way of blasting through it.', 'Insufficient data. I shall try to take further sensor readings.', 'Captain?', "The object's neutronium hull makes sensor readings of the inner mechanism impossible.", 'Correct.', "Captain, you're getting dangerously close to the planet killer.", "Jim, you'll be killed, just like Decker.", "Your chances of survival are not promising. We don't even know if the explosion will be powerful enough.", "There's another factor, Captain. The transporter is not working at one hundred percent efficiency.", 'Thirty seconds is very slim timing.', 'Transporter, stand by.', "Transporter is out, Captain. You'll have to stand by.", 'Acknowledged.', 'Mister Scott, speed is of the essence.', 'Captain, transporter operational, but just barely.', 'Transporter, stand by.', 'Energise.', "We can't, Captain. Transporter is out again.", 'Mister Scott, twenty seconds to detonation.', 'Mister Scott?', 'Mister Scott', 'Try inverse phasing.', 'Mister Scott?', 'Energy output zero. Radiation level normal.', "Welcome aboard, Captain. Sensors show all energy sources deactivated. It's quite dead.", 'Indeed, Captain. I presume your log will show that Commodore Decker died in the line of duty.', "Appropriate, Captain. However, I can't help wondering if there are any more of those weapons wandering around the universe."]
Flattened Dialogue: Captain, sensors show this entire solar system has been destroyed. Nothing left but rubble and asteroids. Nonetheless, Captain, sensors show nothing but debris where we charted seven planets last year. Captain, the two inner most planets of this system appear to be intact. I have it on the sensors, Captain. By configuration, a starship stopped in space. She appears to be drifting. Sensors not recording normal energy output. She may have been wrecked by whatever destroyed these solar systems. All power plants dead, reserve energy banks operative at a very low power level. Also operative at a low power level. The entire Bridge is damaged and uninhabitable. The rest of the ship seems able to sustain life. Normal, but subspace interference makes readings difficult. Acknowledged. Enterprise, Spock here. Improbable, Captain. The surface temperature of the inner planet is that of molten lead. The other has an atmosphere poisonous to human life. Spock here, Captain. Unable to raise Starfleet Command due to heavy subspace interference. Attempting to remedy. She was attacked by what appears to be essentially a robot, an automated weapon of immense size and power. Its apparent function is to smash planets to rubble and then digest the debris for fuel. It is, therefore, self-sustaining as long as there are planetary bodies for it to feed on. Unknown, Captain. Projecting back on our star charts, we find that it came from outside, from another galaxy. If it follows its present path, it will go through the most densely populated section of our galaxy. Red alert! Red alert! It came up on us fast, Captain, but we seem able to maintain our distance. It looks very much like Commodore Decker's planet killer. And it is pursuing us. We are more manoeuvrable, but it is gaining on us. Sensors indicate some kind of total conversion drive. No evidence of life, subspace interference level incredibly high. I would say none, Captain. The energy generated by our power nacelles seems to attracts it. I doubt we could manoeuvre close enough without drawing a direct attack upon ourselves. I also believe the nature of this machine precludes the possibility of easy access to its control mechanisms. Closing, Captain. Acknowledged. Transporter Room, stand by to beam landing party aboard. Evasive action, Mister Sulu. Damage report, all stations. Affect repairs. Captain Kirk, come in please. Captain, we've been attacked. The transporter is damaged. We're taking evasive action. Damage in communications, Captain. Interference will We have outrun it, Doctor. Impulse and warp engines operative, transporter and communications under repair. Random chance seems to have operated in our favour. I believe I said that, Doctor. Evidently programmed to ignore anything as small as a ship beyond a certain radius. We'll maintain a discreet distance and circle back to pick up the Captain. I am aware of the Rigel system's population, Commodore, but we are only one ship. Our deflector shields are strained, our subspace transmitter is useless. Logically, our primary duty is to survive in order to warn Starfleet Command. Mister Sulu, you will lay in an evasive course back to the Constellation. You will carry out my last order, Mister Sulu. You have the right to do so, but I would advise against it. You tried to destroy it once before, Commodore. The result was a wrecked ship and a dead crew. Sensors show the object's hull is solid neutronium. A single ship cannot combat it. Unfortunately, Starfleet Order 104, Section B, leaves me no alternative. Paragraph 1A clearly states If you can certify Commodore Decker medically or psychologically unfit for command, I can relieve him under Section C. You'll also be asked to produce your medical records to prove it. Then your statement would not be considered valid. Deflector shields at full power. They can't take much more of this. Deflectors holding, but weakening. We must retreat, Commodore. The energy drain Commodore, I urgently recommend immediate withdrawal. It has ceased fire. We're being held in a tractor beam. We're being pulled inside, Commodore. You must veer off. We have lost warp power. If we don't break the tractor beam within sixty seconds, we never will. That, sir, is illogical. It is suicide. Attempted suicide would be proof that you are psychologically unfit for command. If you don't veer off, I shall relieve you on that basis. Emergency impulse power. It's closing fast on the Constellation. Commodore, I suggest This machine seems to have a programmed defensive sphere. Any energy source entering that field is subject to attack. Warp drive and deflectors will be out for a solar day. Repairs proceeding on transporter and communications. We can maintain this speed for only seven hours before we exhaust our fuel, but it can refuel itself indefinitely. Illogical. We cannot destroy it. Therefore, we cannot save Rigel. We must transport the Captain and the others from the Constellation and escape this thing's subspace interference in order to warn Starfleet Command. Can you raise Starfleet? On audio, Lieutenant. Commodore. Warp drive out. Deflector shields down. Transporter under repair. We are on emergency impulse power. At least one solar day. At our present rate of consumption, we'll exhaust our impulse power long before then. Commodore Decker, you are relieved of command. You may file a formal protest with Starfleet Command, assuming we survive to reach a Starbase. But you are relieved. Commodore. I do not wish to place you under arrest. Vulcans never bluff. Captain, I have assumed command. One moment, sir. Commodore. I believe you are scheduled for medical examination. Mister Montgomery. You will accompany the commodore to Sickbay. Mister Sulu, change course. Seven zero mark two one. Captain, we are taking an evasive course back to you. We will try to stay ahead of the object until we can transport you aboard. Yes, sir. Shut them, Mister Sulu. Whoever it is, Captain, has no authorisation. Lieutenant, raise the shuttlecraft. Commodore, I must insist that you return to the ship. You cannot succeed, Commodore. Your only logical alternative is to return to the ship. He's gone. Constellation, come in, please. Captain Kirk, come in please. Sir, may I offer my condolences on the death of your friend. It is most regrettable. The drop in power is definite, Captain but negligible. The object is still pursing us, thereby causing us to drain our power reserve at a much greater rate. Transporter operational, Captain. Shall we beam you aboard? There's little to be gained by staying aboard the Constellation. Acknowledged. Transporter Room. Beam damage control party aboard. No, sir. Ninety seven point eight three five megatons. Negative, Captain. Its hull is pure neutronium. There is no known way of blasting through it. Insufficient data. I shall try to take further sensor readings. Captain? The object's neutronium hull makes sensor readings of the inner mechanism impossible. Correct.
