Title: The Trouble with Tribbles
Dialogue: ['How long have you had that thing, Lieutenant?', 'Well, in that case, you got a bargain.', 'Lieutenant, do you mind if I take one of these down to the lab to see what makes it tick?', "I won't harm a hair on its head, wherever that is.", 'Hi, Jim.', 'Let me guess. Klingons? Baris?', 'Just one.', 'You noticed that, huh? Here. This ought to take care of it.', "I haven't figured that out yet, but I can tell you this much. Almost fifty percent of the creature's metabolism is geared for reproduction. Do you know what you get if you feed a tribble too much?", 'No. You get a bunch of hungry little tribbles.', "What's the matter, Spock?", "Don't tell me you've got a feeling.", "Does everything have to have a practical use for you? They're nice, soft, and furry, and they make a pleasant sound.", "It's a human characteristic to love little animals, especially if they're attractive in some way.", "Spock, I don't know too much about these little tribbles yet, but there's one thing that I have discovered.", 'I like them better than I like you.', 'Yes?', "What's that?", "Yes? Did you want to see me, Jim? Don't look at me. It's the tribbles who are breeding. If we don't get them off this ship, we're going to be hip deep in them.", "The nearest thing I can figure out is they're born pregnant, which seems to be quite a time saver.", "And from my observations, it seems they're bisexual, reproducing at will. And, brother, have they got a lot of will.", "Jim, I think I've got it. All we have to do is quit feeding them. We quit feeding them, they stop breeding.", "A lot of them are dead. A lot of them are alive, but they won't be for long.", "I haven't figured out what keeps them alive yet. All right, if I find out anything, I'll let you know.", 'Heartbeat is all wrong. His body temperature is. Jim, this man is a Klingon.', 'Oh, yes. It was poisoned.', "Yes. It's been impregnated with a virus. The virus turns into an inert material in the bloodstream. The more the organism eats, the more inert matter is built up. So after two or three days, they reached a point where they couldn't take in enough nourishment to survive.", 'That is essentially it.', "And you won't find a tribble on this entire ship.", "I cannot take credit for another man's work. Scotty did it.", 'Tell him, Spock.']
Flattened Dialogue: How long have you had that thing, Lieutenant? Well, in that case, you got a bargain. Lieutenant, do you mind if I take one of these down to the lab to see what makes it tick? I won't harm a hair on its head, wherever that is. Hi, Jim. Let me guess. Klingons? Baris? Just one. You noticed that, huh? Here. This ought to take care of it. I haven't figured that out yet, but I can tell you this much. Almost fifty percent of the creature's metabolism is geared for reproduction. Do you know what you get if you feed a tribble too much? No. You get a bunch of hungry little tribbles. What's the matter, Spock? Don't tell me you've got a feeling. Does everything have to have a practical use for you? They're nice, soft, and furry, and they make a pleasant sound. It's a human characteristic to love little animals, especially if they're attractive in some way. Spock, I don't know too much about these little tribbles yet, but there's one thing that I have discovered. I like them better than I like you. Yes? What's that? Yes? Did you want to see me, Jim? Don't look at me. It's the tribbles who are breeding. If we don't get them off this ship, we're going to be hip deep in them. The nearest thing I can figure out is they're born pregnant, which seems to be quite a time saver. And from my observations, it seems they're bisexual, reproducing at will. And, brother, have they got a lot of will. Jim, I think I've got it. All we have to do is quit feeding them. We quit feeding them, they stop breeding. A lot of them are dead. A lot of them are alive, but they won't be for long. I haven't figured out what keeps them alive yet. All right, if I find out anything, I'll let you know. Heartbeat is all wrong. His body temperature is. Jim, this man is a Klingon. Oh, yes. It was poisoned. Yes. It's been impregnated with a virus. The virus turns into an inert material in the bloodstream. The more the organism eats, the more inert matter is built up. So after two or three days, they reached a point where they couldn't take in enough nourishment to survive. That is essentially it. And you won't find a tribble on this entire ship. I cannot take credit for another man's work. Scotty did it. Tell him, Spock.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Ensign Chekov, Lieutenant Uhura, and I will beam down and make a routine check of its facilities.', 'Good. Mind the store, Mister Spock.', "Lieutenant Uhura, let's go.", 'Energise, Scotty.', 'It must be a transporter malfunction.', "This isn't Gamma Two. Look at the colour of that sky.", "That's a trinary sun.", "That's what I'd like to know. Kirk to Enterprise. Kirk to Enterprise. Dead.", 'Either of you hurt?', 'How do you know our names?', 'These Providers of yours, are they', 'What do they want from us?', "Thralls? You must be mistaken. We're officers of a United spaceship on Federation business.", "We're not going anywhere until we have some information. Who are you? What is this place? What do you think you're going to do with us?", "This system's star is a trinary. Limits it a bit, but we're a long way from the Enterprise, if we're in the same dimension.", 'What do you want from her?', "Lieutenant, are you all right? Uhura! Lieutenant! Lieutenant, are you all right? Lieutenant, answer me! Lieutenant! What's happening to Lieutenant Uhura? Lieutenant, are you all right?", "I didn't realise I was so hungry. Whatever you call this, it is very good.", "Nourishment. That's very practical. What do you call this collar?", 'Vended? You mean bought, sold.', 'Our race has another name for it. Slavery. This collar of obedience, is Galt the only one who can operate it?', 'How does he work it?', 'Will you provide all my nourishment?', "Yes, I'm sure you will. I must say, I've never seen a top sergeant who looked like you.", "It means you're a very beautiful woman.", "You mean nobody's ever told you that before? well, er, beautiful is, Beautiful. That's beautiful. Shahna, where were you born?", 'Your parents. Where are they? Your mother and father.', 'Freestyle?', "Lars and Chekov's drill thrall. They weren't born here. Where do they come from?", 'None of us will do it, Galt.', 'The devil with the Providers.', 'No. No! I am responsible for the actions of my people. I demand to see the Providers.', "He's pretty fast with that whip.", "We're free people. We belong to no one.", "Slow down. Slow down. Wait a minute. Wait a minute. We've covered over two miles. Can we take a breather? A rest?", "Oh. well, it's good to get away from that development area, even for a while. Shahna, why do the Providers, why do they like to watch others being hurt, killed?", 'Their voices sound mechanical. Are they computers?', "You've seen them. Do they have bodies?", 'What is this place?', "It's very old. Does it have a name? Shahna, could it have been a city for the Providers?", 'They do have bodies, or did have.', 'Very pretty country. Very much like my home planet, Earth.', "Where I was born. Shahna, don't you ever look at the night sky? The lights up there?", 'Well, those are stars. And around them are planets. And there are people that live on them, Just like us.', "From Earth, Triskelion's three suns are just a flicker of light. Actually, this is the darkest planet I've ever seen.", "The thralls have no freedom, Shahna. You don't think or do anything but what the Providers tell you.", 'Love, for one thing.', 'Love is the most important thing on Earth. Especially to a man and a woman.', 'On Earth, we select our own mate. Someone we care for. On Earth, men and women live together, help each other, make each other happy.', 'All right. All right. Tell me about the Providers. What do they look like? Where do they live?', "Stop it. Stop it! I'm responsible! I made her talk! Stop it! You're killing her! She did nothing wrong! It was my fault. If you want to punish someone, punish me! Please.", "It's all right. It's all right. You can stop crying now, Shahna. It's all right.", "It's the custom of my people to help one another when we're in trouble.", 'You could call it that.', "You're disturbed about what happened today.", "I wouldn't like that, Shahna. I wouldn't like that at all.", "I'm sorry, Shahna.", 'What about Lars?', 'I think Galt is the only one who controls these collars. If we can find the phaser that I threw at Lars, we can use the circuits to short out these collars.', 'Spock? Spock!', 'Spock?', 'Welcome to Triskelion, gentlemen.', 'By now it must be obvious to you that you have been expected.', "What you're hearing, gentlemen, is a Provider.", 'Providing for all their needs means using thralls, people stolen from other parts of the galaxy', 'To fight each other, and the Providers gamble on the winner.', "But these Providers haven't the courage to show themselves.", 'But you are afraid.', 'Then show yourselves.', 'The power source. Shielded by solid rock.', 'Primary mental evolution. Incredible.', 'A species that enslaves other beings is hardly superior, mentally or otherwise.', "It's an unproductive purpose, unworthy of your intellect.", "We have found that all life forms in the galaxy are capable of superior development. Perhaps you're not as evolved as you believe.", 'Our destruction will result only in your own. You may control the Enterprise, but you cannot match the force of the entire Federation.', "And you call yourselves superior! You're murderers without the spirit to really wager for the lives you take.", 'My people pride themselves on being the greatest, most successful gamblers in the universe. We compete for everything. Power, fame, women, everything we desire, and it is our nature to win. And for proof, I offer you our exploration of this galaxy.', 'Well, then, I wager that with weapons of your own choice, right here and now, my people can overcome an equal number of thralls set against us.', "Wait! Wait! Hear me! We can't wager for trifles like quatloos. The stakes must be higher.", 'If we win, the Enterprise and its crew leaves here in safety. Further more, all the thralls on the planet must be freed.', 'You will educate and train them to establish a normal self-governing culture.', "We have done the same with cultures throughout the galaxy. Are you willing to admit that we can do something you can't?", "If we lose? We will remain here, the entire crew of the Enterprise. The most stubborn, determined competitors in the universe. We'll become thralls, enter your games, obey your orders without rebellion. You'll be assured of generations of the most exciting wagering you've ever had.", 'Not for true gamesters.', 'Name it.', 'Three against one? Those are pretty high odds.', 'Your, your terms are unfair.', "Well, in that case, I'll accept your terms.", "Yes, that's clear.", 'The thralls will be trained?', "I think you'll find it a much more exciting game than the one you've been playing. I'm sorry, Shahna. I didn't lie. I did what was necessary. Someday, I hope you'll understand.", 'Yes.', 'Yes.', "I can't.", "There's so much you must learn here first. The Providers will teach you. Learn it, Shahna. all your people must learn before you can reach for the stars. Shahna. Scotty!", 'Beam us up.']

We'll become thralls, enter your games, obey your orders without rebellion. You'll be assured of generations of the most exciting wagering you've ever had. Not for true gamesters. Name it. Three against one? Those are pretty high odds. Your, your terms are unfair. Well, in that case, I'll accept your terms. Yes, that's clear. The thralls will be trained? I think you'll find it a much more exciting game than the one you've been playing. I'm sorry, Shahna. I didn't lie. I did what was necessary. Someday, I hope you'll understand. Yes. Yes. I can't. There's so much you must learn here first. The Providers will teach you. Learn it, Shahna. all your people must learn before you can reach for the stars. Shahna. Scotty! Beam us up.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Standard orbit, Captain.', 'Captain. what happened?', 'That was a rough trip.', "But Captain, if we're not on Gamma Two, then where are we?", 'Mine, too.', "Nobody's hurt, Captain. Yet.", "Captain, the Enterprise. They will be trying to find us, won't they?", 'You, you have been selected for me?', 'Chekov.', 'Oh, pleased, Pleased to know you, miss.', "That's very kind of you, miss, but", 'Cossacks.', 'This is going to kill our romance.', 'Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Standard orbit, Captain. Captain. what happened? That was a rough trip. But Captain, if we're not on Gamma Two, then where are we? Mine, too. Nobody's hurt, Captain. Yet. Captain, the Enterprise. They will be trying to find us, won't they? You, you have been selected for me? Chekov. Oh, pleased, Pleased to know you, miss. That's very kind of you, miss, but Cossacks. This is going to kill our romance. Captain.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Acknowledged, Captain.', 'Spock here.', 'I presume you mean they vanished in a manner not consistent with the usual workings of the transporter, Mister Scott.', 'Have you reversed controls?', 'Power surge?', "Recheck your equipment, Mister Scott. I'll scan for them on the planet's surface. Spock out.", "I'm beginning to believe that, Mister Scott. I've conducted two sweeps of the planet's surface. There is no sign of life.", 'No, Doctor. Even that would show up on our sensors.', 'The only answers are negative. No magnetic storms, no ionic interference, no breakdown in your equipment.', 'We shall continue sensor scans, Doctor. At the moment, that is all we can do, except hope for a rational explanation.', 'True, Doctor. Constant exposure does result in a certain degree of contamination.', 'They are not within the confines of this solar system.', 'I have never heard of a study being done, but it would be a fascinating project.', 'Precisely.', 'No. I would say approximately four hundred', 'I would welcome a suggestion, Doctor, even an emotional one, as to where to look.', "Captain's log, stardate 3259.2. First Officer Spock in command. The Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov have been missing for nearly two hours. Computer probability projections are useless due to insufficient data.", 'Interesting. It seems to be an ionisation trail.', 'Exactly the question I have just fed to the computers, Doctor. And the answer is, nothing known to us would account for it.', 'Plot a follow course, Ensign Haines.', "Doctor, I am chasing the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov, not some wild aquatic fowl. This is the only lead we've had.", 'Initiate. Warp factor two.', 'Projecting back along the path of ionisation, the nearest system is M two four alpha.', 'Eleven point six three zero.', "I'm suggesting nothing, Doctor. I am merely pursuing the only logical course available to us.", 'We searched the area.', 'Such as a failure in the transporter mechanism?', 'There was no sign of them in the area of Gamma Two.', 'In that case, Doctor, we have nothing to lose by pursuing our present course.', 'Mister Scott, can we manage anything faster than warp six?', 'Doctor, I do not respond to hunches. No transporter malfunction was responsible for the disappearance. They were not within the Gamma system. A focused beam of extremely high-intensity light was directed into the Gamma system from the trinary system we are now approaching. No known natural phenomena could have caused that beam. Does that clarify the situation?', 'I see. Gentlemen, I am in command of this vessel, and we shall continue on our present course. Unless it is your intention to declare a mutiny.', 'Agreed. Mister Scott, could you manage warp seven?', 'Ensign, warp seven.', 'Sensors indicate only one concentration of life forms on the planet, on the lower hemisphere. Humanoid readings.', 'There will be no landing force, Doctor. Assuming the captain and the others are still alive, it would be unwise to endanger them by beaming down a large contingent.', 'Interesting. No power source. It may be shielded.', 'I shall beam down, Doctor. If I am unable to communicate, a landing party may be necessary.', "Daniel, as I recall, had only his faith. But I welcome your company, Doctor. Mister Scott, you'll be in command.", 'Fascinating.']

I've conducted two sweeps of the planet's surface. There is no sign of life. No, Doctor. Even that would show up on our sensors. The only answers are negative. No magnetic storms, no ionic interference, no breakdown in your equipment. We shall continue sensor scans, Doctor. At the moment, that is all we can do, except hope for a rational explanation. True, Doctor. Constant exposure does result in a certain degree of contamination. They are not within the confines of this solar system. I have never heard of a study being done, but it would be a fascinating project. Precisely. No. I would say approximately four hundred I would welcome a suggestion, Doctor, even an emotional one, as to where to look. Captain's log, stardate 3259.2. First Officer Spock in command. The Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov have been missing for nearly two hours. Computer probability projections are useless due to insufficient data. Interesting. It seems to be an ionisation trail. Exactly the question I have just fed to the computers, Doctor. And the answer is, nothing known to us would account for it. Plot a follow course, Ensign Haines. Doctor, I am chasing the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Ensign Chekov, not some wild aquatic fowl. This is the only lead we've had. Initiate. Warp factor two. Projecting back along the path of ionisation, the nearest system is M two four alpha. Eleven point six three zero. I'm suggesting nothing, Doctor. I am merely pursuing the only logical course available to us. We searched the area. Such as a failure in the transporter mechanism? There was no sign of them in the area of Gamma Two. In that case, Doctor, we have nothing to lose by pursuing our present course. Mister Scott, can we manage anything faster than warp six? Doctor, I do not respond to hunches. No transporter malfunction was responsible for the disappearance. They were not within the Gamma system. A focused beam of extremely high-intensity light was directed into the Gamma system from the trinary system we are now approaching. No known natural phenomena could have caused that beam. Does that clarify the situation? I see. Gentlemen, I am in command of this vessel, and we shall continue on our present course. Unless it is your intention to declare a mutiny. Agreed. Mister Scott, could you manage warp seven? Ensign, warp seven. Sensors indicate only one concentration of life forms on the planet, on the lower hemisphere. Humanoid readings. There will be no landing force, Doctor. Assuming the captain and the others are still alive, it would be unwise to endanger them by beaming down a large contingent. Interesting. No power source. It may be shielded. I shall beam down, Doctor. If I am unable to communicate, a landing party may be necessary. Daniel, as I recall, had only his faith. But I welcome your company, Doctor. Mister Scott, you'll be in command. Fascinating.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Yes, sir.', "This is the craziest landing pad I've ever seen.", 'Captain. Look.', "I don't think so, Captain.", "They'll try, but where do they look? We're here, and we don't know where it is.", 'What are you doing? Get out!', 'No!', "I don't care whether it's allowed or not. I will not do it.", "He's gone to report me. I said I didn't like the food."]
Flattened Dialogue: Yes, sir. This is the craziest landing pad I've ever seen. Captain. Look. I don't think so, Captain. They'll try, but where do they look? We're here, and we don't know where it is. What are you doing? Get out! No! I don't care whether it's allowed or not. I will not do it. He's gone to report me. I said I didn't like the food.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Aye, Captain.', 'Scott to Bridge.', 'Mister Spock, the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Chekov. they vanished. They got onto the transporter platform and they just vanished.', "Aye, of course I mean that. You think I'd call if they just beamed down?", "I've made all the proper checks. There was nothing. There was no flash of light, nothing. They were gone.", 'Not down here. All the dials were right and the transporter was functioning perfectly.', "Mister Spock, I've checked that transporter from one end to the other. Every circuit works perfectly. Whatever that power surge was, it had nothing to do with the transporter or any other system aboard this ship.", 'Where are they then?', 'Well, the transporter has neither the power nor the range to account for that.', 'We certainly seem to be heading into an empty sector.', 'That must be two dozen light years away.', "Mister Spock, it just doesn't make sense they could have come this far. If there's any chance at all it is to continue to search in the area they were lost.", "It's always possible to miss something.", 'No, sir. There was no sign of failure.', "It's my opinion that we've gone too far as it is, sir.", 'Doctor McCoy speaks for me, too, sir.', 'Mister Spock!', 'I would be more than content to do so, sir, and maybe a wee bit more.', 'Aye, sir.', 'What the voice said was true, sir. Nothing is functioning.', 'Mister Spock, look!', "Heaven's got very little to do with this.", 'Aye, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Aye, Captain. Scott to Bridge. Mister Spock, the Captain, Lieutenant Uhura, and Chekov. they vanished. They got onto the transporter platform and they just vanished. Aye, of course I mean that. You think I'd call if they just beamed down? I've made all the proper checks. There was nothing. There was no flash of light, nothing. They were gone. Not down here. All the dials were right and the transporter was functioning perfectly. Mister Spock, I've checked that transporter from one end to the other. Every circuit works perfectly. Whatever that power surge was, it had nothing to do with the transporter or any other system aboard this ship. Where are they then? Well, the transporter has neither the power nor the range to account for that. We certainly seem to be heading into an empty sector. That must be two dozen light years away. Mister Spock, it just doesn't make sense they could have come this far. If there's any chance at all it is to continue to search in the area they were lost. It's always possible to miss something. No, sir. There was no sign of failure. It's my opinion that we've gone too far as it is, sir. Doctor McCoy speaks for me, too, sir. Mister Spock! I would be more than content to do so, sir, and maybe a wee bit more. Aye, sir. What the voice said was true, sir. Nothing is functioning. Mister Spock, look! Heaven's got very little to do with this. Aye, sir.

Title: The Gamesters of Triskelion
Dialogue: ['Then what the devil is happening? Does that mean their atoms are just floating around out there?', "A negative attitude is no good to us. We can't just leave them out there, wherever they are.", 'Hope? I always thought that was a human failing, Mister Spock.', "It's been nearly an hour. Can people live that long as disassembled atoms in a transporter beam?", "Fascinating? Those people are friends of ours out there, if they're still alive.", 'The odds are not good.', "Don't quote odds and don't give me anymore dispassionate logic, Mister Spock. Just keep looking for them.", "First time you've ever asked me for anything, and it has to be an occasion like this.", 'What would account for that, Spock?', "You're going to leave here without them and run off on some wild goose chase halfway across the galaxy just because you found a discrepancy in a hydrogen cloud?", "This is ridiculous. There's nothing out there. Nothing at all.", "Are you suggesting that they could have transported over a distance of? You're out of your Vulcan mind, Spock.", "If they weren't there it's ridiculous to think they could still be alive. Not after all this time.", "He's right, Spock. We've lost Jim and the others on Gamma Two. Now you've dragged us a dozen light years on some wild hunch that", "No, it doesn't. It's still a fancy way of saying that you're playing a hunch. well, my hunch is that they're back on Gamma Two dead or alive and I still want another search.", "Who said anything about a mutiny, you stubborn, pointed-eared. All right. If we don't find them here, do we still have another search on Gamma Two?", 'Well, at least that gives our landing force a starting point.', "Well we're not going to leave them there while we just sit and wait.", "And it may be just a wild goose chase like we've been telling you.", "Well, Mister Spock, if you're going into the lion's den, you'll need a medical officer.", "What the devil's going on?", 'What in the name of heaven is this?']

We can't just leave them out there, wherever they are. Hope? I always thought that was a human failing, Mister Spock. It's been nearly an hour. Can people live that long as disassembled atoms in a transporter beam? Fascinating? Those people are friends of ours out there, if they're still alive. The odds are not good. Don't quote odds and don't give me anymore dispassionate logic, Mister Spock. Just keep looking for them. First time you've ever asked me for anything, and it has to be an occasion like this. What would account for that, Spock? You're going to leave here without them and run off on some wild goose chase halfway across the galaxy just because you found a discrepancy in a hydrogen cloud? This is ridiculous. There's nothing out there. Nothing at all. Are you suggesting that they could have transported over a distance of? You're out of your Vulcan mind, Spock. If they weren't there it's ridiculous to think they could still be alive. Not after all this time. He's right, Spock. We've lost Jim and the others on Gamma Two. Now you've dragged us a dozen light years on some wild hunch that No, it doesn't. It's still a fancy way of saying that you're playing a hunch. well, my hunch is that they're back on Gamma Two dead or alive and I still want another search. Who said anything about a mutiny, you stubborn, pointed-eared. All right. If we don't find them here, do we still have another search on Gamma Two? Well, at least that gives our landing force a starting point. Well we're not going to leave them there while we just sit and wait. And it may be just a wild goose chase like we've been telling you. Well, Mister Spock, if you're going into the lion's den, you'll need a medical officer. What the devil's going on? What in the name of heaven is this?

Title: A Piece of the Action
Dialogue: ['Standard orbit, Mister Chekov.', 'Boss? All right, Lieutenant, put him on. Oxmyx. This is Captain James T. Kirk of the starship Enterprise, representing the Federation of Planets.', 'Yes. Unfortunately, the Horizon was lost with all hands shortly after leaving your planet. We only received her radio report last month.', "Difficult to explain. We received a report a hundred years late because it was sent by conventional radio. Your system is on the outer reaches of the galaxy. They didn't have subspace communication in those days.", "I'll explain it in more detail when I see him. The ship won't land, but we'll transport several people down. Well, that's a little difficult for you to understand, too. I'll explain it in more detail when I see you. Where will be convenient?", 'Scotty, do you have the co-ordinates?', "Good. I'll be looking forward to it. Kirk out. Scotty, you have the conn.", "Spock, McCoy, we're beaming down. Standard equipment.", "The Horizon's contact came before the Non-Interference Directive went into effect.", "We don't know there is contamination. The evidence is only circumstantial.", 'The beginnings of industrialisation.', "Let's not argue about it. Let's go study it. Energise.", "Home was never like this. I've seen pictures of the old days that look like this.", "That's a weapon. Be careful with that.", 'Look, we were asked to come down here by Mister Oxmyx. He said', 'Is this how you greet all your guests?', "Yes, but the Horizon crew wasn't composed of cold-blooded killers. They didn't report this culture in this state, either. What happened?", 'Is this the way your citizens do business, their right of petition?', 'Depends.', "No, thank you. You're Mister Oxmyx.", 'This is my first officer, Mister Spock, Doctor McCoy.', 'They call you The Boss, Mister Oxmyx. The boss of what?', "You're the government here?", 'But there are other bosses, other territories?', "I know it's a book.", 'Did they leave any other books?', 'What is it you want?', 'Now let me get this straight. You want us to supply you with arms and assistance so you can carry out an aggression against your neighbours?', 'Mister Oxmyx, my orders are quite explicit. Under no circum', "Don't do that. You could knock out the side of the building.", 'Out of the question.', "Hold it. It's a communication device.", "It's locked onto my ship's systems.", 'In old Chicago, conventional government almost broke down. The gangs nearly took over.', "If this society broke down as the result of the Horizon's influence, then the Federation's responsible, and we've got to do something to straighten this mess out. Spock, if you could get to the sociological computer, do you think you could find a solution?", "Well, I've got an idea about that. Gentlemen. Gentlemen. This, card game is a kid's game.", "Oh, yes, yes. I wouldn't waste my time.", "On Beta Antares Four, they play a real game. It's a man's game, but of course it's probably a little beyond you. It requires intelligence.", 'Spock. Spock. Of course, the cards on Beta Antares Four are different, but not too different. The name of the game is called fizzbin.', "Fizzbin. It's not too difficult. Each player gets six cards, except for the player on the dealer's right, who gets seven.", 'Yes. The second card is turned up, except on Tuesdays.', 'Oh, look what you got, two jacks. You got a half fizzbin already.', "No, no. If you got another jack, why, you'd have a sralk.", "Yes. You'd be disqualified. You need a king and a deuce, except at night of course, when you'd need a queen and a four.", "Right. Oh, look at that. You've got another jack. How lucky you are! How wonderful for you. If you didn't get another jack, if you'd gotten a king, why then you'd get another card, except when it's dark, you'd give it back.", "Yes, but what you're after is a royal fizzbin, but the odds in getting a royal fizzbin are astron. Spock, what are the odds in getting a royal fizzbin?", "Well, they're astronomical, believe me. Now, for the last card. We'll call it a kronk. You got that?", "Spock, find the radio station. Uhura's monitoring the broadcasts. Cut in and have yourselves beamed up to the ship.", "I will, but I'm bringing Bela Oxmyx with me.", "Bones, this mess is our responsibility. You have your orders. Let's go.", "If you don't mind, I'd rather walk.", "I'm beginning to get the idea.", 'And you?', 'Would you mind telling me how you even know who I am?', 'You want to make a deal.', "Let me guess. You want, you'll want heaters, and then you'll want troops to teach them how to use them. And then you'll attack the other bosses and take over the whole planet. Then we'll sit down and talk, right?", "I got a better idea. This planet has to be united. You know that. Bela knows that. Let's sit down. You, me, Bela. Discuss this whole matter, contact the other bosses, and talk about it like reasonable men.", "No, I don't think you're stupid. I just think your behaviour is arrested.", "I'm sorry, Krako. No deal.", 'Help me! Help! Help me!', "Drop the guns. Drop 'em. Move down there.", 'I thought you were supposed to report to the ship, Mister Spock.', 'It may be just as well. Did you find out anything from the computer?', "Then you don't mind if I play a hunch?", "Well, now that we have Bela, I'm going to put the bag on Krako. Listen, you. Say, that's nice material.", 'I said.', "You too! Get out of the clothes. Nobody's going to put the bag on me any more.", 'Wheels, Mister Spock.', "Key in the ignition. Turn the ignition on. And nothing happens. Where's the starter? There's the starter. Yes!", 'Oops! Gears.', "I kind of like this. I'm going to get one myself.", 'It was that bad?', "Now, that could be a bit of a problem. If they were inside, where they couldn't be seen, we could stun them with our phasers, but not out here.", "They don't look like the trusting type.", 'Young man, run along and play.', 'Hold on, Spock. Out of the mouths of babes', "I'm calling you a babe.", "Yeah I'm calling you a babe, but there's nothing personal in it. Sit down. You know a way we can get close to them?", 'How?', 'What do you want?', "All right, young man. We'll guarantee you a piece of the action if we can pull this thing off.", 'Done. What do we do?', "That's it. Let's go.", 'Sonny!', 'Sonny! Wait a moment. What have they done? What have they done to you? What have you done?', 'A piece of the action.', 'No one can see. Put your phaser on stun.', "I think you've got it reversed, Mister Krako.", 'The sound of a machine gun bolt being pulled back.', "Mister Krako, I don't, er", "I'm trying to tell you, Mister Krako, that this is bigger than you, Oxmyx or anyone.", 'Can you trust all your men?', 'Well, one of these can make a man a pretty big boss, you know.', "All right, Krako, we don't have time to show you how to play with toys!", "What do you think we're here for, to get a cut of your deal? Forget it. That's peanuts to an outfit like the Federation. Right?", 'Right?', "Now look, Krako, we're taking over the whole ball of wax. You co-operate with us and maybe we'll cut you in for a piece of the action.", "That's, er. We'll figure it out later.", "Who's interfering? We're taking over. Check?", "The planet is being taken over by the Federation, but we don't want to come in here and use our muscle, you know what I mean? That ain't subtle. So what we do is we help one guy take over the planet. He pulls the strings, and then we pull his. Hey, you, sit down.", "What do you care as long as you're being cut in? Course, there's always Bela Oxmyx.", 'Kirk to Enterprise.', 'All right, Scotty. We made a deal with Krako.', "Yeah. We're ready to make the hit. We're taking over the whole planet as soon as you get ready.", "Sure. We can trust Krako, but we don't have any choice. You know what I mean? He's standing about twelve feet in front of me, all ready to be our pal.", "Of course, Scotty, I'd like to show him the ship, just to show him that we're, er, we're on the level. But you know how it is.", "Scotty, we'll need phasers to equip every one of Krako's men. We'll need advisors and troops to back him up on the hit. You got all that, Scotty?", 'You may begin, Mister Scott.', 'Not exactly.', 'Right?', "It's faster than walking.", 'Are you afraid of cars?', "Spock, I've got the hang of it. Now go on.", 'Wrong again, Oxmyx.', "Knock it off, Sawbones. I want to talk to this creep. Now listen, I'm getting tired of playing pattycake with you penny-ante operators.", "You're a penny-ante operator. Sit down. All right, Spocko, cover him. Now listen, sweetheart. The Federation's moving in, taking over. You play ball, we'll cut you in. You don't, you're out. All the way out. You know what I mean?", 'Kirk to Enterprise.', 'You got Krako on ice?', 'Okay, baby. Cool him till I flag you.', "Keep him until I send for him. We're going to make some old-style phone calls from this locale. So you locate the man on the other end of the blower and give him a ride to this flop.", 'Find the man at the other end of the phone', 'And transport him to these co-ordinates.', 'Can do, sweetheart?', 'Now you. Get on the blower and call the other bosses.', "Get with it. I'm giving the orders here.", 'Scotty?', 'Lock in and energise.', 'Yeah.', "All right! All right! All right! All right! Now the Federation's taking over whether you like it or not. You people, you've been running this planet like a piecework factory. From now on, it's going to be under one roof. You're going to run it like a business. That means you're going to make a profit.", "I'm cutting the Federation in for forty percent. You got any objections?", 'Hang on a minute. Hang on a minute. Quiet! Just a moment!', 'There are over four hundred guys there.', "Now, wait a minute. Wait a minute. Get that heater down. Don't you want to take a look at what you're going to fight?", 'All right, but at least let me call my ship one last time and say goodbye.', 'Hello, Scotty. This is Kirk.', "Scotty, put the ship's phasers on stun. Fire a burst in a one-block radius around these co-ordinates.", "They're not dead, just knocked out for a while. But they might just as well have been that way if we wanted them to.", 'I was talking about both.', "Hey, Bela, no, no, no. The Federation can't get connected with a small-time operation like this. No, I was thinking, Bela, you would be the top boss. Krako, you'd be his lieutenant. The rest of you, I don't want any trouble from the rest of you because you'll have to answer to the Federation. We'll be back every year to collect our cut.", "Yeah, I think forty percent's sufficient.", "It's reasonable, Mister Oxmyx. Let's break out some of your drinking stuff and celebrate the syndicate.", 'Gentlemen, you two have been brooding ever since we returned to the ship.', 'Brooding, Mister Spock. A sombre, emotional state. Now, do you wish to continue it or are you going to discuss it?', "Ah, yes. I understand that. You don't think it's logical to leave a criminal organisation in charge.", "Yes, that's a very good question, Mister Spock. I propose our cut be put into the planetary treasury and used to guide the Iotians into a more ethical system. Despite themselves, they'll be forced to accept conventional responsibilities. Isn't that logical? All right, Bones, in the language of the planet, what's your beef?", 'Go ahead.', 'Tell me.', 'You left it?', "You're not certain of what?", "In Bela's office?", "They will, they will. And they'll find out how the transtator works.", 'Everything.', 'Serious? Serious, Bones? It upsets the whole percentage.', 'Well, in a few years, the Iotians may demand a piece of our action.']
