Title: Spock's Brain
Dialogue: ['Hailing on all frequencies, sir. All languages have been attempted. No response. Now using standard interstellar symbols.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Security guard to the Bridge.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Deck five. Personnel, no damage.', 'Aye, sir.', 'No signal at all, Captain.', "Captain, I'm picking up high energy generation on planet six.", "It could be natural. Volcanic activity, steam, any number of causes. But it's very regular.", "What would they want with his brain? What would they want with Mister Spock's brain? What use is it?", 'Why do they want it?', "Yes, sir. It doesn't make sense, but it's there.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Enterprise. Uhura here.', 'Aye, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Hailing on all frequencies, sir. All languages have been attempted. No response. Now using standard interstellar symbols. Aye, sir. Security guard to the Bridge. Aye, sir. Deck five. Personnel, no damage. Aye, sir. No signal at all, Captain. Captain, I'm picking up high energy generation on planet six. It could be natural. Volcanic activity, steam, any number of causes. But it's very regular. What would they want with his brain? What would they want with Mister Spock's brain? What use is it? Why do they want it? Yes, sir. It doesn't make sense, but it's there. Aye, aye, sir. Enterprise. Uhura here. Aye, sir.

Title: Spock's Brain
Dialogue: ["It beats me, but isn't she a beauty?", "I've never seen anything like her. And ion propulsion at that. They could teach us a thing or two.", 'Aye.', 'Scattered. Widely spaced. Humanoid, all right. On the large side.', 'Aye.', "Captain! There's someone, something out there in the rocks. Five of them. Humanoid, large.", 'A companion.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Captain!', "Over here, sir. There's food in there and a whole pile of other stuff. A storehouse for our muscular friends.", 'It could be a warning device to keep those creatures away from the food.', 'In that case, the beam would be a signal.', 'Keep him close to the right.', "Captain, that power we picked up above, we're getting closer.", 'Enough to push this planet out of orbit.', 'Either a nuclear pile a hundred miles across or', 'Ion power.', 'Aye.', "Captain, I've got something, but I can't quite get a fix on it.", 'Mister Spock, where are you?', "Aye. There's no sun, but there's light.", "That's impossible. Who built the machines?", 'These are on to stay for a while. Must be a magnetic lock of some kind.', "Those women could never have set up anything as complex as this has to be. Why, that takes engineering genius. But there's no sign of engineering genius in any of those women.", 'Pain and delight, he said up above.', "How does Spock's brain fit into this?", "Isn't there a way to correct that situation?", 'Body? Why, you have none.', 'Got it.', 'Must be in there, Captain.', 'That phaser is set to kill.', "I've never seen anything like it. He's operating at warp speed. I'd like a try at that teacher myself.", 'Captain Kirk!', "He's forgetting."]
Flattened Dialogue: It beats me, but isn't she a beauty? I've never seen anything like her. And ion propulsion at that. They could teach us a thing or two. Aye. Scattered. Widely spaced. Humanoid, all right. On the large side. Aye. Captain! There's someone, something out there in the rocks. Five of them. Humanoid, large. A companion. Aye, sir. Captain! Over here, sir. There's food in there and a whole pile of other stuff. A storehouse for our muscular friends. It could be a warning device to keep those creatures away from the food. In that case, the beam would be a signal. Keep him close to the right. Captain, that power we picked up above, we're getting closer. Enough to push this planet out of orbit. Either a nuclear pile a hundred miles across or Ion power. Aye. Captain, I've got something, but I can't quite get a fix on it. Mister Spock, where are you? Aye. There's no sun, but there's light. That's impossible. Who built the machines? These are on to stay for a while. Must be a magnetic lock of some kind. Those women could never have set up anything as complex as this has to be. Why, that takes engineering genius. But there's no sign of engineering genius in any of those women. Pain and delight, he said up above. How does Spock's brain fit into this? Isn't there a way to correct that situation? Body? Why, you have none. Got it. Must be in there, Captain. That phaser is set to kill. I've never seen anything like it. He's operating at warp speed. I'd like a try at that teacher myself. Captain Kirk! He's forgetting.

Title: Spock's Brain
Dialogue: ['Jim! Jim!', "You'd better come down to Sickbay", 'Right now.', 'Now.', 'Thank God.', 'No, not like this.', "I don't know.", 'He was worse than dead.', 'Jim.', 'His brain is gone.', "It's been removed surgically.", "It's the greatest technical job I've ever seen. Every nerve ending in the brain must've been neatly sealed. Nothing ripped, nothing torn, no bleeding. It's a medical miracle.", 'No. That incredible Vulcan physique hung on until the life-support cycle took over. His body lives. The autonomic functions continue. But there is no mind.', 'What girl?', "I can't give you any guarantee.", "If it happened to any of us, I'd say indefinitely. But Vulcan physiology limits what I can do. Spock's body is more dependent on that tremendous brain for life support.", 'Take him? Take him where?', "Jim, where are you going to look? In this whole galaxy, where are you going to look for Spock's brain? How are you going to find it?", "Even if you do, I can't restore it. I don't have the medical technique.", "But I don't know how.", "If you don't find it in twenty four hours, you'd better forget the whole thing, Jim.", 'Call Chekov and tell him to send my stomach down.', "I'll have her talking in a minute.", "She's not, Jim. No change in reading. She doesn't know.", "Jim, it's no use. You'll get nothing out of that one. Hers is the mind of a child.", 'Where are you, Spock?', 'Where else would I be?', "Jim, she may not remember or even really know. Disassociation could be complete. It doesn't seem possible she could have performed surgery on Spock.", "Yes, for instance, above it's cold and harsh. And below, it's warm. The air is fresh.", 'Who are the doctors? Who operates?', "We just want to talk to somebody about Spock's brain. That's all.", "Yes. Yes, in a way it is. The human brain controls the individual's functions.", "It's not possible.", "I wouldn't believe the human organism could take such pain.", "I'm sure you noticed the delight aspect of this place.", 'It does, Captain.', 'You are a disembodied brain.', 'Thank you.', 'I told him.', 'Jim.. Spock. No pain.', "She couldn't, Jim. Her mind is functioning on a very simple level. Mental faculties here seem to be almost atrophied because of non-use.", "Without you there could be no delicate miracle that kept Spock's brain alive.", 'Yes. From the very first, I appreciated your ability.', 'It would be just enough time.', 'Jim, it worked for her. It might work for me.', "I'm a surgeon already. If I could learn these techniques, I might be able to retain them.", "He might, but we're sure to lose you if I don't try.", "Spock, didn't you hear? I might be able to retain and bring these techniques to the world. Jim, isn't it worth that risk? Wouldn't you insist upon taking such a risk yourself?", 'Of course. Of course. A child could do it. A child could do it.', "I can't. I", 'All the ganglia, the nerves. There are a million of them. What am I supposed to do? What am I supposed to do?', "I'm trying to thread a needle with a sledgehammer. What am I supposed to do? I can't remember. I don't remember.", 'No one can restore a brain.', "He's dying, and I can't stop it.", 'Spock?', 'Speech centre.', 'Sonic separator.', 'Tri-laser connector. Ready?', 'Right forefinger.', 'Right wrist.', 'Right elbow.', "I'll never live this down. This Vulcan is telling me how to operate.", 'Closed.', "How do I know? I could have made a thousand mistakes. Sealing nerve endings, joining ganglia. The fluid balance is correct, but I don't know.", "I knew it was wrong. I shouldn't have done it.", 'I should have never reconnected his mouth.']
Flattened Dialogue: Jim! Jim! You'd better come down to Sickbay Right now. Now. Thank God. No, not like this. I don't know. He was worse than dead. Jim. His brain is gone. It's been removed surgically. It's the greatest technical job I've ever seen. Every nerve ending in the brain must've been neatly sealed. Nothing ripped, nothing torn, no bleeding. It's a medical miracle. No. That incredible Vulcan physique hung on until the life-support cycle took over. His body lives. The autonomic functions continue. But there is no mind. What girl? I can't give you any guarantee. If it happened to any of us, I'd say indefinitely. But Vulcan physiology limits what I can do. Spock's body is more dependent on that tremendous brain for life support. Take him? Take him where? Jim, where are you going to look? In this whole galaxy, where are you going to look for Spock's brain? How are you going to find it? Even if you do, I can't restore it. I don't have the medical technique. But I don't know how. If you don't find it in twenty four hours, you'd better forget the whole thing, Jim. Call Chekov and tell him to send my stomach down. I'll have her talking in a minute. She's not, Jim. No change in reading. She doesn't know. Jim, it's no use. You'll get nothing out of that one. Hers is the mind of a child. Where are you, Spock? Where else would I be? Jim, she may not remember or even really know. Disassociation could be complete. It doesn't seem possible she could have performed surgery on Spock. Yes, for instance, above it's cold and harsh. And below, it's warm. The air is fresh. Who are the doctors? Who operates? We just want to talk to somebody about Spock's brain. That's all. Yes. Yes, in a way it is. The human brain controls the individual's functions. It's not possible. I wouldn't believe the human organism could take such pain. I'm sure you noticed the delight aspect of this place. It does, Captain. You are a disembodied brain. Thank you. I told him. Jim.. Spock. No pain. She couldn't, Jim. Her mind is functioning on a very simple level. Mental faculties here seem to be almost atrophied because of non-use. Without you there could be no delicate miracle that kept Spock's brain alive. Yes. From the very first, I appreciated your ability. It would be just enough time. Jim, it worked for her. It might work for me. I'm a surgeon already. If I could learn these techniques, I might be able to retain them. He might, but we're sure to lose you if I don't try. Spock, didn't you hear? I might be able to retain and bring these techniques to the world. Jim, isn't it worth that risk? Wouldn't you insist upon taking such a risk yourself? Of course. Of course. A child could do it. A child could do it. I can't. I All the ganglia, the nerves. There are a million of them. What am I supposed to do? What am I supposed to do? I'm trying to thread a needle with a sledgehammer. What am I supposed to do? I can't remember. I don't remember. No one can restore a brain. He's dying, and I can't stop it. Spock? Speech centre. Sonic separator. Tri-laser connector. Ready? Right forefinger. Right wrist. Right elbow. I'll never live this down. This Vulcan is telling me how to operate. Closed. How do I know? I could have made a thousand mistakes. Sealing nerve endings, joining ganglia. The fluid balance is correct, but I don't know. I knew it was wrong. I shouldn't have done it. I should have never reconnected his mouth.

Title: Spock's Brain
Dialogue: ['Functioning.', 'I found him on the table.']
Flattened Dialogue: Functioning. I found him on the table.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ['I have completed the assignment, Captain. A theoretical incursion into', "You're alive!", 'Captain, your ears. What happened?', 'Aye, sir.', 'Romulans and Vulcans appear to read almost exactly alike. There is just a slight difference which. Got him, sir.', 'Sir, transporter room has the co-ordinates and is ready for beaming.', 'Entering Neutral Zone, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: I have completed the assignment, Captain. A theoretical incursion into You're alive! Captain, your ears. What happened? Aye, sir. Romulans and Vulcans appear to read almost exactly alike. There is just a slight difference which. Got him, sir. Sir, transporter room has the co-ordinates and is ready for beaming. Entering Neutral Zone, Captain.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ["Yes, Mister Chekov. I can read, and as usual your theoretical evaluations do not tally with mine. Return to your duty and I'll let you know when your work is satisfactory.", 'Mister Spock. Full sensor scan of the region, please.', "Yes, Mister Spock, that was the past. I'm concerned with the present. Or is it becoming too much for this crew to present me current information?", 'Then, Mister Spock, comply.', 'Very well.', 'Change course. Come about to one eight five, mark three.', 'Yes, very perceptive, Mister Sulu. I know where the course change takes us. Execute.', 'Better and better, Mister Spock.', 'Very well, Mister Sulu.', 'If you two have complaints, you can bring them out into the open.', 'Sound Red Alert. Man battle stations. Stand by main phasers.', 'Lieutenant Uhura, code a message to Starfleet Command. Advise them of our situation. Include all log entries to this point.', 'Mister Spock, your sensors read clear. What happened?', 'Put it on the main viewing screen, Lieutenant, and complete that message to Starfleet Command.', 'Your information is correct. This is Captain Kirk.', 'Lieutenant. They want something, or they would have destroyed us by now.', "It's my ship they want, and very badly.", "Lieutenant. Save your threats. If you board this ship, I'll blow it up. You'll gain nothing.", 'My first officer, Commander Spock.', 'You understand that Starfleet Command has been advised of the situation?', "The design of the ship is the same. Mister Spock, you said you had a theory on why your sensors didn't pick up the new ships until they were upon us.", 'If so, Romulans could attack in Federation territory before we knew they were there, before a vessel or planet could get even begin to get their defences up.', "Well, that's a brilliant observation, Mister Scott. Do you have any other helpful opinions?", 'We have three. We can fight and be destroyed, or we can destroy the Enterprise ourselves and keep her from the Romulans. Or we can surrender. Opinions, gentlemen.', 'Dismissed, Doctor.', 'I said dismissed.', 'Kirk here.', 'Put them on the screen.', 'Put him on.', 'Why should we walk right into your hands?', "What guarantee do we have they'll beam aboard our ship once we're on yours?", "Give us your transporter co-ordinates. We're beaming aboard.", "One final order, Engineer Scott. If we do not return, the Enterprise must not be taken. If the Romulans attempt it, you're to fight, and if necessary, destroy yourselves. Is that clear?", 'Energise.', "Commander. I'm honoured.", 'Instrument failure caused navigational error. We were across the Neutral Zone before we realised it, then we were surrounded by your ships before we could get back.', 'Accidents happen. Cut off back-up systems malfunction. We were due for overhaul two months ago.', 'The error was corrected.', 'We were not spying, Commander.', "You're grossly mistaken if you think we were there", 'What earns Spock your special interest?', "You've been told everything. There's nothing else to say.", "We've been all through that, Commander!", "Let her rant. There's nothing to say.", "That's a lie!", 'Shut up, Spock!', 'You filthy liar!', "I'll kill you, you filthy traitor! I'll kill you! I'll kill you!", "Did you hear that, you coward? You've betrayed everything of value you ever knew. Did you hear the sound of human integrity?", "You traitor. I'll kill you. I'll kill you. I'll kill you!", "Oh. My neck feels like it's been twisted off.", "Ah, but the Romulans don't know that. Sure fooled the doctors.", "As far as the rest of the crew's concerned, I'm still dead.", "That's what this whole masquerade was about. To keep the Enterprise and the Federation off the hook.", 'Bones, I want you to prepare for surgery.', 'Yes.', 'Are those Romulan officers still aboard the ship?', "I'll need a Romulan uniform.", 'I wish I knew. Scotty, are you sure we have a clear channel to Spock?', "Then we can't wait any longer. Prepare to beam me aboard the flagship.", "It can't be helped, Scotty.", "Just don't put me inside a bulkhead. Energise.", "I've just effected an escape from the Federation vessel. I have important information for Sub-commander Tal. Where is he?", 'Good. I shall remember to mention your alertness to him. Return to your duty.', 'Kirk here.', "I'm already on board, Spock. Do you have the information?", "Spock, I'll get the cloaking device. Will you be able to get back to the Enterprise without attracting their attention?", "There's an intruder aboard. Has someone tried to gain entrance there?", 'Over there!', "There's an enemy spy aboard. He'll be after the cloaking device.", 'Scotty, energise.', "We'll just have to hope he can buy us enough time to get this cloaking device installed.", 'Can you do it?', 'You have fifteen minutes, Scotty.', 'The report was premature.', "We'll discuss it later. Mister Sulu, lay in a course for home. Mister Chekov, take the sensors. Mister Spock is still aboard the Romulan flagship. I want his body readings pinpointed and isolated. That was not a request, gentlemen.", "Mister Chekov, there's only one Vulcan aboard that ship. He should be easy enough to locate.", 'Feed the co-ordinates to the transporter room on the double. Have them prepare to beam him aboard on my signal.', 'Go ahead, Scotty.', 'Stand by, Scotty.', 'Transporter room, beam Mister Spock aboard.', 'The commander?', 'All right. Have them report to the Bridge on the double. Mister Sulu, take us away from the Romulans. Warp factor nine.', 'Scotty, throw the switch on that device.', 'Lieutenant, open a channel to the Romulan vessel.', 'Establish two-way visual contact.', 'This is Captain Kirk. Hold your fire. We have your commander aboard.', 'Break contact!', "Scotty, we're running out of time.", 'Mister Spock, distance from the Romulan vessel?', "Stand by, phasers. Commander, you'll forgive me if I put up a fight.", 'Scotty.', 'Throw the switch.', 'Throw the switch.', 'Mister Sulu, come about. Three one eight mark seven.', "Thank you, Mister Spock. Cancel Red Alert. We'll let you off at the nearest Federation outpost.", 'Mister Spock will have the honour of escorting you to your quarters.', 'Commander.', 'Very good, Mister Chekov. Thank you, Mister Leslie.', 'What is it, Bones?', 'What for?', "I'm on my way."]
Flattened Dialogue: Yes, Mister Chekov. I can read, and as usual your theoretical evaluations do not tally with mine. Return to your duty and I'll let you know when your work is satisfactory. Mister Spock. Full sensor scan of the region, please. Yes, Mister Spock, that was the past. I'm concerned with the present. Or is it becoming too much for this crew to present me current information? Then, Mister Spock, comply. Very well. Change course. Come about to one eight five, mark three. Yes, very perceptive, Mister Sulu. I know where the course change takes us. Execute. Better and better, Mister Spock. Very well, Mister Sulu. If you two have complaints, you can bring them out into the open. Sound Red Alert. Man battle stations. Stand by main phasers. Lieutenant Uhura, code a message to Starfleet Command. Advise them of our situation. Include all log entries to this point. Mister Spock, your sensors read clear. What happened? Put it on the main viewing screen, Lieutenant, and complete that message to Starfleet Command. Your information is correct. This is Captain Kirk. Lieutenant. They want something, or they would have destroyed us by now. It's my ship they want, and very badly. Lieutenant. Save your threats. If you board this ship, I'll blow it up. You'll gain nothing. My first officer, Commander Spock. You understand that Starfleet Command has been advised of the situation? The design of the ship is the same. Mister Spock, you said you had a theory on why your sensors didn't pick up the new ships until they were upon us. If so, Romulans could attack in Federation territory before we knew they were there, before a vessel or planet could get even begin to get their defences up. Well, that's a brilliant observation, Mister Scott. Do you have any other helpful opinions? We have three. We can fight and be destroyed, or we can destroy the Enterprise ourselves and keep her from the Romulans. Or we can surrender. Opinions, gentlemen. Dismissed, Doctor. I said dismissed. Kirk here. Put them on the screen. Put him on. Why should we walk right into your hands? What guarantee do we have they'll beam aboard our ship once we're on yours? Give us your transporter co-ordinates. We're beaming aboard. One final order, Engineer Scott. If we do not return, the Enterprise must not be taken. If the Romulans attempt it, you're to fight, and if necessary, destroy yourselves. Is that clear? Energise. Commander. I'm honoured. Instrument failure caused navigational error. We were across the Neutral Zone before we realised it, then we were surrounded by your ships before we could get back. Accidents happen. Cut off back-up systems malfunction. We were due for overhaul two months ago. The error was corrected. We were not spying, Commander. You're grossly mistaken if you think we were there What earns Spock your special interest? You've been told everything. There's nothing else to say. We've been all through that, Commander! Let her rant. There's nothing to say. That's a lie! Shut up, Spock! You filthy liar! I'll kill you, you filthy traitor! I'll kill you! I'll kill you! Did you hear that, you coward? You've betrayed everything of value you ever knew. Did you hear the sound of human integrity? You traitor. I'll kill you. I'll kill you. I'll kill you! Oh. My neck feels like it's been twisted off. Ah, but the Romulans don't know that. Sure fooled the doctors. As far as the rest of the crew's concerned, I'm still dead. That's what this whole masquerade was about. To keep the Enterprise and the Federation off the hook. Bones, I want you to prepare for surgery. Yes. Are those Romulan officers still aboard the ship? I'll need a Romulan uniform. I wish I knew. Scotty, are you sure we have a clear channel to Spock? Then we can't wait any longer. Prepare to beam me aboard the flagship. It can't be helped, Scotty. Just don't put me inside a bulkhead. Energise. I've just effected an escape from the Federation vessel. I have important information for Sub-commander Tal. Where is he? Good. I shall remember to mention your alertness to him. Return to your duty. Kirk here. I'm already on board, Spock. Do you have the information? Spock, I'll get the cloaking device. Will you be able to get back to the Enterprise without attracting their attention? There's an intruder aboard. Has someone tried to gain entrance there? Over there! There's an enemy spy aboard. He'll be after the cloaking device. Scotty, energise. We'll just have to hope he can buy us enough time to get this cloaking device installed. Can you do it? You have fifteen minutes, Scotty. The report was premature. We'll discuss it later. Mister Sulu, lay in a course for home. Mister Chekov, take the sensors. Mister Spock is still aboard the Romulan flagship. I want his body readings pinpointed and isolated. That was not a request, gentlemen. Mister Chekov, there's only one Vulcan aboard that ship. He should be easy enough to locate. Feed the co-ordinates to the transporter room on the double. Have them prepare to beam him aboard on my signal. Go ahead, Scotty. Stand by, Scotty. Transporter room, beam Mister Spock aboard. The commander? All right. Have them report to the Bridge on the double. Mister Sulu, take us away from the Romulans. Warp factor nine. Scotty, throw the switch on that device. Lieutenant, open a channel to the Romulan vessel. Establish two-way visual contact. This is Captain Kirk. Hold your fire. We have your commander aboard. Break contact! Scotty, we're running out of time. Mister Spock, distance from the Romulan vessel? Stand by, phasers. Commander, you'll forgive me if I put up a fight. Scotty. Throw the switch. Throw the switch. Mister Sulu, come about. Three one eight mark seven. Thank you, Mister Spock. Cancel Red Alert. We'll let you off at the nearest Federation outpost. Mister Spock will have the honour of escorting you to your quarters. Commander. Very good, Mister Chekov. Thank you, Mister Leslie. What is it, Bones? What for? I'm on my way.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ['I did give a full report', 'Sensor scan to one half parsec. Negative, Captain.', 'Increasing sensor scan to one parsec. All scanners report clear. Nothing in our immediate vicinity.', 'Intelligence reports Romulans now using Klingon design.', 'A second ship has appeared. Correction, there are now three. We are surrounded.', 'I have a theory, Captain.', 'True, Captain. That would be standard Romulan procedure.', 'It would be a great prize.', 'I believe the Romulans have developed a cloaking device which renders our tracking sensors useless.', 'If we had not crossed the Neutral Zone, on your order, you would not now need our opinions to support a decision which should never have had to be made.', 'Spock.', 'I understand.', "Starfleet is not in the habit of informing Romulans of its ships' personnel.", 'It is no myth.', 'I reserve the privilege of speaking only when it will not violate my honour as a Vulcan.', "You're being clever, Commander. That is unworthy of a Romulan. It is not a lie to keep the truth to oneself.", 'You would not resort to them, Commander. They would prove ineffective against the captain.', "I cannot allow the captain to be further destroyed. The strain of command has worn heavily upon him. He's not been himself for several weeks.", 'As you can see, Captain Kirk is a highly sensitive and emotional person. I believe he has lost the capacity for rational decision.', "I'm betraying no secrets. The commander's suspicion that Starfleet ordered the Enterprise into the Neutral Zone is unacceptable. Our rapid capture demonstrates its foolhardiness.", 'I am speaking the truth for the benefit of the Enterprise and the Federation. I say now and for the record, that Captain Kirk ordered the Enterprise across the Neutral Zone on his own initiative and his craving for glory.', 'He is not sane.', 'I am half Vulcan. My mother is a human.', 'Vulcan.', 'Eighteen years.', 'The question is irrelevant.', 'My duty as an officer is to obey him.', 'I do not desire a ship of my own.', 'Such opportunities are extremely rare.', 'That thought has occasionally crossed my mind.', 'Commander, shall we speak plainly? It is you who desperately need a ship. You want the Enterprise.', 'Indeed.', 'I am honoured, Commander. Are the guards also invited?', 'Of course. I shall obey your restrictions.', 'It would be illogical to assume that all conditions remain stable.', 'I am ready.', 'The matter is not open for discussion, Doctor.', 'There is no alternative, Doctor. The safety of the crew is now the paramount issue. It is misguided loyalty to resist any further.', 'I was unprepared for his attack. I instinctively used the Vulcan death grip.', "I am very flattered, Commander. There's no doubt that the cuisine aboard your vessel is far superior to that of the Enterprise. It is indeed a very powerful recruiting inducement.", 'A place?', 'I was not aware of that aspect of Romulan society.', 'Please believe me. I do appreciate it.', 'Yes, of course, but not just this moment. An hour from now will do even better. Would it not, Commander?', 'I was beginning to wonder.', 'How rare, and how beautiful. But so incongruous when spoken by a soldier.', 'Spock to Captain Kirk.', 'Captain', 'Are you prepared to beam over?', "Yes, Captain. The cloaking device is in an area near the commander's quarters. It is closely guarded and off-limits to all but authorised personnel. What is your present location?", 'Unknown, Captain. At present, I am rather heavily', 'Commander, your attire is not only more appropriate, it should actually stimulate our conversation.', 'I must confess that I too am moved emotionally. I know it is illogical.', 'That will be profitless, Commander. I do not believe you will find it.', 'I assure you I am quite sane.', 'First officer of the Enterprise. What is your present form of execution?', 'I demand the Right of Statement first.', 'Thank you. I shall not require much time. No more than twenty minutes, I should say.', 'My crime is sabotage. I freely admit my guilt. The oath I swore as a Starfleet officer is both specific and binding. As long as I wear the uniform, my duty is to protect the security of the Federation. Clearly, your new cloaking device is a threat to that security. I carried out my duty.', 'There is no regulation regarding the content of my statement. May I continue?', 'Beyond the historic tradition of Vulcan loyalty, there is also the combined Romulan-Vulcan history of obedience to duty.', 'One hundred and fifty thousand kilometres, Captain, and closing very rapidly.', 'One hundred thousand kilometres. They should commence firing at us within the next twelve point seven seconds.', 'The cloaking device is working perfectly, and the commander has informed me that even the Romulan sensors cannot track a vessel so equipped.', 'Deck two. It is regrettable that you were made an unwilling passenger. It was not intentional. All the Federation wanted was the cloaking device.', 'It was my only interest when I boarded your vessel.', 'You underestimate yourself, Commander.', 'Obviously. Military secrets are the most fleeting of all. I hope that you and I exchanged something more permanent.', 'It was the only choice possible. You would not respect any other.', 'Captain, please go. Somehow they do not look aesthetically agreeable', 'On humans.']

What is your present location? Unknown, Captain. At present, I am rather heavily Commander, your attire is not only more appropriate, it should actually stimulate our conversation. I must confess that I too am moved emotionally. I know it is illogical. That will be profitless, Commander. I do not believe you will find it. I assure you I am quite sane. First officer of the Enterprise. What is your present form of execution? I demand the Right of Statement first. Thank you. I shall not require much time. No more than twenty minutes, I should say. My crime is sabotage. I freely admit my guilt. The oath I swore as a Starfleet officer is both specific and binding. As long as I wear the uniform, my duty is to protect the security of the Federation. Clearly, your new cloaking device is a threat to that security. I carried out my duty. There is no regulation regarding the content of my statement. May I continue? Beyond the historic tradition of Vulcan loyalty, there is also the combined Romulan-Vulcan history of obedience to duty. One hundred and fifty thousand kilometres, Captain, and closing very rapidly. One hundred thousand kilometres. They should commence firing at us within the next twelve point seven seconds. The cloaking device is working perfectly, and the commander has informed me that even the Romulan sensors cannot track a vessel so equipped. Deck two. It is regrettable that you were made an unwilling passenger. It was not intentional. All the Federation wanted was the cloaking device. It was my only interest when I boarded your vessel. You underestimate yourself, Commander. Obviously. Military secrets are the most fleeting of all. I hope that you and I exchanged something more permanent. It was the only choice possible. You would not respect any other. Captain, please go. Somehow they do not look aesthetically agreeable On humans.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ["I can find no reason for the captain's behaviour, except possibly that we've been on patrol too long without relief and diversion. He has resisted all of my attempts to run a psychological profile on him.", 'Jim, you ordered us? You had no authority!', 'Jim!', 'McCoy here.', "I don't make house calls.", "He'll recover, but he'll need further attention. Inform your superior.", 'McCoy. Chief medical officer.', "Well, you can see for yourself, he's mentally depressed, physically weak, disoriented, displays feelings of persecution and rebellion.", 'No, not now.', "Yes, it's possible.", "Spock, I don't believe it. There's no price you could pay that would make him sell out.", "What do you mean, the matter's not open for discussion?", 'What did you do? What did you do?', 'Your instincts are still good, Mister Spock. The captain is dead.', 'I left orders that no one come in here.', 'Well now that you know it, you might as well assist me. Hand me the physiostimulator.', 'Spock gave him a nerve pinch to simulate death.', "I didn't know it until I beamed aboard the Romulan ship. Jim and Spock were operating under Federation orders.", "That's the Vulcan death grip for you.", "You took a big chance they didn't start an autopsy.", 'So that if anything went wrong, you would be the one to blame.', 'What for?', 'Sickbay to Bridge.', 'Mister Scott, will you report to Sickbay.', "You have to. It's urgent.", 'Well, I do. Mister Scott, please.', "What the devil is Spock doing? What's delaying him?", "You're taking an awful chance, Jim.", 'Sickbay to Bridge.', "Well, if all the shouting's over up there, I'd like for you to report to Sickbay.", "Well, you're due in surgery. I'm going to bob your ears.", 'Well, are you coming, Jim?', 'Or do you want to go through life looking like your First Officer?']
Flattened Dialogue: I can find no reason for the captain's behaviour, except possibly that we've been on patrol too long without relief and diversion. He has resisted all of my attempts to run a psychological profile on him. Jim, you ordered us? You had no authority! Jim! McCoy here. I don't make house calls. He'll recover, but he'll need further attention. Inform your superior. McCoy. Chief medical officer. Well, you can see for yourself, he's mentally depressed, physically weak, disoriented, displays feelings of persecution and rebellion. No, not now. Yes, it's possible. Spock, I don't believe it. There's no price you could pay that would make him sell out. What do you mean, the matter's not open for discussion? What did you do? What did you do? Your instincts are still good, Mister Spock. The captain is dead. I left orders that no one come in here. Well now that you know it, you might as well assist me. Hand me the physiostimulator. Spock gave him a nerve pinch to simulate death. I didn't know it until I beamed aboard the Romulan ship. Jim and Spock were operating under Federation orders. That's the Vulcan death grip for you. You took a big chance they didn't start an autopsy. So that if anything went wrong, you would be the one to blame. What for? Sickbay to Bridge. Mister Scott, will you report to Sickbay. You have to. It's urgent. Well, I do. Mister Scott, please. What the devil is Spock doing? What's delaying him? You're taking an awful chance, Jim. Sickbay to Bridge. Well, if all the shouting's over up there, I'd like for you to report to Sickbay. Well, you're due in surgery. I'm going to bob your ears. Well, are you coming, Jim? Or do you want to go through life looking like your First Officer?

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ['Maintaining course and speed, sir.', "But, sir, that'll lead us directly into the Romulan Neutral Zone.", 'Aye, sir.', 'Captain, leaving Neutral Zone. Now entering Romulan space.', 'Captain!', 'Aye, sir.', 'Holding at warp nine, sir.', 'Three one eight mark seven, sir. Executing.']
Flattened Dialogue: Maintaining course and speed, sir. But, sir, that'll lead us directly into the Romulan Neutral Zone. Aye, sir. Captain, leaving Neutral Zone. Now entering Romulan space. Captain! Aye, sir. Holding at warp nine, sir. Three one eight mark seven, sir. Executing.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ['Lieutenant, when did the order come through?', 'From Starfleet. The order to enter the Neutral Zone.', "Surely the Captain couldn't be doing this on his own authority.", "That's a Klingon ship! But it couldn't be, not in this area.", 'They caught us right enough.', "We've not got many choices.", "If the Enterprise is taken by Romulans, they'll know everything there is to know about a starship.", 'Perfectly clear.', 'Security, put our two Romulan hostages in the brig. Lieutenant Uhura, give me a channel to that ship.', 'This is Lieutenant Commander Scott. The Enterprise takes no orders, except those of Captain', 'Kirk, And we will stay right here until he returns. And if you make any attempt to board or commandeer the Enterprise, it will be blown to bits along with as many of you as we can take with us.', 'Scott here, Doctor.', "Sickbay? I can't leave the bridge at a time like this.", "We're surrounded by enemy vessels ready to attack us. I don't know of anything more urgent than that.", 'All right, Doctor. It better be important. Scott out.', "All right, Doctor, what's so urgent that... Captain? Captain Kirk.", "Well, you look like the devil himself, but as long as you're alive. What's it all about?", "They're in the brig, sir.", 'Aye, sir. No doubt of it.', "But Mister Spock hasn't sent the proper co-ordinates yet.", 'But, sir, what about Mister Spock?', "It'll have to hook into our deflector shield control.", "I don't know, sir.", "I've got that device installed, but bless me if I know whether it'll work.", "It's the biggest guess I've ever made.", 'I did, sir.', "It's not working.", "Captain, I'm working as fast as I can.", "It's ready now, Captain, but I don't know whether our circuits can handle this alien contraption.", "It'll likely overload."]
Flattened Dialogue: Lieutenant, when did the order come through? From Starfleet. The order to enter the Neutral Zone. Surely the Captain couldn't be doing this on his own authority. That's a Klingon ship! But it couldn't be, not in this area. They caught us right enough. We've not got many choices. If the Enterprise is taken by Romulans, they'll know everything there is to know about a starship. Perfectly clear. Security, put our two Romulan hostages in the brig. Lieutenant Uhura, give me a channel to that ship. This is Lieutenant Commander Scott. The Enterprise takes no orders, except those of Captain Kirk, And we will stay right here until he returns. And if you make any attempt to board or commandeer the Enterprise, it will be blown to bits along with as many of you as we can take with us. Scott here, Doctor. Sickbay? I can't leave the bridge at a time like this. We're surrounded by enemy vessels ready to attack us. I don't know of anything more urgent than that. All right, Doctor. It better be important. Scott out. All right, Doctor, what's so urgent that... Captain? Captain Kirk. Well, you look like the devil himself, but as long as you're alive. What's it all about? They're in the brig, sir. Aye, sir. No doubt of it. But Mister Spock hasn't sent the proper co-ordinates yet. But, sir, what about Mister Spock? It'll have to hook into our deflector shield control. I don't know, sir. I've got that device installed, but bless me if I know whether it'll work. It's the biggest guess I've ever made. I did, sir. It's not working. Captain, I'm working as fast as I can. It's ready now, Captain, but I don't know whether our circuits can handle this alien contraption. It'll likely overload.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ['Order?', "There's been no order I know of, Mister Scott.", 'Battle stations. All hands, battle stations.', 'Aye, sir.', "Captain Kirk, I'm receiving a class two signal from the Romulan vessel.", 'Aye, sir.', 'Bridge to Captain Kirk.', 'The Romulan vessel is signalling again, sir.', 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'Channel is open, Mister Scott, and you are tied in.', 'Bridge to Doctor McCoy.', "Doctor, you must beam aboard the Romulan flagship immediately. There's been an injury.", "Doctor, it's Captain Kirk!", "They said you'd been killed, sir.", 'Aye, sir.', 'Captain Kirk. Mister Scott is on the intercom for you, sir.', 'Transporter room reports Mister Spock aboard, sir, and the Romulan commander.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Aye, sir. I have Sub-commander Tal, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Order? There's been no order I know of, Mister Scott. Battle stations. All hands, battle stations. Aye, sir. Captain Kirk, I'm receiving a class two signal from the Romulan vessel. Aye, sir. Bridge to Captain Kirk. The Romulan vessel is signalling again, sir. Aye, aye, sir. Channel is open, Mister Scott, and you are tied in. Bridge to Doctor McCoy. Doctor, you must beam aboard the Romulan flagship immediately. There's been an injury. Doctor, it's Captain Kirk! They said you'd been killed, sir. Aye, sir. Captain Kirk. Mister Scott is on the intercom for you, sir. Transporter room reports Mister Spock aboard, sir, and the Romulan commander. Aye, sir. Aye, sir. I have Sub-commander Tal, sir.

Title: The Enterprise Incident
Dialogue: ["But he's alive, alive!", 'But he was dead. Their doctors certified he was dead.', "Then Mister Spock isn't a traitor, and you knew that and you didn't", "There's no such thing as a Vulcan death grip.", 'Why?']
Flattened Dialogue: But he's alive, alive! But he was dead. Their doctors certified he was dead. Then Mister Spock isn't a traitor, and you knew that and you didn't There's no such thing as a Vulcan death grip. Why?

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Dialogue: ['Look at those pine trees.', "I swear that's honeysuckle I smell.", 'What in blazes is that?', 'Meadows and no meteor craters. The whole place is an enigma, biologically and culturally.', "Why, they look like. I'd swear they're American Indians.", "Shouldn't we contact them, Jim? Tell them?", "What's the matter, Jim?", "Typical human reaction to an idyllic natural setting. Back in the twentieth century, we referred to it as the Tahiti Syndrome. It's particularly common to over-pressured leader types, like starship captains.", 'Yes.', "Leaving? You can't be serious, Spock.", "The devil with an asteroid! It won't get here for two months, Spock!", 'In the meantime, what about Jim?', 'That may be hours from now. He may be injured or dying.', 'Can a few more minutes matter, Spock?', 'What for?', 'It might also cripple the ship, and we would be crushed by the asteroid.', "Jim won't be able to get out of its path.", "You sound like you're cutting a diamond.", 'Well, Spock, you took your calculated risk in your calculated Vulcan way, and you lost. You lost for us, you lost for that planet, and you lost for Jim.', "And my responsibility is the health of this crew. You've been driving yourself too hard, and I want you to get some rest.", "Back to that planet? Without warp speed, it'll take months, Spock.", "Well then what's the use? We might not be able to save the captain even if he still is alive. We might not be able to save anything, including this ship! You haven't heard a word I've said. All you've been doing is staring at that blasted obelisk.", 'I thought you were reporting to Sickbay.', "You've been trying to do that ever since we started back to that planet. Fifty eight days.", "Well, you won't read them by killing yourself. You've hardly eaten or slept for weeks. Now if you don't let up, you're going to collapse.", 'Well, your Vulcan metabolism is so low it can hardly be measured, and as for the pressure, that green ice water you call blood', "Well, my diagnosis is exhaustion brought on from overwork and guilt. You're blaming yourself for crippling this ship, just as we blamed you. Well, we were wrong. So were you. You made a command decision. Jim would have done the same. My prescription is rest, now. Do I have to call the security guards to enforce it?", 'I prescribed sleep.', "Musical notes? You mean it's nothing but a song?", 'Were you able to make sense our of the symbols?', "I've always wondered why there were so many humanoids scattered through the galaxy.", "That's probably how the planet has survived all these centuries. The Preservers put an asteroid deflector on the planet.", 'And we have to find that deflector and put it back into working order, otherwise', 'I need Nurse Chapel.', 'Wife?', 'His brain is unimpaired. Everything else is functionally normally except his memory.', "It'd take time.", 'We have no choice.', 'What is it?', 'She had bad internal injuries, Jim.', 'No.']
Flattened Dialogue: Look at those pine trees. I swear that's honeysuckle I smell. What in blazes is that? Meadows and no meteor craters. The whole place is an enigma, biologically and culturally. Why, they look like. I'd swear they're American Indians. Shouldn't we contact them, Jim? Tell them? What's the matter, Jim? Typical human reaction to an idyllic natural setting. Back in the twentieth century, we referred to it as the Tahiti Syndrome. It's particularly common to over-pressured leader types, like starship captains. Yes. Leaving? You can't be serious, Spock. The devil with an asteroid! It won't get here for two months, Spock! In the meantime, what about Jim? That may be hours from now. He may be injured or dying. Can a few more minutes matter, Spock? What for? It might also cripple the ship, and we would be crushed by the asteroid. Jim won't be able to get out of its path. You sound like you're cutting a diamond. Well, Spock, you took your calculated risk in your calculated Vulcan way, and you lost. You lost for us, you lost for that planet, and you lost for Jim. And my responsibility is the health of this crew. You've been driving yourself too hard, and I want you to get some rest. Back to that planet? Without warp speed, it'll take months, Spock. Well then what's the use? We might not be able to save the captain even if he still is alive. We might not be able to save anything, including this ship! You haven't heard a word I've said. All you've been doing is staring at that blasted obelisk. I thought you were reporting to Sickbay. You've been trying to do that ever since we started back to that planet. Fifty eight days. Well, you won't read them by killing yourself. You've hardly eaten or slept for weeks. Now if you don't let up, you're going to collapse. Well, your Vulcan metabolism is so low it can hardly be measured, and as for the pressure, that green ice water you call blood Well, my diagnosis is exhaustion brought on from overwork and guilt. You're blaming yourself for crippling this ship, just as we blamed you. Well, we were wrong. So were you. You made a command decision. Jim would have done the same. My prescription is rest, now. Do I have to call the security guards to enforce it? I prescribed sleep. Musical notes? You mean it's nothing but a song? Were you able to make sense our of the symbols? I've always wondered why there were so many humanoids scattered through the galaxy. That's probably how the planet has survived all these centuries. The Preservers put an asteroid deflector on the planet. And we have to find that deflector and put it back into working order, otherwise I need Nurse Chapel. Wife? His brain is unimpaired. Everything else is functionally normally except his memory. It'd take time. We have no choice. What is it? She had bad internal injuries, Jim. No.

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Dialogue: ['And that lake.', "I swear that's a little orange blossom thrown in. It's unbelievable. Growth exactly like that of Earth on a planet half a galaxy away. What are the odds on such duplication?", 'Analysis, Spock.', 'Any theories about what it is?', "What's the nearest concentration of life forms, Mister Spock?", 'And how much time did you say we have to investigate?', 'You did say thirty minutes?', "Then let's go. Let's find out what life forms are blessed by this environment.", "It's like discovering Atlantis or Shangri-la. Mister Spock, is it possible there's a more evolved civilisation somewhere else on this planet, one capable of building that obelisk or developing a deflector system?", "Tell them what? That an asteroid's coming to smash their world into atoms?", "We've got a job to do. Let's get back to the Enterprise.", "What? Oh, nothing. It's just so peaceful, uncomplicated. No problems, no command decisions. Just living.", "Ah, the Tahiti Syndrome. Let's go take care of that asteroid. But first I want another look at that obelisk.", 'Kirk to Enterprise.', "Where am I? What place is this? What are these? I feel should know. They're familiar and yet unfamiliar. How did I get here? Who am I? Try to remember.", 'Who are you?', "I'll answer anything I can, but as I told you, many things are strange to me.", "I came from the temple, as Miramanee said, and it was a beginning for me here. But I came from the sky, too. Only I can't remember. I can't remember.", 'Wait a moment.', "He'll be all right now.", "It's a simple technique. It goes way back. Way back.", 'Miramanee, tell me about the Wise Ones.', 'Not this one. Tell me.', 'Secrets of the temple.', 'The secrets were passed on from father to son?', "Well, why doesn't Salish use it? Why are the people in danger?", 'Ki, Kir', 'No, no, everything is fine.', 'Your land is rich, your people happy. Who could be displeased with that?', "I can't tell you anything. All I can tell you is that I'm happy and peaceful here. I'm not sure, but I think I've never felt that way before.", 'Why are they so sure I can help them?', 'Yes, but I. I need time to remember.', 'The Joining day?', "No, Miramanee, there's no one else in my mind or my heart.", 'Name the Joining day.', 'I have found paradise. Surely no man has ever attained such happiness.', 'Get out of my way, Salish.', "Nobody's asking for your permission.", 'I have no intention of striking you dead.', 'Miramanee. Come here. Miramanee.', "I'm happy. I'm so happy. If it weren't for the dreams, my mind would be completely at peace.", "They've come back. They were gone for a while, but they've come back, and I see faces, too. Very dim. I feel I should know know them. I feel my place is with them, not here. I don't deserve this happiness.", 'A gift? What?', 'These last few weeks, my love for Miramanee grows stronger with each passing day. However, the dreams return every night. Fragments of memories. I can almost get hold of them, and then', 'You!', "A canal. And with it we'll bring the water from the lake right to the lodge. And we can expand the system, and irrigate the fields and double the food supply.", 'Lamp.', 'Preserve.', 'Preserve.', "Oh, no. No, no, no, no, no. That's not why I made the lamp at all, to keep you forever cooking.", "It's only the wind and the thunder.", 'Why?', "But it's only the wind. The wind can't harm them.", "But I can't do anything about the wind or the sky.", "I don't know how to get inside the temple.", "We'll go to the caves. It'll be safe there.", 'Take care of Miramanee.', 'I am Kirok! I have come! I am Kirok!', 'Miramanee!', 'My wife. Is she all right?', 'Miramanee.', 'No!', 'Miramanee! No! Miramanee!', 'I am Kirok! I am', 'It worked.', "Yes. What's inside is loaded with scientific equipment.", 'McCoy.', "I don't know how to get inside.", "The key must be in these symbols. We've got to decipher them.", 'You mean entry can be gained by playing certain notes on a musical instrument?', 'Give me your communicator. Tonal control, consonants and vowels. I must have hit it accidentally when I contacted the ship.', 'Kirk to Enterprise.', "Scotty, if the deflector isn't activated within twenty minutes, get out of orbit. Get the Enterprise out of the danger zone. The landing party is expendable. The Enterprise isn't. Kirk out. Miramanee. Bones, stay with her. Do what you can.", "Careful. I must have hit something accidentally. A beam caught me and that's when I stopped remembering.", 'More symbols. Can you read them?', 'Spock, just press the right button.', 'How is she?', 'Will she live?', 'And so are your people, Miramanee.', "If that's what you want.", "And I'll love you, Miramanee. Always."]

And how much time did you say we have to investigate? You did say thirty minutes? Then let's go. Let's find out what life forms are blessed by this environment. Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Dialogue: ['Astronomical, Captain. The relative size, age and composition of this planet makes it highly improbable that it would evolve similarly to Earth in any way.', "An alien metal of some kind. An alloy resistant to probe. Readings can't even measure its age accurately. These incised symbols are fascinating. Evidently, some form of writing.", 'Negative, Captain. Structures of this complexity require extremely sophisticated building apparatus, the kind usually found in cultures surpassing or equalling our own.', 'Bearing one one seven mark four.', 'If we are to divert the asteroid which is on a collision course with this planet, we must warp out of orbit within thirty minutes. Every second we delay arriving at the deflection point compounds the problem, perhaps past solution.', 'Yes, sir.', 'They are, Doctor. A mixture of Navajo, Mohican, and Delaware, I believe. All among the more advanced and peaceful tribes.', 'Highly improbable, Captain. Sensor probes indicate only one type of life form here.', 'Too primitive to grasp the concept of space flight, Doctor. Our appearance here would only confuse and frighten them.', 'Doctor?', 'I suggest that any further research on your part be delayed until after we have diverted the asteroid.', 'Spock to Enterprise.', "Prepare to beam us up, Mister Scott. We're warping out of orbit.", "Doctor, that asteroid is almost as large as your Earth's moon. Far enough away, the angle necessary to divert it enough to avoid destruction is minute, but as the asteroid approaches this planet, the angle becomes so great that even the power of a starship", 'If we arrive at the deflection point in time, it may not get here at all.', "Once the asteroid has been diverted, we'll return here and resume the search.", "Doctor, assume this is the planet we're on. This is the approaching asteroid. If we don't get to that deflection point in time, it will become physically impossible to divert this asteroid. In that case, everyone on this planet will die, including the captain.", "In the time it's taken me to explain the problem, the asteroid has moved from here to here. The longer we delay, the less the likelihood of being able to divert it. Beam us up, Mister Scott.", 'Stress or not, we cannot reduce speed. I do not intend to miss that', 'Deflection point.', 'Objection noted, Mister Scott. Carry on.', 'Full power, Mister Scott.', 'Then bypass the relays and go to manual control.', 'I want full power, Mister Scott.', 'Magnification factor twelve, Mister Sulu.', 'All engines stop. Hold position here.', 'Prepare to activate deflectors.', 'Engineering, maintain full power. Full power.', 'Not now.', 'Activate deflectors.', 'Degree of deflection, Mister Sulu.', 'Recircuit power to engines. Maximum speed heading three seven mark zero one zero.', 'Correct, Mister Chekov. I intend to retreat in front of that asteroid until we can employ all power on phaser beams.', 'To destroy it. A narrow beam concentrated on a single spot will split that mass.', "Incorrect. We'll still be able to get out of its path by use of impulse power.", 'That, Doctor, is another calculated risk we must take.', 'Co-ordinates, Mister Chekov.', "That is our target. The asteroid's weakest point.", 'Lock all phasers on that mark. Maximum intensity, narrow beam. I want to split that fissure wide open.', 'Very astute, Doctor.', "We'll fire in sequence and continue firing as long as Mister Scott can maintain power.", 'Fire phasers.', 'Rig for simultaneous firing, Mister Sulu. Commence simultaneous bombardment.', 'Estimated repair time?', "I've already surmised that. Thank you, Mister Scott.", 'I accept the responsibility, Doctor.', 'Mister Chekov, resume heading eight eight three mark four one.', 'Exactly fifty nine point two two three days, Doctor, and that asteroid will be four hours behind us all the way.', 'Another calculated Vulcan risk, Doctor.', "There isn't time, Doctor. I must decipher those obelisk's symbols. They're a highly advanced form of cipher writing.", "I'm aware of that, Doctor. I'm also aware when we arrive at the planet, we'll have barely four hours to effect rescue. I believe those symbols are the key.", 'I am not hungry, Doctor. And under stress, we Vulcans can do without sleep for weeks.', 'My physical condition is not important, Doctor. That obelisk is.', 'You prescribed rest, Doctor. The symbols on the obelisk are not words. They are musical notes.', 'In a way, yes. Other cultures, among them certain Vulcan offshoots, use musical notes as words. The tones correspond roughly to an alphabet.', 'Yes. The obelisk is a marker, just as I thought. It was left by a super-race known as the Preservers. Flattened Dialogue: Astronomical, Captain. The relative size, age and composition of this planet makes it highly improbable that it would evolve similarly to Earth in any way. An alien metal of some kind. An alloy resistant to probe. Readings can't even measure its age accurately. These incised symbols are fascinating. Evidently, some form of writing. Negative, Captain. Structures of this complexity require extremely sophisticated building apparatus, the kind usually found in cultures surpassing or equalling our own. Bearing one one seven mark four. If we are to divert the asteroid which is on a collision course with this planet, we must warp out of orbit within thirty minutes. Every second we delay arriving at the deflection point compounds the problem, perhaps past solution. Yes, sir. They are, Doctor. A mixture of Navajo, Mohican, and Delaware, I believe. All among the more advanced and peaceful tribes. Highly improbable, Captain. Sensor probes indicate only one type of life form here. Too primitive to grasp the concept of space flight, Doctor. Our appearance here would only confuse and frighten them. Doctor? I suggest that any further research on your part be delayed until after we have diverted the asteroid. Spock to Enterprise. Prepare to beam us up, Mister Scott. We're warping out of orbit. Doctor, that asteroid is almost as large as your Earth's moon. Far enough away, the angle necessary to divert it enough to avoid destruction is minute, but as the asteroid approaches this planet, the angle becomes so great that even the power of a starship If we arrive at the deflection point in time, it may not get here at all. Once the asteroid has been diverted, we'll return here and resume the search. Doctor, assume this is the planet we're on. This is the approaching asteroid. If we don't get to that deflection point in time, it will become physically impossible to divert this asteroid. In that case, everyone on this planet will die, including the captain. In the time it's taken me to explain the problem, the asteroid has moved from here to here. The longer we delay, the less the likelihood of being able to divert it. Beam us up, Mister Scott. Stress or not, we cannot reduce speed. I do not intend to miss that Deflection point. Objection noted, Mister Scott. Carry on. Full power, Mister Scott. Engineering, maintain full power. Full power. Not now. Activate deflectors. Degree of deflection, Mister Sulu. Recircuit power to engines. Maximum speed heading three seven mark zero one zero. Correct, Mister Chekov. I intend to retreat in front of that asteroid until we can employ all power on phaser beams. To destroy it. A narrow beam concentrated on a single spot will split that mass. Incorrect. We'll still be able to get out of its path by use of impulse power. That, Doctor, is another calculated risk we must take. Co-ordinates, Mister Chekov. That is our target. Title: The Paradise Syndrome

Title: The Paradise Syndrome
Dialogue: ['Enterprise. Come in, Mister Spock.', "I can't give you warp nine much longer, Mister Spock. These engines are beginning to show signs of stress.", "All right, but we're moving further into the danger range all the time.", 'If these circuits', 'The relays will reject the overload, Mister Spock!', "We'll burn out the engines!", 'Aye, sir.', 'All right, you lovelies. Hold together. Full power, Mister Spock.', 'All engines stop, sir.', "Dilithium crystal circuit's failing, sir. We'll have to replace it.", "That Vulcan won't be satisfied till these panels are a puddle of lead.", 'My bairns. My poor bairns.', "Don't ask for anymore warp nine speeds, Mister Spock. Our star drive is completely burned out. The only thing we have left is impulse power.", 'Hanging here in space? Forever.', "The only thing that'll fix these poor darlings is the nearest repair base.", 'Come in, Mister Spock.', 'Aye, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Enterprise. Come in, Mister Spock. I can't give you warp nine much longer, Mister Spock. These engines are beginning to show signs of stress. All right, but we're moving further into the danger range all the time. If these circuits The relays will reject the overload, Mister Spock! We'll burn out the engines! Aye, sir. All right, you lovelies. Hold together. Full power, Mister Spock. All engines stop, sir. Dilithium crystal circuit's failing, sir. We'll have to replace it. That Vulcan won't be satisfied till these panels are a puddle of lead. My bairns. My poor bairns. Don't ask for anymore warp nine speeds, Mister Spock. Our star drive is completely burned out. The only thing we have left is impulse power. Hanging here in space? Forever. The only thing that'll fix these poor darlings is the nearest repair base. Come in, Mister Spock. Aye, Captain.

All phasers fired, sir.', 'Tracking report, sir. Sixty five minutes to end of safety margin.']
Flattened Dialogue: Aye, sir. Aye, sir. Not enough, Mister Spock. It's only point zero zero one three degrees. Aye, sir. All phasers locked, sir. Standing by, sir. Phaser one firing. Title: The Paradise Syndrome

Title: And the Children Shall Lead

Mass suicide.', 'Kirk of the starship Enterprise.', 'No sign of grief?', 'Or of fear.', 'And you insist their behaviour indicates traumatic shock?', "A child suppresses the fact that both parents are dead? I can't believe it.", "Not these children, to this extent. It's incredible.", "I'll be guided by that opinion, Doctor, for the present. What about questioning them?", 'Accepted, Doctor.', 'Careful.', "Children. Children, listen to me. It's late and it's time to go up to the ship.", "I'm sorry. I'm sorry. You'll go up with the doctor.", 'Whatever happened here is locked up inside those children.', 'Attack? This planet is uninhabited, Mister Spock, to the best of our information?', 'Getting a reading?', 'Picking up any life-forms, Mister Spock?', "Oh, that's strange. That's very strange. I'm getting a feeling of anxiety in this place. It doesn't sound very scientific, does it? But it's strongest right here.", "Maybe that's what's registering on your tricorder.", "No, of course. That's, that's me. That's me. But what's causing your tricorder to react?", "Yes, I'm fine. I'm fine. Just some sympathetic vibration with what happened here. Let's get back to the ship. It'll spoil your dinner.", "All right, children, you've had a busy day. I think you could use some rest. Nurse Chapel will see you to your quarters.", "Tommy, Just a moment. I'd like to ask you a question. Come and sit down. Tommy, will you tell me what you saw?", 'In the cave, on the planet. On Triacus.', 'Did you see your father today?', 'Did he seem upset?', 'What about?', 'What was going on that would have upset him?', "I'm not upset with you, Tommy, or your friends. We invited you aboard the Enterprise. Why would I do that if I didn't like you?", "Aren't you unhappy about leaving Triacus?", "Aren't you upset about leaving your parents?", "Yes, certainly. I'll take you.", "Kirk to security. Post a guard on the children. They're to be kept under constant watch.", 'Lieutenant Uhura, any report from the planet security team?', 'Good.', "Let's see them.", "Let's see some more of these unscientific hypotheses, Mister Spock.", 'What happened?', "I didn't see you come in, Tommy.", "No. We'll probably take you to a Federation Starbase.", "I'm sorry, Tommy. Marcos Twelve is not within our patrol area. Mister Spock, we'll pursue this in my quarters.", 'All right, Tommy. Lieutenant, have Doctor McCoy report to my quarters for a brief conference. Mister Leslie?', 'That could be what destroyed him.', 'Misleading the innocent? I wonder.', 'Yes, Doctor. Spock what do we know about the race that lived here?', 'Is that the end of it?', 'Is it possible that the evil found the catalyst?', 'But most legends have their basis in fact, Spock.', "I understand your diagnosis, Doctor, and I'll respect it. But not to the exclusion and safety of the Enterprise. Thank you.", 'Spock, what other expeditions have visited Triacus?', 'What was it Professor Starnes said about the unseen force?', "A ship. Yes, a ship for Triacus. But why? By whom? Security detachment. Ready for relief duty on Triacus. Assemble in the transporter room immediately. I'll have some questions for that planet detachment as soon as they're beamed up. I think it's about time we found out whether Professor Starnes' enemy within is on the planet below or here onboard ship with us. Come on.", "Your tour of duty will last one hour. Be prepared with your communicators at all times to report any alien beings. Don't wait to investigate.", "Beam up the security detachment from Triacus. Spock? What's wrong?", 'Why not?', "That's impossible. If we're not orbiting Triacus, then the men I beamed down are dead.", 'Activate the bridge monitor screen.', 'Captain to Bridge.', "Mister Sulu, we're not orbiting Triacus.", "You're off course. Set a course for Starbase Four.', 'Helmsman, did you hear me?', "Lieutenant Uhura, contact Starbase Four. Tell them we're bringing the children there. Tell Starfleet Command I suspect them of being alien in nature, and I want a thorough investigation made upon our arrival.", 'Lieutenant, what are you staring at?', "Lieutenant, there's nothing there.", 'Mister Spock, you make the call to Starfleet. Mister Sulu, I ordered you to change course. I'm losing the Enterprise.", "I'm losing command. I'm losing the Enterprise. The ship is sailing on and on. I'm alone. Alone. Alone. I'm losing command.", "I've lost command. I've lost the Enterprise.", "I've got command. I've got command. I've got command.", 'Auxiliary control, my Vulcan friend. This ship is off course.', 'Scotty. I want you to override the bridge navigation system and plot a course for Starbase Four.', 'Why not?', 'Scotty, listen to me. The Enterprise has been invaded by alien beings. Its destination is Marcos. If we take it there, millions will die the way they died at Triacus.', "No, I'm all right, Spock. My beast is finished. It won't return.", "Spock, they're not the alien beings. They're children being misled.", "They're children.", "They don't understand the evil that they're doing.", "We'll have to kill them.", 'What is it, Ensign?', 'By whose order?', 'Where did you hear this order, Ensign? Now, listen to me. This order is false. I want you and your men to return to their stations.', 'Ensign, listen to me.', 'Ensign, listen to me. This is a false order, Ensign.', 'I know that, Ensign. You have never disobeyed an order, but an alien being is aboard this ship.', 'Ensign, listen to me. You will disobey this order!', 'Enough. Take these men to detention then join me on the bridge.', 'The Enterprise will never reach Marcos Twelve. We will not be landing there.', "The crew does not understand. When we make them understand as I understand, they won't take you to Marcos.", 'Your friend? Where is your friend? Where is that stowaway? Why does he hide?', "Good. I'm glad you're not afraid of me. But your leader is afraid. What's he afraid of?", "He's afraid to be seen. And when the crew sees and hears him, they'll understand that he is not their friend, and they won't follow him.", "Then let him show himself. Bring him out! Let him prove to me that he is my friend and I'll follow him to Marcos Twelve and to the ends of the universe!", 'Mister Spock, playback the chant the children sang to summon up the Gorgan.', 'The time has come to see the world as it is. Come on.', 'I did, Gorgan. My beast is gone. It lost its power in the light of reality. I command again, and I ordered you here.', 'And we know you.', 'Not if we join together to fight you.', "We're also very strong.", "Children, I have pictures of some of you on Triacus. I'd like to show them to you. Would you like to see them? Mister Spock, the pictures.", 'So we were told. Mister Spock, the pictures. The children are waiting.', "Not always, Gorgan. Not this time. You can't hide from them. They see you as we see you. They know what you are. Even the children learn.", "Don't be afraid. Look at him. Without you children, he's nothing. The evil remains within him.", "Look how ugly he really is. Look at him and don't be afraid.", "It's all right.", "It's all right, Mary. It's all right. It's all right, isn't it, Doctor?", 'Reverse course, Mister Sulu.', 'Set course for Starbase Four, Mister Sulu.']

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ["He's dead, Captain.", 'Cyalodin.', 'No, Jim. No indication of any kind.', 'They seem completely secure and unafraid.', "I don't insist, Jim, but I can't dismiss the possibility.", "What those children saw is incredible, Jim. The way those deaths occurred, any reaction is possible including lacunar amnesia. That's my diagnosis. Until specific tests can be made, it remains that.", 'Not until the fabric of the traumatisation weakens or you come up with another explanation for their behaviour. Forcing them to see this experience now could cause permanent damage.', "Come on. It's time to be going.", 'The tests show no evidence of tensions due to lying. They behave as though nothing had gone wrong. They check out sound physically. There are no signs of any foreign biochemical substances to account for their present state. I have no answers, Jim.', "Well, can't it wait till we get to a Starbase hospital so they can be checked out by child specialists?", "Well, I won't prevent you questioning them, but it could harm the children if you do.", 'Be careful.', 'Or by misleading the innocent.', 'Do you mean the children may be involved?', 'I think I read you, Jim, but as medical officer I must warn you that unless the normal grief is tapped and released from these children, you are treading dangerously.', "They're crying, Jim. I don't know how it happened, but it's good to see.", "Yes. It's all right. We can help them now."]
Flattened Dialogue: He's dead, Captain. Cyalodin. No, Jim. No indication of any kind. They seem completely secure and unafraid. I don't insist, Jim, but I can't dismiss the possibility. What those children saw is incredible, Jim. The way those deaths occurred, any reaction is possible including lacunar amnesia. That's my diagnosis. Until specific tests can be made, it remains that. Not until the fabric of the traumatisation weakens or you come up with another explanation for their behaviour. Forcing them to see this experience now could cause permanent damage. Come on. It's time to be going. The tests show no evidence of tensions due to lying. They behave as though nothing had gone wrong. They check out sound physically. There are no signs of any foreign biochemical substances to account for their present state. I have no answers, Jim. Well, can't it wait till we get to a Starbase hospital so they can be checked out by child specialists? Well, I won't prevent you questioning them, but it could harm the children if you do. Be careful. Or by misleading the innocent. Do you mean the children may be involved? I think I read you, Jim, but as medical officer I must warn you that unless the normal grief is tapped and released from these children, you are treading dangerously. They're crying, Jim. I don't know how it happened, but it's good to see. Yes. It's all right. We can help them now.

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ['Humans do have an amazing capacity for believing what they choose and excluding that which is painful.', "The attack on Professor Starnes' party must surely have been unprovoked.", 'I stand corrected, Captain. Induced would be a more precise term. Induced by an outside force.', 'The release of bacteria. Or a helpless mental depression and a state of suicidal anxiety could have been chemically induced.', 'I do not know, but it is possible.', 'A valid assumption, I would say.', 'At present, yes. Odd.', 'There seems to be some disturbance coming from that cave.', 'Definitely not humanoid, Captain. Impossible to make any specific identification. The readings do not correlate with any known information.', "I'm not aware of it, Captain.", "I am not familiar with anxiety, but I wasn't aware it could be registered on sensors.", 'Are you all right, Captain?', "Captain, I have extracted the salient portion of Professor Starnes' tapes.", 'Among the technical facts he gathered, Professor Starnes also offered some rather unscientific hypotheses.', "There is another portion, Captain, which I believe you'll find particularly interesting.", 'Unknown.', 'He never completed the entry, and the dispatch was never sent. Except for scenes of family life, games and picnics with the children, that is the complete record. Whatever overwhelmed them must have done so with incredible speed. Otherwise, the professor would have provided details of the experience. He was an excellent scientist and tireless in his pursuit of the truth.', 'Possible, Captain. Evil does seek to maintain power by suppressing the truth.', 'According to the legend, Triacus was the seat of a band of marauders who made constant war throughout the system of Epsilon Indi. After many centuries, the destroyers were themselves destroyed by those they had preyed upon.', 'No, like so many legends, this one too has a frightening ending. It warns that the evil is awaiting a catalyst to set it again into motion and send it marauding across the galaxy.', 'I was speaking of a legend, Captain.', 'According to Federation records, this is the first.', 'He said an unseen force was influencing him, that he recognised it, was beginning to fight it and cancelled his request for a ship.', 'I am unable to lock on to the proper co-ordinates.', 'It appears we are no longer orbiting Triacus.', 'Captain, we are no longer orbiting Triacus.', 'Captain, why are we bothering Starfleet?', 'This bridge is under complete control.', 'There is no need.', 'I cannot obey your order, Captain.', 'Captain, we must get off this bridge.', 'Captain.', 'Jim.', 'Correct, Captain.', 'Where to, Captain?', 'Captain, so long as the children are present, there is danger. They are the carriers.', 'They are followers. Without followers, evil cannot spread.', 'Captain, the four hundred and thirty men and women on board the Enterprise and the ship itself are endangered by these children.', 'Perhaps that is true, but the evil that is within them is spreading fast, and unless we can find a way to remove it', 'You take from those who do not know you.', 'Why should you fear it?', "Tommy's father would have destroyed you, but he recognised you too late."]

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ['All right, children. Each card is a different flavour. You take your pick, and the computer will mix your favourite combination. Now, what would you like? Call out your favourites.', 'Well, would you like a surprise, Stevie?', 'There, there now, Stevie. There are unpleasant surprises as well as pleasant ones. That was your unpleasant surprise. Now, what would you like for your pleasant surprise?', 'Well, coming right up.', "All right. It's going to be a wonderful surprise.", 'After this, we can all play games.', 'How do you like getting ice cream out of a computer?', 'Oh, of course.', "Oh, I don't know about that. Parents like children.", 'I know. A swarm of bees.', 'Very good idea, Captain.']

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ['Maintaining standard orbit, Captain.', 'Hi there.', 'The planet Triacus.', "With all respects, Captain, you're wrong. I have Triacus on my screen now.", 'Yes, sir.', "Captain, stay away from the controls! If you touch them, we'll be destroyed.", 'Marcos Twelve dead ahead, sir.', 'Aye, sir.', 'Course reversed, Captain.', 'Yes, sir.']

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ['Everything is quiet, sir.', "Mister Sulu, the screen. We're out of orbit.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'I see my death. A long death. Disease and pain. I see my death.', "Oh, God. Captain, don't let it be."]

Title: And the Children Shall Lead
Dialogue: ["Yes, we will. I will if I have to. Will you come peacefully, Captain?', 'I have never disobeyed an order, Captain. You know I have never', 'I will not disobey now! I cannot disobey!']
