Fire phasers. Lieutenant Uhura? Mister Sulu, change course to seventeen mark four, warp factor three. Sulu? Override. Scotty, stop all engines. Scotty! New course? That'll take us out of the galaxy. Johnson. Get down to Security. Search every section. Some Klingons may have beamed aboard undetected from the wrecked ship. Then get down to Engineering and help Scotty hammer things back to normal. And free those trapped crewmen. And before I put you in the brig, there's a little something I owe you. Phasers. Out! Sickbay. Bridge. The Klingons are free. They're armed as we are. They'll try to take the ship. Scotty, how many men do we have? Deploy forces to protect your section and the auxiliary control centre. Check the armoury, and try and free those trapped crewmen. Blow out the bulkheads if you have to. We need numbers. What kind of luck have you had controlling the ship's speed? Five-minute report. Kirk out. Full sensor scan of the ship. Report on any movement by the Klingons. The Klingon Empire has maintained a duelling tradition. They think they can beat us with swords. Any other logical candidate? Mister Sulu. Get below. Take command of Engineering and auxiliary control. Mister Chekov. Mister Chekov, as you were. Chekov! This is no time for a vendetta. Maintain your post. Chekov, maintain your post! His only brother, killed in a Klingon raid. Sulu, get down to Engineering. Security, this is the captain. Find Mister Chekov and bring him to the bridge. I don't know, but he does. And now he wants revenge for a non-existent loss. Kirk here. What about the armoury? Get back to Engineering. Try to re-establish engine control, and talk to ordnance about manufacturing phaser replacements. What the blazes is going on? Constant surveillance, Mister Spock. Could more Klingons have beamed aboard? An alien life force. We must make contact, find out what it wants. A brother that never existed, a phantom colony, imaginary distress calls, the creation of these weapons. Do you sense a pattern, Mister Spock? And now it has control of the Enterprise and taking us out of the galaxy. But why? We must talk to Kang, bury the hatchet. McCoy? The alien is the real threat. That's the enemy we have to wipe out. Kirk here. Kang, there's something important I must discuss with you. The Enterprise is heading out of our galaxy, controlled by a mysterious alien somewhere aboard the ship. Engineering has been taken over by Klingons who have cut off life-support systems. Mister Sulu. Get down to emergency manual control. Try to protect our life-support circuits and auxiliary power. Scotty, I'm glad you've come. Scotty? Scotty, take it easy. Gentlemen! Spock! Scotty. Spock. Spock! Stop it! You're half human! What are we saying? What are we doing to each other? We've been under stress before. It's never set us at each other's throats. There isn't any war! Or is there? Scotty. What's happening to us? We've been trained to think in other terms than war. We've been trained to fight its causes, if necessary. Then why are we behaving like a group of savages? Look at me. Look at me. Two forces aboard this ship, each of them equally armed. Has a war been staged for us, complete with weapons and ideology and patriotic drum beating? Even, Spock, even race hatred? But what's the game? And whose? And what are the rules? Yes. Mister Sulu, report. We're getting something. Good work. Start scanning. Let's find that alien. Let's go. Chekov! What have I done? There's an alien entity aboard the ship. It's forcing us to fight. We don't want to. We don't know what its motive is. We're trying to find out. You must help us. Take me to Kang. A temporary truce, that's all I ask. Spock, take her. Chekov. Chekov. Is this what's in store for us, from here on in? Violence, hatred. He lost control. So did I. We're becoming animal warriors. Let's go, Spock. Why? So we can fight, and fight, and keep coming back for more like some bloody coliseum? What's next, the roar of crowds? Let's find the alien. You come with us. Maybe we can prove to you that it exists. What is it? What do you want? What are you doing here? Duty? Did McCoy release you from Sickbay? Then get back to Sickbay! I order you Johnson! It subsists on the emotions of others. It exists on the hate of others. And kept numbers and resources balanced, so that it can maintain a constant state of violence. It's got to have a vulnerable area. We've got to get rid of it. Or we're a doomed ship, travelling forever between galaxies, filled with eternal bloodlust, eternal warfare. Kang has got to listen. We've got to pool our knowledge and get rid of this thing. Kang. Kang, this is Captain Kirk. Kang, do you read me? Kang. He won't answer. Time factor? Well, do whatever you can. Kirk out. And so we drift in space, with only hatred and bloodshed aboard. Now do you believe? If I could talk to Kang, somehow cut through the Klingon lines, make peace before it's too late. Kang! Kang, this is Captain Kirk. I know you can hear me, so don't cut me off. We have Mara, your wife. We talk truce now, or she dies. Reply. She has five seconds to live. Reply. He called my bluff. The Federation doesn't kill or mistreat its prisoners. You've been listening to propaganda, fables. How much time? We only wanted to stop the fighting to save us all. There's another way to survive. Mutual trust and help. How? We can't get through the Klingon defences in time, unless. Spock. Intra-ship beaming from one section to another. It's possible? We're all in a trap. This is the only way out. No. That'd start the final battle. I believe her. Prepare the transporter. We'll wait for your signal. I hope your computations are correct, Mister Spock. Mara. Before you start killing, give me one minute. Nobody wins. Have any more of your men died? We can't be killed. There's an alien aboard. It wants us alive. Look! Look, Kang. For the rest of our lives. A thousand lifetimes. Senseless violence, fighting, while an alien has total control over us. All right. All right. In the heart. In the head. I won't stay dead. Next time I'll do the same to you. I'll kill you. And it goes on, the good old game of war, pawn against pawn! Stopping the bad guys. While somewhere, something sits back and laughs and starts it all over again. Be a pawn, be a toy, be a good soldier that never questions orders. Lieutenant Uhura. Put me on ship-wide intercom. Kang. This is Captain Kirk. A truce is ordered. The fighting is over. Lay down your weapons. Get off my ship. You're a dead duck here. You're powerless. We know about you, and we don't want to play. Maybe there are others like you around. Maybe you've caused a lot of suffering, a lot of history, but that's all over. We'll be on guard now, ready for you. So ship out! Come on! Haul it!

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Full scan. Results negative. Radiation level normal. Atmosphere and terrain are undisturbed. No evidence of a colony nor any residual aftereffect of a force that might have annihilated it.', 'Which we were unable to detect upon approach.', 'Cossacks! Filthy Klingon murderers! You killed my brother Piotre. The Archanis Four research outpost. A hundred peaceful people massacred! Just like you did here. My brother, you killed my brother.', "Captain, you can't. Don't let these animals have the ship.", "Captain, leave them where they are. Non-existence. That's so many less Klingon monsters in the galaxy.", 'We know what happened. That distress call.', 'Lies. They want to start a war by pretending that we did.', 'Captain.', 'Captain!', "Sir, let me go too. I've got a personal score to settle with the Klingons.", 'Captain!', "Don't try to stop me, Captain. I saw what they left of Piotre, and I swore on his grave I would avenge his murder.", "You don't die yet. You're not human, but you're very beautiful. Very beautiful."]
Flattened Dialogue: Full scan. Results negative. Radiation level normal. Atmosphere and terrain are undisturbed. No evidence of a colony nor any residual aftereffect of a force that might have annihilated it. Which we were unable to detect upon approach. Cossacks! Filthy Klingon murderers! You killed my brother Piotre. The Archanis Four research outpost. A hundred peaceful people massacred! Just like you did here. My brother, you killed my brother. Captain, you can't. Don't let these animals have the ship. Captain, leave them where they are. Non-existence. That's so many less Klingon monsters in the galaxy. We know what happened. That distress call. Lies. They want to start a war by pretending that we did. Captain. Captain! Sir, let me go too. I've got a personal score to settle with the Klingons. Captain! Don't try to stop me, Captain. I saw what they left of Piotre, and I swore on his grave I would avenge his murder. You don't die yet. You're not human, but you're very beautiful. Very beautiful.

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Nothing. They said they were being attacked by an unidentified ship.', "Jim, you can't hand over the Enterprise.", 'Move aside.', 'What happened?', 'Chekov may be right. The Klingons claim to have honoured the truce, but there have been incidents, raids on our outposts.', 'What proof do we need? We know what a Klingon is.', "There. Those filthy butchers. There are rules, even in war. You don't keep hacking at a man after he's down. Hand me that numanol capsule.", "Truce? Are you serious? I've got men in Sickbay, some of them dying. Atrocities committed on their persons, and you talk about making peace with these fiends? If our backs were turned, they'd jump us in a minute. And you know what Klingons do to prisoners. Slave labour, death planets, experiments!", "While you're talking, they're planning attacks. This is a fight to the death. We'd better start trying to win it!", "Who cares what started it, Mister Spock. We're in it! Murderers. We should wipe out every one of them!", 'How many more men must die before you two begin to act like military men instead of fools?', 'Brain waves show almost paranoid mania. What happened?', "Orderly. Jim. Johnson's heart wound is almost healed. Same with the other casualties. Sword wounds in the vital organs, massive trauma, shock. They're all healing at a fantastic rate.", "Gentlemen, if we are pawns, you're looking at one who is extremely sorry.", "Let's jump him.", 'Yeah, out already.']
Flattened Dialogue: Nothing. They said they were being attacked by an unidentified ship. Jim, you can't hand over the Enterprise. Move aside. What happened? Chekov may be right. The Klingons claim to have honoured the truce, but there have been incidents, raids on our outposts. What proof do we need? We know what a Klingon is. There. Those filthy butchers. There are rules, even in war. You don't keep hacking at a man after he's down. Hand me that numanol capsule. Truce? Are you serious? I've got men in Sickbay, some of them dying. Atrocities committed on their persons, and you talk about making peace with these fiends? If our backs were turned, they'd jump us in a minute. And you know what Klingons do to prisoners. Slave labour, death planets, experiments! While you're talking, they're planning attacks. This is a fight to the death. We'd better start trying to win it! Who cares what started it, Mister Spock. We're in it! Murderers. We should wipe out every one of them! How many more men must die before you two begin to act like military men instead of fools? Brain waves show almost paranoid mania. What happened? Orderly. Jim. Johnson's heart wound is almost healed. Same with the other casualties. Sword wounds in the vital organs, massive trauma, shock. They're all healing at a fantastic rate. Gentlemen, if we are pawns, you're looking at one who is extremely sorry. Let's jump him. Yeah, out already.

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Spock here, Captain.', 'Sensors have picked up a Klingon ship, closing fast.', 'Captain, the enemy ship is drifting, totally disabled.', 'And we never fired upon her.', 'Here, Captain.', 'Understood, Captain. Transporter room.', 'Our landing party is intact, Doctor.', 'First group from the Klingon vessel, Captain.', 'At the moment we received the distress signal from the colony on Beta Twelve A, the Klingons were too far distant to have been the attackers. Moreover, they also were apparently attracted by a distress call.', 'Our log tapes will indicate our innocence in the present situation.', 'Sensor sweeps reveal no other ships within range, Captain.', 'Captain, neither the Klingon technology nor ours, is capable of this. The instantaneous transmutation of matter. I doubt that they are responsible.', 'None. However, if they had such power, would they not have used it to create more effective weapons and only for themselves?', 'Scans indicate that our forces and those of the Klingons are exactly equal at thirty eight each. The Klingons control deck six and starboard deck seven, while we control all sections above.', 'Most curious, Captain. There appear to be more life-energy units on board than can be accounted for by the presence of the Enterprise crew plus the Klingons. A considerable discrepancy.', 'I shall attempt a compensatory reading of Klingon units.', 'No additional Klingons detected, Captain. It is an alien life force, a single entity. I cannot ascertain its location.', 'Readings being diverted to the library computer for analysis. Computer report.', 'What purpose?', 'If the alien is creating these events, Captain, it is apparently capable of manipulating matter and mind.', 'Captain, I am constrained to point out that since minds are evidently being influenced, we cannot know at this moment whether our own memories are completely accurate and true.', 'An appropriate choice of terms. However, it is notoriously difficult to arrange a truce with the Klingons once blood has been drawn.', 'We are attempting to end it, Doctor. By reason, preferably. There is an alien on board which may have created this situation.', 'Easy, Mister Scott.', 'May I say that I have not thoroughly enjoyed serving with humans? I find their illogic and foolish emotions a constant irritant.', 'Fascinating. The result of stress?', 'Recent events would seem to be directed toward a magnification of the basic hostilities between humans and Klingons. Apparently, it is by design that we fight. We seem to be pawns.', 'It is most urgent that we locate the alien entity immediately, and determine its motives and a method for halting its activities.', 'Sensors may be operating.', 'Alien detected in the engineering section, near reactor number three.', "Jim, he's not responsible.", 'It would appear that the entity wants us alive.', 'Perhaps human and Klingon psychologies and combat capabilities are being tested by an alien with designs on both powers.', 'I understand, Doctor. I, too, felt a brief surge of racial bigotry. Most distasteful.', 'Totally unfamiliar.', "Fascinating. During Lieutenant Johnson's emotional outburst, his expression of hatred and lust for vengeance, the alien's life energy level increased. When the Lieutenant became unconscious, the alien lost energy.", 'This one appears to be strengthened by mental irradiations of hostility, violent intentions.', 'To put it simply. And it has acted as a catalyst, creating this situation in order to satisfy that need. It has brought together opposing forces, provided crude instruments in an effort to promote the most violent mode of conflict.', 'Then all hostile attitudes on board must be eliminated. The fighting must end and soon.', 'The alien is affecting his mind, Captain. Soon, it will become so powerful that none of us will be able to resist it.', "There's nothing we can do about it.", 'We have nine minutes, fifty three seconds to power zero.', "There is, of course, a logical alternative. Kang's wife is, after all, our prisoner. Perhaps a threat.", 'Eight minutes, forty two seconds.', 'It has rarely been done because of the danger involved. Pinpoint accuracy is required. If the transportee should materialise inside a solid object, a deck or wall.', 'No one can guarantee the actions of another.', 'Your automatic setting is laid in, Captain.', 'When transporter is energised, you will have eight seconds to get to the pads.', "You'll know in seven point nine seconds, Captain.", 'Those who hate and fight must stop themselves, Doctor. Otherwise, it is not stopped.', 'All fighting must end, Captain, to weaken the alien before our dilithium crystals are gone.', 'The cessation of violence appears to have weakened it, Captain. I suggest that good spirits might make an effective weapon.']
Flattened Dialogue: Spock here, Captain. Sensors have picked up a Klingon ship, closing fast. Captain, the enemy ship is drifting, totally disabled. And we never fired upon her. Here, Captain. Understood, Captain. Transporter room. Our landing party is intact, Doctor. First group from the Klingon vessel, Captain. At the moment we received the distress signal from the colony on Beta Twelve A, the Klingons were too far distant to have been the attackers. Moreover, they also were apparently attracted by a distress call. Our log tapes will indicate our innocence in the present situation. Sensor sweeps reveal no other ships within range, Captain. Captain, neither the Klingon technology nor ours, is capable of this. The instantaneous transmutation of matter. I doubt that they are responsible. None. However, if they had such power, would they not have used it to create more effective weapons and only for themselves? Scans indicate that our forces and those of the Klingons are exactly equal at thirty eight each. The Klingons control deck six and starboard deck seven, while we control all sections above. Most curious, Captain. There appear to be more life-energy units on board than can be accounted for by the presence of the Enterprise crew plus the Klingons. A considerable discrepancy. I shall attempt a compensatory reading of Klingon units. No additional Klingons detected, Captain. It is an alien life force, a single entity. I cannot ascertain its location. Readings being diverted to the library computer for analysis. Computer report. What purpose? If the alien is creating these events, Captain, it is apparently capable of manipulating matter and mind. Captain, I am constrained to point out that since minds are evidently being influenced, we cannot know at this moment whether our own memories are completely accurate and true. An appropriate choice of terms. However, it is notoriously difficult to arrange a truce with the Klingons once blood has been drawn. We are attempting to end it, Doctor. By reason, preferably. There is an alien on board which may have created this situation. Easy, Mister Scott. May I say that I have not thoroughly enjoyed serving with humans? I find their illogic and foolish emotions a constant irritant. Fascinating. The result of stress? Recent events would seem to be directed toward a magnification of the basic hostilities between humans and Klingons. Apparently, it is by design that we fight. We seem to be pawns. It is most urgent that we locate the alien entity immediately, and determine its motives and a method for halting its activities. Sensors may be operating. Alien detected in the engineering section, near reactor number three. Jim, he's not responsible. It would appear that the entity wants us alive. Perhaps human and Klingon psychologies and combat capabilities are being tested by an alien with designs on both powers. I understand, Doctor. I, too, felt a brief surge of racial bigotry. Most distasteful. Totally unfamiliar. Fascinating. During Lieutenant Johnson's emotional outburst, his expression of hatred and lust for vengeance, the alien's life energy level increased. When the Lieutenant became unconscious, the alien lost energy. This one appears to be strengthened by mental irradiations of hostility, violent intentions. To put it simply. And it has acted as a catalyst, creating this situation in order to satisfy that need. It has brought together opposing forces, provided crude instruments in an effort to promote the most violent mode of conflict. Then all hostile attitudes on board must be eliminated. The fighting must end and soon. The alien is affecting his mind, Captain. Soon, it will become so powerful that none of us will be able to resist it. There's nothing we can do about it. We have nine minutes, fifty three seconds to power zero. There is, of course, a logical alternative. Kang's wife is, after all, our prisoner. Perhaps a threat. Eight minutes, forty two seconds. It has rarely been done because of the danger involved. Pinpoint accuracy is required. If the transportee should materialise inside a solid object, a deck or wall. No one can guarantee the actions of another. Your automatic setting is laid in, Captain. When transporter is energised, you will have eight seconds to get to the pads. You'll know in seven point nine seconds, Captain. Those who hate and fight must stop themselves, Doctor. Otherwise, it is not stopped. All fighting must end, Captain, to weaken the alien before our dilithium crystals are gone. The cessation of violence appears to have weakened it, Captain. I suggest that good spirits might make an effective weapon.

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Trouble aboard the Klingon ship. Evidence of explosions, massive destruction.', 'Forward phasers locked and ready to fire, sir.', 'Warp factor three, sir.', 'Change in course. Accelerating. Helm dead. Auxiliary navigation dead.', 'Nothing responds, Captain.', 'Nine oh two mark five.', 'Aye, sir.', "What's Chekov's grudge against the Klingons? Who's Piotre?", "His brother? He never had a brother. He's an only child.", 'Aye, sir.', 'All clear, Mister Scott.', 'Aye.', 'Captain.', 'Aye, Captain.', 'No good, Captain.', "Circuits are in, but systems just aren't responding.", 'Aye, Captain. Power and life-support restored. Remotes on standby.']

Accelerating. Helm dead. Auxiliary navigation dead. Nothing responds, Captain. Nine oh two mark five. Aye, sir. What's Chekov's grudge against the Klingons? Who's Piotre? His brother? He never had a brother. He's an only child. Aye, sir. All clear, Mister Scott. Aye. Captain. Aye, Captain. No good, Captain. Circuits are in, but systems just aren't responding. Aye, Captain. Power and life-support restored. Remotes on standby.

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['All others suspended in transit. Who are the guests, by the way?', "Well, they're right in here.", "Captain, we've not been able to get through to Starfleet Command. All subspace frequencies have been blocked, and there's too much radiation coming from that Klingon ship. It's a hazard to the vicinity.", 'Transporter room to Bridge. Klingon ship is vacated, sir.', 'I would if I could, sir.', "The controls have gone crazy. Something's taken over.", 'The engines, sir.', "They've gone to warp nine, by themselves!", 'Three hundred and ninety two trapped below decks.', "The doors and bulkheads won't budge. We'll have to cut through.", "No, sir. She's a projectile at warp nine. And don't ask me what's holding her together.", "Scott here, sir. There's no use trying to free those men down below. The phaser torches, they won't cut through the bulkheads, nor the doors, nor the decks. There's something happened to the metal.", "I'm there now, sir, and you never saw such a fine collection of antiques in your life.", "Aye, sir. A Claymore. You're a beauty.", 'Any signs of those devils, Mister Sulu?', "They've taken Engineering. I don't know how many more of those Klingons are around, but we'll split up here and try to make it back to the bridge.", 'Sir. Chekov was right, Captain.', "We should have left those fuzz-faced goons in the transporter. That's right where they belong!", "Non-existence! Now they can study the Enterprise, add our technology to theirs, change the balance of power. You've jeopardised the Federation!", 'Keep your Vulcan hands off me. Just keep away! Your feelings might be hurt, you green-blooded half-breed!', 'Then transfer out, freak!', 'But this is war.', 'Have we forgotten how to defend ourselves?', 'Without sensors? All our power down? This thing could go anywhere.', "But, Captain, I didn't do it. Everything just came on by itself.", 'Scotty, sir.', "The ship's dilithium crystals are deteriorating. We can't stop the process.", "In twelve minutes, we'll be totally without engine power.", "There's no change, Captain. The dilithium crystals are discharging.", "Aye. Now that's something the Klingons would understand.", "It's the alien that's done this. We're in its power, our people and yours.", "I wouldn't trust her, Captain.", 'Even if it could work, she may be leading you into a trap.', "We'll go with you.", "But she can't guarantee that Kang will stop to listen, right, Mister Spock?"]

I don't know how many more of those Klingons are around, but we'll split up here and try to make it back to the bridge. Sir. Chekov was right, Captain. Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Still no contact with Starfleet Command, sir. Outside communications blanketed.', 'No contact with Starfleet as yet, sir.', "Captain! This doesn't make sense. Carriers are normal. Channels are open. There's still no outside contact! I don't understand it, sir. Could the Klingons be doing something?", 'Captain, reports coming in from the lower decks. Emergency bulkheads have closed. Almost four hundred crewmen are trapped down there, sir.', 'Captain, why would, why would Chekov believe he has a brother?', 'Sickbay calling, Doctor. There are more wounded men requiring your attention.', 'Yes, Captain?', 'Aye, sir.', 'Ready, Captain.']
Flattened Dialogue: Still no contact with Starfleet Command, sir. Outside communications blanketed. No contact with Starfleet as yet, sir. Captain! This doesn't make sense. Carriers are normal. Channels are open. There's still no outside contact! I don't understand it, sir. Could the Klingons be doing something? Captain, reports coming in from the lower decks. Emergency bulkheads have closed. Almost four hundred crewmen are trapped down there, sir. Captain, why would, why would Chekov believe he has a brother? Sickbay calling, Doctor. There are more wounded men requiring your attention. Yes, Captain? Aye, sir. Ready, Captain.

Title: Day of the Dove
Dialogue: ['Alien life force onboard is composed of pure energy. Type unknown. Actions indicate intelligence and purpose.', 'Insufficient data for further analysis.']
Flattened Dialogue: Alien life force onboard is composed of pure energy. Type unknown. Actions indicate intelligence and purpose. Insufficient data for further analysis.

Title: For the World is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
Dialogue: ['Do we have maximum magnification, Lieutenant?', 'Very archaic type, Captain. Sub light speed.', 'It would appear that the Enterprise is the target, Captain.', 'Yes, Captain?', 'Correct, Captain. We are approaching those co-ordinates.', 'An asteroid, two hundred miles in diameter.', "Negative, Captain. We've had that area on scanners constantly.", 'Correct, Captain.', 'Typical asteroid chemically, but it is not orbiting. It is pursing an independent course through this solar system.', 'It is under power, Captain. And correcting for all gravitational stresses.', 'Atomic. Very archaic. Leaving a trail of debris and hard radiation.', 'Asteroid has an outer shell, which is hollow. It surrounds an independent inner core, which has a breathable atmosphere. Sensors read no life forms.', 'Then the passengers, or builders, are dead.', 'Interesting.', 'The course Ensign Chekov just gave for the asteroid would put it on a collision course with Daran Five.', 'Correct. Population approximately three billion and seven hundred twenty four million, if memory serves me correctly. Estimated time of impact three hundred ninety six days.', 'One fails to see the logic in making a ship look like a planet.', 'The asteroid ship is over ten thousand years old, Doctor. Still no sign of life forms, Captain.', 'The doctor must have received an excessively large electrical shock.', "Nothing else could've caused this, Captain. At least nothing that has happened here.", 'May I ask precisely what is troubling the doctor?', 'Yes. I know of it, Captain.', 'Very well, Doctor. The Captain and I seem to have suffered no ill effects.', "Captain, informing these people they're on a ship may be in violation of the Prime Directive of Starfleet Command.", 'Logical, Captain.', 'Also logical, Captain.', 'He said it was forbidden to climb the mountains.', 'Indeed, Doctor. The young lady did show a marked preference for your company.', 'We are very interested in your world.', "Incredible as it may seem, these people have no idea they're living on a spaceship.", 'Captain, the Oracle room.', 'I believe that I can. The writing is definitely Fabrini, Captain. I recognise it.', 'Yes. Towards the end, the Fabrini people lived underground, as these people do, to protect themselves.', "Captain. If I remember correctly, the oracle's reprehensible conduct was initiated when Natira knelt on that platform.", "Nothing here which would indicate this is anything but a planet. There's no question but that the creators would be considered gods.", 'Eight planets, Captain. That is the number in the Fabrina solar system.', "And no doubt they've been in flight on this asteroid ship for ten thousand years.", 'Your decision is most illogical, Doctor.', "I believe it's time to move on.", 'She evidently understood something. There are no guards to detain us.', 'Temperature one hundred eleven degrees and rising.', 'Temperature one hundred fifteen degrees.', 'One hundred twenty degrees.', 'Yes, it is.', 'It refers to the altar. Apply pressure to the centre until it opens.', "I've neutralised the heating elements.", 'There seems to be a weakness in one of the eight tubes.', 'Yes. Let me check that engine. A very simple problem, easy to correct.', 'I believe we can attempt the course correction, Captain.', "Guidance control's taking over. I believe we can allow this ship to go back to its automatic control.", 'Captain. Intelligence files. Their banks contain the total knowledge of the Fabrini, ready for the people to consult when they arrive at their destination. And they seem to have amassed a great deal of medical knowledge.', 'Your haemoglobin count is back to normal, Doctor, which indicates that the flow of oxygen to each cell of your body is back up to its abundantly energetic level.']
Flattened Dialogue: Do we have maximum magnification, Lieutenant? Very archaic type, Captain. Sub light speed. It would appear that the Enterprise is the target, Captain. Yes, Captain? Correct, Captain. We are approaching those co-ordinates. An asteroid, two hundred miles in diameter. Negative, Captain. We've had that area on scanners constantly. Correct, Captain. Typical asteroid chemically, but it is not orbiting. It is pursing an independent course through this solar system. It is under power, Captain. And correcting for all gravitational stresses. Atomic. Very archaic. Leaving a trail of debris and hard radiation. Asteroid has an outer shell, which is hollow. It surrounds an independent inner core, which has a breathable atmosphere. Sensors read no life forms. Then the passengers, or builders, are dead. Interesting. The course Ensign Chekov just gave for the asteroid would put it on a collision course with Daran Five. Correct. Population approximately three billion and seven hundred twenty four million, if memory serves me correctly. Estimated time of impact three hundred ninety six days. One fails to see the logic in making a ship look like a planet. The asteroid ship is over ten thousand years old, Doctor. Still no sign of life forms, Captain. The doctor must have received an excessively large electrical shock. Nothing else could've caused this, Captain. At least nothing that has happened here. May I ask precisely what is troubling the doctor? Yes. I know of it, Captain. Very well, Doctor. The Captain and I seem to have suffered no ill effects. Captain, informing these people they're on a ship may be in violation of the Prime Directive of Starfleet Command. Logical, Captain. Also logical, Captain. He said it was forbidden to climb the mountains. Indeed, Doctor. The young lady did show a marked preference for your company. We are very interested in your world. Incredible as it may seem, these people have no idea they're living on a spaceship. Captain, the Oracle room. I believe that I can. The writing is definitely Fabrini, Captain. I recognise it. Yes. Towards the end, the Fabrini people lived underground, as these people do, to protect themselves. Captain. If I remember correctly, the oracle's reprehensible conduct was initiated when Natira knelt on that platform. Nothing here which would indicate this is anything but a planet. There's no question but that the creators would be considered gods. Eight planets, Captain. That is the number in the Fabrina solar system. And no doubt they've been in flight on this asteroid ship for ten thousand years. Your decision is most illogical, Doctor. I believe it's time to move on. She evidently understood something. There are no guards to detain us. Temperature one hundred eleven degrees and rising. Temperature one hundred fifteen degrees. One hundred twenty degrees. Yes, it is. It refers to the altar. Apply pressure to the centre until it opens. I've neutralised the heating elements. There seems to be a weakness in one of the eight tubes. Yes. Let me check that engine. A very simple problem, easy to correct. I believe we can attempt the course correction, Captain. Guidance control's taking over. I believe we can allow this ship to go back to its automatic control. Captain. Intelligence files. Their banks contain the total knowledge of the Fabrini, ready for the people to consult when they arrive at their destination. And they seem to have amassed a great deal of medical knowledge. Your haemoglobin count is back to normal, Doctor, which indicates that the flow of oxygen to each cell of your body is back up to its abundantly energetic level.

Title: For the World is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky

And unless we correct it, Yonada will kill millions of people and destroy a world it doesn't even know.", 'Let us remove the instrument of obedience, the way we did for McCoy. Natira.', 'Do you think she understood me?', 'Is she all right?', 'We do this for the survival of the people of Yonada.', 'We mean no desecration to the faith of Yonada. Title: For the World is Hollow and I Have Touched the Sky
Dialogue: ["You're excused. You may return to your quarters.", "I said you were excused, Nurse. Please, Christine. I'm fine, Captain.", "You'd swear you were on the surface of a planet.", 'You found no intelligent life forms, Mister Spock, but surely', 'I think so.', "She called this the world. I have one year to live.', 'What are you going to do to my friends?', 'And the punishment is death?', 'They acted out of ignorance, Natira.', 'Please let them return to the ship.', "For me? I've made my decision. I'm staying here, on Yonada. Natira, what they did, they did because they felt they had to. Please, let them return to the ship. You won't regret it. How do you think I'd feel if I stayed here with the chance to be happy for the first time in my life, but knowing my friends had died?", "No, I'm not.", "I'm on a kind of a collision course myself, Jim.", 'And I refuse.', 'I intend to stay on this ship, with these people, whatever happens.', "Is it, Mister Spock? He has one year to live. The ship's Chief Medical Officer. I'll be most effective on the job in the time left, if you'll keep this to yourself. Without me, Jim? You'd never find your way back. No, there isn't. Oh, yes. Yes, I do. We do. But we're strangers to each other. Yes. How long will it take you to reach this new world? If you only knew how I needed some kind of future, Natira. Yes, very lonely. There's something I need to tell you. But there is. I have an illness for which there is no cure. I have one year to live. What are you going to do to my friends? I do. Let it be done. We're now of one mind. One life. Do the people know the contents of their book? Has the reason that the people must leave here been revealed to you? Press the three lower planets on the left-hand side simultaneously. We'll be all right here now, Jim. The oracle can no longer punish us. Yes. Yes. Then come. Don't be afraid. You intend to stay here, on Yonada? Then I won't leave you. Now more than ever, I wish to search through the universe to find a cure for myself and others like me. And I want you to be with me. Thank you, Mister Spock, for bringing back the knowledge of the Fabrini.

Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ['Captain, we are registering very curious readings from all sensors.', 'I cannot. According to our instruments, space itself is literally breaking up. There is no known phenomenon which would account for these readings.', 'Negative. I have run a complete check on all systems.', 'Fascinating.', 'There is virtually no sensor contact. No mass analysis. No trace of radiation. We see it, but our sensors indicate it is not there.', 'Absolutely no record of such an occurrence, Ensign.', 'The ship is still functioning, Captain. It is logical to assume the mutineers are somewhere aboard.', 'Captain, there is no sign of life aboard this vessel.', "Captain, the Defiant's sensors correspond with an extremely high degree of correlation to those of the Enterprise.", 'Affirmative.', 'Request permission to remain, Captain. I could be completing the data.', 'Captain, there is a chance', 'Energise.', 'Negative.', 'Compute the next period of spatial interphase.', 'We must try, Mister Scott. The fabric of space is very weak here. If we disturb it, there will be no chance of retrieving the Captain alive.', "Well, picture it this way, Mister Chekov. We exist in a universe which co-exists with a multitude of others in the same physical space. At certain brief periods of time, an area of their space overlaps an area of ours. That is a time of interphase, during which we can connect with the Defiant's universe.", 'Yes. However, the dimensional structure of each universe is totally dissimilar. Any use of power disturbs it. If we are not extremely careful, we shall lose the Captain and become trapped ourselves.', 'Chekov! Chekov!', 'Security guards to the Bridge.', 'I was attempting to explain to Mister Chekov the nature of our problems in this situation when he attacked.', 'Lieutenant Uhura is correct. There was murderous fury in Chekov. The same fury which was evident in the Defiant.', 'Is there anything you need to isolate the cause?', 'If we are to recover the Captain, we must not move.', 'Approximately two hours before the attempt can be made.', 'The Captain was caught in our transporter beam when the Defiant phased out. It is possible he was spared the shock of transition and survived. However, if we are to recover him, we must catch him at the precise moment during the next interphase, or he will die. And there can be no margin for error. His environmental unit can provide breathable air for no more than three point six two hours.', 'Status, Mister Sulu.', 'Lieutenant Uhura, signal Red Alert.', 'Transfer to main viewer.', 'Spock, in command of the Federation star ship Enterprise. Commander, according to the Federation, this area is free space.', 'We are not interested in your display of force. The Enterprise is responding to a distress signal from one of our ships and is currently engaged in rescue operations. Do you wish to assist us?', 'The other ship is interspatially trapped. It should reappear in one hour and fifty three minutes. We request you stand by until then.', 'Bridge to transporter room.', 'Ready for interphase in twenty seconds.', "Lock on to Captain Kirk's co-ordinates", 'And prepare to bring him aboard, Mister Scott.', 'Bring him aboard, Mister Scott.', 'Well, keep trying, Mister Scott.', 'Lieutenant Sulu, evaluation.', "It's possible the Tholian entry into the area has disturbed the space, and if that has occurred", 'Spock here.', 'Negative, Doctor.', 'Theoretically it already has happened, Doctor.', "However, the ship's sensors are not responding as predicted.", 'I did, Doctor. The space was disturbed by the Tholians.', 'Not at this interphase.', 'I shall have to recalculate to determine when the next interphase will occur. They do not take place at regular intervals.', 'I have confidence that you will soon isolate the cause, Doctor, and prevent further spread of the affliction.', 'The renowned Tholian punctuality.', 'Engineering, hold power steady and cut off all unnecessary expenditures. Mister Sulu, divert all but emergency maintenance power to the shields.', 'Spock here.', 'Understood. Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel to the Tholian ship. Mister Sulu, lock in phaser tracking controls.', 'Ready, Mister Sulu?', 'Fire.', 'Engineering, status report. Mister Scott?', 'Can you estimate minimum time required for repair?', 'The decision to fight was logical. Lack of time prevented any other course of action. The Tholian ship had to be disabled.', 'Doctor, I hardly believe this is the time for comparisons. Please go to your laboratory and search for an antidote to the effects of this space. That is your primary task, since we must remain here.', 'Fascinating.', 'Negative. Lieutenant Uhura, can you open a channel to the approaching vessel?', 'Distance, Mister Sulu.', "Mister Sulu, I shall run an analysis on those filaments. Tie in all sensors to the ship's library computer console. Switch scanners.", "There's no analogy to this structure in Federation technology. It is, however, an energy field, and if the Tholians are successful in completing this structure before we have completed our repairs, we shall not see home again.", 'Doctor, your last report on an antidote on the effects of this space was negative.', 'The urgency requires your personal attention in the laboratory.', 'A few hours ago, the Captain elected to remain on board the Defiant so that three members of this crew would have the best chance of returning safely to the Enterprise. His concern was not only for them, but for all the members of the crew of this ship. You all know the sequence of events. We were fired upon by the Tholian ship. At that time, Captain Kirk may have been alive. I deemed it necessary to return the Tholian fire for the safety of the Enterprise. The Tholian ship has been disabled. But as a result of the battle, we must accept the fact that Captain Kirk is no longer alive.', 'I shall not attempt to voice the quality of respect and admiration which Captain Kirk commanded. Each of you must evaluate the loss in the privacy of your own thoughts.', 'It can wait, Doctor. My duties require my immediate presence on the bridge.', 'It will wait for a more suitable moment, Doctor.', 'The mental and physical state of this crew are your responsibility, Doctor. Flattened Dialogue: Captain, we are registering very curious readings from all sensors. I cannot. According to our instruments, space itself is literally breaking up. There is no known phenomenon which would account for these readings. Negative. I have run a complete check on all systems. Fascinating. There is virtually no sensor contact. No mass analysis. No trace of radiation. We see it, but our sensors indicate it is not there. Absolutely no record of such an occurrence, Ensign. The ship is still functioning, Captain. It is logical to assume the mutineers are somewhere aboard. Captain, there is no sign of life aboard this vessel. Captain, the Defiant's sensors correspond with an extremely high degree of correlation to those of the Enterprise. Affirmative. Request permission to remain, Captain. I could be completing the data. Captain, there is a chance Energise. Negative. Compute the next period of spatial interphase. We must try, Mister Scott. The fabric of space is very weak here. If we disturb it, there will be no chance of retrieving the Captain alive. Well, picture it this way, Mister Chekov. We exist in a universe which co-exists with a multitude of others in the same physical space. At certain brief periods of time, an area of their space overlaps an area of ours. That is a time of interphase, during which we can connect with the Defiant's universe. Yes. However, the dimensional structure of each universe is totally dissimilar. Any use of power disturbs it. If we are not extremely careful, we shall lose the Captain and become trapped ourselves. Chekov! Chekov! Security guards to the Bridge. I was attempting to explain to Mister Chekov the nature of our problems in this situation when he attacked. Lieutenant Uhura is correct. There was murderous fury in Chekov. The same fury which was evident in the Defiant. Is there anything you need to isolate the cause? If we are to recover the Captain, we must not move. Approximately two hours before the attempt can be made. The Captain was caught in our transporter beam when the Defiant phased out. It is possible he was spared the shock of transition and survived. However, if we are to recover him, we must catch him at the precise moment during the next interphase, or he will die. And there can be no margin for error. His environmental unit can provide breathable air for no more than three point six two hours. Status, Mister Sulu. Lieutenant Uhura, signal Red Alert. Transfer to main viewer. Spock, in command of the Federation star ship Enterprise. Commander, according to the Federation, this area is free space. We are not interested in your display of force. The Enterprise is responding to a distress signal from one of our ships and is currently engaged in rescue operations. Do you wish to assist us? The other ship is interspatially trapped. It should reappear in one hour and fifty three minutes. We request you stand by until then. Bridge to transporter room. Ready for interphase in twenty seconds. Lock on to Captain Kirk's co-ordinates And prepare to bring him aboard, Mister Scott. Bring him aboard, Mister Scott. Well, keep trying, Mister Scott. Lieutenant Sulu, evaluation. It's possible the Tholian entry into the area has disturbed the space, and if that has occurred Spock here. Negative, Doctor. Theoretically it already has happened, Doctor. However, the ship's sensors are not responding as predicted. I did, Doctor. The space was disturbed by the Tholians. Not at this interphase. I shall have to recalculate to determine when the next interphase will occur. They do not take place at regular intervals. I have confidence that you will soon isolate the cause, Doctor, and prevent further spread of the affliction. The renowned Tholian punctuality. Engineering, hold power steady and cut off all unnecessary expenditures. Mister Sulu, divert all but emergency maintenance power to the shields. Spock here. Understood. Lieutenant Uhura, open a channel to the Tholian ship. Mister Sulu, lock in phaser tracking controls. Ready, Mister Sulu? Fire. Engineering, status report. Mister Scott? Can you estimate minimum time required for repair? The decision to fight was logical. Lack of time prevented any other course of action. The Tholian ship had to be disabled. Doctor, I hardly believe this is the time for comparisons. Please go to your laboratory and search for an antidote to the effects of this space. That is your primary task, since we must remain here. Fascinating. Negative. Lieutenant Uhura, can you open a channel to the approaching vessel? Distance, Mister Sulu. Mister Sulu, I shall run an analysis on those filaments. Tie in all sensors to the ship's library computer console. Switch scanners. There's no analogy to this structure in Federation technology. It is, however, an energy field, and if the Tholians are successful in completing this structure before we have completed our repairs, we shall not see home again. Doctor, your last report on an antidote on the effects of this space was negative. The urgency requires your personal attention in the laboratory. A few hours ago, the Captain elected to remain on board the Defiant so that three members of this crew would have the best chance of returning safely to the Enterprise. His concern was not only for them, but for all the members of the crew of this ship. You all know the sequence of events. We were fired upon by the Tholian ship. At that time, Captain Kirk may have been alive. I deemed it necessary to return the Tholian fire for the safety of the Enterprise. The Tholian ship has been disabled. But as a result of the battle, we must accept the fact that Captain Kirk is no longer alive. I shall not attempt to voice the quality of respect and admiration which Captain Kirk commanded. Each of you must evaluate the loss in the privacy of your own thoughts. It can wait, Doctor. My duties require my immediate presence on the bridge. It will wait for a more suitable moment, Doctor. The mental and physical state of this crew are your responsibility, Doctor. At the moment, they are your top priority. We came here for a specific purpose, Doctor. The Captain would have remained to recover a crew member at the risk of his own life or even his own ship. I need not explain my rationale to you or any other member of this crew. There is a margin of variation in any experiment. While there was a chance, I was bound legally and morally to ascertain the Captain's status. That is enough, Doctor. We both have other things to do. You will return to your duty as soon as we've discharged our responsibilities here. Doctor, I am in command of the Enterprise. If you believe I have acted irregularly, then relieve me of duty. That is your prerogative as medical officer of this ship. What would you have me say, Doctor? Spock here. I shall be there shortly. Doctor, I believe we each have our respective tasks to complete before the Tholians complete theirs. Spock here. Proceed, Mister Scott. Report to Doctor McCoy all symptoms noted prior to the attack. Spock out. Bridge. Spock here. Negative. We are relatively stable at the moment. Why do you ask? What is it, Mister Scott? Mister Scott? Report to the bridge immediately. In critical moments, men sometimes see exactly what they wish to see. I was merely stating a fact, Doctor. Please leave that to me, Doctor McCoy. I realise that the crew are your prime concern. You can best serve them in your laboratory. I urge you to confine yourself to it until a remedy has been found. I understand, Doctor. I'm sure the Captain would simply have said forget it, Bones. Captain? Captain? Captain. Exactly. But the Captain remained. Only the overlap time changed. The next interphase will occur here. Can you be ready? It will have to do, Mister Scott. Come. You've found the antidote, Doctor. Ensign Chekov was affected so early. Has he responded to it? Theragen? A nerve gas used by the Klingons. If I remember correctly, it caused fatality only when used in pure form. Welcome back, Lieutenant. Your absence was keenly felt, Mister Chekov. Estimated time for completion of the Tholian web. Are the ships computers programmed for entry into interspace? Spock to engineering. Prepare for interphase in Fifteen seconds. Stand by with full power. It will have to do. Ready to transport on my order. Try to maintain position Mister Sulu. Engineering, bring ship's power up to full capability. Negative, Ensign. Utilising ship's power has thrown us clear of it. Compute the distance from the original location. We shall soon see, Lieutenant. Good. Since the Captain was locked into our transporter beam when we were thrown clear of the interphase area, he should've been drawn here with us. Spock to transporter room. The Captain's oxygen supply is running out now. Are you standing by with a hypo of tri-ox compound for him? Prepare to transport on the Captain's co-ordinates on my order. I see him, Ensign. I see him. Now, Doctor. None worth reporting, Captain. Only such minor disturbances as are inevitable when humans are involved. Orders, Captain? No. You see, the crisis was upon us, and then passed so quickly, Captain, that we

Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ['Specify.', 'What about sensor failure?', 'How bad is it?', 'How about it, Spock?', 'Explain.', 'The Defiant! Mister Sulu, impulse engines only. Close to transporter range.', 'Lieutenant, open up a hailing frequency.', 'Good. Maintain position. Mister Spock, Mister Chekov, come with me. Doctor McCoy, report to the transporter room immediately. Scotty, you have the conn.', 'Energise.', "Use the ship's sensors to locate them. Kirk to Enterprise.", 'Prepare to beam over a full security squad on my orders.', 'Odd, Mister Spock. Very odd. Spock, you stay here with me. Chekov, get down to Engineering and life support systems. Doctor McCoy, check out the Sickbay. Kirk to Enterprise. Cancel the security squad and stand by for further instructions.', 'Report, Mister Chekov.', 'Get back up here.', 'Kirk to McCoy.', 'Bones, can you tell me what they all died of?', 'They what?', 'Could mental disease have infected all of the crew?', 'Bones, what is it?', 'Bones, what is it? Answer me!', 'Answer me!', 'Get up here on the double.', 'You mean what happened to the Defiant might be happening to the Enterprise?', 'Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott.', 'Mister Scott, stand by to beam us back.', "Why not? What's happened?", 'Chekov, McCoy, prepare for transportation. You, too, Spock.', 'Request denied.', "I know what the chances are. Mister Spock, don't argue. Get back with the information. I'll be right there. Scotty, energise transporter.", "Bones, Spock. since you are playing this tape, we will assume that I am dead, that the tactical situation is critical, and both of you are locked in mortal combat. It means, Spock, that you have control of the ship and are probably making the most difficult decisions of your career. I can offer only one small piece of advice, for whatever it's worth. Use every scrap of knowledge and logic you have to save the ship. But temper your judgment with intuitive insight. I believe you have those qualities, but if you can't find them in yourself, seek out McCoy. Ask his advice. And if you find it sound, take it. Bones, you've heard what I've just told Spock. Help him if you can. But remember he is the Captain. His decisions must be followed without question. You might find that he is capable of human insight and human error. They are most difficult to defend, but you will find that he is deserving of the same loyalty and confidence each of you have given me. Take care.", 'Bones.', 'I had a whole universe to myself after the Defiant was thrown out. There was absolutely no one else in it. I must say I prefer a crowded universe much better. How did you two get along without me?', 'Good. No problems between you?', 'Try me.', 'Which humans, Mister Spock?', "Ah, yes. I understand. Well, I hope my last orders were helpful in solving any problems that you don't feel worth reporting.", 'My last orders. The last orders that I left for both of you. The last taped orders.', "Good. Good. Well, I hope we won't have similar opportunities to test those orders which you never heard. Ahead warp factor two, Mister Sulu."]
Flattened Dialogue: Specify. What about sensor failure? How bad is it? How about it, Spock? Explain. The Defiant! Mister Sulu, impulse engines only. Close to transporter range. Lieutenant, open up a hailing frequency. Good. Maintain position. Mister Spock, Mister Chekov, come with me. Doctor McCoy, report to the transporter room immediately. Scotty, you have the conn. Energise. Use the ship's sensors to locate them. Kirk to Enterprise. Prepare to beam over a full security squad on my orders. Odd, Mister Spock. Very odd. Spock, you stay here with me. Chekov, get down to Engineering and life support systems. Doctor McCoy, check out the Sickbay. Kirk to Enterprise. Cancel the security squad and stand by for further instructions. Report, Mister Chekov. Get back up here. Kirk to McCoy. Bones, can you tell me what they all died of? They what? Could mental disease have infected all of the crew? Bones, what is it? Bones, what is it? Answer me! Answer me! Get up here on the double. You mean what happened to the Defiant might be happening to the Enterprise? Kirk to Enterprise. Mister Scott. Mister Scott, stand by to beam us back. Why not? What's happened? Chekov, McCoy, prepare for transportation. You, too, Spock. Request denied. I know what the chances are. Mister Spock, don't argue. Get back with the information. I'll be right there. Scotty, energise transporter. Bones, Spock. since you are playing this tape, we will assume that I am dead, that the tactical situation is critical, and both of you are locked in mortal combat. It means, Spock, that you have control of the ship and are probably making the most difficult decisions of your career. I can offer only one small piece of advice, for whatever it's worth. Use every scrap of knowledge and logic you have to save the ship. But temper your judgment with intuitive insight. I believe you have those qualities, but if you can't find them in yourself, seek out McCoy. Ask his advice. And if you find it sound, take it. Bones, you've heard what I've just told Spock. Help him if you can. But remember he is the Captain. His decisions must be followed without question. You might find that he is capable of human insight and human error. They are most difficult to defend, but you will find that he is deserving of the same loyalty and confidence each of you have given me. Take care. Bones. I had a whole universe to myself after the Defiant was thrown out. There was absolutely no one else in it. I must say I prefer a crowded universe much better. How did you two get along without me? Good. No problems between you? Try me. Which humans, Mister Spock? Ah, yes. I understand. Well, I hope my last orders were helpful in solving any problems that you don't feel worth reporting. My last orders. The last orders that I left for both of you. The last taped orders. Good. Good. Well, I hope we won't have similar opportunities to test those orders which you never heard. Ahead warp factor two, Mister Sulu.

Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ["Captain. We're losing power in the warp engines.", "We can barely read it, but I don't like the looks of it. And I cannot find out the cause.", 'Aye, sir.', 'Scott here, sir.', 'Aye, aye, Captain.', 'Aye, aye, Captain. Standing by.', "Aye, I think you're right. Keep us within beaming range, but not too close.", 'Bridge to transporter room.', 'You got that transporter working yet, Mister?', "Take over, Mister Sulu. I'll be in the transporter room.", 'Scott here.', "I can't, sir. At least, not all at once.", "Everything. That ship you're in is fading out, and it's ripping the innards out of this one.", "It's jamming our transporter frequencies. I've only got three of them working, and I'm not sure of those. One of you has got to wait.", 'Aye.', 'Anything?', "That's it. I've done all I can. There's nothing out there to grab a hold of and bring in. When that ship went, it must have taken the Captain with it.", "Two hours and twelve minutes? That power leak has unbalanced the ship and she's starting to drift. I can't hold her in place that long.", 'He had no cause to be angry.', 'Transporter room here.', "I'm trying. Captain Kirk is not on his designated co-ordinates, Mister Spock.", 'Scott to Bridge!', "I know you don't like to use the phasers, but you've got to do something about that ship out there.", 'Spock, that hit from the Tholians has fused our power supply converters.', "I can't do a thing with the Enterprise now.", "She's bound to drift, maybe right through that doorway out there.", "I don't even know if she can be repaired.", 'Attention. Dismissed.', 'Mister Spock, we have a readout on the Tholian tractor field. I think we can estimate its approximate completion time.', 'Scott to Captain.', 'Scott to Captain.', 'One of our crewmen just went berserk, but we have him under control for the moment.', "We're beginning to interphase.", 'Scott to Bridge.', 'Are we slipping into interspace?', "I don't believe it.", 'Mister Spock.', "I've just seen Captain Kirk. He was standing there as plain as we are.", 'And then he just disappeared.', 'Mister Spock, look!', 'Then your fears about that phaser were correct. It blasted a hole right through that crazy space fabric, and only heaven knows where it sent the Defiant.', "That'll be about twenty minutes. Aye, she'll be back together. But we'll only have about eighty percent power built up.", 'What have you got there?', 'What is it?', 'Aye. And deadly, too. What are you thinking of, Doc? Are you trying to kill us all?', 'Oh, well, any decent brand of Scotch will do that.', 'Does it make a good mix with Scotch?', "I'll let you know.", 'Scott here.', 'Aye, sir. Standing by.', "She's only up to seventy six percent."]
Flattened Dialogue: Captain. We're losing power in the warp engines. We can barely read it, but I don't like the looks of it. And I cannot find out the cause. Aye, sir. Scott here, sir. Aye, aye, Captain. Aye, aye, Captain. Standing by. Aye, I think you're right. Keep us within beaming range, but not too close. Bridge to transporter room. You got that transporter working yet, Mister? Take over, Mister Sulu. I'll be in the transporter room. Scott here. I can't, sir. At least, not all at once. Everything. That ship you're in is fading out, and it's ripping the innards out of this one. It's jamming our transporter frequencies. I've only got three of them working, and I'm not sure of those. One of you has got to wait. Aye. Anything? That's it. I've done all I can. There's nothing out there to grab a hold of and bring in. When that ship went, it must have taken the Captain with it. Two hours and twelve minutes? That power leak has unbalanced the ship and she's starting to drift. I can't hold her in place that long. He had no cause to be angry. Transporter room here. I'm trying. Captain Kirk is not on his designated co-ordinates, Mister Spock. Scott to Bridge! I know you don't like to use the phasers, but you've got to do something about that ship out there. Spock, that hit from the Tholians has fused our power supply converters. I can't do a thing with the Enterprise now. She's bound to drift, maybe right through that doorway out there. I don't even know if she can be repaired. Attention. Dismissed. Mister Spock, we have a readout on the Tholian tractor field. I think we can estimate its approximate completion time. Scott to Captain. Scott to Captain. One of our crewmen just went berserk, but we have him under control for the moment. We're beginning to interphase. Scott to Bridge. Are we slipping into interspace? I don't believe it. Mister Spock. I've just seen Captain Kirk. He was standing there as plain as we are. And then he just disappeared. Mister Spock, look! Then your fears about that phaser were correct. It blasted a hole right through that crazy space fabric, and only heaven knows where it sent the Defiant. That'll be about twenty minutes. Aye, she'll be back together. But we'll only have about eighty percent power built up. What have you got there? What is it? Aye. And deadly, too. What are you thinking of, Doc? Are you trying to kill us all? Oh, well, any decent brand of Scotch will do that. Does it make a good mix with Scotch? I'll let you know. Scott here. Aye, sir. Standing by. She's only up to seventy six percent.

Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ['Captain. Visual detection of an object dead ahead.', 'Has there ever been a mutiny on a starship before?', 'Captain.', 'Just like what I found in life support. All dead.', "It's gone. The Defiant just vanished.", "I don't understand what's so special about this region of space.", 'And die like him?', 'Thank you, Mister Spock.', 'Two minutes, sir.', 'Yes, sir. The ship can drive into interspace at any time.', 'Interphase in ten seconds. Nine, eight', 'Seven, six, five', 'Four, three', 'One.', 'There he is!', "We're being pulled out of here.", "Captain, we have destroyed the Tholians' web.", 'At once, sir.', 'The ship has been thrown exactly two point seven two parsecs distant from our previous position.', "Mister Spock, it's him! It's the Captain!"]
Flattened Dialogue: Captain. Visual detection of an object dead ahead. Has there ever been a mutiny on a starship before? Captain. Just like what I found in life support. All dead. It's gone. The Defiant just vanished. I don't understand what's so special about this region of space. And die like him? Thank you, Mister Spock. Two minutes, sir. Yes, sir. The ship can drive into interspace at any time. Interphase in ten seconds. Nine, eight Seven, six, five Four, three One. There he is! We're being pulled out of here. Captain, we have destroyed the Tholians' web. At once, sir. The ship has been thrown exactly two point seven two parsecs distant from our previous position. Mister Spock, it's him! It's the Captain!

Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ['Aye, aye, sir.', 'Just within transporter range, sir.', "I can't get an accurate fix on the Defiant, Mister Scott, but I know it's drifting away from us. Shall I correct for range, sir?", "Mister Scott, the Defiant. It's starting to disappear.", 'Aye, aye, sir.', 'I think he had several spasms of pain.', 'Mister Spock. A vessel approaching on an intercept vector.', 'Range two hundred thousand kilometres. Velocity zero point five one C.', "They've stopped dead, sir. Range ninety thousand kilometres and holding.", 'Sensor readings are not corresponding to those we received the last time we saw the Defiant.', "Mister Spock, we're being fired upon.", "But sir, that'll reduce our phaser power by fifty percent.", 'Phasers locked in, sir.', 'Ready, Mister Spock.', 'A hit, Mister Spock.', "Mister Spock, something has just entered sensor range. It's another Tholian, sir. Loskene must've contacted them when he tried to intercept us.", 'Shall I lock in remaining phaser power, sir?', 'Just beyond phaser range, sir.', 'Yes, sir.', "Mister Spock, they're closing the web.", "It's the Captain. Sir, the tractor field is activating.", "I can't, sir.", 'Warp factor two, sir.']
Flattened Dialogue: Aye, aye, sir. Just within transporter range, sir. I can't get an accurate fix on the Defiant, Mister Scott, but I know it's drifting away from us. Shall I correct for range, sir? Mister Scott, the Defiant. It's starting to disappear. Aye, aye, sir. I think he had several spasms of pain. Mister Spock. A vessel approaching on an intercept vector. Range two hundred thousand kilometres. Velocity zero point five one C. They've stopped dead, sir. Range ninety thousand kilometres and holding. Sensor readings are not corresponding to those we received the last time we saw the Defiant. Mister Spock, we're being fired upon. But sir, that'll reduce our phaser power by fifty percent. Phasers locked in, sir. Ready, Mister Spock. A hit, Mister Spock. Mister Spock, something has just entered sensor range. It's another Tholian, sir. Loskene must've contacted them when he tried to intercept us. Shall I lock in remaining phaser power, sir? Just beyond phaser range, sir. Yes, sir. Mister Spock, they're closing the web. It's the Captain. Sir, the tractor field is activating. I can't, sir. Warp factor two, sir.

Captain Kirk, we thought you were Spock! Mister. Oh, Doctor I've just seen the Captain. He's alive. He's alive, Doctor. Believe me, I did see him. I did. Spock! Mister Spock! Doctor. Doctor, I'm not going mad. I did see Captain Kirk. I've got to get to Mister Spock. Mister Spock didn't believe me either, did he, Doctor? Then I didn't really see him, did I? Title: The Tholian Web
Dialogue: ["Jim. The Captain's neck is broken.", 'McCoy here.', "I'd say these people killed each other.", 'You heard correctly, Jim. These people killed each other.', "According to the ship's log, the medical surgeon down here didn't even know what was going on.", 'The best I can do is get all the readings I can get and analyse them later.', 'What the devil?', 'Jim, this ship is dissolving. My hand just passed through a man', 'And a table.', 'What happened, Mister Spock?', 'Did anyone notice anything peculiar in his behaviour before this?', 'Did he seem to be getting hysterical?', 'Take Mister Chekov to Sickbay. Put him under restraint.', "That's what I was afraid of. Whatever it was that drove the crew of the Defiant to murder each other could be communicable.", 'Time. By the way, Mister Spock, I think it might be a wise precaution to put some distance between us and the Defiant.', 'How long will that take?', 'Spock, are you sure that Jim is still alive?', "If we could only find the proper filtering agent, we might be able to solve this problem. Negative. It's the third failure.", 'Nurse, take this sample and run an analysis on it.', 'Thank you, nurse. Call security. I want to have some checks run on this man.', 'McCoy to Bridge.', 'Has the Captain been beamed aboard yet?', 'When is that interphase going to happen?', 'I thought you had the thing timed out.', "You mean you don't know whether you're going to be able to recover the Captain or not?", "You can't wait for the next one. We've had another case like Chekov.", 'I had to confine my orderly to sickbay.', "The disease is not transmitted by the men, Mister Spock. The cause is the area of space we're in. It's affecting the whole crew.", 'The molecular structure of the brain tissues in the central nervous system are distorting.', "And the madness that affected the Defiant's crew will soon happen to the Enterprise.", "Now you've got to get this ship out of here.", "What's the use of this battle, Spock? You've lost Jim. Take this ship out of here.", 'Are you satisfied? Spock, why did you do it?', "You should've known what could've happened and done everything in your power to safeguard your crew. That is the mark of a starship Captain, like Jim.", "It's still negative, Mister Spock. Theragen is the most promising substance tested so far. We're progressing.", 'My staff is working around the clock. My being there will not affect the biochemistry of any of the tests. This service requires my personal attention, Mister Spock.', 'Take him to Sickbay. Put him in restraint.', "There is a duty to be performed in the Captain's quarters, which requires our presence.", 'The Captain left a message tape. It was his order that it be reviewed by both of us, should he ever be declared dead. You have just declared Jim dead.', "Why? Are you afraid it'll change your present status?", "The Captain's last order is top priority, and you will honour that order before you take over.", "He was a hero in every sense of the word, yet his life was sacrificed for nothing. The one thing that would have given his death meaning is the safety of the Enterprise. Now you've made that impossible, Mister Spock.", 'Maybe not the same one. I really came here to find out why you stayed and fought.', "Yes, he would, Mister Spock, but you didn't have that decision to make. What would you gain by fighting the Tholians? You could have assured yourself of a captaincy by leaving the area. But you chose to stay. Why?", 'You mean to be sure if he was dead. Well, you made certain of that.', "Yes, I have something to do. If this crew is to survive, I have to find an antidote to this space you've locked us into.", "There's no hurry, Mister Spock. The antidote probably doesn't concern you. Vulcans are probably immune, so just take your time.", "I must admit I don't understand you, Spock, but I just can't believe that you would want Jim's command. You must know that if you get us out of this situation, they'll pin a medal on your chest and give you command of the Enterprise.", 'I would like to remedy that situation.', "Spock, I, er, I'm sorry. It does hurt, doesn't it?", 'Of course you have, Uhura. We would all like to', 'Of course.', "We're going to Sickbay.", 'Yes, Nurse.', "Yes, it's beginning to spread generally throughout the ship.", "No, except I'm positive that it's a theragen derivative that's the answer. And it better be the next one.", 'Well, nobody saw him but you, Uhura.', "I don't think so.", "No, no. We're working hard. We'll find an antidote.", "Sounds like a horror story. Suppose there's any truth in it?", "Do you suppose they're seeing Jim because they've lost confidence in you?", "It's getting critical. There have been a number of assaults down on the lower decks. Even Scotty's being affected. If Scotty goes under, that's the finish of whatever chance we have of getting the Enterprise out of here.", "Spock! It must be this space. It's getting to me too. I know it's nothing you've done, Spock. I, I'm sorry.", "Yes, Uhura, you're fine.", 'It was real.', "We all saw him. The Captain's still alive.", 'McCoy here.', "I'll be right there.", 'Compliments of the house. To your good health and the health of the crew.', "Yes, and I've ordered it orally or intravenously for everyone aboard the ship. I would like for you gentlemen to drink it down.", "He's his smiling self again. I've discharged him from Sickbay.", "It's a diluted theragen derivative.", "That's right, and in this derivative, mixed with alcohol, it merely deadens certain nerve inputs to the brain.", "One good slug of this, and you can hit a man with phaser stun, and he'd never feel it or even know it.", 'It should.', "Well, drink it down, Spock. It's the human thing to do. That's a medical order, Captain.", 'McCoy here.', "I'm ready, Mister Spock.", 'Welcome home, Jim.', 'Oh, we managed. Mister Spock gave the orders, and I found the answers.', 'He means when humans become involved with Vulcans, Jim.', 'What orders are you referring to, Jim?', "Oh, those orders. Well, there wasn't time. We never had a chance to listen to them."]
